QUENYA: But in the night the Lord's angel opened the gates of the gaol, brought them outside and said:

ENGLISH: “Go, and standing in the temple speak to the people all the sayings about this life!”
QUENYA: “Go, and standing in the temple speak to the people all the sayings about this life!”

ENGLISH: After they heard that, they went at dawn into the temple and taught.
QUENYA: After they heard that, they went at dawn into the temple and taught.

ENGLISH: When the chief priest and that were with him came, they assembled the High Council and the entire council of the sons of Israel, and they sent them to the gaol to bring them.
QUENYA: When the chief priest and that were with him came, they assembled the High Council and the entire council of the sons of Israel, and they sent them to the gaol to bring them.

ENGLISH: But when the officers came thither, they did not find them in the gaol. After returning they told:
QUENYA: But when the officers came thither, they did not find them in the gaol. After returning they told:

ENGLISH: “The gaol we found shut with all security, and the guards standing by the doors, but when we opened the gaol we did not find anyone on the inside.”
QUENYA: “The gaol we found shut with all security, and the guards standing by the doors, but when we opened the gaol we did not find anyone on the inside.”

ENGLISH: When the captain of the temple and the chief priest alike heard these words, they were uncertain about these things and about what was going to happen because of this matter.
QUENYA: When the captain of the temple and the chief priest alike heard these words, they were uncertain about these things and about what was going to happen because of this matter.

ENGLISH: But a man came and told them: “Behold! The men that you put in the gaol are in the temple, standing and instructing the people!”
QUENYA: But a man came and told them: “Behold! The men that you put in the gaol are in the temple, standing and instructing the people!”

ENGLISH: Then the captain went away with his officers and brought them, but without violence, since they feared to be stoned by the people.
QUENYA: Then the captain went away with his officers and brought them, but without violence, since they feared to be stoned by the people.

ENGLISH: They brought them and put them before the High Council. And the chief priest said: “We gave you the command: Cease to teach in this name! And yet, behold! you have filled Jerusalem with your teaching, and you want to bring this man's blood upon us!”
QUENYA: They brought them and put them before the High Council. And the chief priest said: “We gave you the command: Cease to teach in this name! And yet, behold! you have filled Jerusalem with your teaching, and you want to bring this man's blood upon us!”

ENGLISH: In answer Peter and the other apostles said: “It is necessary for us to follow God's commands over those of men.
QUENYA: In answer Peter and the other apostles said: “It is necessary for us to follow God's commands over those of men.

ENGLISH: The God of your fathers raised Jesus, whom you killed by hanging him on a tree.
QUENYA: The God of your fathers raised Jesus, whom you killed by hanging him on a tree.

ENGLISH: God raised him to his right hand as Chief and Saviour, in order to give repentance to Israel and forgiveness of sins.
QUENYA: God raised him to his right hand as Chief and Saviour, in order to give repentance to Israel and forgiveness of sins.

ENGLISH: And we are witnesses about these matters, as is the Holy Spirit, that God gave to that listen to his commands.”
QUENYA: And we are witnesses about these matters, as is the Holy Spirit, that God gave to that listen to his commands.”

ENGLISH: When they heard that, they felt wounded and wished to kill them.
QUENYA: When they heard that, they felt wounded and wished to kill them.

ENGLISH: But was a man who arose in the High Council, a Pharisee whose name was Gamaliel, a law-teacher dear to the entire people. He commanded: “Lead the men to the outside for a short time.”
QUENYA: But was a man who arose in the High Council, a Pharisee whose name was Gamaliel, a law-teacher dear to the entire people. He commanded: “Lead the men to the outside for a short time.”

ENGLISH: Then he said to them: “Men of Israel, give heed to yourselves concerning what you want to do to these men.
QUENYA: Then he said to them: “Men of Israel, give heed to yourselves concerning what you want to do to these men.

ENGLISH: For before these days Theudas arose, saying that he was important, and a number of men, around four hundred, went with him. But he was slain, and all that heeded his commands were scattered and undone.
QUENYA: For before these days Theudas arose, saying that he was important, and a number of men, around four hundred, went with him. But he was slain, and all that heeded his commands were scattered and undone.

ENGLISH: After him Judas from Galilee arose, in the days in which the people was counted, and he drew away some people after himself. And yet that man died, and all that heeded his commands were scattered.
QUENYA: After him Judas from Galilee arose, in the days in which the people was counted, and he drew away some people after himself. And yet that man died, and all that heeded his commands were scattered.

ENGLISH: And as things stand now, I say to you: Let these men be and do not trouble them, for if this matter or things doing is from men, it will be undone,
QUENYA: And as things stand now, I say to you: Let these men be and do not trouble them, for if this matter or things doing is from men, it will be undone,

ENGLISH: but if it is from God, you will not be able to undo them. Watch yourselves, that you will not be found fighting against God!”
QUENYA: but if it is from God, you will not be able to undo them. Watch yourselves, that you will not be found fighting against God!”

ENGLISH: Then they gave heed to what he said. After summoning the apostles they flayed them and commanded them: “Do not speak in the name of Jesus!” Then they allowed them to go.
QUENYA: Then they gave heed to what he said. After summoning the apostles they flayed them and commanded them: “Do not speak in the name of Jesus!” Then they allowed them to go.

ENGLISH: They, therefore, went away from the High Council in joy, since they were counted worthy to suffer mockery for the sake of the name.
QUENYA: They, therefore, went away from the High Council in joy, since they were counted worthy to suffer mockery for the sake of the name.

ENGLISH: And every day, in the temple and in the houses, they did not cease to make known the gospel about Jesus Christ.
QUENYA: And every day, in the temple and in the houses, they did not cease to make known the gospel about Jesus Christ.

ENGLISH: But in those days, while the number of disciples rose, the Hellenists were grumbling against the Hebrews, since their widows were not heeded in the daily distribution.
QUENYA: But in those days, while the number of disciples rose, the Hellenists were grumbling against the Hebrews, since their widows were not heeded in the daily distribution.

ENGLISH: Therefore the twelve summoned the multitude of the disciples to themselves and said: “It is not good for us to abandon God's word to distribute food at the tables.
QUENYA: Therefore the twelve summoned the multitude of the disciples to themselves and said: “It is not good for us to abandon God's word to distribute food at the tables.

ENGLISH: Therefore, brothers, seek among yourselves seven men that have good witness, full of spirit and wisdom, and we will set them to cover this need,
QUENYA: Therefore, brothers, seek among yourselves seven men that have good witness, full of spirit and wisdom, and we will set them to cover this need,

ENGLISH: but we will still give yourselves to the praying and to the service of the Word.”
QUENYA: but we will still give yourselves to the praying and to the service of the Word.”

ENGLISH: And what they said was good to the entire multitude, and they chose Stephen, a man full of faith and of Holy Spirit, and Philip and Procorus and Nicanor and Timon and Parmenas and Nicolaus, a proselyte from Antioch,
QUENYA: And what they said was good to the entire multitude, and they chose Stephen, a man full of faith and of Holy Spirit, and Philip and Procorus and Nicanor and Timon and Parmenas and Nicolaus, a proselyte from Antioch,

ENGLISH: and they put them before the apostles, and after praying they placed their hands on them.
QUENYA: and they put them before the apostles, and after praying they placed their hands on them.

ENGLISH: And God's word grew, and the number of the disciples rose quickly in Jerusalem, and a huge crowd of priests subjected themseves the faith.
QUENYA: And God's word grew, and the number of the disciples rose quickly in Jerusalem, and a huge crowd of priests subjected themseves the faith.

ENGLISH: But Stephen, full of grace and of power, made mighty signs and portents among the people.
QUENYA: But Stephen, full of grace and of power, made mighty signs and portents among the people.

ENGLISH: But arose some men from the synagogue called of Freed Ones, and some people that came from Cyrene and Alexandria, to quarrel with Stephen.
QUENYA: But arose some men from the synagogue called of Freed Ones, and some people that came from Cyrene and Alexandria, to quarrel with Stephen.

ENGLISH: But they could not stand against the wisdom and the spirit with which he talked.
QUENYA: But they could not stand against the wisdom and the spirit with which he talked.

ENGLISH: Then secretly they made some men say: “We have heard him speak blasphemies against Moses and God.”
QUENYA: Then secretly they made some men say: “We have heard him speak blasphemies against Moses and God.”

ENGLISH: And they stirred up the people and the elders and the scribes, and they fell upon him and seized him, and they brought him into the High Council.
QUENYA: And they stirred up the people and the elders and the scribes, and they fell upon him and seized him, and they brought him into the High Council.

ENGLISH: And they called lying witnesses, that said: “This man does not cease to speak words against this holy place and against the Law.
QUENYA: And they called lying witnesses, that said: “This man does not cease to speak words against this holy place and against the Law.

ENGLISH: And we have heard him say that this Jesus from Nazareth will throw down this place and will change the customs that we have received from Moses.”
QUENYA: And we have heard him say that this Jesus from Nazareth will throw down this place and will change the customs that we have received from Moses.”

ENGLISH: And when all that were sitting in the High Council looked at him, they saw that his face was like an angel's face.
QUENYA: And when all that were sitting in the High Council looked at him, they saw that his face was like an angel's face.

ENGLISH: But the chief priest said: “Are these matters so?”
QUENYA: But the chief priest said: “Are these matters so?”

ENGLISH: He said: “Men, brothers and fathers, hear! The God of Glory showed himself to Abraham our father while he was in Mesopotamia, before he dwelt in Haran,
QUENYA: He said: “Men, brothers and fathers, hear! The God of Glory showed himself to Abraham our father while he was in Mesopotamia, before he dwelt in Haran,

ENGLISH: and he said to him: 'Go away from your land and from your kin and come to the place that I will show you.'
QUENYA: and he said to him: 'Go away from your land and from your kin and come to the place that I will show you.'

ENGLISH: Then he went out from the land of the Chaldeans and dwelt in Haran. And from there, after his father died, God caused him to move to this land in which you now dwell.
QUENYA: Then he went out from the land of the Chaldeans and dwelt in Haran. And from there, after his father died, God caused him to move to this land in which you now dwell.

ENGLISH: And yet he did not give him an heir's part in it, also not the earth under his foot-sole, but he gave him the promise that he was going to give it to him for him to possess it, and after him to his seed, while he still lacked child.
QUENYA: And yet he did not give him an heir's part in it, also not the earth under his foot-sole, but he gave him the promise that he was going to give it to him for him to possess it, and after him to his seed, while he still lacked child.

ENGLISH: Futhermore, this God said, that his seed was going to dwell like exiles in a foreign nation , and the people were going to make them thralls and were going to cause them affliction, through four hundred years.
QUENYA: Futhermore, this God said, that his seed was going to dwell like exiles in a foreign nation , and the people were going to make them thralls and were going to cause them affliction, through four hundred years.

ENGLISH: And 'the country for which they will be thralls I shall judge,' said God, 'and thereafter they will go forth and will do service for me in this place.'
QUENYA: And 'the country for which they will be thralls I shall judge,' said God, 'and thereafter they will go forth and will do service for me in this place.'

ENGLISH: And he gave him a covenant of circumcision, and thus he begat Isaac and circumcized him on the eight day, and Isaac begat Jacob, and Jacob the twelve family heads .
QUENYA: And he gave him a covenant of circumcision, and thus he begat Isaac and circumcized him on the eight day, and Isaac begat Jacob, and Jacob the twelve family heads .

ENGLISH: And the family heads, full of envy against Joseph, sold him into Egypt. But God was with him,
QUENYA: And the family heads, full of envy against Joseph, sold him into Egypt. But God was with him,

ENGLISH: and he delivered him out of all his tribulations and gave him grace and wisdom before Pharaoh king of Egypt. And he put him to rule Egypt and his entire house.
QUENYA: and he delivered him out of all his tribulations and gave him grace and wisdom before Pharaoh king of Egypt. And he put him to rule Egypt and his entire house.

ENGLISH: But famine came upon he entire land of Egypt and Canaan, indeed a great tribulation, and our fathers did not find food.

QUENYA: But when he was put outside, Pharaoh's daughter took him and raised him as her own son.

QUENYA: Perhaps you intend to kill me, like you killed the Egyptian yesterday?'

QUENYA: Because of this word Moses ran away and dwelt in the land of Midian, where two sons were born to him.

QUENYA: And when forty years were gone, an angel showed himself to him in the wilderness by Mount Sinai, in the fiery flame of a thorn-bush.

QUENYA: 'I am the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham and Isaak and Jacob.' Then trembling seized Moses, and he did not dare to examine further .

QUENYA: The Lord said to him: 'Take your shoes from your feet, for the place on which you are standing is holy ground.

QUENYA: This Moses that they turned away, saying: 'Who made you chief or judge?', this man God sent as chief and deliverer alike, by the hand of the angel that showed himself to him in the thornbush.

QUENYA: saying to Aaron: 'Make for us gods that can go before us! For this Moses, who led us out of Egypt – we do not know what has happened to him.'

QUENYA: Now when Peter went through all regions he came down also to the holy ones that dwelt in Lydda.

QUENYA: There he found a man called Aeneas, who had lain on his bier for eight years, since he was lame.

ENGLISH: And Peter said to him: “Aeneas, Jesus Christ heals you. Rise and arrange your bed!” And he arose in the same moment.
QUENYA: And Peter said to him: “Aeneas, Jesus Christ heals you. Rise and arrange your bed!” And he arose in the same moment.

ENGLISH: And all that dwelt in Lydda and Sharon saw him, and they turned to the Lord.
QUENYA: And all that dwelt in Lydda and Sharon saw him, and they turned to the Lord.

ENGLISH: But in Joppa there was a female disiciple whose name was Tabitha, which means Dorcas . She was full of good deeds and gifts of mercy that she did.
QUENYA: But in Joppa there was a female disiciple whose name was Tabitha, which means Dorcas . She was full of good deeds and gifts of mercy that she did.

ENGLISH: But in those days she became ill and died. They washed her and put her in the upper room.
QUENYA: But in those days she became ill and died. They washed her and put her in the upper room.

ENGLISH: Since Lydda was near to Joppa, when the disciples heard that Peter was in that city they sent two men to him to request of him: “Do not be late in coming to us!”
QUENYA: Since Lydda was near to Joppa, when the disciples heard that Peter was in that city they sent two men to him to request of him: “Do not be late in coming to us!”

ENGLISH: They Peter arose and went with them. And when he came thither, they led him into the upper room, and all the widows stood with him in tears, showing him many tunics and cloaks that Dorcas had made when she was still with them.
QUENYA: They Peter arose and went with them. And when he came thither, they led him into the upper room, and all the widows stood with him in tears, showing him many tunics and cloaks that Dorcas had made when she was still with them.

ENGLISH: But Peter sent all outside, fell upon his knees and prayed. Then, after turning to the body, he said: “Tabitha, rise!” She opened her eyes, and seeing Peter she sat up.
QUENYA: But Peter sent all outside, fell upon his knees and prayed. Then, after turning to the body, he said: “Tabitha, rise!” She opened her eyes, and seeing Peter she sat up.

ENGLISH: Peter gave her his hand and raised her , and he called the holy ones and the widows and put her before them alive.
QUENYA: Peter gave her his hand and raised her , and he called the holy ones and the widows and put her before them alive.

ENGLISH: This matter became known to all in Joppa, and numerous ones believed in the Lord.
QUENYA: This matter became known to all in Joppa, and numerous ones believed in the Lord.

ENGLISH: For a sufficient number of days he remained in Joppa with a man called Simon, a leather-worker.
QUENYA: For a sufficient number of days he remained in Joppa with a man called Simon, a leather-worker.

ENGLISH: There was a man in Caesarea called Cornelius, a centurion of the army division called the Italian,
QUENYA: There was a man in Caesarea called Cornelius, a centurion of the army division called the Italian,

ENGLISH: who was reverent and feared God with his entire family, and he gave many gifts of mercy to the people and was praying to God always.
QUENYA: who was reverent and feared God with his entire family, and he gave many gifts of mercy to the people and was praying to God always.

ENGLISH: Around the ninth hour he saw in a vision an angel of God come inside to him and saying to him: “Cornelius!”
QUENYA: Around the ninth hour he saw in a vision an angel of God come inside to him and saying to him: “Cornelius!”

ENGLISH: The man looked at him, and being frightened he said: “What do you want, Lord?” He said to him: “Your prayers and your gifts of mercy have ascended like a reminder before God.
QUENYA: The man looked at him, and being frightened he said: “What do you want, Lord?” He said to him: “Your prayers and your gifts of mercy have ascended like a reminder before God.

ENGLISH: And now, send some men to Joppa and call a person called Simon, who has the nickname Peter.
QUENYA: And now, send some men to Joppa and call a person called Simon, who has the nickname Peter.

ENGLISH: This man dwells in house of a man whose name is Simon, a leather-worker, who has his house by the sea.”
QUENYA: This man dwells in house of a man whose name is Simon, a leather-worker, who has his house by the sea.”

ENGLISH: After the angel who spoke to him went away, he called two of the servants of his house and a reverent soldier from among those that remained with him,
QUENYA: After the angel who spoke to him went away, he called two of the servants of his house and a reverent soldier from among those that remained with him,

ENGLISH: and he told them everything and sent them to Joppa.
QUENYA: and he told them everything and sent them to Joppa.

ENGLISH: On the following day, when they were on their journey and were coming near to the city, Peter went up to the roof around the sixth hour, in order to pray.
QUENYA: On the following day, when they were on their journey and were coming near to the city, Peter went up to the roof around the sixth hour, in order to pray.

ENGLISH: But he was hungry and wanted to eat. While they prepared, he went into a vision
QUENYA: But he was hungry and wanted to eat. While they prepared, he went into a vision

ENGLISH: and saw heaven opened and some kind of vessel that came down like a huge sheet of linen,
QUENYA: and saw heaven opened and some kind of vessel that came down like a huge sheet of linen,

ENGLISH: and in it were all kinds of four-legged and creeping things and birds of heaven.
QUENYA: and in it were all kinds of four-legged and creeping things and birds of heaven.

ENGLISH: And a voice came to him: “Rise, Peter, slaughter and eat!”
QUENYA: And a voice came to him: “Rise, Peter, slaughter and eat!”

ENGLISH: But Peter said: “By no means, Lord, for nothing defiled or unclean have I ever eaten!”
QUENYA: But Peter said: “By no means, Lord, for nothing defiled or unclean have I ever eaten!”

ENGLISH: And the voice said to him a second time: “Do not call defiled that God has cleansed!”
QUENYA: And the voice said to him a second time: “Do not call defiled that God has cleansed!”

ENGLISH: This happened a third time, and then the vessel was taken into heaven.
QUENYA: This happened a third time, and then the vessel was taken into heaven.

ENGLISH: While Peter was still very uncertain about what the vision that he had seen signified, behold! the men sent by Cornelius stood before the gate after asking their way to the house of Simon.
QUENYA: While Peter was still very uncertain about what the vision that he had seen signified, behold! the men sent by Cornelius stood before the gate after asking their way to the house of Simon.

ENGLISH: While Peter thought about the vision, the spirit said: “Behold! Three men are seeking you.
QUENYA: While Peter thought about the vision, the spirit said: “Behold! Three men are seeking you.

ENGLISH: But go down and follow them, and do not be uncertain about anything, for I have sent them.”
QUENYA: But go down and follow them, and do not be uncertain about anything, for I have sent them.”

ENGLISH: Thus Peter went down and said to the men: “Behold, I am that you are seeking. What is your reason for coming here?”
QUENYA: Thus Peter went down and said to the men: “Behold, I am that you are seeking. What is your reason for coming here?”

ENGLISH: They said: “Cornelius the centurion, a man just and reverent, of whom the whole nation of Jews speak well, has received a command through a holy angel that he was going to send for you, for you to come to his house and for him to hear your sayings.”
QUENYA: They said: “Cornelius the centurion, a man just and reverent, of whom the whole nation of Jews speak well, has received a command through a holy angel that he was going to send for you, for you to come to his house and for him to hear your sayings.”

ENGLISH: Then he requested of them to come inside, and he received them as guests.On the following day he arose and went with them, and some of the brothers in Joppa went with him.
QUENYA: Then he requested of them to come inside, and he received them as guests.On the following day he arose and went with them, and some of the brothers in Joppa went with him.

ENGLISH: One day thereafter he went into Caesarea. Cornelius, waiting for their coming, beforehand called together the people of his family and his close friends.
QUENYA: One day thereafter he went into Caesarea. Cornelius, waiting for their coming, beforehand called together the people of his family and his close friends.

ENGLISH: When Peter went inside, Cornelius met him, fell down before his feet and worshipped him.
QUENYA: When Peter went inside, Cornelius met him, fell down before his feet and worshipped him.

ENGLISH: But Peter raised him , saying: “Rise; I as well am a man!”
QUENYA: But Peter raised him , saying: “Rise; I as well am a man!”

ENGLISH: And when he spoke with him, he went inside and found numerous people assembled.
QUENYA: And when he spoke with him, he went inside and found numerous people assembled.

ENGLISH: And he said to them: “You know well how to a Jew is wholly against the Law to unite himself to a person of another nation, or to go into his house. And yet God showed me that I am not to call anyone defiled or unclean.
QUENYA: And he said to them: “You know well how to a Jew is wholly against the Law to unite himself to a person of another nation, or to go into his house. And yet God showed me that I am not to call anyone defiled or unclean.

ENGLISH: Therefore I indeed came, without speaking against your calling when I was being summoned. Therefore I ask: What is your reason for sending to me?”
QUENYA: Therefore I indeed came, without speaking against your calling when I was being summoned. Therefore I ask: What is your reason for sending to me?”

ENGLISH: And Cornelius said: “Four days ago, counting from this hour, I prayed in my house when behold! a man with bright garment stood before me
QUENYA: And Cornelius said: “Four days ago, counting from this hour, I prayed in my house when behold! a man with bright garment stood before me

ENGLISH: and said: “Cornelius, your prayer has been heard, and your gifts of mercy have been remembered before God.
QUENYA: and said: “Cornelius, your prayer has been heard, and your gifts of mercy have been remembered before God.

ENGLISH: Therefore send to Joppa and call Simon, who has the nickname Peter. This man is a guest in the house of another Simon, a leather-worker, by the sea.”
QUENYA: Therefore send to Joppa and call Simon, who has the nickname Peter. This man is a guest in the house of another Simon, a leather-worker, by the sea.”

ENGLISH: Therefore in the same hour I sent to you, and you did well by coming here. And so in this hour all among us are here before God, to hear all the things that the Lord has commanded you to say.”
QUENYA: Therefore in the same hour I sent to you, and you did well by coming here. And so in this hour all among us are here before God, to hear all the things that the Lord has commanded you to say.”

ENGLISH: Then Peter opened his mouth and said: “Truly I perceive that God does not heed faces ,
QUENYA: Then Peter opened his mouth and said: “Truly I perceive that God does not heed faces ,

ENGLISH: but from every nation he receives well the person that fears him and does righteousness.
QUENYA: but from every nation he receives well the person that fears him and does righteousness.

QUENYA: He sent the word to sons of Israel to make known to them the gospel of peace through Jesus Chrsit; he is Lord of all.

ENGLISH: You know the saying that went through the entire Judea, beginning from Galilee after the baptism about which John talked –
QUENYA: You know the saying that went through the entire Judea, beginning from Galilee after the baptism about which John talked –

QUENYA: about Jesus from Nazareth, how God annointed him with Holy Spirit and with power, and he went through the land, doing good deeds and healing all upon which the Devil's power lay heavy, for God was with him.

ENGLISH: And all among us are witnesses of the things that he did in the land of the Jews and in Jerusalem alike, but they also killed him by hanging him on a tree.
QUENYA: And all among us are witnesses of the things that he did in the land of the Jews and in Jerusalem alike, but they also killed him by hanging him on a tree.

ENGLISH: Him God raised on the third day and allowed him to show himself,
QUENYA: Him God raised on the third day and allowed him to show himself,

ENGLISH: not to the entire people, but to witnesses chosen by God – to us, that ate and drank with him after his raising from dead.
QUENYA: not to the entire people, but to witnesses chosen by God – to us, that ate and drank with him after his raising from dead.

ENGLISH: And he commanded us to make known to the people, and to give them witness, that this man was whom God has placed as judge of living ones and dead ones.
QUENYA: And he commanded us to make known to the people, and to give them witness, that this man was whom God has placed as judge of living ones and dead ones.

ENGLISH: About him all the Prophets spoke – that everyone who believes in him receives forgiveness of sins by his name.”
QUENYA: About him all the Prophets spoke – that everyone who believes in him receives forgiveness of sins by his name.”

ENGLISH: While Peter still was still speaking about these things, the Holy Spirit fell upon all that heard the word.
QUENYA: While Peter still was still speaking about these things, the Holy Spirit fell upon all that heard the word.

QUENYA: And the faithful that had come with Peter, those that were of the circumcision, were filled with wonder since the gift of Holy Spirit was poured also upon non-Jews.

ENGLISH: And they heard them speak in tongues and praise God. Then Peter said: “Can anyone deny them the water, to stop from being baptized these men that have received the same Holy Spirit that we as well have received?”
QUENYA: And they heard them speak in tongues and praise God. Then Peter said: “Can anyone deny them the water, to stop from being baptized these men that have received the same Holy Spirit that we as well have received?”

QUENYA: And he commanded them to be baptized by the name of Jesus Christ. Then they requested of him that he would remain with them for some days.

QUENYA: Now the apostles and the brother that were in Judea heard that some non-Jews also received God's word.

QUENYA: But when Peter went up to Jerusalem, the people of circumcision quarreled with him,

QUENYA: saying that he had gone into the house of men that were not circumcized and had eaten with them.

ENGLISH: Then Peter began to tell them everything as it had happened, saying:
QUENYA: Then Peter began to tell them everything as it had happened, saying:

ENGLISH: “I was in Joppa city when I saw a vision, a kind of vessel that came down like a huge sheet of linen, being sent down from heaven by its four corners, and it came near to me.
QUENYA: “I was in Joppa city when I saw a vision, a kind of vessel that came down like a huge sheet of linen, being sent down from heaven by its four corners, and it came near to me.

ENGLISH: Looking into it I watched and saw the four-legged creatures of earth and the wild beasts and the creeping things and the birds of heaven.
QUENYA: Looking into it I watched and saw the four-legged creatures of earth and the wild beasts and the creeping things and the birds of heaven.

ENGLISH: I also heard a voice say to me: Rise, Peter, slaughter and eat!
QUENYA: I also heard a voice say to me: Rise, Peter, slaughter and eat!

ENGLISH: But I said: By no means, Lord, for nothing defiled or unclean has ever come into my mouth!
QUENYA: But I said: By no means, Lord, for nothing defiled or unclean has ever come into my mouth!

ENGLISH: A second time the voice from heaven answered: Do not call unclean that God has cleansed!
QUENYA: A second time the voice from heaven answered: Do not call unclean that God has cleansed!

ENGLISH: This happened a third time, and everthing was drawn back into heaven.
QUENYA: This happened a third time, and everthing was drawn back into heaven.

QUENYA: And behold! in that moment three men stood by the house that we were in, for they were sent from Caesarea to me.

QUENYA: Therefore the spirit commanded me to go with them, not being uncertain about anything. But these six brothers also went with me, and we went into the man's house.

QUENYA: He told us how he saw the angel stand in his house, saying: Send some men to Joppa and summon Simon who has the nick-name Peter,

QUENYA: and he will speak to you sayings by which you will be saved, you and your family.

QUENYA: But when I began to speak, the spirit fell upon them just as it fell also upon us in the beginning.

QUENYA: Then I recalled the Lord's saying, how he said: John baptized with water, but you will be baptized with Holy Spirit.

QUENYA: Therefore, if God gave the same gift to them as to ourselves that have believed in the Lord Jesus Christ, who am I, that I will be able to stop God?”

QUENYA: Now when they heard these things, they said nothing more against him, and they gave glory to God, saying: “Then God has indeed given repentance leading to life also to non-Jews.”

QUENYA: Therefore that were scattered by the tribulation that arose concerning Stephen went as far as Phoenicia and Cyprus and Antioch, but they spoke the word only to the Jews.

QUENYA: But among them were some men from Cyprus and Cyrene that came to Antioch and talked about the gospel of the Lord Jesus also to that spoke Greek.

QUENYA: Furthermore, the Lord's hand was with them, and a great number believed and turned themselves to the Lord.

QUENYA: The story about them came to the ears of the congregation which was in Jerusalem, and they sent Barnabas as far as Antioch.

QUENYA: When he came there and saw God's grace, he had joy and urged them sincerely to remain in God's will,

QUENYA: Then he went away to Tarsus to seek Saul,

QUENYA: and after he found him, he led him to Antioch. Thus it came that for a full year they assembled with them in the congregation and taught a huge crowd, and in Antioch the disciples were for the first time called Christians .

QUENYA: In those days came prophets down from Jerusalem to Antioch.

QUENYA: One among them, whose name was Agabus, arose and made known by the Spirit that was going to come a great famine upon the entire world. That indeed came in the days of Claudius.

QUENYA: And so they did, sending it to the elders by the hand of Barnabas and Saul.

QUENYA: Around that time Herod the King laid hands on some persons of the congregation, to evil to them.

ENGLISH: He killed Jacob, the brother of Jacob, by sword.
QUENYA: He killed Jacob, the brother of Jacob, by sword.

ENGLISH: Seeing how the Jews thought well about that, he also seized Peter. That happened in the days of unleavened breads.
QUENYA: Seeing how the Jews thought well about that, he also seized Peter. That happened in the days of unleavened breads.

ENGLISH: After he seized him, he put him in prison, giving him into the hands of four groups, each having four soldiers, for he intended to show him to the people.
QUENYA: After he seized him, he put him in prison, giving him into the hands of four groups, each having four soldiers, for he intended to show him to the people.

ENGLISH: Thus Peter was kept in prison, but the entire congregation was intensely praying to God for him.
QUENYA: Thus Peter was kept in prison, but the entire congregation was intensely praying to God for him.

ENGLISH: In the night before Herod was going to lead him before the people, Peter was asleep, bound with two chains between to soldiers, and some guards before the door kept the gaol.
QUENYA: In the night before Herod was going to lead him before the people, Peter was asleep, bound with two chains between to soldiers, and some guards before the door kept the gaol.

ENGLISH: But behold! the Lord's angel stood by him, and a light shone in the room. Tapping Peter's body he woke him up, saying: “Rise quickly!” And his chains fell from his hands.
QUENYA: But behold! the Lord's angel stood by him, and a light shone in the room. Tapping Peter's body he woke him up, saying: “Rise quickly!” And his chains fell from his hands.

QUENYA: The angel said to him: “Put your girt around your hips and tie your shoes on your feet!” He did so. And he said to him: “Put your cloak on your body and follow me!”

QUENYA: And he went outside and followed him, but he did now know that what happened by the angel was true. He supposed that he saw a vision.

ENGLISH: Passing by the first guard, and the second, they came to the iron gate leading into the city, and that opened itself to them. And after they went outside they walked down one street, and in that moment the angel went away from him.

QUENYA: And Peter, finding himself, said: “Now I know that the Lord sent his angel and delivered me from Herod's hand and from everything that the people of the Jews is waiting for.»

QUENYA: After making a consideration he went to the house of Mary, mother of John who had the nickname Mark. In the house a quite large number of people were assembled, praying.

QUENYA: When he knocked on the door, a female slave whose name was Rhoda came to open,

QUENYA: and when she recognized Peter's voice, for her joy she did not open the gate, but ran inside and told that Peter was standing before the door.

QUENYA: They said to her: “You are out of your mind!” But she said forcefully that so it was . They said: “It is his angel.”

QUENYA: But Peter remained where he was, knocking. When they opened, they saw him and were startled.

ENGLISH: But he made a gesture to them with his hand, for them to be silent, and he told them everything about how the Lord led him out of gaol, and he said: “Tell these things to Jacob and to the brothers.” Then he went outside and went to another place.

QUENYA: But on a set day Herod covered himself with a royal garment and sat down on the seat of judgement and talked to them.

QUENYA: But the Lord's word grew and spread.

QUENYA: Barnabas and Saul returned to Jerusalem after they completed their service, and they brought John, who had the nickname Mark.

QUENYA: Therefore these men, sent by the Holy Spirit, went down into Seleucia, and from there they sailed away to Cyprus.

QUENYA: And when they came into Salamis they made God's word known in the synagogues of the Jews. They also had John with them , helping them .

ENGLISH: When they went through the entire island as far as Paphos, they met a man who was a wizard, a false prophet .
QUENYA: When they went through the entire island as far as Paphos, they met a man who was a wizard, a false prophet .

ENGLISH: He was with Sergius Paulus, the governor, who was an intelligent man. After he called Barnabas and Saul to himself, this man sought to hear God's word.
QUENYA: He was with Sergius Paulus, the governor, who was an intelligent man. After he called Barnabas and Saul to himself, this man sought to hear God's word.

ENGLISH: But Elymas the wizard – for that is what his name means – stood against them , seeking to turn the governor away from the faith.
QUENYA: But Elymas the wizard – for that is what his name means – stood against them , seeking to turn the governor away from the faith.

ENGLISH: Saul, who is also Paul , was filled with Holy Spirit, looked at him
QUENYA: Saul, who is also Paul , was filled with Holy Spirit, looked at him

ENGLISH: and said: “O man full of every kind of lie and of every wicked deed, o son of the Devil, o enemy of all that is just, will you not stop twisting the straight roads of the Lord?
QUENYA: and said: “O man full of every kind of lie and of every wicked deed, o son of the Devil, o enemy of all that is just, will you not stop twisting the straight roads of the Lord?

QUENYA: And now, behold, the Lord's hand is upon you, and you will be blind, not seeing the sunlight for a time.” In the same moment mist and darkness fell upon him, and he went seeking people to lead him by the hand.

QUENYA: Then the governor, when he saw what had happend, believed; and he was in wonder at the Lord's teaching.

QUENYA: The men that were with Paul now went by ship from Paphos and came to Perga in Pamphylia. But John abandoned them and returned to Jerusalem.

ENGLISH: But they , after they went away from Perga, came to Antioch in Pisidia. They went into the synagogue on the sabbath and sat down.
QUENYA: But they , after they went away from Perga, came to Antioch in Pisidia. They went into the synagogue on the sabbath and sat down.

ENGLISH: After the reading out of the Law and of the Prophets, the synagogue chiefs sent to them, saying: “Men, brothers, if you have a word of comfort for the people, tell it!”
QUENYA: After the reading out of the Law and of the Prophets, the synagogue chiefs sent to them, saying: “Men, brothers, if you have a word of comfort for the people, tell it!”

ENGLISH: And Paul arose, and making a gesture with his hand he said: “Men, Israelites and you who fear God, listen!
QUENYA: And Paul arose, and making a gesture with his hand he said: “Men, Israelites and you who fear God, listen!

QUENYA: The God of our people Israel chose our fathers and made our people great while they were dwelling as foreigners in Egypt; then with a mighty arm he led them out from there,

ENGLISH: and through forty years he gave them food in the wilderness.
QUENYA: and through forty years he gave them food in the wilderness.

ENGLISH: After he destroyed ten peoples in Canaan, he caused them to possess their land
QUENYA: After he destroyed ten peoples in Canaan, he caused them to possess their land

QUENYA: for about four hundred and fifty years. Thereafter he gave them judges, until Samuel the Prophet.

ENGLISH: Then they requested a king, and God gave them Saul son of Kish, a man of the tribe of Benjamin. After forty years
QUENYA: Then they requested a king, and God gave them Saul son of Kish, a man of the tribe of Benjamin. After forty years

ENGLISH: he put him away and raised up David son of Jesse to be king, about whom he also said as a witness: I have found David son of Jesse a man according to my heart, who will do my entire will.
QUENYA: he put him away and raised up David son of Jesse to be king, about whom he also said as a witness: I have found David son of Jesse a man according to my heart, who will do my entire will.

QUENYA: From this man's seed, God by his promise sent a Savior to Israel, Jesus,

ENGLISH: after John, before his coming, made baptism of repentance known to the entire people of Israel.
QUENYA: after John, before his coming, made baptism of repentance known to the entire people of Israel.

ENGLISH: But when John was soon going to complete his run, he said: Who do you suppose that I am? I am not he. But behold, after me comes a person whose shoes I am not worthy to loosen!
QUENYA: But when John was soon going to complete his run, he said: Who do you suppose that I am? I am not he. But behold, after me comes a person whose shoes I am not worthy to loosen!

ENGLISH: Men, brothers, sons of the kin of Abraham and the people among you that fear God: To you the word of this salvation has been sent.
QUENYA: Men, brothers, sons of the kin of Abraham and the people among you that fear God: To you the word of this salvation has been sent.

ENGLISH: For that dwell in Jerusalem and their rulers did not know this person, but when they judged him they made true the sayings of the Prophets, which are being read aloud on every sabbath,
QUENYA: For that dwell in Jerusalem and their rulers did not know this person, but when they judged him they made true the sayings of the Prophets, which are being read aloud on every sabbath,

QUENYA: and though they did not find cause of death, they requested from Pilate that one was to kill him.

QUENYA: After they completed all the things written about him, they took him down from the tree and put him in a grave.

ENGLISH: But God raised him out of dead,
QUENYA: But God raised him out of dead,

QUENYA: and through many days he was being seen by those that had gone with him from Galilee to Jerusalem, that are now his witnesses to the people.

ENGLISH: For we make known to you the gospel about the promise given to the fathers:
QUENYA: For we make known to you the gospel about the promise given to the fathers:

QUENYA: that God has made it real to us , their children, by resurrecting Jesus, as is also written in the second psalm: You are my son, I begat you today.

ENGLISH: That he resurrected him out of dead, and that he will not return to a corrupt state, he has said thus: I will give to you David's mercies, the faithful ones.
QUENYA: That he resurrected him out of dead, and that he will not return to a corrupt state, he has said thus: I will give to you David's mercies, the faithful ones.

ENGLISH: Therefore he also says in another psalm: You will not allow your faithful one to see a corrupt state.
QUENYA: Therefore he also says in another psalm: You will not allow your faithful one to see a corrupt state.

ENGLISH: For David, after he was a servant to God's will in his own generation, died and as put with his fathers and saw a corrupt state.
QUENYA: For David, after he was a servant to God's will in his own generation, died and as put with his fathers and saw a corrupt state.

ENGLISH: But whom God raised did not see a corrupt state.
QUENYA: But whom God raised did not see a corrupt state.

QUENYA: Therefore you are to know – men, brothers – that through this man the forgiveness of sins is made known to you.

QUENYA: For the guilt from which it was not possible for you to be freed by the Law of Moses – concerning that anyone who believes is said without guilt .

ENGLISH: Therefore see that which is said in the Prophets will not come upon you:
QUENYA: Therefore see that which is said in the Prophets will not come upon you:

QUENYA: Look, you who speak mockery, and be filled with wonder, for I do a work in your days – a work that you will by no means believe even if anyone tells you about it!”

ENGLISH: leaving, the people asked to hear more about these matters on the following day of rest.
QUENYA: leaving, the people asked to hear more about these matters on the following day of rest.

ENGLISH: Therefore, after the people that were assembled scattered, numerous ones among the Jews and the converts that feared God followed Paul and Barnabas, who spoke to them and urged them to remain in God's grace.
QUENYA: Therefore, after the people that were assembled scattered, numerous ones among the Jews and the converts that feared God followed Paul and Barnabas, who spoke to them and urged them to remain in God's grace.

ENGLISH: On the following day of rest nearly the entire city assembled to hear the word of the Lord.
QUENYA: On the following day of rest nearly the entire city assembled to hear the word of the Lord.

ENGLISH: When the Jews saw the crowds, they were filled with envy, and with blasphemy they spoke against the things said by Paul.
QUENYA: When the Jews saw the crowds, they were filled with envy, and with blasphemy they spoke against the things said by Paul.

ENGLISH: Then, talking with boldness, Paul and Barnabas said: “To you it was necessary to first speak God's word. Since you push it away and do not count yourselves worthy for eternal life, behold! we turn to non-Jews.
QUENYA: Then, talking with boldness, Paul and Barnabas said: “To you it was necessary to first speak God's word. Since you push it away and do not count yourselves worthy for eternal life, behold! we turn to non-Jews.

ENGLISH: For so the Lord has commanded us: I have put you like a light of nations, for you to be salvation to the remotest part of earth.”
QUENYA: For so the Lord has commanded us: I have put you like a light of nations, for you to be salvation to the remotest part of earth.”

ENGLISH: When the people of the nations heard that, they had joy and praised God's word, and all that were destined for eternal life believed.
QUENYA: When the people of the nations heard that, they had joy and praised God's word, and all that were destined for eternal life believed.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, the Lord's word was carried through the entire country.
QUENYA: Furthermore, the Lord's word was carried through the entire country.

ENGLISH: But the Jews stirred up the reverent women and the prominent men in the city, and they raised up persecution against Paul and Barnabas and threw them beyond their borders.
QUENYA: But the Jews stirred up the reverent women and the prominent men in the city, and they raised up persecution against Paul and Barnabas and threw them beyond their borders.

ENGLISH: They shook the dust from their feet and went to Iconium.
QUENYA: They shook the dust from their feet and went to Iconium.

ENGLISH: And the disciples were filled with joy and Holy Spirit.
QUENYA: And the disciples were filled with joy and Holy Spirit.

QUENYA: Now in Iconium they went together into the synagogue, and they spoke in a manner causing a huge multitude to believe, Jews and Greeks alike.

ENGLISH: But the Jews that did not believe stirred up the non-Jews and made them hostile against the brothers.
QUENYA: But the Jews that did not believe stirred up the non-Jews and made them hostile against the brothers.

QUENYA: And yet, for a long time, they spoke with boldness by the power of the Lord, who witnessed to the word of his grace, by allowing signs and portents to happen through their hands.

QUENYA: But the multitude in the city was split, and some people were for the Jews and some others for the apostles.

QUENYA: There was an uprising of non-Jews and the Jews alike, with their rulers, to humiliate them and to kill them with stones.

ENGLISH: When they perceived it, they fled to the cities in Lycaonia, Lystra and Derbe and the country surrounding it.
QUENYA: When they perceived it, they fled to the cities in Lycaonia, Lystra and Derbe and the country surrounding it.

QUENYA: And there they made the gospel known.

QUENYA: And in Lystra was a man sitting who could not stand on his feet. He was lame from his mother's womb and had not ever walked.

QUENYA: This man listened to Paul when he talked, and when Paul looked at him and saw that he had the faith to be healed,

QUENYA: he spoke to him with a mighty voice: “Stand up on your feet, straight!” And he jumped up and walked.

QUENYA: And the crowds, when they saw what Paul had done, raised their voices, saying in the tongue of Lycaonia: “The gods have become men and have come down to us!”

QUENYA: And they called Barnabas Zeus, but Paul Hermes, since he was who spoke for them .

QUENYA: And the priest of Zeus, whose temple was before the city, brought oxen and garlands to the gates and wanted to sacrifice with the crowds.

QUENYA: But when the apostles Barnabas and Paul heard about that, they rent their cloaks and jumped into the crowd, crying

Also we are men that suffer the same things that you suffer, and we make the gospel known to you, wishing that you will turn yourselves away from these empty things to the living God, who created heaven and earth and sea and all the things in them.
QUENYA: and saying: “Men, what is your reason for doing these things? Also we are men that suffer the same things that you suffer, and we make the gospel known to you, wishing that you will turn yourselves away from these empty things to the living God, who created heaven and earth and sea and all the things in them.

QUENYA: In the past generations he allowed all the nations to go their own ways, though he did not let himself lack witness about his doing good, giving them rain from heaven and fruit in the proper time, filling their heart with food and joy.”

QUENYA: And speaking so they stopped – though with difficulty – the crowds from sacrificing to them .

QUENYA: But came some Jews from Antioch and Iconium and spoke to the crowds and changed their mind, and they threw stones at Paul and drew him out of the city, supposing that he was dead.

QUENYA: And after they made known the gospel to that city and made a quite large number of disciples, they returned to Lystra and Iconium and Antioch.

QUENYA: They strengthened the souls of the disciples, urging them to remain in the faith by saying: “It is necessary for us to go into God's kingdom through many tribulations.”

QUENYA: Furthermore, they appointed for them elders in every congregation, and by praying and fasting they gave them into hand of the Lord in whom they believed.

ENGLISH: And they went through Pisidia and came into Pamphylia,
QUENYA: And they went through Pisidia and came into Pamphylia,

QUENYA: and after they spoke the word in Perga, they went down to Attalia.

QUENYA: And from there they sailed away to Antioch, where beforehand God's grace was put in their care for the work they had now completed.

QUENYA: After they came there and gathered the congregation, they told them about all the things that God had done through them , and that he had opened to the non-Jews the door of faith.

QUENYA: Then they remained for not a short time with the disciples.

QUENYA: And some men came down from Judea and taught the brothers: “If you are not circumcised, by the tradition of Moses, it is not possible for you to obtain salvation.”

QUENYA: But after no small strife and quarreling among them and Paul and Barnabas, they arranged that Paul and Barnabas and some others from them were going to go up to the apostles and elders in Jerusalem concerning this dispute.

QUENYA: Therefore they, sent by the congregation, went through Phoenicia and Samaria, telling how some non-Jews were converted , and they brought great joy to the brothers.

ENGLISH: When they came to Jerusalem they were received by the congregation and the apostles and the elder men, and they told about all the things that God did by them.
QUENYA: When they came to Jerusalem they were received by the congregation and the apostles and the elder men, and they told about all the things that God did by them.

QUENYA: And yet some persons from the order of the Pharisees that believed, arose from their seats and said: “It is necessary to circumcize them and command them to keep the law of Moses.”

ENGLISH: And the apostles and the elders assembled to make a consideration about this matter.
QUENYA: And the apostles and the elders assembled to make a consideration about this matter.

QUENYA: After much dispute Peter arose and said to them: “Men, brothers, you know that from the first days God's choice was that through my mouth the nations were going to hear the word of the gospel, for them to believe.

QUENYA: Thus God, who knows the hearts, witnessed to them by giving them the Holy Spirit, as he also did to us.

ENGLISH: In nothing did he behave towards us and them in a different manner, after cleansing their heart by faith.
QUENYA: In nothing did he behave towards us and them in a different manner, after cleansing their heart by faith.

ENGLISH: Therefore, now what is your reason for testing God, by putting on the neck of these disciples a yoke that it was not possible to us and to our fathers alike to bear?
QUENYA: Therefore, now what is your reason for testing God, by putting on the neck of these disciples a yoke that it was not possible to us and to our fathers alike to bear?

ENGLISH: On the contrary, we believe that we will be saved by the grace of the Lord Jesus, as also these people believe.
QUENYA: On the contrary, we believe that we will be saved by the grace of the Lord Jesus, as also these people believe.

QUENYA: And the entire multitude was made silent, and they listened to Barnabas and Paul when they told about all the signs and portents that God had done among the nations through them .

QUENYA: After they stopped talking, Jacob said: “Men, brothers listen to me!

QUENYA: Symeon has told how God first gave heed to the nations to take out of them a people for his name.

ENGLISH: And the words of the prophets say the same thing, as is written:
QUENYA: And the words of the prophets say the same thing, as is written:

QUENYA: 'After these things I will return and I will rebuild David's fallen shelter, and I will rebuild its ruinous parts and I will raise it agan,

QUENYA: causing that remained among the men to seek the Lord, with people from all the nations,' says the Lord who is doing these things,

ENGLISH: known from of old.
QUENYA: known from of old.

QUENYA: Therefore my judgment is that we are not to cause difficulty to the people from the nations that turn themselves to God,

QUENYA: but that we will write to them that it is necessary for them to keep themselves away from idols and fornication and from what is strangled, and from blood.

QUENYA: For from ancient times Moses has had in all cities people that make him known, since he is read out in the synagogies on every day of rest.”

QUENYA: Then it seemed well to the apostles and the elders and to the whole congregation to send some chosen men from them to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas: Judas who was called Barsabbas, and Silas, prominent men among the brothers,

ENGLISH: and by their hand they wrote:“The apostles and the elders, your brothers, to the brothers that are in Antioch and Syria and Cilicia, they that are of the nations: Greetings! .
QUENYA: and by their hand they wrote:“The apostles and the elders, your brothers, to the brothers that are in Antioch and Syria and Cilicia, they that are of the nations: Greetings! .

ENGLISH: Since we have heard that some people from among us have caused you difficulty with their words, trying to overturn your soul though we have not given them instructions,
QUENYA: Since we have heard that some people from among us have caused you difficulty with their words, trying to overturn your soul though we have not given them instructions,

ENGLISH: we have with one mind made the choice that we will send some men to you with our dear ones, Barnabas and Paul,
QUENYA: we have with one mind made the choice that we will send some men to you with our dear ones, Barnabas and Paul,

ENGLISH: men that have put their life in danger, for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.
QUENYA: men that have put their life in danger, for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.

ENGLISH: Therefore we send Judas and Silas, to tell you the same things by word.
QUENYA: Therefore we send Judas and Silas, to tell you the same things by word.

QUENYA: For it seemed well to the Holy Spirit and to us not to put another burden upon you except these things that are necessary:

QUENYA: Keep yourselves away from things sacrificed to idols, and from blood, and from strangled animals, and from fornication. If you keep yourselves away from these things, you will do well. Health to you!”

QUENYA: Thus, when these men were being sent, they went down to Antioch, and they gathered the multitude and gave them the letter.

QUENYA: And after they read it, they had joy by the encouragement .

QUENYA: And Judas and Silas, since also they were prophets, urged the brothers with many words and strengthened them.

QUENYA: After dwelling there for a time, they were released by the brothers back to that sent them.

QUENYA: But Silas thought it was good for him to tarry there.

QUENYA: But Paul and Barnabas remained in Antioch, where they and numerous others made known the gospel about the Lord's word.

QUENYA: But Barnabas wished to bring with himself also John, who was called Mark.

QUENYA: But Paul did not think it was good to bring the men who abandoned them in Pamphylia and did not go with them to the work.

QUENYA: The anger between them was so sharp that it caused them to abandon one another, and Barnabas took Mark and sailed away to Cyprus.

QUENYA: He went through Syria and Cilicia, strengthening the congregations.
