QUENYA: Then he came to Derbe and also to Lystra. And behold! was there a disciple whose name was Timothy, the son of a believing Jewish woman, but of a Greek father.

ENGLISH: Of him all the brotehrs in Lystra and Iconium spoke well.
QUENYA: Of him all the brotehrs in Lystra and Iconium spoke well.

ENGLISH: Paul wished that he would come with him, and he took and circumsized him, by reason of the Jews that were in those regions, for all knew that his father was Greek.
QUENYA: Paul wished that he would come with him, and he took and circumsized him, by reason of the Jews that were in those regions, for all knew that his father was Greek.

ENGLISH: But when they went through the cities, they commanded them to keep the statutes fixed by the apostles and elders that were in Jerusalem.
QUENYA: But when they went through the cities, they commanded them to keep the statutes fixed by the apostles and elders that were in Jerusalem.

ENGLISH: Thus the congregations were being strengthened in the faith and rose in number from day to day.
QUENYA: Thus the congregations were being strengthened in the faith and rose in number from day to day.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, they went through Phrygia and the country of Galatia, since the Holy Spirit forbade to speak the word in Asia,
QUENYA: Furthermore, they went through Phrygia and the country of Galatia, since the Holy Spirit forbade to speak the word in Asia,

ENGLISH: but when they came to Mysia, they tried to go to Bithynia, but Jesus' spirit did not allow them .
QUENYA: but when they came to Mysia, they tried to go to Bithynia, but Jesus' spirit did not allow them .

ENGLISH: After they went through Mysia they came down to Troas.
QUENYA: After they went through Mysia they came down to Troas.

ENGLISH: And in the night Paul received a vision: A man from Macedonia stood requesting of him, saying: “Come over into Macedonia and help us!”
QUENYA: And in the night Paul received a vision: A man from Macedonia stood requesting of him, saying: “Come over into Macedonia and help us!”

ENGLISH: After he saw the vision, we sought to go to Macedonia, supposing that God summoned us to make the gospel known to them.
QUENYA: After he saw the vision, we sought to go to Macedonia, supposing that God summoned us to make the gospel known to them.

ENGLISH: Therefore we sailed from Troas and went straight to Samothrace, but on the following day to Neapolis
QUENYA: Therefore we sailed from Troas and went straight to Samothrace, but on the following day to Neapolis

ENGLISH: and from there to Philippi, a colony , which is the most prominent city in the Macedonia region. We halted in this city, remaining for some days.
QUENYA: and from there to Philippi, a colony , which is the most prominent city in the Macedonia region. We halted in this city, remaining for some days.

ENGLISH: And on the day of rest we went outside though the gate, to a place beside a river which we thought was a place of prayer, and we sat down and talked to the women that were assembled.
QUENYA: And on the day of rest we went outside though the gate, to a place beside a river which we thought was a place of prayer, and we sat down and talked to the women that were assembled.

ENGLISH: And a woman whose name was Lydia, a trader in purple cloth from the city of Thyatira who worshipped God, listened, and the Lord opened her heart to give heed to the things that Paul spoke.
QUENYA: And a woman whose name was Lydia, a trader in purple cloth from the city of Thyatira who worshipped God, listened, and the Lord opened her heart to give heed to the things that Paul spoke.

ENGLISH: After she and his family were baptized, she said in entreaty: “If you judge me faithful to the Lord, come into my house and remain!” And she compelled us to come.
QUENYA: After she and his family were baptized, she said in entreaty: “If you judge me faithful to the Lord, come into my house and remain!” And she compelled us to come.

ENGLISH: And it came , when we were going to the place of prayer, that a female slave met us, having a spirit of foresight . She brought her masters much money by using foresight.
QUENYA: And it came , when we were going to the place of prayer, that a female slave met us, having a spirit of foresight . She brought her masters much money by using foresight.

ENGLISH: This woman followed Paul and us, crying these words: “These men are slaves of God Most High, and they make known to you the path of salvation.”
QUENYA: This woman followed Paul and us, crying these words: “These men are slaves of God Most High, and they make known to you the path of salvation.”

ENGLISH: She did so for many days. Weary, Paul finally turned and said to the spirit: “I command you by the name of Jesus Christ: Come out of her!” And it came out in the same hour.
QUENYA: She did so for many days. Weary, Paul finally turned and said to the spirit: “I command you by the name of Jesus Christ: Come out of her!” And it came out in the same hour.

ENGLISH: When her masters saw that their hope of gain was gone, they seized Paul and Silas and dragged them to the place of commerce, to the rulers.
QUENYA: When her masters saw that their hope of gain was gone, they seized Paul and Silas and dragged them to the place of commerce, to the rulers.

ENGLISH: They brought them to the judges and said: “These men trouble our city, being Jewish,
QUENYA: They brought them to the judges and said: “These men trouble our city, being Jewish,

ENGLISH: and they make known customs that are not allowed for us as Romans to receive or follow.”
QUENYA: and they make known customs that are not allowed for us as Romans to receive or follow.”

ENGLISH: And the crowed arose against them , and the judges, after the tore their cloaks from them , commanded that one was to beat them with sticks .
QUENYA: And the crowed arose against them , and the judges, after the tore their cloaks from them , commanded that one was to beat them with sticks .

ENGLISH: After they gave them many blows, they threw them into gaol, commanding the goalkeeper to keep them securely.
QUENYA: After they gave them many blows, they threw them into gaol, commanding the goalkeeper to keep them securely.

ENGLISH: After they received such command, he threw them into the inmost gaol and fastened the their feet to the block .
QUENYA: After they received such command, he threw them into the inmost gaol and fastened the their feet to the block .

ENGLISH: But around the midst of the night Paul and Silas were praying, praising God with song, and the people in the gaol listened to them.
QUENYA: But around the midst of the night Paul and Silas were praying, praising God with song, and the people in the gaol listened to them.

ENGLISH: Suddenly a great earthquake happened, causing the foundations of the gaol to shake. Furthermore, in the same moment all the doors were opened, and the chains of all were loosened.
QUENYA: Suddenly a great earthquake happened, causing the foundations of the gaol to shake. Furthermore, in the same moment all the doors were opened, and the chains of all were loosened.

ENGLISH: The gaoler, when he was awakened and saw the doors of the prison opened, drew his sword and was going to kill himself, supposing that everyone in the gaol was gone.
QUENYA: The gaoler, when he was awakened and saw the doors of the prison opened, drew his sword and was going to kill himself, supposing that everyone in the gaol was gone.

ENGLISH: But Paul cried with a mighty voice: “Do not harm yourself, for we are all here!”
QUENYA: But Paul cried with a mighty voice: “Do not harm yourself, for we are all here!”

ENGLISH: And he asked for lights and jumped inside, and trembling he fell down before Paul and Silas.
QUENYA: And he asked for lights and jumped inside, and trembling he fell down before Paul and Silas.

ENGLISH: And he led them outside and said: “Lords, what is necessary for me to do to obtain salvation?”
QUENYA: And he led them outside and said: “Lords, what is necessary for me to do to obtain salvation?”

ENGLISH: They said: “Believe in the Lord Jesus, and you will be saved, you and your family.”
QUENYA: They said: “Believe in the Lord Jesus, and you will be saved, you and your family.”

ENGLISH: And they spoke the Lord's word to him and to all that were in his house.
QUENYA: And they spoke the Lord's word to him and to all that were in his house.

ENGLISH: And he brought them with him in that hour and washed their stripes, and he and all that were with him were baptized without waiting.
QUENYA: And he brought them with him in that hour and washed their stripes, and he and all that were with him were baptized without waiting.

ENGLISH: And he brought them into his house and put food on the table before them , and he had great joy with his entire familty, since he found faith in God.
QUENYA: And he brought them into his house and put food on the table before them , and he had great joy with his entire familty, since he found faith in God.

ENGLISH: When day came, the judges sent the club-bearers to say: “Release those men!”
QUENYA: When day came, the judges sent the club-bearers to say: “Release those men!”

ENGLISH: And the gaoler told these words to Paul: “The judges have sent some men to release you ! Therefore, now come out and go away in peace!”
QUENYA: And the gaoler told these words to Paul: “The judges have sent some men to release you ! Therefore, now come out and go away in peace!”

ENGLISH: But Paul said to them: “They flogged us before the people, without judgement, men that are Romans, and they threw us into gaol – and now they are throwing us out secretly? By no means! Let them come and lead us outside!”
QUENYA: But Paul said to them: “They flogged us before the people, without judgement, men that are Romans, and they threw us into gaol – and now they are throwing us out secretly? By no means! Let them come and lead us outside!”

ENGLISH: The club-bearers told these words to the judges. They were scared when they heard that they were Romans.
QUENYA: The club-bearers told these words to the judges. They were scared when they heard that they were Romans.

ENGLISH: Therefore they came and made a petition to them , and after they brought them outside, they asked that they would go away from the city.
QUENYA: Therefore they came and made a petition to them , and after they brought them outside, they asked that they would go away from the city.

ENGLISH: But they came out from the prison and went to the house of Lydia, and when they saw the brothers they urged them. Then they went away.
QUENYA: But they came out from the prison and went to the house of Lydia, and when they saw the brothers they urged them. Then they went away.

ENGLISH: Now they went through Amphipolis and Apollonia and came to Thessalonica, where was a Jewish synagogue.
QUENYA: Now they went through Amphipolis and Apollonia and came to Thessalonica, where was a Jewish synagogue.

ENGLISH: Thus, by his habit, Paul went in to them, and on three sabbaths he spoke with them about the Scriptures,
QUENYA: Thus, by his habit, Paul went in to them, and on three sabbaths he spoke with them about the Scriptures,

ENGLISH: giving them understanding and showing that it was necessary for the Christ to suffer and rise from dead, and he said: “This is the Christ, this Jesus that I make known to you.”
QUENYA: giving them understanding and showing that it was necessary for the Christ to suffer and rise from dead, and he said: “This is the Christ, this Jesus that I make known to you.”

ENGLISH: Therefore some people among them believed and stuck to Paul and Silas, with a great multitude of the Greeks that served God, and not a few of the most prominent women.
QUENYA: Therefore some people among them believed and stuck to Paul and Silas, with a great multitude of the Greeks that served God, and not a few of the most prominent women.

ENGLISH: But the Jews were being filled with envy, and after they gathered some wicked men from the place of commerce and formed a crowd, they caused an uprising in the city. They fell upon the house of Jason and sought to bring them ouside to the people.
QUENYA: But the Jews were being filled with envy, and after they gathered some wicked men from the place of commerce and formed a crowd, they caused an uprising in the city. They fell upon the house of Jason and sought to bring them ouside to the people.

ENGLISH: When they did not find them they drew Jason and some brothers to the rulers of the city, crying: “These people that have turned the world upside down have now come here as well,
QUENYA: When they did not find them they drew Jason and some brothers to the rulers of the city, crying: “These people that have turned the world upside down have now come here as well,

ENGLISH: and Jason has received them into his house! And all these people stand against the commands of the Emperor, for they say that is another king, Jesus.”
QUENYA: and Jason has received them into his house! And all these people stand against the commands of the Emperor, for they say that is another king, Jesus.”

ENGLISH: They stirred up the crowd and the rulers of the city that heard these things,
QUENYA: They stirred up the crowd and the rulers of the city that heard these things,

ENGLISH: and after taking sufficient security from Jason and the others they released them.
QUENYA: and after taking sufficient security from Jason and the others they released them.

ENGLISH: Without waiting, in that night the brothers sent both Paul and Silas to Beroea, and when they came there, they went into the synagogue of the Jews.
QUENYA: Without waiting, in that night the brothers sent both Paul and Silas to Beroea, and when they came there, they went into the synagogue of the Jews.

ENGLISH: They were nobler than those that lived in Thessalonica, and they received the word with all good will, and every day they searched the Scriptures to see if these things were so.
QUENYA: They were nobler than those that lived in Thessalonica, and they received the word with all good will, and every day they searched the Scriptures to see if these things were so.

ENGLISH: Therefore numerous ones among them believed, and so did not a few prominent Greek women, also numerous men.
QUENYA: Therefore numerous ones among them believed, and so did not a few prominent Greek women, also numerous men.

ENGLISH: But when the Jews from Thessalonica learnt that God's word was made known also in Beroea by Paul, they came there stirring up and disturbing the crowds.
QUENYA: But when the Jews from Thessalonica learnt that God's word was made known also in Beroea by Paul, they came there stirring up and disturbing the crowds.

ENGLISH: Without waiting the brothers sent Paul away, as far as the sea, but Silas and Timothy alike remained were they were.
QUENYA: Without waiting the brothers sent Paul away, as far as the sea, but Silas and Timothy alike remained were they were.

ENGLISH: But that led Paul brought him as far as Athens, and they returned bringing his command to Silas and Timothy: It was necessary for them to come as soon as they could .
QUENYA: But that led Paul brought him as far as Athens, and they returned bringing his command to Silas and Timothy: It was necessary for them to come as soon as they could .

ENGLISH: While Paul was waiting for them in Athens, his spirit was being disturned by seeing how the city was full of idols.
QUENYA: While Paul was waiting for them in Athens, his spirit was being disturned by seeing how the city was full of idols.

ENGLISH: Therefore he talked in the synagoge with the Jews and the others that worshipped God – also in the place of commerce, with those that came there.
QUENYA: Therefore he talked in the synagoge with the Jews and the others that worshipped God – also in the place of commerce, with those that came there.

ENGLISH: But some among the philosophers, the Epicureans and the Stoics alike, went into dispute with him, and some people among them said: “What does this idle-talking person want to say?” Others said: “It seems he is making known some foreign gods.” That was since he talked about the gospel about Jesus and the resurrection.
QUENYA: But some among the philosophers, the Epicureans and the Stoics alike, went into dispute with him, and some people among them said: “What does this idle-talking person want to say?” Others said: “It seems he is making known some foreign gods.” That was since he talked about the gospel about Jesus and the resurrection.

ENGLISH: Therefore they took him and led him into the Areopagus, saying: “May we know what it is, this teaching that you are speaking?
QUENYA: Therefore they took him and led him into the Areopagus, saying: “May we know what it is, this teaching that you are speaking?

ENGLISH: For you bring some ideas that are strange to our ears. Therefore we want to know what these things mean.”
QUENYA: For you bring some ideas that are strange to our ears. Therefore we want to know what these things mean.”

ENGLISH: For all in Athens and all the foreigners there set aside every free moment to do nothing except tell or hear news.
QUENYA: For all in Athens and all the foreigners there set aside every free moment to do nothing except tell or hear news.

ENGLISH: Paul stood up in the middle of the Areopagus and said: “Men from Athens, I perceive that in all things you have an awe for the gods greater than what others have.
QUENYA: Paul stood up in the middle of the Areopagus and said: “Men from Athens, I perceive that in all things you have an awe for the gods greater than what others have.

ENGLISH: For while I was going through the city, looking at the things that you worship, I found also an alter on which it was written: “To an unknown god.” Therefore, which you worship without knowing it, that I am making known to you.
QUENYA: For while I was going through the city, looking at the things that you worship, I found also an alter on which it was written: “To an unknown god.” Therefore, which you worship without knowing it, that I am making known to you.

ENGLISH: The God who made the earth and everything that is in it does not dwell in temples made by hands.
QUENYA: The God who made the earth and everything that is in it does not dwell in temples made by hands.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, he is not being served by men's hands, as if he has need of a single thing, he himself giving to all life and breath and all things.
QUENYA: Furthermore, he is not being served by men's hands, as if he has need of a single thing, he himself giving to all life and breath and all things.

ENGLISH: And he made out of one man every nation of men, for them to dwell on the entire surface of earth, and he appointed the times and the borders for the dwelling of men,
QUENYA: And he made out of one man every nation of men, for them to dwell on the entire surface of earth, and he appointed the times and the borders for the dwelling of men,

ENGLISH: for them to seek God, if they can reach towards him and find him, though indeed he is not far from a single person among us.
QUENYA: for them to seek God, if they can reach towards him and find him, though indeed he is not far from a single person among us.

ENGLISH: For by him we have life and we move and we exist, as also some poets among you have said: 'For we are also his kin.'
QUENYA: For by him we have life and we move and we exist, as also some poets among you have said: 'For we are also his kin.'

ENGLISH: Therefore, seeing that we are God's kin, we do not do well if we think about the Deity that he is like gold or silver or stone, or an artifact formed by man's art or thought.
QUENYA: Therefore, seeing that we are God's kin, we do not do well if we think about the Deity that he is like gold or silver or stone, or an artifact formed by man's art or thought.

ENGLISH: True, God showed patience in these times when people have been lacking knowledge, but now he says to men in every place that it is necessary for them to find repentance.
QUENYA: True, God showed patience in these times when people have been lacking knowledge, but now he says to men in every place that it is necessary for them to find repentance.

ENGLISH: For he has set a day in which he will judge earth in righteousness by a man that he has chosen, and he has given to all men security by raising him out of dead.”
QUENYA: For he has set a day in which he will judge earth in righteousness by a man that he has chosen, and he has given to all men security by raising him out of dead.”

ENGLISH: But when they heard about resurrection of dead, some among them spoke mockery, while others said: “We will hear you again about this matter another time.”
QUENYA: But when they heard about resurrection of dead, some among them spoke mockery, while others said: “We will hear you again about this matter another time.”

ENGLISH: Thus Paul went out from their midst,
QUENYA: Thus Paul went out from their midst,

ENGLISH: but some people stuck to him and believed. Among them were Dionysius who was a judge in the Areopagus, and a woman called Damaris, and some others beside them .
QUENYA: but some people stuck to him and believed. Among them were Dionysius who was a judge in the Areopagus, and a woman called Damaris, and some others beside them .

ENGLISH: After these things he went away from Athens and came to Corinth.
QUENYA: After these things he went away from Athens and came to Corinth.

ENGLISH: And he found a Jew called Aquila, a man born in Pontus, who a short time ago had come from Italy with Priscilla his wife, since by the command of Claudius all Jews had gone away from Rome. And he came to them,
QUENYA: And he found a Jew called Aquila, a man born in Pontus, who a short time ago had come from Italy with Priscilla his wife, since by the command of Claudius all Jews had gone away from Rome. And he came to them,

ENGLISH: and since they had the same kind of work, he remained with them and laboured. For their work was to make tents.
QUENYA: and since they had the same kind of work, he remained with them and laboured. For their work was to make tents.

ENGLISH: But he talked in the synagogue every sabbath and caused Jews and Greeks to believe.
QUENYA: But he talked in the synagogue every sabbath and caused Jews and Greeks to believe.

ENGLISH: When Silas and Timothy came down from Macedonia, Paul completely gave himself to making the Word known, witnessing to the Jews that Jesus was the Christ.
QUENYA: When Silas and Timothy came down from Macedonia, Paul completely gave himself to making the Word known, witnessing to the Jews that Jesus was the Christ.

ENGLISH: But when they stood against him and spoke mockery, he shook the dust from his garments and said to them: “May you blood come upon your own head! I am clean. From now I go to non-Jews.”
QUENYA: But when they stood against him and spoke mockery, he shook the dust from his garments and said to them: “May you blood come upon your own head! I am clean. From now I go to non-Jews.”

ENGLISH: And he moved from there and went into the house of a person called Titius Justus, who worshipped God. His house was built into the same building where the synagogue was.
QUENYA: And he moved from there and went into the house of a person called Titius Justus, who worshipped God. His house was built into the same building where the synagogue was.

ENGLISH: Crispus the synagogue ruler received the faith in the Lord with his entire family, and after hearing, numerous ones among the people of Corinth believed and were baptized.
QUENYA: Crispus the synagogue ruler received the faith in the Lord with his entire family, and after hearing, numerous ones among the people of Corinth believed and were baptized.

ENGLISH: And in a vision in the night the Lord said to Paul: “Do not fear, but speak and do not be silent,
QUENYA: And in a vision in the night the Lord said to Paul: “Do not fear, but speak and do not be silent,

ENGLISH: for I am with you and no one will do to you evil, for I have numerous people in this city.”
QUENYA: for I am with you and no one will do to you evil, for I have numerous people in this city.”

ENGLISH: And he remained there for one year and six months, teaching among them God's word.
QUENYA: And he remained there for one year and six months, teaching among them God's word.

ENGLISH: Now when Gallio was proconsul of Achaia, the Jews with one mind arose against Paul and led him to the judgement seat,
QUENYA: Now when Gallio was proconsul of Achaia, the Jews with one mind arose against Paul and led him to the judgement seat,

ENGLISH: saying: “This man causes men to believe it is necessary for them to worship God in a manner against the Law.”
QUENYA: saying: “This man causes men to believe it is necessary for them to worship God in a manner against the Law.”

ENGLISH: But when Paul was going to open his mouth, Gallio said to the Jews: “If the matter were about evil or a wicked deed, I had reason to have patience with you.
QUENYA: But when Paul was going to open his mouth, Gallio said to the Jews: “If the matter were about evil or a wicked deed, I had reason to have patience with you.

ENGLISH: But if the matter is about quarrelings about some words and names and the Law that you have, it is necessary for you to see to it. I do not want to be judge concerning these things.”
QUENYA: But if the matter is about quarrelings about some words and names and the Law that you have, it is necessary for you to see to it. I do not want to be judge concerning these things.”

ENGLISH: And he drove them away from the judgement seat.
QUENYA: And he drove them away from the judgement seat.

ENGLISH: But all among them seized Sosthenes the synagogue ruler and beat him before the judgement seat. But Gallio gave heed to none of these things.
QUENYA: But all among them seized Sosthenes the synagogue ruler and beat him before the judgement seat. But Gallio gave heed to none of these things.

ENGLISH: But after remaining there for many days more, Paul said farewell to the brothers and sailed away to Syria, and with him went Priscilla and Aquila. He went away after cutting his hair in Cencreai, for he had a pledge.
QUENYA: But after remaining there for many days more, Paul said farewell to the brothers and sailed away to Syria, and with him went Priscilla and Aquila. He went away after cutting his hair in Cencreai, for he had a pledge.

ENGLISH: They came to Ephesus, and he left them there, but he went into the synagogue and spoke with the Jews.
QUENYA: They came to Ephesus, and he left them there, but he went into the synagogue and spoke with the Jews.

ENGLISH: When they requested from him to stay with them for a longer time, he did not want to,
QUENYA: When they requested from him to stay with them for a longer time, he did not want to,

ENGLISH: but said farewell and told them: “I will return to you again, if God wishes.” And he sailed away to Ephesus and came down to Caesarea. And he went up and greeted the congregation, and went down to Antioch.
QUENYA: but said farewell and told them: “I will return to you again, if God wishes.” And he sailed away to Ephesus and came down to Caesarea. And he went up and greeted the congregation, and went down to Antioch.

ENGLISH: And after he dwelt there for a time he went away and travelled from place to place through the country of Alatia and Phrygia, strengthening the disciples.
QUENYA: And after he dwelt there for a time he went away and travelled from place to place through the country of Alatia and Phrygia, strengthening the disciples.

ENGLISH: Now came to Ephesus a Jew whose name was Apollo, born in Alexandria. He knew to talk well and was mighty in the Scriptures.
QUENYA: Now came to Ephesus a Jew whose name was Apollo, born in Alexandria. He knew to talk well and was mighty in the Scriptures.

ENGLISH: He was instructed in hte Lord's way, and since he was glowing with the spirit, he talked and taught what was true concerning Jesus, be he knew only John's baptism.
QUENYA: He was instructed in hte Lord's way, and since he was glowing with the spirit, he talked and taught what was true concerning Jesus, be he knew only John's baptism.

ENGLISH: And this man began to speak boldly in the synagogue. When Priscilla and Aquila heard him, they took him with them and led him to a deeper understanding of God's way.
QUENYA: And this man began to speak boldly in the synagogue. When Priscilla and Aquila heard him, they took him with them and led him to a deeper understanding of God's way.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, since he wished to go into Achaia, the brothers wrote to the disciples, urging them to receive him well . Thus, when he came there, he greatly helped those who believed by the grace.
QUENYA: Furthermore, since he wished to go into Achaia, the brothers wrote to the disciples, urging them to receive him well . Thus, when he came there, he greatly helped those who believed by the grace.

ENGLISH: And with vigour he indicated the mistake of the Jews, showing from the scriptures that Jesus was the Christ.
QUENYA: And with vigour he indicated the mistake of the Jews, showing from the scriptures that Jesus was the Christ.

ENGLISH: While Apollos was in Corinth it happened that Paul went through the inlands as far as Ephesus. And he found some disciples
QUENYA: While Apollos was in Corinth it happened that Paul went through the inlands as far as Ephesus. And he found some disciples

ENGLISH: and said to them: “Did you receive Holy Spirit when you believed?” They said to him: “Indeed we have not heard that is a Holy Spirit.”
QUENYA: and said to them: “Did you receive Holy Spirit when you believed?” They said to him: “Indeed we have not heard that is a Holy Spirit.”

ENGLISH: And he said: “In what, then, were you baptized?” They answered: “In the baptism of John.”
QUENYA: And he said: “In what, then, were you baptized?” They answered: “In the baptism of John.”

ENGLISH: Paul said: “John baptized with the baptism of mind-change, urging the people to believe in who was going to come after him – that is, in Jesus.”
QUENYA: Paul said: “John baptized with the baptism of mind-change, urging the people to believe in who was going to come after him – that is, in Jesus.”

ENGLISH: When they heard that, they were baptized in the name of Jesus Christ.
QUENYA: When they heard that, they were baptized in the name of Jesus Christ.

ENGLISH: And when Paul put his hands on them, the Holy Spirit came upon them, and they spoke in tongues and talked like prophets.
QUENYA: And when Paul put his hands on them, the Holy Spirit came upon them, and they spoke in tongues and talked like prophets.

ENGLISH: Their whole number was around twelve men.
QUENYA: Their whole number was around twelve men.

ENGLISH: He went into the synagogue and spoke boldly for three months, talking and bringing others to an understanding of God's kingdom.
QUENYA: He went into the synagogue and spoke boldly for three months, talking and bringing others to an understanding of God's kingdom.

ENGLISH: But when some people made themselves hard and did not believe, speaking mockery about the Way before the multitude, he abandoned them and separated the disciples from them, on every day giving talks in the hall of Tyranus.
QUENYA: But when some people made themselves hard and did not believe, speaking mockery about the Way before the multitude, he abandoned them and separated the disciples from them, on every day giving talks in the hall of Tyranus.

ENGLISH: That happened throughout two years, and thus all that dwelt in Asia heard God's word, Jews and Greeks alike.
QUENYA: That happened throughout two years, and thus all that dwelt in Asia heard God's word, Jews and Greeks alike.

ENGLISH: God did some mighty deeds, beyond what was usual, by Paul's hands.
QUENYA: God did some mighty deeds, beyond what was usual, by Paul's hands.

ENGLISH: Thus even clothes and aprons were carried from his skin and put on the sick ones, and the illnesses went away from them, and the wicked spirits came out.
QUENYA: Thus even clothes and aprons were carried from his skin and put on the sick ones, and the illnesses went away from them, and the wicked spirits came out.

QUENYA: And numerous ones of who believed came and spoke openly about their deeds.

QUENYA: Not a few among those that before used magic gathered their books and burned them before the eyes of all. And they calculated the sum that they paid for them and found that their value was fifty thousand silver-pieces.

QUENYA: Thus, with power, the Lord's word grew and was made mighty.

QUENYA: He sent to Macedonia two of his servants, Timothy and Erastus, but he himself remained for a time in Asia.

QUENYA: Around that time was not a small uprising concerning the Way.

QUENYA: For a man called Demetrius, a silversmith, gave no small wealth to the craftsmen by making silver shrines of Artemis.

QUENYA: And he gathered them and who worked with such things and said: “Men, you know well that by this our work we have our wealth.

QUENYA: And you see and you hear how not only in Ephesus, but in nearly all Asia, this Paul has brought a big crowd to a new belief, by saying that those gods that are made by hands are not gods at all.

QUENYA: Furthermore, is a danger that not only this our work will be despised, but also that the temple of the great Artemis will be counted as nothing, putting an end also to her greatness, before which all Asia and world bow.”

QUENYA: Hearing this and being filled with anger, the men cried: “Great is Artemis of the Ephesians!”

QUENYA: Thus the city was being filled with confusion, and with one mind they went rushing into the theater, seizing Gaius and Aristarchus and bringing them with them by force. They were people from Macedonia traveling with Paul.

QUENYA: Paul himself wanted to go inside to the people, but the disciples were not willling to let him.

QUENYA: Some among the rulers of Asia, that were his friends, sent to him and asked of him that he was not going to put himself in danger in the theater.

QUENYA: Therefore they together brought forward Alexander out of the crowd, for the Jews pushed him forward.

QUENYA: After the city scribe made the crowd quiet, he said: “Men, who is among men who does not know that the city of the Ephesians is guardian of the temple of the great Artemis and of the image that fell from heaven?

QUENYA: Therefore, since one cannot deny that, you will do well if you are still and do nothing without thought.

QUENYA: For you have brought these men that are not robbers of temples and have not spoken mockery against our goddess.

QUENYA: Therefore, if Demetrius and the craftsmen with him have a dispute with anyone, are court days and are proconsuls : Let them bring the disputes that they have, one with the other, to the judges.

QUENYA: But if you seek anything beyond that, it is necessary that a regular assembly settles it.

QUENYA: And after he said that, he send the ones having assembled away.

QUENYA: When the uprising was over, Paul summoned the disciples, and after he encouraged them and said farewell to them, he went away to go into Macedonia.

QUENYA: After he went through those regions and encouraged that were there with numerous words, he came into Greece.

QUENYA: And after he remained three months there, he was going to said away to Syrian, but since the Jews made plans against him, he made the choice that he was going to return through Macedonia.

QUENYA: With him on the journey were Sosipather the son of Pyrrhus from Beroea, Aristarchus and Secundus from Thessalonica, and Gaius from Derbe, and Timothy and Tryphimus from Asia.

QUENYA: They went before us and waited for us in Troas,

QUENYA: but we sailed away from Philippi after the days of Unleavened Breads, and we came to them in Troas before five days were gone. There we remained for seven days.

QUENYA: On the first day of the week, when we were assembled to break bread, Paul talked to them, since he was going away on the following day, and he was speaking until the middle of the night.

QUENYA: But were many lamps in the upper hall where we were assembled.

QUENYA: Sitting by the window was a young man called Eutychus, who fell into deep sleep while Paul was talking, and collapsing in sleep he fell down from the third floor and was dead when he was lifted up.

QUENYA: But Paul went down, threw himself upon him, put his arms around him and said: “Do not make clamour, for he is still alive.”

QUENYA: But the boy they brough away alive, and they were comforted beyond measure.

QUENYA: Now we went before them to the boat and sailed away to Assos, where we were going to receive Paul into the ship. For after he gave commands about that, he himself wished to go on his feet .

QUENYA: When he came as far as the place where we were in Assos, we received him into the boat and went to Mitylene.

QUENYA: And after we sailed from there on the following day we came beside Chios, and after one more day we reached as far as Samos, and on the following day we came into Miletus.

QUENYA: For Paul made the choice that he would pass over Ephesus, not wishing to halt in Asia, for he was traveling in urgency: If he could he wanted to reach Jerusalem before the Festival of Seven Weeks .

QUENYA: But from Miletus he sent to Ephesus and summoned the elders of the congregation.

QUENYA: When they came to him he said to them: “You know well how from the first day that I came to Asia I was with you the whole time,

ENGLISH: working for the Lord in all lowliness, having tears and suffering the tribulations that happened to me by the evil plans of the Jews,
QUENYA: working for the Lord in all lowliness, having tears and suffering the tribulations that happened to me by the evil plans of the Jews,

QUENYA: while I did not keep from you a single thing beneficial to you, or failed to instruct you before the people and in the houses.

ENGLISH: But I witnessed to Jews and to Greeks alike about repentance towards God and faith in our Lord, Jesus.
QUENYA: But I witnessed to Jews and to Greeks alike about repentance towards God and faith in our Lord, Jesus.

ENGLISH: And now, behold, bound in the spirit I go to Jerusalem, though I do not know that will happen to me in it,
QUENYA: And now, behold, bound in the spirit I go to Jerusalem, though I do not know that will happen to me in it,

ENGLISH: except that in every city the Holy Spirit witnesses to me that bonds and tribulations are waiting for me.
QUENYA: except that in every city the Holy Spirit witnesses to me that bonds and tribulations are waiting for me.

ENGLISH: And yet I do not count my life that dear to me, if it is possible for me to complete my ministry which I received from the Lord Jesus: Witnessing about the gospel of the grace of God.
QUENYA: And yet I do not count my life that dear to me, if it is possible for me to complete my ministry which I received from the Lord Jesus: Witnessing about the gospel of the grace of God.

ENGLISH: And now, behold, I know that you will not see my face again, you all among whom I walked, making known the kingdom
QUENYA: And now, behold, I know that you will not see my face again, you all among whom I walked, making known the kingdom

ENGLISH: Therefore I witness to all among you that I am clean from the blood of all men,
QUENYA: Therefore I witness to all among you that I am clean from the blood of all men,

ENGLISH: for I have not kept myself from telling you God's entire plan.
QUENYA: for I have not kept myself from telling you God's entire plan.

ENGLISH: Watch yourselves and the entire flock which the Holy Spirit has put in your patronage . Be shepherds for the Lord's congregation, which he gained with his own blood.
QUENYA: Watch yourselves and the entire flock which the Holy Spirit has put in your patronage . Be shepherds for the Lord's congregation, which he gained with his own blood.

ENGLISH: I know that after I pass, oppressive wolves will come among you, that do not have mercy on the flock,
QUENYA: I know that after I pass, oppressive wolves will come among you, that do not have mercy on the flock,

QUENYA: and from yourselves will arise some men that speak twisted things, to draw away the disicples after themselves.

QUENYA: Therefore be awake, recalling how through three years, at night and at day, I did not stop instructing you with tears.

ENGLISH: And now I give you over to God and to the word of his grace, which can build you up and give you your part as heirs, with all the sanctified ones.
QUENYA: And now I give you over to God and to the word of his grace, which can build you up and give you your part as heirs, with all the sanctified ones.

QUENYA: You yourselves know that these hands have given me and who were with me our needs.

QUENYA: We sought the disciples and found them, and we remained there for seven days. But by the Spirit they said to Paul: “Do not set foot in Jerusalem!”

QUENYA: and we said farewell to one another, and we went into the boat, but they returned home.

QUENYA: From Tyre we came to Ptolemais, completing the voyage . We greeted the brothers and remained one day with them.

QUENYA: On hte following day we sailed away and came to Caesarea, and we went into the house of Philip, a man who was making known the gospel. He was among the Seven, and we remained with him.

QUENYA: were with this man four daughters, virgins, who had a prophet's gift.

QUENYA: When we heard this, we and who dwelt there alike asked of him: “Do not go up to Jerusalem!”

QUENYA: Then Paul answered: “What are you doing, wailing and breaking my heart? For I am ready, not just to be bound, but also to die in Jerusalem for the name of the Lord Jesus.”

QUENYA: After these days we prepared and went on our journey to Jerusalem.

QUENYA: But some of the discipes from Jerusalem also went with us, to bring us to the man in whose house we were going to dwell: Mnason, who was of the first disciples.

ENGLISH: When we came to Jerusalem, the brothers received us in joy.
QUENYA: When we came to Jerusalem, the brothers received us in joy.

QUENYA: But on the following day Paul went with us into the house of James, and all the elders were there.

QUENYA: And they greeted them and told about every single thing that God did among the nations by his ministry.

QUENYA: After hearing that they gave glory to God, and they said to him: “You behold, brother, how are multitudes that believe among the Jews, and all among them burn for the Law.

QUENYA: But they have heard that it has been said concerning you that you have taught among the nations that it is necessary for them to stand away from Moses, teaching them that they are not to circumcise their children or follow the customs.

ENGLISH: What, then, are we to do? It is certain that they will hear that you have come.
QUENYA: What, then, are we to do? It is certain that they will hear that you have come.

ENGLISH: Therefore do this thing that we tell you: are with us four men that have a vow.
QUENYA: Therefore do this thing that we tell you: are with us four men that have a vow.

ENGLISH: Bring them with you and purify yourself with them, and you pay for them, for them to cut the hair off their head. Then all will understand that what they have heard about you is not true, but that you follow the Law and keep it.
QUENYA: Bring them with you and purify yourself with them, and you pay for them, for them to cut the hair off their head. Then all will understand that what they have heard about you is not true, but that you follow the Law and keep it.

QUENYA: Concerning the non-Jews that believe we have written to them, commanding that it is necessary for them to keep themselves away from what has been sacrificed to idols, from blood, from flesh of strangled animals and from fornication.”

QUENYA: But shortly before the seven days were complete, the Jews from Asia saw him in the temple and caused an uprising among the crowd, and they put their hands on him

ENGLISH: and cried: “Men of Israel, help! This man is who teaches everyone in every place against the people and the Law, and against this place! Furthermore, he has brought some Greeks into the temple and has defiled this holy place!”
QUENYA: and cried: “Men of Israel, help! This man is who teaches everyone in every place against the people and the Law, and against this place! Furthermore, he has brought some Greeks into the temple and has defiled this holy place!”

QUENYA: For before they saw Tryphimus from Ephesus in the city with him, and they supposed that Paul brought him into the temple.

QUENYA: And the whole city was stirred, and the people ran together, and they seized Paul and dragged him out of the temple. In the same moment the gates were closed.

QUENYA: And while they sought to kill him, word came to the chief of the army, about all of Jerusalem being in disorder.

ENGLISH: Without waiting he brought some soldiers and centurions and ran down to them. Seeing the chief and the soldiers they stopped beating Paul.
QUENYA: Without waiting he brought some soldiers and centurions and ran down to them. Seeing the chief and the soldiers they stopped beating Paul.

QUENYA: Then the army commander came and took him and commanded: “Bind him with two chains!” And he asked about who he was and about what he had done.

QUENYA: But some in the crowd cried one thing and others another thing. By reason of the noise he could learn nothing certain, and he commanded that they were to bring Paul to the camp.

ENGLISH: But when he came to the steps it was necessary for the soldiers to carry him, because of the violence of the crowd.
QUENYA: But when he came to the steps it was necessary for the soldiers to carry him, because of the violence of the crowd.

ENGLISH: For the multitude of the people followed him, crying: “Kill him!”
QUENYA: For the multitude of the people followed him, crying: “Kill him!”

QUENYA: When they were going to lead him into the camp, Paul said to the army commander: “May I say something to you?” He said: “Can you speak Greek?

ENGLISH: Are you really not the Egyptian who before these days caused an unrising and led the four thousand dagger men into the wilderness?”
QUENYA: Are you really not the Egyptian who before these days caused an unrising and led the four thousand dagger men into the wilderness?”

ENGLISH: Then Paul said: “I a Jewish man, born in Tarsus in Cilicia, a city not obscure. But I ask of you: Allow me to speak to the people!”
QUENYA: Then Paul said: “I a Jewish man, born in Tarsus in Cilicia, a city not obscure. But I ask of you: Allow me to speak to the people!”

ENGLISH: After he allowed that, Paul, standing on the steps, moved with his hand to the people. When a deep silence fell, he spoke to them in the Hebrew language, saying:
QUENYA: After he allowed that, Paul, standing on the steps, moved with his hand to the people. When a deep silence fell, he spoke to them in the Hebrew language, saying:

ENGLISH: “Men, brothers and fathers, hear me speak for myself!”
QUENYA: “Men, brothers and fathers, hear me speak for myself!”

ENGLISH: When they heard that he was speaking to them in the Hebrew language, they were still more silent, and he said:
QUENYA: When they heard that he was speaking to them in the Hebrew language, they were still more silent, and he said:

ENGLISH: “I am a Jew, born in Tarsus in Cilicia, but instructed in this city before the feet of Gamaliel in the tough manner of the Law of our fathers. I was burning for God like all among you on this day.
QUENYA: “I am a Jew, born in Tarsus in Cilicia, but instructed in this city before the feet of Gamaliel in the tough manner of the Law of our fathers. I was burning for God like all among you on this day.

ENGLISH: And I persecuted this Way to the death, binding and giving over into prison men and women alike,
QUENYA: And I persecuted this Way to the death, binding and giving over into prison men and women alike,

ENGLISH: as also the chief priest and the entire council of elders can witness for me. From them I also got messages to the brothers in Damascus, and I was on my way to bring also that were there bound to Jerusalem for punishment.

QUENYA: and I fell to earth and heard a voice say to me: 'Saul, Saul, what is your reason for persecuting me?'

QUENYA: I answered: 'Who are you, Lord?' And he said to me: 'I am Jesus from Nazareth, whom you pursue.'

QUENYA: Then I said: 'What am I to do, Lord?' The Lord said to me: 'Rise, go into Damascus, and there everything which is appointed to you to do will be told you.'

QUENYA: and saw him say to me: 'Be quick and go away from Jerusalem with urgency, for they will not receive your witness about me.'

QUENYA: And yet he said to me: 'Go, for I will send you to far-off nations!'

QUENYA: And since they shouted and shook their cloaks and threw dust into the air,

QUENYA: the army chief commanded that one was to bring him into the camp, in order to be examined by flogging, for him to know the reason why they shouted at him so.

QUENYA: But after they stretched him out with straps for the flogging, Paul said to the centurion who was standing there: “May you flog a man who is Roman, and who is not judged?”

QUENYA: When the centurion heard that, he went to the army chief and told it to him, saying: “What are you going to do? For the man is a Roman!”

ENGLISH: Therefore the army commander came to him and asked: “Tell me, are you Roman?” He said: “I am.”
QUENYA: Therefore the army commander came to him and asked: “Tell me, are you Roman?” He said: “I am.”

ENGLISH: The army commander answered: “I traded to myself those rights with a great sum .” Paul said: “But I was born into them.”
QUENYA: The army commander answered: “I traded to myself those rights with a great sum .” Paul said: “But I was born into them.”

ENGLISH: Therefore, in the same moment, the men that were going to examine him by torture stood away from him, and fear seized the army commander when he found that he was Roman, after he had bound him.
QUENYA: Therefore, in the same moment, the men that were going to examine him by torture stood away from him, and fear seized the army commander when he found that he was Roman, after he had bound him.

QUENYA: On the following day he wished to know certainly what evil the Jews said that he had done. Therefore he released him from the chains and commanded the High Council that they were to assemble. Then he brought Paul and put him before them.

ENGLISH: Paul, looking at the High Council, said: “Men, brothers, I have behaved before God with perfect conscience, until this day.”
QUENYA: Paul, looking at the High Council, said: “Men, brothers, I have behaved before God with perfect conscience, until this day.”

QUENYA: Then Ananias the chief priest commanded that stood by him that they were to strike him on the mouth.

ENGLISH: that stood by him said: “Are you speaking evil about the chief priest of God?”
QUENYA: that stood by him said: “Are you speaking evil about the chief priest of God?”

QUENYA: And Paul said: “Brothers, I did not know that he is the chief priest. For is written: Do not speak evil of a chief of your people.”

ENGLISH: He knew that among that were there, one part was of Sadducees and another of Pharisees, and therefore he cried in the High Council: “Men, brothers, I am a Pharisee, a son of Pharisees. Concerning the hope and the resurrection of dead I am being judged!”
QUENYA: He knew that among that were there, one part was of Sadducees and another of Pharisees, and therefore he cried in the High Council: “Men, brothers, I am a Pharisee, a son of Pharisees. Concerning the hope and the resurrection of dead I am being judged!”

QUENYA: Since he said this thing, there was a dispute between Pharisees and Sadducees, and the multitude was split.

QUENYA: For Sadducces say that is not resurrection or angel or spirit, but the Pharisees openly believe all these things.

QUENYA: Then there was great clamour, and some scribes that were of the party of the Pharisees arose and said in dispute: “We do not find evil in this man. What if a spirit has indeed spoken to him, or an angel?”

QUENYA: When a sharp strife arose, the army commander feared that they were going to pull him into pieces, and he commanded the soldiers that they were to go down to snatch him out of their midst and to bring him into the camp.

QUENYA: But on the following day the Lord stood by him and said: “Courage! For as you have witnessed about that concern me in Jerusalem, so it is necessary for you to witness also in Rome.”

QUENYA: When day came, the Jews made a compact and cursed themselves if they ate or drank before killing Paul.

ENGLISH: The number of the men who together gave this oath was over forty.
QUENYA: The number of the men who together gave this oath was over forty.

QUENYA: They went to the chief priests and to the elders and said: “We have given an oath that we are not going to eat before we have killed Paul.

ENGLISH: Therefore tell the army chief, you together with the High Council, that it is necessary for him to bring him down to you, as if you wish to make an inquiry to know more certainly the things that concern him. But before he shall come near, we shall be ready to kill him.”
QUENYA: Therefore tell the army chief, you together with the High Council, that it is necessary for him to bring him down to you, as if you wish to make an inquiry to know more certainly the things that concern him. But before he shall come near, we shall be ready to kill him.”

QUENYA: But when Paul's sister's son heard that they were lying hidden to kill him, he went to him, and when he came to the camp he told it to him.

ENGLISH: Therefore Paul called one among the centurions and said: 'Bring this young man to the army chief, for he has a thing to tell him.”
QUENYA: Therefore Paul called one among the centurions and said: 'Bring this young man to the army chief, for he has a thing to tell him.”

ENGLISH: Therefore this man took him and brought him to the army chief, and he said: “Paul, the bound man, called me and asked of me that I would bring this young man to you, for he has a thing to say to you.”
QUENYA: Therefore this man took him and brought him to the army chief, and he said: “Paul, the bound man, called me and asked of me that I would bring this young man to you, for he has a thing to say to you.”

ENGLISH: The army chief took his hand and went away to a private place and asked: “What do you have to tell me?”
QUENYA: The army chief took his hand and went away to a private place and asked: “What do you have to tell me?”

ENGLISH: He said: “The Jews together have made a plan that they will ask that tomorrow you will bring Paul down to the High Council, as if they want to learn more certainly what he has done.
QUENYA: He said: “The Jews together have made a plan that they will ask that tomorrow you will bring Paul down to the High Council, as if they want to learn more certainly what he has done.

ENGLISH: But you do not allow them to induce you into doing that, for more than forty men among them are lying hidden waiting for him, and they have bound themselves with an oath that they will not eat or drink before they have killed him, and now they are ready, waiting for your assent.”
QUENYA: But you do not allow them to induce you into doing that, for more than forty men among them are lying hidden waiting for him, and they have bound themselves with an oath that they will not eat or drink before they have killed him, and now they are ready, waiting for your assent.”

QUENYA: Then the army chief went away from the young man after commanding him: “Do not say to anyone that you have revealed these things to me.”

ENGLISH: And he called two of the centurions and said: “Prepare two hundred soldiers to go to Caesarea, with seventy horsemen and two hundred men that carry spears, at the third hour of the night.
QUENYA: And he called two of the centurions and said: “Prepare two hundred soldiers to go to Caesarea, with seventy horsemen and two hundred men that carry spears, at the third hour of the night.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, bring some horses. Thus, letting Paul ride, you will bring him in safety to Felix the governor.”
QUENYA: Furthermore, bring some horses. Thus, letting Paul ride, you will bring him in safety to Felix the governor.”

ENGLISH: And he wrote a message having these words:
QUENYA: And he wrote a message having these words:

ENGLISH: “Claudius Lysias to the mighty governor, Felix: Greetings!
QUENYA: “Claudius Lysias to the mighty governor, Felix: Greetings!

ENGLISH: This man was seized by the Jews and was near to being slain by them, but I fell upon them with the soldiers and saved him, since I learnt that he was a Roman.
QUENYA: This man was seized by the Jews and was near to being slain by them, but I fell upon them with the soldiers and saved him, since I learnt that he was a Roman.

ENGLISH: And wishing to know the reason of their complaint against him, I brought him down into their High Council.
QUENYA: And wishing to know the reason of their complaint against him, I brought him down into their High Council.

ENGLISH: I found that complaints about disputes touching on their Law are brought against him, but about nothing worthy of death or of chains.
QUENYA: I found that complaints about disputes touching on their Law are brought against him, but about nothing worthy of death or of chains.

ENGLISH: But since a plan against this man has been revealed to me, I sent him to you without waiting, and I command that have complaints about him that they must speak against him before you.”
QUENYA: But since a plan against this man has been revealed to me, I sent him to you without waiting, and I command that have complaints about him that they must speak against him before you.”

ENGLISH: Therefore these soldiers took Paul, as was commanded to them, and brought him at night to Antipatris.
QUENYA: Therefore these soldiers took Paul, as was commanded to them, and brought him at night to Antipatris.

ENGLISH: On the following day they let the horsemen go with him still, and returned to the camp.
QUENYA: On the following day they let the horsemen go with him still, and returned to the camp.

ENGLISH: The horsemen went into Caesarea and gave the message to the governor, and put also Paul before him.
QUENYA: The horsemen went into Caesarea and gave the message to the governor, and put also Paul before him.

QUENYA: After he read the letter he asked about what region he came from, and learnt that he was from Cilicia.

ENGLISH: He said: “I will hear you, when the people that have complaints about you shall arive also.” And he commanded that one was to keep him in gaol in the palace of Herod.
QUENYA: He said: “I will hear you, when the people that have complaints about you shall arive also.” And he commanded that one was to keep him in gaol in the palace of Herod.

QUENYA: After five days Ananias the chief priest came down with some elders and an orator whose name was Tertulllus, and they spoke evil about Paul.

QUENYA: When he was called, Tertullus began to speak against him, saying: “Great peace we have through you, and reforms occur in this nation by your foresight!

ENGLISH: In all times and places, mighty Felix, we receive those with greatest thanks.
QUENYA: In all times and places, mighty Felix, we receive those with greatest thanks.

ENGLISH: But so as not to take more of your time, I ask of you that you will listen to us briefly, gracious as you are.
QUENYA: But so as not to take more of your time, I ask of you that you will listen to us briefly, gracious as you are.

ENGLISH: For we have found that this man is a pestilence, causing uprisings among all the Jews through the entire world, and he is prominent in the sect of the Nazarenes,
QUENYA: For we have found that this man is a pestilence, causing uprisings among all the Jews through the entire world, and he is prominent in the sect of the Nazarenes,

ENGLISH: a person who also tried to defile the temple, and whom we seized. We wanted to judge him by our Law,
QUENYA: a person who also tried to defile the temple, and whom we seized. We wanted to judge him by our Law,

ENGLISH: but Lysias the army chief came and took him out of our hands by violence and brought him away.
QUENYA: but Lysias the army chief came and took him out of our hands by violence and brought him away.

ENGLISH: From him it is possible for you, by examining him, to learn about all the crimes that we say he has done.”
QUENYA: From him it is possible for you, by examining him, to learn about all the crimes that we say he has done.”

ENGLISH: The Jews were his supporters and said that so it was.
QUENYA: The Jews were his supporters and said that so it was.

ENGLISH: And Paul, when the governor with a gesture of his head allowed him to talk, answered:“Knowing well that this nation has had you as judge for many years, I speak freely for myself.
QUENYA: And Paul, when the governor with a gesture of his head allowed him to talk, answered:“Knowing well that this nation has had you as judge for many years, I speak freely for myself.

ENGLISH: It is possible for you to learn that only twelve days ago I went up to worship in Jerusalem.
QUENYA: It is possible for you to learn that only twelve days ago I went up to worship in Jerusalem.

ENGLISH: They did not find me in the temple having a dispute with anyone or causing an uprising, in the synagogues or in the city.
QUENYA: They did not find me in the temple having a dispute with anyone or causing an uprising, in the synagogues or in the city.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, it is not possible for them to demonstrate that I have done the crimes of which they now speak against me.
QUENYA: Furthermore, it is not possible for them to demonstrate that I have done the crimes of which they now speak against me.

ENGLISH: But this thing I openly tell you: By the Way that they call a 'sect', by it I serve God, believing all the matters that are of the Law and written in the Prophets.
QUENYA: But this thing I openly tell you: By the Way that they call a 'sect', by it I serve God, believing all the matters that are of the Law and written in the Prophets.

ENGLISH: And I have hope to God, the same hope that also these men have: will be a resurrection of just ones and injust ones alike.
QUENYA: And I have hope to God, the same hope that also these men have: will be a resurrection of just ones and injust ones alike.

ENGLISH: Therefore my goal is that I will always have a clean conscience towards God and men.
QUENYA: Therefore my goal is that I will always have a clean conscience towards God and men.

ENGLISH: After some years passed, I came to bring gifts of mercy to my nation, and to sacrifice.
QUENYA: After some years passed, I came to bring gifts of mercy to my nation, and to sacrifice.

ENGLISH: While I was doing these things, they found me cleansed in the temple, but was not crowd or uprising. But were there some Jews from Asia,
QUENYA: While I was doing these things, they found me cleansed in the temple, but was not crowd or uprising. But were there some Jews from Asia,

ENGLISH: and was better if they came before you to speak about my crimes, if they have a complaint against me.
QUENYA: and was better if they came before you to speak about my crimes, if they have a complaint against me.

ENGLISH: Or let these men say what evil they found in me when I stood before the High Council,
QUENYA: Or let these men say what evil they found in me when I stood before the High Council,

ENGLISH: if it was not this single saying that I cried when I stood before them: 'Concerning the resurrection of dead I am being judged before you today!'
QUENYA: if it was not this single saying that I cried when I stood before them: 'Concerning the resurrection of dead I am being judged before you today!'

ENGLISH: But Felix, knowing well the matters that concerned the Way, turned the men away and said: “When Lysias the army chief shall come down, I will make my choices about the matters that concern you.”
QUENYA: But Felix, knowing well the matters that concerned the Way, turned the men away and said: “When Lysias the army chief shall come down, I will make my choices about the matters that concern you.”

ENGLISH: And he commanded the centurion to keep the man in a gentle manner, and he was not going to stop anyone among his own from serving him.
QUENYA: And he commanded the centurion to keep the man in a gentle manner, and he was not going to stop anyone among his own from serving him.

ENGLISH: After some days Felix came with Drusilla his wife, who was Jewish, and he brought Paul and listened to him about the faith in Christ Jesus.
QUENYA: After some days Felix came with Drusilla his wife, who was Jewish, and he brought Paul and listened to him about the faith in Christ Jesus.

ENGLISH: But when he talked about justice and self-control and the coming judgement, Felix was scared and answered: “For this time go away, but when I have an opportunity, I will summon you again.”
QUENYA: But when he talked about justice and self-control and the coming judgement, Felix was scared and answered: “For this time go away, but when I have an opportunity, I will summon you again.”

ENGLISH: But at the same time he had the hope that he would receive money from Paul. Therefore he summoned him that more frequently, and he talked with him.
QUENYA: But at the same time he had the hope that he would receive money from Paul. Therefore he summoned him that more frequently, and he talked with him.

ENGLISH: But after two years passed, Felix was followed as governor by Porcius Festus, and since Felix wanted to have the grace of the Jews, he left Paul bound.
QUENYA: But after two years passed, Felix was followed as governor by Porcius Festus, and since Felix wanted to have the grace of the Jews, he left Paul bound.

ENGLISH: Therefore Festus, when he received the power over the region , after three days went up to Jerusalem from Caesarea,
QUENYA: Therefore Festus, when he received the power over the region , after three days went up to Jerusalem from Caesarea,

ENGLISH: and the chief priests and the prominent ones of the Jews told him their complaints against Paul. Then they asked Festus,
QUENYA: and the chief priests and the prominent ones of the Jews told him their complaints against Paul. Then they asked Festus,

ENGLISH: seeking a favor against Paul, that he would send him to Jerusalem. For they were going to lie hidden, to kill him on the road.
QUENYA: seeking a favor against Paul, that he would send him to Jerusalem. For they were going to lie hidden, to kill him on the road.

ENGLISH: But Festus answered that Paul was going to remain kept in Caesarea, and that he himself would return there soon.
QUENYA: But Festus answered that Paul was going to remain kept in Caesarea, and that he himself would return there soon.

ENGLISH: He said: “Therefore may the mighty among you come down to speak of his crimes, if there is anything irregular about him.”
QUENYA: He said: “Therefore may the mighty among you come down to speak of his crimes, if there is anything irregular about him.”

ENGLISH: Thus, after remaining with them for no more than eight or ten days, he went down to Caesarea, and the following day he sat down on the judgement seat and commanded that one was to bring Paul.
QUENYA: Thus, after remaining with them for no more than eight or ten days, he went down to Caesarea, and the following day he sat down on the judgement seat and commanded that one was to bring Paul.

ENGLISH: When he came, the Jews that had come down from Jerusalem stood around him, saying that he had done numerous and weighty crimes, but it was not possible for them to show that that was true.
QUENYA: When he came, the Jews that had come down from Jerusalem stood around him, saying that he had done numerous and weighty crimes, but it was not possible for them to show that that was true.

ENGLISH: But Paul said, defending himself: “Against the Law or against the Jews or against the High King alike I have not done a single sin.”
QUENYA: But Paul said, defending himself: “Against the Law or against the Jews or against the High King alike I have not done a single sin.”

ENGLISH: Festus, who wanted to receive the good will of the Jews, answered Paul: “Do you want to go up to Jerusalem to be judged there before me concerning these matters?”
QUENYA: Festus, who wanted to receive the good will of the Jews, answered Paul: “Do you want to go up to Jerusalem to be judged there before me concerning these matters?”

ENGLISH: But Paul said: “I am standing before the judgement seat of the High King, where it is necessary for me to be judged. I have done nothing evil against the Jews, as also you well know.
QUENYA: But Paul said: “I am standing before the judgement seat of the High King, where it is necessary for me to be judged. I have done nothing evil against the Jews, as also you well know.

ENGLISH: If I have indeed done a crime and I am worthy of death, I do not ask to escape from death, but if I have not done a single one of the crimes which they say I have done, nobody may give me into their hand. I put my case before the High King.”
QUENYA: If I have indeed done a crime and I am worthy of death, I do not ask to escape from death, but if I have not done a single one of the crimes which they say I have done, nobody may give me into their hand. I put my case before the High King.”

ENGLISH: After speaking with the council, Festus answered: “Before the High King you have put your case; to the High King you will go.”
QUENYA: After speaking with the council, Festus answered: “Before the High King you have put your case; to the High King you will go.”

ENGLISH: After some days passed, Agrippa the king and Bernice came to Caesarea to greet Festus.
QUENYA: After some days passed, Agrippa the king and Bernice came to Caesarea to greet Festus.

ENGLISH: After they were there for a number of days, Festus told the king about the matters that concerned Paul, saying:“ is a man left bound by Felix,
QUENYA: After they were there for a number of days, Festus told the king about the matters that concerned Paul, saying:“ is a man left bound by Felix,

ENGLISH: and when I was in Jerusalem the chief priests and the elders of the Jews told me about him, requesting that I would judge him as having guilt.
QUENYA: and when I was in Jerusalem the chief priests and the elders of the Jews told me about him, requesting that I would judge him as having guilt.

ENGLISH: But I answered them that among Romans it is not custom to give anyone over, before the person of whom others say that he had committed crimes meets those that speak against him face to face, and he has the opportunity to speak for himself concerning the complaint.
QUENYA: But I answered them that among Romans it is not custom to give anyone over, before the person of whom others say that he had committed crimes meets those that speak against him face to face, and he has the opportunity to speak for himself concerning the complaint.

ENGLISH: Therefore, when they assembled here, without halting I sat down on the judgement seat and commanded that one was to bring the man.
QUENYA: Therefore, when they assembled here, without halting I sat down on the judgement seat and commanded that one was to bring the man.

ENGLISH: Standing before me, those who say that he has committed crimes did not talk about the wicked things that I supposed concerning him.
QUENYA: Standing before me, those who say that he has committed crimes did not talk about the wicked things that I supposed concerning him.

ENGLISH: They had some quarrels with him about their own worship of the deity, and about a person called Jesus, who is dead, but who Paul said is alive.
QUENYA: They had some quarrels with him about their own worship of the deity, and about a person called Jesus, who is dead, but who Paul said is alive.

ENGLISH: Not knowing what I was going to do about the quarrel about these things, I asked if he wanted to go to Jerusalem, there to be judged concerning these matters.
QUENYA: Not knowing what I was going to do about the quarrel about these things, I asked if he wanted to go to Jerusalem, there to be judged concerning these matters.

ENGLISH: But when Paul asked to be kept for the judgment of His Majesty, I commanded that he is to be kept until I shall send him to the High King.”
QUENYA: But when Paul asked to be kept for the judgment of His Majesty, I commanded that he is to be kept until I shall send him to the High King.”

ENGLISH: Then Agrippa said to Festus: “I as well wish to hear the man.” He answered: “Tomorrow you will hear him.”
QUENYA: Then Agrippa said to Festus: “I as well wish to hear the man.” He answered: “Tomorrow you will hear him.”

ENGLISH: Therefore, on the following day, Agrippa and Bernice came with great glory and went into the audience chamber with army chiefs and some prominent men from the city, and when Festus commanded, Paul was brought.
QUENYA: Therefore, on the following day, Agrippa and Bernice came with great glory and went into the audience chamber with army chiefs and some prominent men from the city, and when Festus commanded, Paul was brought.

ENGLISH: And Festus said: “King Agrippa and you that are with us, you behold this man concerning whom the entire multitude of Jews together have made pention to me, in Jerusalemn and here alike, crying that he is not worthy of life anymore.
QUENYA: And Festus said: “King Agrippa and you that are with us, you behold this man concerning whom the entire multitude of Jews together have made pention to me, in Jerusalemn and here alike, crying that he is not worthy of life anymore.

ENGLISH: But I perceived that he has done nothing worthy of death. Therefore, when this man put his case before his Majesty, I judged that I would send him.
QUENYA: But I perceived that he has done nothing worthy of death. Therefore, when this man put his case before his Majesty, I judged that I would send him.

ENGLISH: But concerning him I have nothing certain to write to my lord. Therefore I brought him out before you, and above all before you, King Agrippa: After the interrogation I will know what I am to write.
QUENYA: But concerning him I have nothing certain to write to my lord. Therefore I brought him out before you, and above all before you, King Agrippa: After the interrogation I will know what I am to write.

ENGLISH: For I think it is senseless if I send a bound person but fail to indicate the complaints against him.
QUENYA: For I think it is senseless if I send a bound person but fail to indicate the complaints against him.

ENGLISH: Agrippa said to Paul: “You may speak.” Then Paul reached out with his hand and spoke, defending himself:
QUENYA: Agrippa said to Paul: “You may speak.” Then Paul reached out with his hand and spoke, defending himself:

ENGLISH: “Concerning all the crimes that the Jews say that I have done, King Agrippa, I count myself happy that before you I speak for myself today,
QUENYA: “Concerning all the crimes that the Jews say that I have done, King Agrippa, I count myself happy that before you I speak for myself today,

ENGLISH: above all for the reason that you know all the customs and strifes of among Jews. Therefore I ask that you will hear me with patience.
QUENYA: above all for the reason that you know all the customs and strifes of among Jews. Therefore I ask that you will hear me with patience.

ENGLISH: My manner of living from my youth – how I behaved from the beginning in my nation and in Jerusalem – is known by all Jews
QUENYA: My manner of living from my youth – how I behaved from the beginning in my nation and in Jerusalem – is known by all Jews

ENGLISH: that have known me beforehand, if they want to witness. They know that my life as a Pharisee was by the harshest order of our worship.
QUENYA: that have known me beforehand, if they want to witness. They know that my life as a Pharisee was by the harshest order of our worship.

ENGLISH: And yet now, by reason of the promise given to our fathers, I am standing here to be judged.
QUENYA: And yet now, by reason of the promise given to our fathers, I am standing here to be judged.

ENGLISH: Our twelve tribes have the hope that they will see the promise made true if they serve him with vigour through night and day. Concerning this hope the Jews say that I have committed crimes, o King.
QUENYA: Our twelve tribes have the hope that they will see the promise made true if they serve him with vigour through night and day. Concerning this hope the Jews say that I have committed crimes, o King.

ENGLISH: What is your reason for judging that one cannot believe that God rises dead?
QUENYA: What is your reason for judging that one cannot believe that God rises dead?

ENGLISH: I indeed thought that it was necessary for me to stand against the name of Jesus Christ from Nazareth in numerous manners,
QUENYA: I indeed thought that it was necessary for me to stand against the name of Jesus Christ from Nazareth in numerous manners,

ENGLISH: as I also did in Jerusalem, and numerous ones among the holy ones I put in goals after I received power from the chief priests, and when one spoke about killing them, I gave my vote againat them.
QUENYA: as I also did in Jerusalem, and numerous ones among the holy ones I put in goals after I received power from the chief priests, and when one spoke about killing them, I gave my vote againat them.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, I frequently punished them in all synagogues and compelled them to blaspheme, and being extremely angry against them I also pursued them into foreign cities.
QUENYA: Furthermore, I frequently punished them in all synagogues and compelled them to blaspheme, and being extremely angry against them I also pursued them into foreign cities.

ENGLISH: While I was doing these things – on a journey to Damascus, after receiving power and permission from the chief priests –
QUENYA: While I was doing these things – on a journey to Damascus, after receiving power and permission from the chief priests –

ENGLISH: in the midst of the day, still on the road, I saw a light beyond the glory of the sun which shone around me and around who travelled with me.
QUENYA: in the midst of the day, still on the road, I saw a light beyond the glory of the sun which shone around me and around who travelled with me.

ENGLISH: And after all among us fell to the ground I heard a voice say to me in the Hebrew language: 'Saul, Saul, what is your reason for pursuing me? Striking against the spikes will be painful for you.'
QUENYA: And after all among us fell to the ground I heard a voice say to me in the Hebrew language: 'Saul, Saul, what is your reason for pursuing me? Striking against the spikes will be painful for you.'

ENGLISH: But I said: 'Who are you, Lord?' And the Lord said: 'I Jesus, whom you pursue.
QUENYA: But I said: 'Who are you, Lord?' And the Lord said: 'I Jesus, whom you pursue.

ENGLISH: And yet rise and stand on your feet . For for this purpose I have shown myself to you, to choose you as a servant and a witness both of that you have seen and of that I shall cause you to see, concerning me.
QUENYA: And yet rise and stand on your feet . For for this purpose I have shown myself to you, to choose you as a servant and a witness both of that you have seen and of that I shall cause you to see, concerning me.

ENGLISH: I deliver you out of this people and from the nations, to which I send you
QUENYA: I deliver you out of this people and from the nations, to which I send you

ENGLISH: to open their eyes , in order to turn them from darkness to light and from Satan's power to God, for them to receive forgiveness of sins and a part as heirs among who are hallowed by believing in me.'
