QUENYA: For this is the covenant that I shall make with the house of Israel after those days, says the Lord: I shall put my laws in their minds, and in their hearts I shall write them. And I shall be their God, and they shall be my people.

ENGLISH: And they shall by no means instruct, everyone his neighbor and everyone his brother, saying: "Know the Lord!" For all among them shall know me, from the smalles to the greatest among them.
QUENYA: And they shall by no means instruct, everyone his neighbor and everyone his brother, saying: "Know the Lord!" For all among them shall know me, from the smalles to the greatest among them.

ENGLISH: For I shall be mercifull about their unjust doings, and I shall by no means recall their sins more."
QUENYA: For I shall be mercifull about their unjust doings, and I shall by no means recall their sins more."

ENGLISH: When he says "a new covenant", he has abandoned the former covenant. But that which is abandoned and worn-out will soon pass.
QUENYA: When he says "a new covenant", he has abandoned the former covenant. But that which is abandoned and worn-out will soon pass.

ENGLISH: Also the former covenant indeed had laws about service and a santurary which was of this world.
QUENYA: Also the former covenant indeed had laws about service and a santurary which was of this world.

ENGLISH: For one made a first tent-room in which were the lampstand and the showing of the breads, and it is called the Holy.
QUENYA: For one made a first tent-room in which were the lampstand and the showing of the breads, and it is called the Holy.

ENGLISH: But behind the second veil there was a tent-room called the Holy of Holies.
QUENYA: But behind the second veil there was a tent-room called the Holy of Holies.

ENGLISH: There were the altar of incence and the Ark of the Covenant, wholly covered by gold, in which was the receptable of gold having the manna and Aaron's staff which sprouted and the tablets of the covenant;
QUENYA: There were the altar of incence and the Ark of the Covenant, wholly covered by gold, in which was the receptable of gold having the manna and Aaron's staff which sprouted and the tablets of the covenant;

ENGLISH: but above it were the glorious pair of cherubs, which screened the cover. But now is not the time to speak about every single among these things.
QUENYA: but above it were the glorious pair of cherubs, which screened the cover. But now is not the time to speak about every single among these things.

ENGLISH: After these things were made so, the priests went into the first tent-room at all times to do acts of service ,
QUENYA: After these things were made so, the priests went into the first tent-room at all times to do acts of service ,

ENGLISH: but into the second room the chief priest alone goes, a single time in one year, not without blood, which he sacrifices for himself and for the people's sins that are done without knowledge.
QUENYA: but into the second room the chief priest alone goes, a single time in one year, not without blood, which he sacrifices for himself and for the people's sins that are done without knowledge.

ENGLISH: Thus the Holy Spirit lets us understand that the path into the holy place was not made known when the first tent stood.
QUENYA: Thus the Holy Spirit lets us understand that the path into the holy place was not made known when the first tent stood.

ENGLISH: This tent was an image of the time that now has come, and as the image was, gifts and sacrifices are now sacrificed. But they cannot make the man who does service, perfect concerning his conscience,
QUENYA: This tent was an image of the time that now has come, and as the image was, gifts and sacrifices are now sacrificed. But they cannot make the man who does service, perfect concerning his conscience,

ENGLISH: but touch on nothing except some foods and drinks and various baptisms. They were commands of the flesh, until the time for making things straight came.
QUENYA: but touch on nothing except some foods and drinks and various baptisms. They were commands of the flesh, until the time for making things straight came.

ENGLISH: But when Christ came as chief priest of the boons that have come, through the greater and more perfect tent not made by hands, that is, not of this creation,
QUENYA: But when Christ came as chief priest of the boons that have come, through the greater and more perfect tent not made by hands, that is, not of this creation,

ENGLISH: he went one time and forever into the holy place, not having blood of goats or young bulls, but having his own blood, getting an eternal deliverance for us.
QUENYA: he went one time and forever into the holy place, not having blood of goats or young bulls, but having his own blood, getting an eternal deliverance for us.

ENGLISH: For if the blood of goats and bulls and ash of a cow, splashed on those that have been defiled, can hallow as far as making the flesh clean,
QUENYA: For if the blood of goats and bulls and ash of a cow, splashed on those that have been defiled, can hallow as far as making the flesh clean,

ENGLISH: how much more will blood of the Christ, who by an eternal spirit sacrificed himself without stain to God, purify our consciences from dead works, for us to labor for the living Deity?
QUENYA: how much more will blood of the Christ, who by an eternal spirit sacrificed himself without stain to God, purify our consciences from dead works, for us to labor for the living Deity?

ENGLISH: And so he is an intermediary of a new covenant. Therefore that are called can receive the promise of eternal inheritance, since a death has occurred to release them by ransom from their crimes under the former covenant.
QUENYA: And so he is an intermediary of a new covenant. Therefore that are called can receive the promise of eternal inheritance, since a death has occurred to release them by ransom from their crimes under the former covenant.

ENGLISH: For where exists a last will, it is necessary to be established that who wrote it, is dead.
QUENYA: For where exists a last will, it is necessary to be established that who wrote it, is dead.

ENGLISH: Not before he is dead is it in force, since it does not have force at time that the person who made it, is alive.
QUENYA: Not before he is dead is it in force, since it does not have force at time that the person who made it, is alive.

ENGLISH: And when every commandment written in the Law was spoken by Moses to the people, he took the blood of the young oxes and the goats with water and red wool and hyssop and sprinkled the book itself and the entire people,
QUENYA: And when every commandment written in the Law was spoken by Moses to the people, he took the blood of the young oxes and the goats with water and red wool and hyssop and sprinkled the book itself and the entire people,

ENGLISH: saying: "This is the blood of the covenant which God has put on you."
QUENYA: saying: "This is the blood of the covenant which God has put on you."

ENGLISH: And he sprinkled the tent and all the vessels of the service in the same manner, with the blood.
QUENYA: And he sprinkled the tent and all the vessels of the service in the same manner, with the blood.

ENGLISH: By the law nearly all things are cleansed with blood, and if blood is not poured , is not forgiveness.
QUENYA: By the law nearly all things are cleansed with blood, and if blood is not poured , is not forgiveness.

ENGLISH: Therefore, as had to be , the images of the heavenly things were by them purified, but the heavenly things themselves have been purified by sacrifices which were better than such sacrifices.
QUENYA: Therefore, as had to be , the images of the heavenly things were by them purified, but the heavenly things themselves have been purified by sacrifices which were better than such sacrifices.

ENGLISH: For Christ went into, not a sanctuary made by hands, but heaven itself, to come before God's face on our behalf.
QUENYA: For Christ went into, not a sanctuary made by hands, but heaven itself, to come before God's face on our behalf.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, he did not come to sacrifice himself frequently, like the chief priest goes into the sanctuary from year to year, bringing blood which is not is own.
QUENYA: Furthermore, he did not come to sacrifice himself frequently, like the chief priest goes into the sanctuary from year to year, bringing blood which is not is own.

ENGLISH: Then it was necessary for him to suffer frequently from the founding of the world. But now he has made himself known at a single time and forever at the conclusion of the age, to put away sin by sacrificing himself.
QUENYA: Then it was necessary for him to suffer frequently from the founding of the world. But now he has made himself known at a single time and forever at the conclusion of the age, to put away sin by sacrificing himself.

ENGLISH: And as is reserved for Men to die a single time, but thereafter a judgement,
QUENYA: And as is reserved for Men to die a single time, but thereafter a judgement,

ENGLISH: so also the Christ was sacrifice a single time and forever to carry the sins of many. He will not come concerning sin at the second occasion that he will show himself, to that look to him in order to receive salvation.
QUENYA: so also the Christ was sacrifice a single time and forever to carry the sins of many. He will not come concerning sin at the second occasion that he will show himself, to that look to him in order to receive salvation.

ENGLISH: And since the Law has a shadow of the coming good things, but not the full picture of the things, the sacrifices sacrificed from year to year cannot make perfect who bring them.
QUENYA: And since the Law has a shadow of the coming good things, but not the full picture of the things, the sacrifices sacrificed from year to year cannot make perfect who bring them.

ENGLISH: If they did, did one not stop sacrificing, the worshippers being cleansed a single time and forever, no more perceiving sin in themselves?
QUENYA: If they did, did one not stop sacrificing, the worshippers being cleansed a single time and forever, no more perceiving sin in themselves?

ENGLISH: On the contrary, by these sacrifices there is a recalling of sins from year to year,
QUENYA: On the contrary, by these sacrifices there is a recalling of sins from year to year,

ENGLISH: and the blood of oxen and goats cannot take sin away.
QUENYA: and the blood of oxen and goats cannot take sin away.

ENGLISH: Therefore, when he comes into the world he says: "Sacrifice and offering you did not want, but you prepared a body for me.
QUENYA: Therefore, when he comes into the world he says: "Sacrifice and offering you did not want, but you prepared a body for me.

ENGLISH: You do not have joy in burnt sacrifices, or in sacrifices concerning sins."
QUENYA: You do not have joy in burnt sacrifices, or in sacrifices concerning sins."

ENGLISH: Then I said: "Behold, I have come – in the scroll it is written about me – to do your will, God!"
QUENYA: Then I said: "Behold, I have come – in the scroll it is written about me – to do your will, God!"

ENGLISH: After he firstly said: "You do not wish or have joy in sacrifices and offerings and burnt sacrifices and sin-sacrifice" – which are sacrificed by the Law –
QUENYA: After he firstly said: "You do not wish or have joy in sacrifices and offerings and burnt sacrifices and sin-sacrifice" – which are sacrificed by the Law –

ENGLISH: then he says: "Behold, I have come to do your will." He takes away the first to establish the second.
QUENYA: then he says: "Behold, I have come to do your will." He takes away the first to establish the second.

ENGLISH: By that "will" we are hallowed by the sacrificing of the body of Jesus Christ, a single time and forever.
QUENYA: By that "will" we are hallowed by the sacrificing of the body of Jesus Christ, a single time and forever.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, every chief priest stands from day to day to serve and to sacrifice the same sacrifices frequently, since they cannot wholly take away sins.
QUENYA: Furthermore, every chief priest stands from day to day to serve and to sacrifice the same sacrifices frequently, since they cannot wholly take away sins.

ENGLISH: But this man sacrificed one sacrifice concerning sins forever and sat down at God's right hand,
QUENYA: But this man sacrificed one sacrifice concerning sins forever and sat down at God's right hand,

ENGLISH: from then waiting until his enemies shall be placed as a support for his feet.
QUENYA: from then waiting until his enemies shall be placed as a support for his feet.

ENGLISH: For by a single sacrifice he has made that are hallowed perfect forever.
QUENYA: For by a single sacrifice he has made that are hallowed perfect forever.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, the Holy Spirit also witnesses to us, for after saying: "This is the covenant that I will make with them in those days, the Lord is saying: I will put my laws in their heart, and in their mind I will write them",
QUENYA: Furthermore, the Holy Spirit also witnesses to us, for after saying: "This is the covenant that I will make with them in those days, the Lord is saying: I will put my laws in their heart, and in their mind I will write them",

ENGLISH: he also says: "And their sins and their lawless acts I will by no means recall more."
QUENYA: he also says: "And their sins and their lawless acts I will by no means recall more."

ENGLISH: Where is forgiveness of them , is no more sacrificing concerning sin.
QUENYA: Where is forgiveness of them , is no more sacrificing concerning sin.

ENGLISH: Therefore, brothers, since we have courage about the path into the sanctuary by the blood of Jesus Christ,
QUENYA: Therefore, brothers, since we have courage about the path into the sanctuary by the blood of Jesus Christ,

ENGLISH: a path that he opened up to us as a new and living path through the veil, that is, the flesh,
QUENYA: a path that he opened up to us as a new and living path through the veil, that is, the flesh,

ENGLISH: and since we have a great chief priest over the house of God,
QUENYA: and since we have a great chief priest over the house of God,

ENGLISH: let us come having a faithful heard and a wholly firm faith, since our heart is cleanced from a wicked conscience and our bodies cleansed with pure water.
QUENYA: let us come having a faithful heard and a wholly firm faith, since our heart is cleanced from a wicked conscience and our bodies cleansed with pure water.

ENGLISH: Let us still confess our hope, not being unsteady, for who gave the promise is steadfast.
QUENYA: Let us still confess our hope, not being unsteady, for who gave the promise is steadfast.

ENGLISH: And let us give heed to one another, urging love and good deeds,
QUENYA: And let us give heed to one another, urging love and good deeds,

ENGLISH: not forsaking our meetings, as is the habit of some people, but encouraging one another, and that more so when you see the day approaching .
QUENYA: not forsaking our meetings, as is the habit of some people, but encouraging one another, and that more so when you see the day approaching .

ENGLISH: For if by will we sin after receiving the knowledge of the truth, no longer remains a sacrifice concerning sins.
QUENYA: For if by will we sin after receiving the knowledge of the truth, no longer remains a sacrifice concerning sins.

ENGLISH: Instead one in fear looks ahead to judgement and to a fiery burning spirit which will devour that stand against it.
QUENYA: Instead one in fear looks ahead to judgement and to a fiery burning spirit which will devour that stand against it.

ENGLISH: Anyone who has broken the Law of Moses dies without mercy, when are two or three that are witnesses.
QUENYA: Anyone who has broken the Law of Moses dies without mercy, when are two or three that are witnesses.

ENGLISH: Of how much more harsh punishment, do you think, he is worthy who has trampled on the Son of God and who has failed to count as holy the blood of the covenant with which he was hallowed, and who has made the Spirit of Grace angry by contempt?
QUENYA: Of how much more harsh punishment, do you think, he is worthy who has trampled on the Son of God and who has failed to count as holy the blood of the covenant with which he was hallowed, and who has made the Spirit of Grace angry by contempt?

ENGLISH: For we know who said: "Mine is revenge; I will avenge", and again: "The Lord will judge his people."
QUENYA: For we know who said: "Mine is revenge; I will avenge", and again: "The Lord will judge his people."

ENGLISH: It is terrible to fall into the hands of the living God!
QUENYA: It is terrible to fall into the hands of the living God!

ENGLISH: But recall the former days, in which, after you received the light, you suffered a great fight, having difficulties.
QUENYA: But recall the former days, in which, after you received the light, you suffered a great fight, having difficulties.

ENGLISH: There were occasions when you were openly given to mockeries and tribulations alike, and on some occasions you had a part with others that went through such things.
QUENYA: There were occasions when you were openly given to mockeries and tribulations alike, and on some occasions you had a part with others that went through such things.

ENGLISH: For you showed compassion to that were in prison, and with joy you bore the stealing of your gods, knowing that you possessed which is better and remaining.
QUENYA: For you showed compassion to that were in prison, and with joy you bore the stealing of your gods, knowing that you possessed which is better and remaining.

ENGLISH: Therefore, do not throw away from yourselves your courage, which carries with it a great reward.
QUENYA: Therefore, do not throw away from yourselves your courage, which carries with it a great reward.

ENGLISH: For you have need of endurance, for you to receive that of which God gave his promise, after doing his will.
QUENYA: For you have need of endurance, for you to receive that of which God gave his promise, after doing his will.

ENGLISH: For "after an extremely short time who is coming shall come, and he will not be late".
QUENYA: For "after an extremely short time who is coming shall come, and he will not be late".

ENGLISH: But "my righteous one shall have life by his faith", but if "he pulls himself away, my soul does not have joy by him".
QUENYA: But "my righteous one shall have life by his faith", but if "he pulls himself away, my soul does not have joy by him".

ENGLISH: We are not of the kind that pulls itself away into undoing, but the kind that has faith, thus receiving life.
QUENYA: We are not of the kind that pulls itself away into undoing, but the kind that has faith, thus receiving life.

ENGLISH: Faith is the safety of things about which one has hope, the showing of real which one still does not see.
QUENYA: Faith is the safety of things about which one has hope, the showing of real which one still does not see.

ENGLISH: For by such faith the old ones received witness.
QUENYA: For by such faith the old ones received witness.

ENGLISH: By faith we perceive that the universe was arranged by God's word, and so which is seen has come from whos is not revealed.
QUENYA: By faith we perceive that the universe was arranged by God's word, and so which is seen has come from whos is not revealed.

ENGLISH: By faith Abel sacrificed to God a sacrifice more splendid than that of Cain, and by that faith he received witness that he was righteous, God witnessing about his gifts – and through that he still speaks, although he died.
QUENYA: By faith Abel sacrificed to God a sacrifice more splendid than that of Cain, and by that faith he received witness that he was righteous, God witnessing about his gifts – and through that he still speaks, although he died.

ENGLISH: By faith Enoch was taken away, to stop him from seeing death, and he was not found, since God took him away. Before he was taken away he received the witness that he was good in God's eyes.
QUENYA: By faith Enoch was taken away, to stop him from seeing death, and he was not found, since God took him away. Before he was taken away he received the witness that he was good in God's eyes.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, without faith it is not possible to be good from his perspective, for it is necessary for that comes near to God to believe that he exists, and that he rewards anyone who seeks him.
QUENYA: Furthermore, without faith it is not possible to be good from his perspective, for it is necessary for that comes near to God to believe that he exists, and that he rewards anyone who seeks him.

ENGLISH: By faith Noah, after he had a warning about things that still were not seen, showed himself God-loving and built an ark for the saving of his family, and by his faith he judged the world, and he was made heir of the salvation that comes from faith.
QUENYA: By faith Noah, after he had a warning about things that still were not seen, showed himself God-loving and built an ark for the saving of his family, and by his faith he judged the world, and he was made heir of the salvation that comes from faith.

ENGLISH: By faith Abraham, when he was called, did according to the command and went forth into a place which he was destined to receive as an heir's part, and he went forth not knowing where to he was going to travel.
QUENYA: By faith Abraham, when he was called, did according to the command and went forth into a place which he was destined to receive as an heir's part, and he went forth not knowing where to he was going to travel.

ENGLISH: By faith he dwelt as a foreign person in the land of promise as in a foreign land, and he dwelt in tents with Isaac and Jacob, that were heirs with him of the same promise.
QUENYA: By faith he dwelt as a foreign person in the land of promise as in a foreign land, and he dwelt in tents with Isaac and Jacob, that were heirs with him of the same promise.

ENGLISH: For he looked forward to the city having true foundations, the builder and craftsman of which is God.
QUENYA: For he looked forward to the city having true foundations, the builder and craftsman of which is God.

ENGLISH: By faith also Sarah received power to conceive seed, although she was too old, since she counted him faithful who gave the promise.
QUENYA: By faith also Sarah received power to conceive seed, although she was too old, since she counted him faithful who gave the promise.

ENGLISH: Thus from one man, who also was like dead, were born children numerous like the stars of heaven and like the sands on the shore of the sea, uncountable.
QUENYA: Thus from one man, who also was like dead, were born children numerous like the stars of heaven and like the sands on the shore of the sea, uncountable.

ENGLISH: In faith all these people died, though they did not see the promises made true, but saw them from afar and greated them, and they confessed that they were strangers and exiles on earth.
QUENYA: In faith all these people died, though they did not see the promises made true, but saw them from afar and greated them, and they confessed that they were strangers and exiles on earth.

ENGLISH: For who say such things show that they seek a place that will be their own.
QUENYA: For who say such things show that they seek a place that will be their own.

ENGLISH: And yet, if indeed they kept in mind the place from which they went forth, it was possible for them to return.
QUENYA: And yet, if indeed they kept in mind the place from which they went forth, it was possible for them to return.

ENGLISH: But now they sought a better place, that is, a heavenly place. Therefore God is not ashamed about them when he is called their God, for he has prepared a city for them.
QUENYA: But now they sought a better place, that is, a heavenly place. Therefore God is not ashamed about them when he is called their God, for he has prepared a city for them.

ENGLISH: By faith Abraham, when he was tested, sacrificed Isaac, and the man who had received the promises was sacrificing his only-born son,
QUENYA: By faith Abraham, when he was tested, sacrificed Isaac, and the man who had received the promises was sacrificing his only-born son,

ENGLISH: though was said to him: " which will be called 'your seed' will come through Isaac."
QUENYA: though was said to him: " which will be called 'your seed' will come through Isaac."

ENGLISH: But he supposed that God could raise him also from the dead, and figuratively he indeed received him from there.
QUENYA: But he supposed that God could raise him also from the dead, and figuratively he indeed received him from there.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, by faith Isaak blessed Jacob and Esau concerning the things that were to come.
QUENYA: Furthermore, by faith Isaak blessed Jacob and Esau concerning the things that were to come.

ENGLISH: By faith Jacob, near to his death, blessed both of Joseph's sons and worshiped leaning on the top of his staff.
QUENYA: By faith Jacob, near to his death, blessed both of Joseph's sons and worshiped leaning on the top of his staff.

ENGLISH: By faith Joseph, near to his end, spoke about how the sons of Israel would go out, and he gave a command about his bones.
QUENYA: By faith Joseph, near to his end, spoke about how the sons of Israel would go out, and he gave a command about his bones.

ENGLISH: By faith Moses was hidden for three months by his parents after he was born, since they saw the beauty of the baby and did not fear the command of the king.
QUENYA: By faith Moses was hidden for three months by his parents after he was born, since they saw the beauty of the baby and did not fear the command of the king.

ENGLISH: By faith Moses, after he came to manhood, refused to be called Pharao's daughter's son,
QUENYA: By faith Moses, after he came to manhood, refused to be called Pharao's daughter's son,

ENGLISH: choosing to suffer evil with God's people above having joy in sin for a time,
QUENYA: choosing to suffer evil with God's people above having joy in sin for a time,

ENGLISH: for he counted the shame of Christ more precious than the treasures of Egypt, for he looked forward to the giving of the reward.
QUENYA: for he counted the shame of Christ more precious than the treasures of Egypt, for he looked forward to the giving of the reward.

ENGLISH: By faith he left Egypt, but without fearing the king, and he was faithful as if he saw the Invisible One.
QUENYA: By faith he left Egypt, but without fearing the king, and he was faithful as if he saw the Invisible One.

ENGLISH: By faith he made the Passover and the splashing of the blood, to stop the Destroyer from touching their firstborn.
QUENYA: By faith he made the Passover and the splashing of the blood, to stop the Destroyer from touching their firstborn.

ENGLISH: By faith the walls of Jericho fell after they were encircled for seven days.
QUENYA: By faith the walls of Jericho fell after they were encircled for seven days.

ENGLISH: By faith Rahab the harlot did not die with that were not obedient, since she received hte spies in peace.
QUENYA: By faith Rahab the harlot did not die with that were not obedient, since she received hte spies in peace.

ENGLISH: And what more am I to say? For time will fail me if I tell about Gideon, Barak, Samson, Jephta, David and also Samuel and the Prophets,
QUENYA: And what more am I to say? For time will fail me if I tell about Gideon, Barak, Samson, Jephta, David and also Samuel and the Prophets,

ENGLISH: who by faith conquered kingdoms, did justice, received promises, stopped the mouths of lions,
QUENYA: who by faith conquered kingdoms, did justice, received promises, stopped the mouths of lions,

ENGLISH: blocked the power of fire, escaped from the blades of swords, from a weak state were made strong; they were bold in war, they scattered foreign armies.
QUENYA: blocked the power of fire, escaped from the blades of swords, from a weak state were made strong; they were bold in war, they scattered foreign armies.

ENGLISH: Some women received back their dead by resurrection, but others were tormented since they did not want a release by ransom, for they wanted to receive a better resurrection.
QUENYA: Some women received back their dead by resurrection, but others were tormented since they did not want a release by ransom, for they wanted to receive a better resurrection.

ENGLISH: Others received scorns and lashings, indeed more than those, bonds and prisons.
QUENYA: Others received scorns and lashings, indeed more than those, bonds and prisons.

ENGLISH: They were slain with stones, they were tested, they were sawn into peaces, they died being slain with swords, they covered themselves with skins of sheep and goats, while they were in need, in tribulation, suffering evil behavior.
QUENYA: They were slain with stones, they were tested, they were sawn into peaces, they died being slain with swords, they covered themselves with skins of sheep and goats, while they were in need, in tribulation, suffering evil behavior.

ENGLISH: They were too good for this world. They wandered in deserts and caves and holes in earth.
QUENYA: They were too good for this world. They wandered in deserts and caves and holes in earth.

ENGLISH: And yet all these people, though they received a witness about their faith, did not receive the fulfillment of the promise.
QUENYA: And yet all these people, though they received a witness about their faith, did not receive the fulfillment of the promise.

ENGLISH: For God foresaw a better thing for us; thus they were not made perfect away from us.
QUENYA: For God foresaw a better thing for us; thus they were not made perfect away from us.

ENGLISH: Therefore, having that great a cloud of witnesses around us, may we as well put away every heavy thing and the sin that quickly ensnares us, and let us run with endurance the race put before us,
QUENYA: Therefore, having that great a cloud of witnesses around us, may we as well put away every heavy thing and the sin that quickly ensnares us, and let us run with endurance the race put before us,

ENGLISH: while we look to who is Chief of our faith and who makes it perfect, Jesus. For the joy that was put before him he suffered the cross, despising shame, and he has sat down to the right of the throne of God.
QUENYA: while we look to who is Chief of our faith and who makes it perfect, Jesus. For the joy that was put before him he suffered the cross, despising shame, and he has sat down to the right of the throne of God.

ENGLISH: Heed well who has borne such hostile talk from who sin against themselves; then you will not be tired and give out in your soul.
QUENYA: Heed well who has borne such hostile talk from who sin against themselves; then you will not be tired and give out in your soul.

ENGLISH: Fighting against sin, you still have not resisted as far as blood,
QUENYA: Fighting against sin, you still have not resisted as far as blood,

ENGLISH: but you have allowed the exhortation that speaks to you as sons: "My son, do not despise the chastisement of the Lord, and do not totter when you receive his firm words,
QUENYA: but you have allowed the exhortation that speaks to you as sons: "My son, do not despise the chastisement of the Lord, and do not totter when you receive his firm words,

ENGLISH: for to whom the Lord loves, he gives chastiment, and he flays everyone that he receives as son."
QUENYA: for to whom the Lord loves, he gives chastiment, and he flays everyone that he receives as son."

ENGLISH: By chastisement you are faithful. God behaves towards you as towards sons. For who is the son that the father does not give chastisement?
QUENYA: By chastisement you are faithful. God behaves towards you as towards sons. For who is the son that the father does not give chastisement?

ENGLISH: But if you are without the chastisement in which all have had part, you are really children conceived outside of marriage, and not sons.
QUENYA: But if you are without the chastisement in which all have had part, you are really children conceived outside of marriage, and not sons.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, we had the fathers of our flesh to give us chastisement, and we had awe for them. Will we not much more do well if we subject ourselves to the Father of spirits, in order to have life?
QUENYA: Furthermore, we had the fathers of our flesh to give us chastisement, and we had awe for them. Will we not much more do well if we subject ourselves to the Father of spirits, in order to have life?

ENGLISH: For they for a short time gave us chastisement, as was good in their eyes, but he does that since is is beneficial to us, for us to receive a share in his holiness.
QUENYA: For they for a short time gave us chastisement, as was good in their eyes, but he does that since is is beneficial to us, for us to receive a share in his holiness.

ENGLISH: In the moment that it is given, every chastisement seems, not like joy, but like a grief; and yet afterwards to those that are instructed by it it gives fruit of piece, that is, righteousness.
QUENYA: In the moment that it is given, every chastisement seems, not like joy, but like a grief; and yet afterwards to those that are instructed by it it gives fruit of piece, that is, righteousness.

ENGLISH: Therefore strengthen the hands that hang down and the weak knees,
QUENYA: Therefore strengthen the hands that hang down and the weak knees,

ENGLISH: and make straight ways for your feet. Thus which is paralyzed will not be put out of joint, but rather it will be healed.
QUENYA: and make straight ways for your feet. Thus which is paralyzed will not be put out of joint, but rather it will be healed.

ENGLISH: Pursue peace with all people, and the sanctification without which nobody will see the Lord,
QUENYA: Pursue peace with all people, and the sanctification without which nobody will see the Lord,

ENGLISH: while you take heed that nobody will be deprived of God's grace and do not allow poisonous root to grow up to cause difficulty and to soil many.
QUENYA: while you take heed that nobody will be deprived of God's grace and do not allow poisonous root to grow up to cause difficulty and to soil many.

ENGLISH: Thus will not be anyone who fornicates or anyone unholy, like Esau, who in exchange for a single meal gave away his right as firstborn.
QUENYA: Thus will not be anyone who fornicates or anyone unholy, like Esau, who in exchange for a single meal gave away his right as firstborn.

ENGLISH: For you as well know that afterwards, when he wished to possess the blessing, he was turned away. For although in tears he sought a change of mind, he did not find place for it.
QUENYA: For you as well know that afterwards, when he wished to possess the blessing, he was turned away. For although in tears he sought a change of mind, he did not find place for it.

ENGLISH: For now you have not come near to which one can touch and which is kindled by fire, to a cloud and gloom and a storm
QUENYA: For now you have not come near to which one can touch and which is kindled by fire, to a cloud and gloom and a storm

ENGLISH: and a trumpet's sound and the voice that spoke; when they heard that voice, the people asked that nothing more be spoken to them.
QUENYA: and a trumpet's sound and the voice that spoke; when they heard that voice, the people asked that nothing more be spoken to them.

ENGLISH: For they could not bear the commandment: "And if an animal touches the mountain, it is necessary that it is slain with stones!"
QUENYA: For they could not bear the commandment: "And if an animal touches the mountain, it is necessary that it is slain with stones!"

ENGLISH: Furthermore, which they saw was so terrible that it caused Moses to say: "I am afraid and shaking!"
QUENYA: Furthermore, which they saw was so terrible that it caused Moses to say: "I am afraid and shaking!"

ENGLISH: But you have come near to Mount Sion and the city of the living God, a heavenly Jerusalem, and to tens of thousands of angels
QUENYA: But you have come near to Mount Sion and the city of the living God, a heavenly Jerusalem, and to tens of thousands of angels

ENGLISH: gathered together, and to the congregation of the firstborn recorded in heaven, and to God who is judge of all, and to spirits of the righteous ones that are made perfect, and to Jesus, the intermediary of a new covenant, and the blood of sprinkling, which speaks in a manner better than the blood of Abel.
QUENYA: gathered together, and to the congregation of the firstborn recorded in heaven, and to God who is judge of all, and to spirits of the righteous ones that are made perfect, and to Jesus, the intermediary of a new covenant, and the blood of sprinkling, which speaks in a manner better than the blood of Abel.

ENGLISH: See that you do not turn away who is speaking! For if they did not escape that turned him away when they received warning on earth, much more shall we not, if we turn away from who speaks from heaven.
QUENYA: See that you do not turn away who is speaking! For if they did not escape that turned him away when they received warning on earth, much more shall we not, if we turn away from who speaks from heaven.

ENGLISH: At that time his voice shook the earth, but now he has given a promise, saying: "For a second time I will shake, not earth alone, but also heaven."
QUENYA: At that time his voice shook the earth, but now he has given a promise, saying: "For a second time I will shake, not earth alone, but also heaven."

ENGLISH: The words "for a second time" indicate the taking away of the things that have been made, and so the things that are not shaken will remain.
QUENYA: The words "for a second time" indicate the taking away of the things that have been made, and so the things that are not shaken will remain.

ENGLISH: Therefore, since we will receive an unshakable kingdom, may we still have grace, by which we may serve God in reverence and awe.
QUENYA: Therefore, since we will receive an unshakable kingdom, may we still have grace, by which we may serve God in reverence and awe.

ENGLISH: For our God is also a consuming fire.
QUENYA: For our God is also a consuming fire.

ENGLISH: May your brotherly love remain!
QUENYA: May your brotherly love remain!

ENGLISH: Do not fail to show friendliness to strangers, for through it some, without knowing, have received angels as their guests.
QUENYA: Do not fail to show friendliness to strangers, for through it some, without knowing, have received angels as their guests.

ENGLISH: Recall that are in prison, as if you are there with them, and those that suffer evil, since you as well are still in a body.
QUENYA: Recall that are in prison, as if you are there with them, and those that suffer evil, since you as well are still in a body.

ENGLISH: May marriage be honorable among all, and the marriage-bed without stain, for God will judge that fornicate and that break marriage.
QUENYA: May marriage be honorable among all, and the marriage-bed without stain, for God will judge that fornicate and that break marriage.

ENGLISH: May your manner of life be without love of money, while you think about the things that exist now, as sufficient for you. For he has said: "I shall by no means leave you and by no means pass away from you."
QUENYA: May your manner of life be without love of money, while you think about the things that exist now, as sufficient for you. For he has said: "I shall by no means leave you and by no means pass away from you."

ENGLISH: Therefore we may have courage and say: "The Lord helps me; I shall not fear. What can man do to me?"
QUENYA: Therefore we may have courage and say: "The Lord helps me; I shall not fear. What can man do to me?"

ENGLISH: Heed those that lead you, that have spoken God's word to you, and when you think of the fruit of their behavior, follow their faith.
QUENYA: Heed those that lead you, that have spoken God's word to you, and when you think of the fruit of their behavior, follow their faith.

ENGLISH: Jesus Christ is the same yesterday and today and forever.
QUENYA: Jesus Christ is the same yesterday and today and forever.

ENGLISH: Do not be carried away by different and strange teachings, for is beneficial to the heart to be made firm in grace, not by food, which has not been beneficial to those that heed it.
QUENYA: Do not be carried away by different and strange teachings, for is beneficial to the heart to be made firm in grace, not by food, which has not been beneficial to those that heed it.

ENGLISH: We have an alter from which that serve at the tent may not eat.
QUENYA: We have an alter from which that serve at the tent may not eat.

ENGLISH: For the bodies of the animals the blood of which is brought into the holy place by the chief priest, are burnt on the outside of the camp.
QUENYA: For the bodies of the animals the blood of which is brought into the holy place by the chief priest, are burnt on the outside of the camp.

ENGLISH: Thus also Jesus, for him to hallow the people by his own blood, suffered on the outside of the gate.
QUENYA: Thus also Jesus, for him to hallow the people by his own blood, suffered on the outside of the gate.

ENGLISH: Therefore let us go to him outside of the camp, bearing the shameful speech that he bore,
QUENYA: Therefore let us go to him outside of the camp, bearing the shameful speech that he bore,

ENGLISH: for we do not here have a city that remains, but we seek that which shall come.
QUENYA: for we do not here have a city that remains, but we seek that which shall come.

ENGLISH: Through him let us always sacrifice to God a sacrifice of praise, that is, fruit from lips that confess his name.
QUENYA: Through him let us always sacrifice to God a sacrifice of praise, that is, fruit from lips that confess his name.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, do not let the doing of good or the giving to others slip from your mind, for they are sacrifices that are desirable to God.
QUENYA: Furthermore, do not let the doing of good or the giving to others slip from your mind, for they are sacrifices that are desirable to God.

ENGLISH: Stick to the commands of that lead you and submit yourselves to them, for they watch your souls as persons that will give a reckoning; thus it will be possible to them to do this with joy and not with sighing, for that is not beneficial to you.
QUENYA: Stick to the commands of that lead you and submit yourselves to them, for they watch your souls as persons that will give a reckoning; thus it will be possible to them to do this with joy and not with sighing, for that is not beneficial to you.

ENGLISH: Pray for us, for we are sure that we have a good conscience, wishing to behave well in all matters.
QUENYA: Pray for us, for we are sure that we have a good conscience, wishing to behave well in all matters.

ENGLISH: But we urge that you do this above all, for me to return to you the sooner .
QUENYA: But we urge that you do this above all, for me to return to you the sooner .

ENGLISH: Now may the God of peace, who brought up from dead the great shepherd of sheep having the blood of an eternal covenant,
QUENYA: Now may the God of peace, who brought up from dead the great shepherd of sheep having the blood of an eternal covenant,

ENGLISH: give you every good thing as tools to do his will, doing in us by Jesus Christ what is good in his eyes. May there be for him the glory forever and ever! Amen!
QUENYA: give you every good thing as tools to do his will, doing in us by Jesus Christ what is good in his eyes. May there be for him the glory forever and ever! Amen!

ENGLISH: Now I urge you, brothers, that you bear this word of urging, for I send you a letter of few words.
QUENYA: Now I urge you, brothers, that you bear this word of urging, for I send you a letter of few words.

ENGLISH: Know that Timothy, our brother, has been released. If he comes quickly, I shall see you with him.
QUENYA: Know that Timothy, our brother, has been released. If he comes quickly, I shall see you with him.

ENGLISH: Give my greeting to all that lead you, and to all the holy ones. that are in Italy greet you.
QUENYA: Give my greeting to all that lead you, and to all the holy ones. that are in Italy greet you.

ENGLISH: May the grace of God be with all among you!
QUENYA: May the grace of God be with all among you!

ENGLISH: James , slave of God and the Lord Jesus Christ, to the twelves tribes that are scattered: Greetings!
QUENYA: James , slave of God and the Lord Jesus Christ, to the twelves tribes that are scattered: Greetings!

ENGLISH: My brothers, when you meet tests of all kinds, count all those as pure joy,
QUENYA: My brothers, when you meet tests of all kinds, count all those as pure joy,

ENGLISH: knowing, as you do, that your tested faith works endurance.
QUENYA: knowing, as you do, that your tested faith works endurance.

ENGLISH: But let endurance complete its work, for you to be perfect and completed in all things, lacking nothing.
QUENYA: But let endurance complete its work, for you to be perfect and completed in all things, lacking nothing.

ENGLISH: Thus, if anyone among you lacks knowledge, may he ask of God, who gives to all, willing and without harsh words, and wisdom will be given to him.
QUENYA: Thus, if anyone among you lacks knowledge, may he ask of God, who gives to all, willing and without harsh words, and wisdom will be given to him.

ENGLISH: But may he ask in faith, entirely without uncertain thoughts, for who is uncertain is like a wave of sea, sent by the wind and blown hither and thither.
QUENYA: But may he ask in faith, entirely without uncertain thoughts, for who is uncertain is like a wave of sea, sent by the wind and blown hither and thither.

ENGLISH: Do not let such a man suppose that he will receive anything from God;
QUENYA: Do not let such a man suppose that he will receive anything from God;

ENGLISH: he is a man of a double mind, unsteady in all his ways.
QUENYA: he is a man of a double mind, unsteady in all his ways.

ENGLISH: But may the lowly brother have joy since he is made exalted,
QUENYA: But may the lowly brother have joy since he is made exalted,

ENGLISH: and the rich since he is humbled, for like a flower of the grass he shall pass away.
QUENYA: and the rich since he is humbled, for like a flower of the grass he shall pass away.

ENGLISH: For the Sun rises in heat, and it withers the grass, and its flower falls off , and its beautiful appearance fades . Thus also the rich person will fade in the midst of his pursuits.
QUENYA: For the Sun rises in heat, and it withers the grass, and its flower falls off , and its beautiful appearance fades . Thus also the rich person will fade in the midst of his pursuits.

ENGLISH: Happy is the man who endures in test, for wholly tested he shall receive the crown of life, concerning which the Lord has given promise to who love him.
QUENYA: Happy is the man who endures in test, for wholly tested he shall receive the crown of life, concerning which the Lord has given promise to who love him.

ENGLISH: May a person who is tested not be saying: "I am tested by God." For God cannot be tested by evil; furthermore, he does not test anyone.
QUENYA: May a person who is tested not be saying: "I am tested by God." For God cannot be tested by evil; furthermore, he does not test anyone.

ENGLISH: But everyone is tested by being drawn and tempted by his own lust.
QUENYA: But everyone is tested by being drawn and tempted by his own lust.

ENGLISH: Then the lust, when it conceives, bears sin, and when the sin has been done, it causes death.
QUENYA: Then the lust, when it conceives, bears sin, and when the sin has been done, it causes death.

ENGLISH: Let no one cause you to stray, my beloved brothers!
QUENYA: Let no one cause you to stray, my beloved brothers!

ENGLISH: Every good thing given and every perfect gift comes from on high, for it comes down from the Father of lights: Concerning him there is nothing that changes or a shadow that moves.
QUENYA: Every good thing given and every perfect gift comes from on high, for it comes down from the Father of lights: Concerning him there is nothing that changes or a shadow that moves.

ENGLISH: Since he wished, he caused us to exist by the word of truth, for us to be first fruits of his creatures.
QUENYA: Since he wished, he caused us to exist by the word of truth, for us to be first fruits of his creatures.

ENGLISH: Do know this thing, my beloved brothers: For every man it is necessary to be quick about hearing, slow about speaking, slow about wrath;
QUENYA: Do know this thing, my beloved brothers: For every man it is necessary to be quick about hearing, slow about speaking, slow about wrath;

ENGLISH: for a man's wrath does not make God's justice come.
QUENYA: for a man's wrath does not make God's justice come.

ENGLISH: Therefore put away every filthiness and evil, for there is no need for evil. Gently receive the implanting of the word which can save your souls!
QUENYA: Therefore put away every filthiness and evil, for there is no need for evil. Gently receive the implanting of the word which can save your souls!

ENGLISH: But be doers of the word, not solely hearers, causing yourselves to stray.
QUENYA: But be doers of the word, not solely hearers, causing yourselves to stray.

ENGLISH: For if anyone is a hearer of the word, and not a doer, that person is like a man who looks at the face of his body in a looking-glass .
QUENYA: For if anyone is a hearer of the word, and not a doer, that person is like a man who looks at the face of his body in a looking-glass .

ENGLISH: For he looks at himself, but in the moment that he goes away, his appearance slips from his memory.
QUENYA: For he looks at himself, but in the moment that he goes away, his appearance slips from his memory.

ENGLISH: But who inquires into the perfect law of freedom, and endures in it – since he has made himself, not a hearer that recalls nothing, but a doer of labour – will be happy in his labour.
QUENYA: But who inquires into the perfect law of freedom, and endures in it – since he has made himself, not a hearer that recalls nothing, but a doer of labour – will be happy in his labour.

ENGLISH: If anyone thinks of himself as a worshiper, and yet he does not control his tongue, but lets his heart stray, then this person's worship is empty.
QUENYA: If anyone thinks of himself as a worshiper, and yet he does not control his tongue, but lets his heart stray, then this person's worship is empty.

ENGLISH: The worship that is clean and without stain to our God the Father is this: Heeding the needs of children without parents and of widows in their tribulation, and keeping himself without stain from the world.
QUENYA: The worship that is clean and without stain to our God the Father is this: Heeding the needs of children without parents and of widows in their tribulation, and keeping himself without stain from the world.

ENGLISH: My brothers, surely you do not heed faces at the same time that you believe in Jesus Christ our Lord?
QUENYA: My brothers, surely you do not heed faces at the same time that you believe in Jesus Christ our Lord?

ENGLISH: For if a man comes to your meeting, having rings of gold and a splendid raiment, but a poor person in a dirty raiment also comes,
QUENYA: For if a man comes to your meeting, having rings of gold and a splendid raiment, but a poor person in a dirty raiment also comes,

ENGLISH: and with joy you receive who has the splendid raiment and say: "You sit here in a prominent place!", but you say to the poor one: "You may stand!", or "Sit there by the support for my feet" –
QUENYA: and with joy you receive who has the splendid raiment and say: "You sit here in a prominent place!", but you say to the poor one: "You may stand!", or "Sit there by the support for my feet" –

ENGLISH: then you count some among you more precious than others, and you are judges that pronounce wicked judgements. Is this not true?
QUENYA: then you count some among you more precious than others, and you are judges that pronounce wicked judgements. Is this not true?

ENGLISH: Listen, my beloved: Did God not choose the poor ones of this world for them to be rich in faith and heirs of the kingdom, concerning which he gave a promise to those who love him?
QUENYA: Listen, my beloved: Did God not choose the poor ones of this world for them to be rich in faith and heirs of the kingdom, concerning which he gave a promise to those who love him?

ENGLISH: But you have denied the poor one his respect. Do rich people not oppress you and drag you before judges?
QUENYA: But you have denied the poor one his respect. Do rich people not oppress you and drag you before judges?

ENGLISH: Do they not speak against the name by which you were called?
QUENYA: Do they not speak against the name by which you were called?

ENGLISH: You do well if indeed you behave by the royal law, as the Scriptures say: "Love your neighbor as yourself."
QUENYA: You do well if indeed you behave by the royal law, as the Scriptures say: "Love your neighbor as yourself."

ENGLISH: But if you heed faces , you sin, since you receive a rebuke from the Law, about breaking it.
QUENYA: But if you heed faces , you sin, since you receive a rebuke from the Law, about breaking it.

ENGLISH: For anyone who keeps the entire Law, but fails concerning a single thing, he has broken all the commandments.
QUENYA: For anyone who keeps the entire Law, but fails concerning a single thing, he has broken all the commandments.

ENGLISH: For who said: "Do not fornicate!", also said: "Do not kill!" If you do not fornicate, but you do kill, you have broken the Law.
QUENYA: For who said: "Do not fornicate!", also said: "Do not kill!" If you do not fornicate, but you do kill, you have broken the Law.

ENGLISH: Like people that will be judged by the law of freedom, so you are to talk, and so you are to behave!
QUENYA: Like people that will be judged by the law of freedom, so you are to talk, and so you are to behave!

ENGLISH: For who does not do mercy, will receive judgement without mercy. With triumphant cries mercy is conquering judgement.
QUENYA: For who does not do mercy, will receive judgement without mercy. With triumphant cries mercy is conquering judgement.

ENGLISH: How is beneficial, my brothers, if a person says that he has faith, but he does not have acts? Surely the faith cannot save him?
QUENYA: How is beneficial, my brothers, if a person says that he has faith, but he does not have acts? Surely the faith cannot save him?

ENGLISH: If a brother or a sister is naked and lacks bread for the day,
QUENYA: If a brother or a sister is naked and lacks bread for the day,

ENGLISH: and yet person among you says to them: "Go in peace, be warm and filled", but he does not give to them their body's needs, how is that beneficial?
QUENYA: and yet person among you says to them: "Go in peace, be warm and filled", but he does not give to them their body's needs, how is that beneficial?

ENGLISH: Thus faith as well, if it does not have acts, is in itself dead..
QUENYA: Thus faith as well, if it does not have acts, is in itself dead..

ENGLISH: And yet a person will perhaps say: "You have faith, and I have acts." Show me your faith except by acts, and I shall show you my faith by my acts!
QUENYA: And yet a person will perhaps say: "You have faith, and I have acts." Show me your faith except by acts, and I shall show you my faith by my acts!

ENGLISH: You believe that there is one God, no? You do well. The demons as well believe – and tremble!
QUENYA: You believe that there is one God, no? You do well. The demons as well believe – and tremble!

ENGLISH: But do you want to know, o empty man, that without acts faith does nothing good?
QUENYA: But do you want to know, o empty man, that without acts faith does nothing good?

ENGLISH: Was Abraham our father not pronounced just after he sacrificed Isaac his son on the altar?
QUENYA: Was Abraham our father not pronounced just after he sacrificed Isaac his son on the altar?

ENGLISH: As you see, his faith worked with is acts, and by his acts his faith was made perfect.
QUENYA: As you see, his faith worked with is acts, and by his acts his faith was made perfect.

ENGLISH: Thus the scripture was fulfilled which says: "Abraham believed in the Lord, and that was counted to him as righteousness", and he was called "friend of the Lord".
QUENYA: Thus the scripture was fulfilled which says: "Abraham believed in the Lord, and that was counted to him as righteousness", and he was called "friend of the Lord".

ENGLISH: You see that a person is justified by acts, and not by faith alone.
QUENYA: You see that a person is justified by acts, and not by faith alone.

ENGLISH: In the same manner, was Rahab the harlot not justified by acts, after she received the spies and sent them away by another road?
QUENYA: In the same manner, was Rahab the harlot not justified by acts, after she received the spies and sent them away by another road?

ENGLISH: Like the body is dead without breath, so also faith without acts is dead.
QUENYA: Like the body is dead without breath, so also faith without acts is dead.

ENGLISH: Do not let numerous ones among you be teachers, my brothers, for you know that we shall receive a heavier judgement.
QUENYA: Do not let numerous ones among you be teachers, my brothers, for you know that we shall receive a heavier judgement.

ENGLISH: For all among us slip frequently. If anyone does not slip in a word, he is a perfect man, who can also control his entire body.
QUENYA: For all among us slip frequently. If anyone does not slip in a word, he is a perfect man, who can also control his entire body.

ENGLISH: If we put bridles into the mouths of horses, for them to do as we want, we control also their entire body.
QUENYA: If we put bridles into the mouths of horses, for them to do as we want, we control also their entire body.

ENGLISH: Behold! Also ships, though they are that big and mighty winds cause them to move, are controlled by a very small rudder, to where the helmsman wants.
QUENYA: Behold! Also ships, though they are that big and mighty winds cause them to move, are controlled by a very small rudder, to where the helmsman wants.

ENGLISH: Thus the tongue as well is a small body-part, and yet it boasts greatly. Behold, how small is the fire that can kindle so great a wood!
QUENYA: Thus the tongue as well is a small body-part, and yet it boasts greatly. Behold, how small is the fire that can kindle so great a wood!

ENGLISH: And the tongue is a fire! The tongue is a world of unrighteousness among our body-parts, for it defiles the entire body and kindles the wheel of life, and it is kindled by Gehenna.
QUENYA: And the tongue is a fire! The tongue is a world of unrighteousness among our body-parts, for it defiles the entire body and kindles the wheel of life, and it is kindled by Gehenna.

ENGLISH: For every kind of wild animals and of birds and of reptiles and of creatures in sea have ben made servants of Men.
QUENYA: For every kind of wild animals and of birds and of reptiles and of creatures in sea have ben made servants of Men.

ENGLISH: But the tongue – there is no one among Men who can make it his servant. An unruly, evil thing, it is full of death-bringing poison.
QUENYA: But the tongue – there is no one among Men who can make it his servant. An unruly, evil thing, it is full of death-bringing poison.

ENGLISH: By it we bless the Lord and Father, and yet by it we also curse men that are created in God's image.
QUENYA: By it we bless the Lord and Father, and yet by it we also curse men that are created in God's image.

ENGLISH: From the same mouth come blessing and curse.It is not good, my brothers, that these things occur so.
QUENYA: From the same mouth come blessing and curse.It is not good, my brothers, that these things occur so.

ENGLISH: In a spring, sweet and bitter water does not flow from the same hole, no?
QUENYA: In a spring, sweet and bitter water does not flow from the same hole, no?

ENGLISH: My brothers, a fig tree does not give olives, or a vine figs, no? In the same manner, salt water cannot give sweet water.
QUENYA: My brothers, a fig tree does not give olives, or a vine figs, no? In the same manner, salt water cannot give sweet water.

ENGLISH: Who is wise and intelligent among you? May he show his deeds by his good conduct, by the gentle manner of wisdom.
QUENYA: Who is wise and intelligent among you? May he show his deeds by his good conduct, by the gentle manner of wisdom.

ENGLISH: But if you have a bitter envy and a love of quarreling in your heart, do not praise yourselves and speak lies against the truth.
QUENYA: But if you have a bitter envy and a love of quarreling in your heart, do not praise yourselves and speak lies against the truth.

ENGLISH: This is not the love that comes from on high, but it is from earth – animal-like, demonic.
QUENYA: This is not the love that comes from on high, but it is from earth – animal-like, demonic.

ENGLISH: For where there is envy and a love of quarreling, there is unorder and every foul thing.
QUENYA: For where there is envy and a love of quarreling, there is unorder and every foul thing.

ENGLISH: But the wisdom from on high is above everything clean. Furthermore, it loves peace, it is gentle, it heeds the will of others, it is full of mercy and of good fruits, it does not heed faces , it is not hypocritical ,
QUENYA: But the wisdom from on high is above everything clean. Furthermore, it loves peace, it is gentle, it heeds the will of others, it is full of mercy and of good fruits, it does not heed faces , it is not hypocritical ,

ENGLISH: but the seed of fruit of righteousness is sown in peace for that make peace.
QUENYA: but the seed of fruit of righteousness is sown in peace for that make peace.

ENGLISH: For from where come wars, from where are there quarrels among you? Do they not come from here: from your lusts, that make war in your body-parts?
QUENYA: For from where come wars, from where are there quarrels among you? Do they not come from here: from your lusts, that make war in your body-parts?

ENGLISH: You desire, but you do not have. You slay and you long, and yet you cannot receive. You fight and you make war. You do not have, since you do not ask.
QUENYA: You desire, but you do not have. You slay and you long, and yet you cannot receive. You fight and you make war. You do not have, since you do not ask.

ENGLISH: You ask , and yet you do not receive, for you ask for a wrong reason, to use it on your lust for the joys of the flesh.
QUENYA: You ask , and yet you do not receive, for you ask for a wrong reason, to use it on your lust for the joys of the flesh.

ENGLISH: You who break marriage, do you not know that if one is friendly to the world, one is hostile to God?
QUENYA: You who break marriage, do you not know that if one is friendly to the world, one is hostile to God?

ENGLISH: Therefore, anyone who wishes to be the world's friend makes himself an enemy of God.
QUENYA: Therefore, anyone who wishes to be the world's friend makes himself an enemy of God.

ENGLISH: Or if you think that without reason the Scripture says: "By envy the spirit that dwells in us is longing" – ?
QUENYA: Or if you think that without reason the Scripture says: "By envy the spirit that dwells in us is longing" – ?

ENGLISH: But greater is the grace that he gives. Therefore he says: "God stands against the haughty ones, but he gives grace to the lowly ones."
QUENYA: But greater is the grace that he gives. Therefore he says: "God stands against the haughty ones, but he gives grace to the lowly ones."

ENGLISH: Therefore submit yourselves to God, but stand against the Devil, and he shall flee from you.
QUENYA: Therefore submit yourselves to God, but stand against the Devil, and he shall flee from you.

ENGLISH: Come near to God, and he shall come near to you. Cleanse your hands, you sinners, and make your heart pure, you having a double mind.
QUENYA: Come near to God, and he shall come near to you. Cleanse your hands, you sinners, and make your heart pure, you having a double mind.

ENGLISH: Give yourselves to misery, have grief, let your tears flow! May your laughter change into lamenting, and your joy into grief!
QUENYA: Give yourselves to misery, have grief, let your tears flow! May your laughter change into lamenting, and your joy into grief!

ENGLISH: Humble yourselves in the Lord's eyes, and he shall rise you up.
QUENYA: Humble yourselves in the Lord's eyes, and he shall rise you up.

ENGLISH: Do not speak evil one about the other, brothers! who speaks evil about a brother or judges his brother speaks against law and judges law. But if you judge law, you are not a doer of law, but a judge.
QUENYA: Do not speak evil one about the other, brothers! who speaks evil about a brother or judges his brother speaks against law and judges law. But if you judge law, you are not a doer of law, but a judge.

ENGLISH: There is One who gave the law and is a judge, he who can save and undo. But you, how may you judge your neighbor?
QUENYA: There is One who gave the law and is a judge, he who can save and undo. But you, how may you judge your neighbor?

ENGLISH: Come, now, you who say: "Today or tomorrow we will go to this city and we will remain there for a year, and we shall trade and make money" – and you do not know how your life will be tomorrow! For you are a mist, seen for a short moment and then disappearing.
QUENYA: Come, now, you who say: "Today or tomorrow we will go to this city and we will remain there for a year, and we shall trade and make money" – and you do not know how your life will be tomorrow! For you are a mist, seen for a short moment and then disappearing.

ENGLISH: Instead, you did well if you said: "If the Lord wants, we shall still be alive and also do this or that."
QUENYA: Instead, you did well if you said: "If the Lord wants, we shall still be alive and also do this or that."

ENGLISH: But now you have pride by your boasts . All such boasting is wicked.
QUENYA: But now you have pride by your boasts . All such boasting is wicked.

ENGLISH: Therefore, if a person knows to do what is right, and yet he does not do it, that is to him a sin.
QUENYA: Therefore, if a person knows to do what is right, and yet he does not do it, that is to him a sin.

ENGLISH: Come, now, you who are rich; in tears lament about the griefs that are coming upon you!
QUENYA: Come, now, you who are rich; in tears lament about the griefs that are coming upon you!

ENGLISH: Your riches have crumbled, and your raiments are eaten by moths;
QUENYA: Your riches have crumbled, and your raiments are eaten by moths;

ENGLISH: the gold and the silver are eroded into dust, and the dust shall witness against you and shall consume your body. It is like fire, that which you have gathered in the last days!
QUENYA: the gold and the silver are eroded into dust, and the dust shall witness against you and shall consume your body. It is like fire, that which you have gathered in the last days!

ENGLISH: Hear! The payment for which the people that reaped your fields have laboured, but which you have kept, is crying against you! The reapers' cries have come to the ears of the Lord of Hosts.
QUENYA: Hear! The payment for which the people that reaped your fields have laboured, but which you have kept, is crying against you! The reapers' cries have come to the ears of the Lord of Hosts.

ENGLISH: On earth you have had abundance and a life of lust. On the day of slaughter you have made your heart fat. You have judged, you have slain the just one; he did not stop you.
QUENYA: On earth you have had abundance and a life of lust. On the day of slaughter you have made your heart fat. You have judged, you have slain the just one; he did not stop you.

ENGLISH: Have patience, then, until the Lord comes! A farmer looks forward to earth's precious fruit; it is necessary for him to have patience until the rain has fallen in autumn and spring alike.
QUENYA: Have patience, then, until the Lord comes! A farmer looks forward to earth's precious fruit; it is necessary for him to have patience until the rain has fallen in autumn and spring alike.

ENGLISH: Thus it is necessary also for you to have patience and courage, for the Lord's coming is near.
QUENYA: Thus it is necessary also for you to have patience and courage, for the Lord's coming is near.

ENGLISH: Do not sigh one at the other, or maybe you will be judged. Behold! The Judge is standing before the doors.
QUENYA: Do not sigh one at the other, or maybe you will be judged. Behold! The Judge is standing before the doors.

ENGLISH: Brothers, learn from the manner in which the prophets – who spoke in the Lord's name – endured evil and had patience.
QUENYA: Brothers, learn from the manner in which the prophets – who spoke in the Lord's name – endured evil and had patience.

ENGLISH: Behold, we name happy who have endured! You have heard or the steadfastness of Job and know the final end that the Lord gave, how the Lord has deep sympathy and is full of grace.
QUENYA: Behold, we name happy who have endured! You have heard or the steadfastness of Job and know the final end that the Lord gave, how the Lord has deep sympathy and is full of grace.

ENGLISH: Above everything, my brothers, do not give oaths – by heaven or by earth or by every other oath. May you say "yes, yes" – "no, no", or you will fall under judgement.
QUENYA: Above everything, my brothers, do not give oaths – by heaven or by earth or by every other oath. May you say "yes, yes" – "no, no", or you will fall under judgement.

ENGLISH: But is there anyone that has hardship? Let him pray ! But is there anyone having joy? Let him sing psalms! .
QUENYA: But is there anyone that has hardship? Let him pray ! But is there anyone having joy? Let him sing psalms! .

ENGLISH: Is there anyone sick among you? Let him call the elders of the congregation, for them to pray over him, annointing him with oil by the Lord's name.
QUENYA: Is there anyone sick among you? Let him call the elders of the congregation, for them to pray over him, annointing him with oil by the Lord's name.

ENGLISH: And the prayer of faith will bring health to the bed-ridden one, and the Lord shall raise him up. Furthermore, if he has done sins, that will be forgiven him.
QUENYA: And the prayer of faith will bring health to the bed-ridden one, and the Lord shall raise him up. Furthermore, if he has done sins, that will be forgiven him.

ENGLISH: Therefore speak openly, one to the other, about your sins; and pray one for the other, for you to be healed. A just person's petition carries abundant power when it is at work.
QUENYA: Therefore speak openly, one to the other, about your sins; and pray one for the other, for you to be healed. A just person's petition carries abundant power when it is at work.

ENGLISH: Elijah was a man having the same fealings that we have, and yet in prayer he asked that would not fall rain, and rain did not fall for three years and six months.
QUENYA: Elijah was a man having the same fealings that we have, and yet in prayer he asked that would not fall rain, and rain did not fall for three years and six months.

ENGLISH: And he prayed again, and heaven gave rain and the land bore its fruit.
QUENYA: And he prayed again, and heaven gave rain and the land bore its fruit.

ENGLISH: My brothers, if anyone among you is caused to stray from the truth and another turns him back,
QUENYA: My brothers, if anyone among you is caused to stray from the truth and another turns him back,

ENGLISH: know this: Anyone that turns a sinner from the error of his way will save his soul from death and will cover a host of sins.
QUENYA: know this: Anyone that turns a sinner from the error of his way will save his soul from death and will cover a host of sins.

ENGLISH: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.
QUENYA: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.

ENGLISH: He was in the beginning with God.
QUENYA: He was in the beginning with God.

ENGLISH: Everything was created by means of him, and except by him not a single thing was created. which was created
QUENYA: Everything was created by means of him, and except by him not a single thing was created. which was created

ENGLISH: by him was life, and the life was the light of men.
QUENYA: by him was life, and the life was the light of men.

ENGLISH: And the light shines in the darkness, but the darkness has not conquered it.
QUENYA: And the light shines in the darkness, but the darkness has not conquered it.

ENGLISH: arose a man sent by God; his name was John .
QUENYA: arose a man sent by God; his name was John .

ENGLISH: He came for a witness, that he was to witness about the light, that all men were going to believe by means of him.
QUENYA: He came for a witness, that he was to witness about the light, that all men were going to believe by means of him.

ENGLISH: He was not this light, but he was to witness about this light.
QUENYA: He was not this light, but he was to witness about this light.

ENGLISH: The true light, shining for all men, was coming into the world.
QUENYA: The true light, shining for all men, was coming into the world.

ENGLISH: He was in the world, and the world was created by him, but the world did not know him.
QUENYA: He was in the world, and the world was created by him, but the world did not know him.

ENGLISH: He came to his own, but his own did not receive him.
QUENYA: He came to his own, but his own did not receive him.

ENGLISH: But all who did receive him, to them he gave authority to be children of God, for they had faith in his name;
QUENYA: But all who did receive him, to them he gave authority to be children of God, for they had faith in his name;

ENGLISH: and they were born, not by blood or by flesh or by man’s will, but by God.
QUENYA: and they were born, not by blood or by flesh or by man’s will, but by God.

ENGLISH: And the Word changed into flesh and dwelt among us, and we saw his glory, such glory as an only-born son has from his father; and he was full of grace and truth.
QUENYA: And the Word changed into flesh and dwelt among us, and we saw his glory, such glory as an only-born son has from his father; and he was full of grace and truth.

ENGLISH: John witnessed about him; indeed he cried out: “This man is the one of whom I said: who comes behind me is now in front of me, since he existed before me.”
QUENYA: John witnessed about him; indeed he cried out: “This man is the one of whom I said: who comes behind me is now in front of me, since he existed before me.”

ENGLISH: For we all received out of his fullness, grace over grace.
QUENYA: For we all received out of his fullness, grace over grace.

ENGLISH: For the Law was given through Moses, but the grace and the truth came through Jesus Christ.
QUENYA: For the Law was given through Moses, but the grace and the truth came through Jesus Christ.

ENGLISH: God nobody has ever seen; the only-born Son who is in the Father’s bosom has made him known.
QUENYA: God nobody has ever seen; the only-born Son who is in the Father’s bosom has made him known.

ENGLISH: This is the witness of John when the Jews sent some priests and Levites from Jerusalem to inquire of him: “Who are you?”
QUENYA: This is the witness of John when the Jews sent some priests and Levites from Jerusalem to inquire of him: “Who are you?”

ENGLISH: And he confessed and did not deny , but confessed: “I am not the Christ.”
QUENYA: And he confessed and did not deny , but confessed: “I am not the Christ.”

ENGLISH: And they asked him: “Then what? Are you Elijah?” And he said: “I am not.” “Are you the Prophet?” And he answered: “No!”
QUENYA: And they asked him: “Then what? Are you Elijah?” And he said: “I am not.” “Are you the Prophet?” And he answered: “No!”

ENGLISH: Therefore they said to him: “Who are you? Let us have an answer for those who sent us. What do you say about self?”
QUENYA: Therefore they said to him: “Who are you? Let us have an answer for those who sent us. What do you say about self?”

ENGLISH: He said: “I am a voice crying in the desert: Make the Lord’s way straight! – as Isaiah the Prophet said.”
QUENYA: He said: “I am a voice crying in the desert: Make the Lord’s way straight! – as Isaiah the Prophet said.”

ENGLISH: The ones sent were of the Pharisees.
QUENYA: The ones sent were of the Pharisees.

ENGLISH: And they asked and said to him: “Then what is the reason that you baptize, if you are not the Christ or Elijah or the Prophet?”
QUENYA: And they asked and said to him: “Then what is the reason that you baptize, if you are not the Christ or Elijah or the Prophet?”

ENGLISH: John answered and said: “I baptize with water; in your midst one is standing whom you do not know,
QUENYA: John answered and said: “I baptize with water; in your midst one is standing whom you do not know,

ENGLISH: who comes after me, but I am not worthy to loosen the strap of his shoe."
QUENYA: who comes after me, but I am not worthy to loosen the strap of his shoe."

ENGLISH: These things happened in Bethany beyond the Jordan, where John was baptizing.
QUENYA: These things happened in Bethany beyond the Jordan, where John was baptizing.

ENGLISH: On the following day he saw Jesus come to him, and he said: “Behold God’s Lamb who takes away the world’s sin!
QUENYA: On the following day he saw Jesus come to him, and he said: “Behold God’s Lamb who takes away the world’s sin!

ENGLISH: He is the one of whom I said: Look! A man is coming who is now in front of me, for before me he existed.
QUENYA: He is the one of whom I said: Look! A man is coming who is now in front of me, for before me he existed.

ENGLISH: I did not know him, but I came baptizing with water that he was to be revealed to Israel.”
QUENYA: I did not know him, but I came baptizing with water that he was to be revealed to Israel.”

ENGLISH: John also witnessed, saying: “I saw the Spirit come down out of heaven as a dove, and it remained on him.
QUENYA: John also witnessed, saying: “I saw the Spirit come down out of heaven as a dove, and it remained on him.

ENGLISH: And I did not know him, but who sent me to baptize with water said to me: The one to whom you shall see the Spirit come down as a dove, he is who baptizes with Holy Spirit.
QUENYA: And I did not know him, but who sent me to baptize with water said to me: The one to whom you shall see the Spirit come down as a dove, he is who baptizes with Holy Spirit.

ENGLISH: And I have seen it, and I have witnessed that he is the Son of God.”
QUENYA: And I have seen it, and I have witnessed that he is the Son of God.”

ENGLISH: On the following day John again stood with two of his disciples,
QUENYA: On the following day John again stood with two of his disciples,

ENGLISH: and seeing Jesus walking he said: “Behold God’s Lamb!”
QUENYA: and seeing Jesus walking he said: “Behold God’s Lamb!”

ENGLISH: And the two disciples heard him speak, and they followed Jesus.
QUENYA: And the two disciples heard him speak, and they followed Jesus.

ENGLISH: But Jesus turned and saw them follow, and he said to them: “What are you seeking?” They said to him: “Rabbi” – which means teacher – “where are you staying?”
QUENYA: But Jesus turned and saw them follow, and he said to them: “What are you seeking?” They said to him: “Rabbi” – which means teacher – “where are you staying?”

ENGLISH: He said to them: “Come and see!” Therefore they came and saw the place where he stayed, and they remained with him on that day. was around the tenth hour.
