QUENYA: He said to them: “Come and see!” Therefore they came and saw the place where he stayed, and they remained with him on that day. was around the tenth hour.

ENGLISH: Andrew , the brother of Simon Peter, was one of the two disciples who heard which John said and followed Jesus.
QUENYA: Andrew , the brother of Simon Peter, was one of the two disciples who heard which John said and followed Jesus.

ENGLISH: He found first his own brother, Simon, and said to him: “We have found Messiah!” – which means Christ.
QUENYA: He found first his own brother, Simon, and said to him: “We have found Messiah!” – which means Christ.

ENGLISH: He led him to Jesus. When Jesus saw him he said: “You are Simon son of John. You will be called Cephas” – which means Peter .
QUENYA: He led him to Jesus. When Jesus saw him he said: “You are Simon son of John. You will be called Cephas” – which means Peter .

ENGLISH: On the following day he wanted to go to Galilee . Jesus found Philip and said to him: “Follow me!”
QUENYA: On the following day he wanted to go to Galilee . Jesus found Philip and said to him: “Follow me!”

ENGLISH: Philip was from Bethsaida, the city of Andrew and Peter.
QUENYA: Philip was from Bethsaida, the city of Andrew and Peter.

ENGLISH: Philip found Nathanael and said to him: “We have found the one of whom Moses in the Law and the Prophets wrote: Jesus son of Joseph from Nazareth.”
QUENYA: Philip found Nathanael and said to him: “We have found the one of whom Moses in the Law and the Prophets wrote: Jesus son of Joseph from Nazareth.”

ENGLISH: But Nathanael said to him: “Can anything good come from Nazareth?”
QUENYA: But Nathanael said to him: “Can anything good come from Nazareth?”

ENGLISH: Jesus saw Nathanael come to him and said of him: “Behold a true Israelite, in whom there is no deceit !”
QUENYA: Jesus saw Nathanael come to him and said of him: “Behold a true Israelite, in whom there is no deceit !”

ENGLISH: Nathanael said to him: “How do you know me?” Jesus answered and said: “Before Philip called you, when you were under the fig tree, I saw you.”
QUENYA: Nathanael said to him: “How do you know me?” Jesus answered and said: “Before Philip called you, when you were under the fig tree, I saw you.”

ENGLISH: Nathanael answered him: “Rabbi, you are the Son of God, you are the King of Israel!”
QUENYA: Nathanael answered him: “Rabbi, you are the Son of God, you are the King of Israel!”

ENGLISH: Jesus answered and said: “Since I told you that I saw you under the fig tree you believe? You will see some things greater than that.”
QUENYA: Jesus answered and said: “Since I told you that I saw you under the fig tree you believe? You will see some things greater than that.”

ENGLISH: And he said to them: “Truly, truly I say to you: You will see heaven opened and God’s angels go up and down on the Son of Man.”
QUENYA: And he said to them: “Truly, truly I say to you: You will see heaven opened and God’s angels go up and down on the Son of Man.”

ENGLISH: On the third day was a wedding in Cana of Galilee, and Jesus’ mother was there.
QUENYA: On the third day was a wedding in Cana of Galilee, and Jesus’ mother was there.

ENGLISH: Also Jesus and his disciples were invited to the wedding.
QUENYA: Also Jesus and his disciples were invited to the wedding.

ENGLISH: When they did not have more wine Jesus’ mother said to him: “They are lacking wine.”
QUENYA: When they did not have more wine Jesus’ mother said to him: “They are lacking wine.”

ENGLISH: But Jesus said to her: “Woman, what do I have with you? My hour still has not come.”
QUENYA: But Jesus said to her: “Woman, what do I have with you? My hour still has not come.”

ENGLISH: His mother said to those who served: “Do anything that he says to you!”
QUENYA: His mother said to those who served: “Do anything that he says to you!”

ENGLISH: stood there six water-vessels, according to the laws of purification of Jews; each water-vessel could take two or three measures.

QUENYA: But when the leader of the feast tasted the water, which was changed into wine, but he did not know where it came from – though the ones who served knew – the leader of the feast called the bridegroom

QUENYA: Jesus answered and said: “Destroy this temple, and in three days I will raise it up.”

QUENYA: Therefore the Jews said: “This temple was built over forty-six years, and you will raise it up in three days?”

QUENYA: But he talked about the temple of his body.

QUENYA: Thus, after he was raised from dead, his disciples recalled that he said this, and they believed what the Scripture says and the word that Jesus spoke.

QUENYA: There was a man of the Pharisees; his name was Nicodemus, a ruler of Jews.

QUENYA: This man came to him in the night and said to him: “Rabbi, we know that you are a teacher come from God, for is nobody who can do these signs if God is not with him.”

QUENYA: Jesus answered and said to him: “Truly, truly I say to you, if anyone is not reborn, he cannot see God’s kingdom.”

QUENYA: Nicodemus said to him: “How can a person be born when he is old? Can he return to his mother’s womb to be born again?”

QUENYA: Jesus answered: “Truly, truly I say to you, if anybody is not born by water and by spirit, he cannot come into God’s kingdom.

ENGLISH: What is born by flesh is flesh, and what is born by spirit is spirit.

QUENYA: Do not feel wonder because I said to you: You must be reborn.

QUENYA: The wind is blowing where it wants, and you hear the sound of it, but you do not know where it comes from or where it is goes to. So is everone who is born by the spirit.”

QUENYA: Nicodemus answered and said to him: “How can these things happen?”

QUENYA: Jesus answered and said to him: “Are you Israel’s teacher and you do not know these things?

QUENYA: If I have told you about the things of earth and you do not believe, how will you believe if I tell you about the things of heaven?

QUENYA: Furthermore, nobody has gone up to heaven except who has come down from heaven, the Son of Man.

QUENYA: And as Moses lifted up the serpent in the desert, so is necessary for the Son of Man to be lifted up,

QUENYA: that everybody who believes in him will have eternal life.

QUENYA: For God has loved the world as far as giving his only-born Son, that everyone who believes in him shall not be destroyed, but shall have eternal life.

QUENYA: For God sent his Son, not that he was to judge the world, but that the world was to be saved by him.

QUENYA: And this is the judgement, that the light has come into the world, but Men loved the darkness over the light, for their deeds are evil.

QUENYA: And who does foul things hates the light and does not want to come to the light, that his deeds will not be reproved.

QUENYA: After these things Jesus and his disciples went to the Judean region, and there he remained with them and baptized.

QUENYA: For his disciples had gone into the city to buy food.

QUENYA: Therefore the woman from Samaria said to him: “How do you, who are a Jew, ask for a drink from me who is a Samaritan woman?” For Jews and Samaritans have nothing together.

QUENYA: Jesus answered and said to her: “If you knew God’s gift and true-being of who is saying to you: Give me a drink, you asked him, and he gave you living water.”

QUENYA: She said to him: “Lord, you have no water-vessel, and the well is deep. From where, then, do you have the living water?

QUENYA: Surely you are not greater than Jacob our father, who gave us the well and who himself drank from it with his sons and his animals?”

QUENYA: The woman said to him: “Lord, give me this water, that I will not be thirsty and will not be necessary for me to come here to draw water.”

QUENYA: He said to her: “Go, call your husband and come here!”

QUENYA: But Jesus said to him: “If you do not see signs and wonders, you do not believe at all.”

QUENYA: After these things there wsa a festival of Jews, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.

QUENYA: In Jerusalem there is a pool called in Hebrew Bethsatha, having five columnades.

ENGLISH: For from time to time an angel of the Lord came down into the pool, causing a stirring of the water, and anyone who went first into the pool after the disturbance of the water was healed from every kind of illness that he had.
QUENYA: For from time to time an angel of the Lord came down into the pool, causing a stirring of the water, and anyone who went first into the pool after the disturbance of the water was healed from every kind of illness that he had.

QUENYA: Seeing this man lie there, and knowing that already he was ill for a long time, Jesus said to him: “Do you want good health?”

ENGLISH: The sick man answered him: “Lord, I do not have a man to put me in the pool when the water is disturbed, and when I am coming, another goes down before me.”

QUENYA: Jesus said to him: “Rise, take up your bed and walk!”

QUENYA: And in the same moment the man received good health, and he lifted up his bed and began to walk.But that day was a day of rest.

ENGLISH: Therefore the Jews said to the healed man: “This is a day of rest; carrying the bed is not allowed for you.”
QUENYA: Therefore the Jews said to the healed man: “This is a day of rest; carrying the bed is not allowed for you.”

QUENYA: But he answered them: “ who gave me good health, he said to me: Take up your bed and walk.”

QUENYA: They said to him: “Who is the man who said to you, Take it up and walk – ?”

ENGLISH: But the healed man did not know who he was, for Jesus had gone away, since was a crowd in the place.
QUENYA: But the healed man did not know who he was, for Jesus had gone away, since was a crowd in the place.

ENGLISH: After these things Jesus found him in the temple and said to him: “See, now you have good health. Do not sin more, that something worse will not happen to you.”
QUENYA: After these things Jesus found him in the temple and said to him: “See, now you have good health. Do not sin more, that something worse will not happen to you.”

ENGLISH: The man went away and told the Jews that Jesus was one who gave him good health.
QUENYA: The man went away and told the Jews that Jesus was one who gave him good health.

ENGLISH: And for this reason the Jews persecuted Jesus, because he did these things in the day of rest.
QUENYA: And for this reason the Jews persecuted Jesus, because he did these things in the day of rest.

ENGLISH: But he answered them: “My father works until now, and so I am working.”
QUENYA: But he answered them: “My father works until now, and so I am working.”

ENGLISH: For this reason the Jews wanted still more to kill him, for not only did he break the day of rest, but he also called God his own father, making himself like God.
QUENYA: For this reason the Jews wanted still more to kill him, for not only did he break the day of rest, but he also called God his own father, making himself like God.

ENGLISH: Therefore Jesus answered and said to them: “Truly, truly I say to you, the Son cannot do a single thing by himself, but only which he sees the Father doing. For anything which he does, that the Son also does in the same manner.
QUENYA: Therefore Jesus answered and said to them: “Truly, truly I say to you, the Son cannot do a single thing by himself, but only which he sees the Father doing. For anything which he does, that the Son also does in the same manner.

ENGLISH: For the Father loves the Son and shows him everything that he does, and he shall show him deeds greater than these, that you will be in wonder.
QUENYA: For the Father loves the Son and shows him everything that he does, and he shall show him deeds greater than these, that you will be in wonder.

ENGLISH: For as the Father raises dead and makes them alive, so also the Son makes those he wants alive.
QUENYA: For as the Father raises dead and makes them alive, so also the Son makes those he wants alive.

ENGLISH: For the Father does not judge anyone, but has given all judgement to the Son,
QUENYA: For the Father does not judge anyone, but has given all judgement to the Son,

ENGLISH: that all will praise the Son as they praise the Father. who does not praise the Son does not praise the Father who sent him.
QUENYA: that all will praise the Son as they praise the Father. who does not praise the Son does not praise the Father who sent him.

ENGLISH: Truly, truly I say to you: who hears my word and believes in who sent me has eternal life, and he does not come to judgement, but has passed from death to life.
QUENYA: Truly, truly I say to you: who hears my word and believes in who sent me has eternal life, and he does not come to judgement, but has passed from death to life.

ENGLISH: Truly, truly I say to you: The hour is coming, and it is now, when dead shall hear the voice of the Son of God, and who hear shall come to life.
QUENYA: Truly, truly I say to you: The hour is coming, and it is now, when dead shall hear the voice of the Son of God, and who hear shall come to life.

ENGLISH: For as the Father has life in self, so he has given the Son to have life in self.
QUENYA: For as the Father has life in self, so he has given the Son to have life in self.

ENGLISH: For he has given him authority of judgement, because he is Son of Man.
QUENYA: For he has given him authority of judgement, because he is Son of Man.

ENGLISH: Do not feel wonder about this, because the hour is coming when all that are in the tombs shall hear his voice
QUENYA: Do not feel wonder about this, because the hour is coming when all that are in the tombs shall hear his voice

ENGLISH: and will come out, who did good things in a resurrection to life, but who did vile things in a resurrection of judgement.
QUENYA: and will come out, who did good things in a resurrection to life, but who did vile things in a resurrection of judgement.

ENGLISH: I do not do a single thng by self; as I hear I judge, and my judgement is just, for I do not seek my own will, but the will of who sent me.
QUENYA: I do not do a single thng by self; as I hear I judge, and my judgement is just, for I do not seek my own will, but the will of who sent me.

ENGLISH: If I bear witness about self, my witness is not true.
QUENYA: If I bear witness about self, my witness is not true.

ENGLISH: There is another who bears witness about me, and I know that his witness about me is true.
QUENYA: There is another who bears witness about me, and I know that his witness about me is true.

ENGLISH: You sent some people to John, and he has witnessed about the truth.
QUENYA: You sent some people to John, and he has witnessed about the truth.

ENGLISH: I do not receive man’s witness, but I say these things that maybe you will be saved.
QUENYA: I do not receive man’s witness, but I say these things that maybe you will be saved.

ENGLISH: That man was a burning and shining lamp, and for an hour you wanted to rejoice in his light.
QUENYA: That man was a burning and shining lamp, and for an hour you wanted to rejoice in his light.

ENGLISH: But I have the witness that is greater than John’s, for the deeds that the Father has given me to complete – the deeds that I am doing – those deeds bear witness about me that my Father sent me.
QUENYA: But I have the witness that is greater than John’s, for the deeds that the Father has given me to complete – the deeds that I am doing – those deeds bear witness about me that my Father sent me.

ENGLISH: Therefore, the Father who sent me, he has witnessed about me. You have not heard his voice or seen his shape,
QUENYA: Therefore, the Father who sent me, he has witnessed about me. You have not heard his voice or seen his shape,

ENGLISH: and you do not have my word remaining in you. For that he sent, in him you do not believe.
QUENYA: and you do not have my word remaining in you. For that he sent, in him you do not believe.

ENGLISH: You search the scriptures, because you think that by them you will have eternal life, and they are that bear witness about me.
QUENYA: You search the scriptures, because you think that by them you will have eternal life, and they are that bear witness about me.

ENGLISH: And yet you do not want to come to me, so that you will have life.
QUENYA: And yet you do not want to come to me, so that you will have life.

ENGLISH: I do not want to receive glory from men,
QUENYA: I do not want to receive glory from men,

ENGLISH: but I know about you that you do not have love for God in you.
QUENYA: but I know about you that you do not have love for God in you.

ENGLISH: I have come in my Father’s name, but you do not receive me. If another comes in his own name, you will receive him.
QUENYA: I have come in my Father’s name, but you do not receive me. If another comes in his own name, you will receive him.

ENGLISH: How can you believe, when you receive glory from one another but do not seek the glory that comes from the only God?
QUENYA: How can you believe, when you receive glory from one another but do not seek the glory that comes from the only God?

ENGLISH: Do not think that I will accuse you before the Father. who accuses you is Moses, in whom you have put your hope.
QUENYA: Do not think that I will accuse you before the Father. who accuses you is Moses, in whom you have put your hope.

ENGLISH: For if you believed Moses’ saying you believed mine , for he wrote about me.
QUENYA: For if you believed Moses’ saying you believed mine , for he wrote about me.

ENGLISH: But if you do not believe his writings, how will you believe in my sayings?
QUENYA: But if you do not believe his writings, how will you believe in my sayings?

ENGLISH: After these things Jesus went away crossing the Sea of Galilee, or Sea Tiberias.
QUENYA: After these things Jesus went away crossing the Sea of Galilee, or Sea Tiberias.

ENGLISH: But a huge crowd followed him, because they saw the signs that he did on the sick.
QUENYA: But a huge crowd followed him, because they saw the signs that he did on the sick.

ENGLISH: Then Jesus went up into a mountain, and there he sat down with his disciples.
QUENYA: Then Jesus went up into a mountain, and there he sat down with his disciples.

ENGLISH: Now the Passover, the festival of Jews, was near.
QUENYA: Now the Passover, the festival of Jews, was near.

ENGLISH: When Jesus raised his eyes and saw a great crowd come to him, he said to Philip: “Where will we buy breads so that these may eat?” But this he said to test him, for he knew what he was going to do.
QUENYA: When Jesus raised his eyes and saw a great crowd come to him, he said to Philip: “Where will we buy breads so that these may eat?” But this he said to test him, for he knew what he was going to do.

ENGLISH: Philip answered him: “Two hundred denarii are not enough for breads sufficing for them, that each person will receive a small piece.”
QUENYA: Philip answered him: “Two hundred denarii are not enough for breads sufficing for them, that each person will receive a small piece.”

ENGLISH: One of the dciples, Andrew the brother of Simon Peter, said to him: “ is here a small boy having five breads of barley and two fishes. But what are they for so many people?”
QUENYA: One of the dciples, Andrew the brother of Simon Peter, said to him: “ is here a small boy having five breads of barley and two fishes. But what are they for so many people?”

ENGLISH: Jesus said: “Make the men sit down.” was much grass in the place. Therefore the men sat down, a number around five thousand.
QUENYA: Jesus said: “Make the men sit down.” was much grass in the place. Therefore the men sat down, a number around five thousand.

ENGLISH: Then Jesus took the breads, and after giving thanks, he distributed them to the sitting people, and so also the fishes, all that they wanted.
QUENYA: Then Jesus took the breads, and after giving thanks, he distributed them to the sitting people, and so also the fishes, all that they wanted.

ENGLISH: But after they were filled he said to his disciples: “Gather the leftover pieces, that nothing will be lost.”
QUENYA: But after they were filled he said to his disciples: “Gather the leftover pieces, that nothing will be lost.”

ENGLISH: Therefore they gathered them, and they filled twelwe baskets with pieces of the five breads of barley – the leftovers left over by the people having eaten.
QUENYA: Therefore they gathered them, and they filled twelwe baskets with pieces of the five breads of barley – the leftovers left over by the people having eaten.

ENGLISH: Thus, when the men saw the signs that he did, they said: “This man truly is the prophet who was to come into the world.”
QUENYA: Thus, when the men saw the signs that he did, they said: “This man truly is the prophet who was to come into the world.”

ENGLISH: Therefore Jesus, knowing that now they were going to come and take him to make him king, went away into the mountain, he alone.
QUENYA: Therefore Jesus, knowing that now they were going to come and take him to make him king, went away into the mountain, he alone.

ENGLISH: When evening came, his disciples went down to the sea,
QUENYA: When evening came, his disciples went down to the sea,

ENGLISH: and after going into a boat they were going over sea to Capernaum. But now it was dark , and Jesus still had not come to them.
QUENYA: and after going into a boat they were going over sea to Capernaum. But now it was dark , and Jesus still had not come to them.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, the sea rose up, because a strong wind was blowing.
QUENYA: Furthermore, the sea rose up, because a strong wind was blowing.

ENGLISH: But when they had sailed around twenty-five or thirty furlongs, they saw Jesus walk on the sea and come near to the boat, and they were afraid.
QUENYA: But when they had sailed around twenty-five or thirty furlongs, they saw Jesus walk on the sea and come near to the boat, and they were afraid.

ENGLISH: But he said to them: “ is I; do not fear!”
QUENYA: But he said to them: “ is I; do not fear!”

ENGLISH: Therefore they were willing to receive him into the boat, and in the same moment the boat was by the land to which they tried to go.
QUENYA: Therefore they were willing to receive him into the boat, and in the same moment the boat was by the land to which they tried to go.

ENGLISH: On the following day the crowd that stood on the other shore of the sea saw that was not there boat. They had seen that was not another boat except the one, and that Jesus did not go away in it with his disciples, but his disciples alone had gone away.
QUENYA: On the following day the crowd that stood on the other shore of the sea saw that was not there boat. They had seen that was not another boat except the one, and that Jesus did not go away in it with his disciples, but his disciples alone had gone away.

ENGLISH: But boats from Tiberias came to the place in which they ate the bread after the Lord gave thanks.
QUENYA: But boats from Tiberias came to the place in which they ate the bread after the Lord gave thanks.

ENGLISH: Therefore, when the crowd saw that neither Jesus nor his disciples were there, they went into their boats and went to Capernaum to seek Jesus.
QUENYA: Therefore, when the crowd saw that neither Jesus nor his disciples were there, they went into their boats and went to Capernaum to seek Jesus.

ENGLISH: When they found him on the other side of the sea they asked him: “Rabbi, at what time did you come here? ”
QUENYA: When they found him on the other side of the sea they asked him: “Rabbi, at what time did you come here? ”

ENGLISH: Jesus answered them and said: “Truly, truly I say to you, you are seeking me, not because you saw signs, but because you ate of the breads and were filled .
QUENYA: Jesus answered them and said: “Truly, truly I say to you, you are seeking me, not because you saw signs, but because you ate of the breads and were filled .

ENGLISH: Work, not for the food that will pass away, but for the food that remains for eternal life, which the Son of Man will give you; for on him the Father, God, has set his seal.”
QUENYA: Work, not for the food that will pass away, but for the food that remains for eternal life, which the Son of Man will give you; for on him the Father, God, has set his seal.”

ENGLISH: Therefore they said to him: “What are we to do in order to do God’s work?”
QUENYA: Therefore they said to him: “What are we to do in order to do God’s work?”

ENGLISH: Jesus answered and said to them: “This is God’s work, that you are to believe in whom he sent.”
QUENYA: Jesus answered and said to them: “This is God’s work, that you are to believe in whom he sent.”

ENGLISH: Therefore they said to him: “What, then, are you doing as a sign, that we will see it and we are going to believe in you? What are you doing?
QUENYA: Therefore they said to him: “What, then, are you doing as a sign, that we will see it and we are going to believe in you? What are you doing?

ENGLISH: Our fathers ate the manna in the desert, as is written: He gave them bread from heaven to eat.”
QUENYA: Our fathers ate the manna in the desert, as is written: He gave them bread from heaven to eat.”

ENGLISH: Therefore Jesus said to them: “Truly, truly I say to you: Moses did not give you the bread from heaven, but my Father indeed gives you the true bread from heaven.
QUENYA: Therefore Jesus said to them: “Truly, truly I say to you: Moses did not give you the bread from heaven, but my Father indeed gives you the true bread from heaven.

ENGLISH: For God’s bread is who comes down from heaven and gives light to the world.”
QUENYA: For God’s bread is who comes down from heaven and gives light to the world.”

ENGLISH: Therefore they said to him: “Lord, always give us this bread!”
QUENYA: Therefore they said to him: “Lord, always give us this bread!”

ENGLISH: Jesus said to them: “I am the bread of life. who comes to me will not ever be hungry, and who believes in me will not ever be thirsty.
QUENYA: Jesus said to them: “I am the bread of life. who comes to me will not ever be hungry, and who believes in me will not ever be thirsty.

ENGLISH: But I have said to you: you have seen me, and yet you do not believe.
QUENYA: But I have said to you: you have seen me, and yet you do not believe.

ENGLISH: Everyone whom the Father gives me will come to me, and who comes to me I will by no means throw out,
QUENYA: Everyone whom the Father gives me will come to me, and who comes to me I will by no means throw out,

ENGLISH: because I have come down from heaven to do, not my will, but the will of who sent me.
QUENYA: because I have come down from heaven to do, not my will, but the will of who sent me.

ENGLISH: This is the will of who sent me, that nothing will be lost to me of all that he has given me, but I will raise it up again at the last day.”
QUENYA: This is the will of who sent me, that nothing will be lost to me of all that he has given me, but I will raise it up again at the last day.”

ENGLISH: Then the Jews murmured at him because he said: “I am the bread that came down from heaven.”
QUENYA: Then the Jews murmured at him because he said: “I am the bread that came down from heaven.”

ENGLISH: And they said: “Is this man not Jesus son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know? How may he say: I have come down from heaven – ?”
QUENYA: And they said: “Is this man not Jesus son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know? How may he say: I have come down from heaven – ?”

ENGLISH: Jesus answered and said to them: “Do not be murmuring among yourselves.
QUENYA: Jesus answered and said to them: “Do not be murmuring among yourselves.

ENGLISH: Nobody can come to me if the Father who sent me does not draw him, and I shall raise him up again at the last day.
QUENYA: Nobody can come to me if the Father who sent me does not draw him, and I shall raise him up again at the last day.

ENGLISH: For is written in the Prophets: And all among them shall be taught by the Lord. Everybody who has heard from the Father and has learnt comes to me.
QUENYA: For is written in the Prophets: And all among them shall be taught by the Lord. Everybody who has heard from the Father and has learnt comes to me.

ENGLISH: Not that anyone has seen the Father, except who is from God; he has seen the Father.
QUENYA: Not that anyone has seen the Father, except who is from God; he has seen the Father.

ENGLISH: Truly, truly I say to you: who believes has eternal life.
QUENYA: Truly, truly I say to you: who believes has eternal life.

ENGLISH: I am the bread of life.
QUENYA: I am the bread of life.

ENGLISH: Your fathers ate the manna in the desert, and yet they died.
QUENYA: Your fathers ate the manna in the desert, and yet they died.

ENGLISH: This is the bread that comes down from heaven, that anyone can eat of it and not die.
QUENYA: This is the bread that comes down from heaven, that anyone can eat of it and not die.

ENGLISH: I am the living bread that comes down from heaven; if anybody eats of this bread he will be alive forever. And the bread that I will give is my flesh for the life of the world.”
QUENYA: I am the living bread that comes down from heaven; if anybody eats of this bread he will be alive forever. And the bread that I will give is my flesh for the life of the world.”

ENGLISH: Therefore the Jews quarreled one with the other, saying: “How can this man give us his flesh to eat?”
QUENYA: Therefore the Jews quarreled one with the other, saying: “How can this man give us his flesh to eat?”

ENGLISH: Thus Jesus said to them: “Truly, truly I say to you, if you do not eat the flesh of the Son of Man and drink his blood, you do not have life in yourselves.
QUENYA: Thus Jesus said to them: “Truly, truly I say to you, if you do not eat the flesh of the Son of Man and drink his blood, you do not have life in yourselves.

ENGLISH: He who eats my flesh and drinks my blood has eternal life, and I will raise him up again at the last day.
QUENYA: He who eats my flesh and drinks my blood has eternal life, and I will raise him up again at the last day.

ENGLISH: For my flesh is real food, and my blood is a real drink.
QUENYA: For my flesh is real food, and my blood is a real drink.

ENGLISH: who eats my flesh and drinks my blood remains in me, and I in him.
QUENYA: who eats my flesh and drinks my blood remains in me, and I in him.

ENGLISH: As the living Father sent me and I have life by the Father, so also who eats me will have life by me.
QUENYA: As the living Father sent me and I have life by the Father, so also who eats me will have life by me.

ENGLISH: This is the bread that came down from heaven, not like that which your fathers ate and yet died. who eats this bread will be alive forever.”
QUENYA: This is the bread that came down from heaven, not like that which your fathers ate and yet died. who eats this bread will be alive forever.”

ENGLISH: These things he said when he was teaching in a synagoge in Capernaum.
QUENYA: These things he said when he was teaching in a synagoge in Capernaum.

ENGLISH: Therefore numerous ones of his disciples, when they heard this, said: “This saying is hard; who can listen to it?”
QUENYA: Therefore numerous ones of his disciples, when they heard this, said: “This saying is hard; who can listen to it?”

ENGLISH: But Jesus, knowing by himself that his disiciples murmured about this, said to them: “Does this cause you to fall?
QUENYA: But Jesus, knowing by himself that his disiciples murmured about this, said to them: “Does this cause you to fall?

ENGLISH: What, then, if you will see the Son of Man ascend to where he was before?
QUENYA: What, then, if you will see the Son of Man ascend to where he was before?

ENGLISH: The spirit is what gives life; the flesh does nothing beneficial. The sayings that I have spoken to you are spirit and are life.
QUENYA: The spirit is what gives life; the flesh does nothing beneficial. The sayings that I have spoken to you are spirit and are life.

ENGLISH: But are among you some people who do not believe.” For from the beginning Jesus knew who did not believe and who was the one who was to betray him.
QUENYA: But are among you some people who do not believe.” For from the beginning Jesus knew who did not believe and who was the one who was to betray him.

ENGLISH: And he said: “For this reason I have said to you: Nobody can come to me if that is not given him by the Father.”
QUENYA: And he said: “For this reason I have said to you: Nobody can come to me if that is not given him by the Father.”

ENGLISH: Thereafter numerous ones of his disciples went away to the things behind them and did not want to walk with him more.
QUENYA: Thereafter numerous ones of his disciples went away to the things behind them and did not want to walk with him more.

ENGLISH: Therefore Jesus said to the twelve: “Do you not want to go away, you too?”
QUENYA: Therefore Jesus said to the twelve: “Do you not want to go away, you too?”

ENGLISH: Simon Peter answered him: “Lord, to whom are we to go? You have sayings of eternal life,
QUENYA: Simon Peter answered him: “Lord, to whom are we to go? You have sayings of eternal life,

ENGLISH: and we have believed and we know that you are the Holy One of God.”
QUENYA: and we have believed and we know that you are the Holy One of God.”

ENGLISH: Jesus answered them: “Have I not chosen you twelve? And among you one is a devil!”
QUENYA: Jesus answered them: “Have I not chosen you twelve? And among you one is a devil!”

ENGLISH: He talked about Judas, the son of Simon Iscariot. For this man, one of the twelve, was going to betray him.
QUENYA: He talked about Judas, the son of Simon Iscariot. For this man, one of the twelve, was going to betray him.

ENGLISH: And after these things Jesus walked in Galilee, for he did not want to walk in Judea, since the Jews sought to kill him.
QUENYA: And after these things Jesus walked in Galilee, for he did not want to walk in Judea, since the Jews sought to kill him.

ENGLISH: But the festival of Jews, the Feast of Leaf-huts, was near.
QUENYA: But the festival of Jews, the Feast of Leaf-huts, was near.

ENGLISH: Therefore his brothers said to him: “Go away from here and go into Judea, that also your disciples will see the deeds that you do!
QUENYA: Therefore his brothers said to him: “Go away from here and go into Judea, that also your disciples will see the deeds that you do!

ENGLISH: For nobody does anything secretly if he seeks to be known.
QUENYA: For nobody does anything secretly if he seeks to be known.

ENGLISH: If you do these things, reveal yourself to the world!”
QUENYA: If you do these things, reveal yourself to the world!”

ENGLISH: Therefore Jesus said to them: “My hour still has not come, but to you the hour is always ready.
QUENYA: Therefore Jesus said to them: “My hour still has not come, but to you the hour is always ready.

ENGLISH: The world cannot hate you, but it hates me, for I witnessed about it that its deeds are evil.
QUENYA: The world cannot hate you, but it hates me, for I witnessed about it that its deeds are evil.

ENGLISH: You go up to the festival! I do not go up to this festival, for my hour still has not come.”
QUENYA: You go up to the festival! I do not go up to this festival, for my hour still has not come.”

ENGLISH: After saying these things to them he remained in Galilee.
QUENYA: After saying these things to them he remained in Galilee.

ENGLISH: But after his brothers went to the festival, he too went up, not openly, but secretly.
QUENYA: But after his brothers went to the festival, he too went up, not openly, but secretly.

ENGLISH: Therefore the Jews sought him at the festival and said: “Where is that man?”
QUENYA: Therefore the Jews sought him at the festival and said: “Where is that man?”

ENGLISH: And there was much murmuring about him among the crowds. Some people said: “He is a good man.” Others said: “He is not, but he causes the crowd to err!”
QUENYA: And there was much murmuring about him among the crowds. Some people said: “He is a good man.” Others said: “He is not, but he causes the crowd to err!”

ENGLISH: Of course , nobody talked openly about him, for they feared the Jews.
QUENYA: Of course , nobody talked openly about him, for they feared the Jews.

ENGLISH: When half of the festival had passed, Jesus went up into the temple and taught.
QUENYA: When half of the festival had passed, Jesus went up into the temple and taught.

ENGLISH: Therefore the Jews were in wonder, saying: “How does this man know the Scriptures when he has not learnt lore?”
QUENYA: Therefore the Jews were in wonder, saying: “How does this man know the Scriptures when he has not learnt lore?”

ENGLISH: Jesus therefore answered them and said: “What I teach is not mine, but is of who sent me.
QUENYA: Jesus therefore answered them and said: “What I teach is not mine, but is of who sent me.

ENGLISH: If anybody wants to do his will, he shall know concerning the teaching if it is from God or if I speak out of myself.
QUENYA: If anybody wants to do his will, he shall know concerning the teaching if it is from God or if I speak out of myself.

ENGLISH: who speaks out of himself is seeking his own glory; but who seeks the glory of the person who sent him, he is true, and there is no unrighteousness in him.
QUENYA: who speaks out of himself is seeking his own glory; but who seeks the glory of the person who sent him, he is true, and there is no unrighteousness in him.

ENGLISH: Did not Moses give you the Law? But nobody among you does as the Law says. For what reason are you seeking to kill me?”
QUENYA: Did not Moses give you the Law? But nobody among you does as the Law says. For what reason are you seeking to kill me?”

ENGLISH: The crowd answered: “You are possessed by a demon! Who is seeking to kill you?”
QUENYA: The crowd answered: “You are possessed by a demon! Who is seeking to kill you?”

ENGLISH: Jesus answered and said to them: “One deed I did, and you were all in wonder.
QUENYA: Jesus answered and said to them: “One deed I did, and you were all in wonder.

ENGLISH: For this reason Moses gave you the circumcision – not that it is from Moses, but from the fathers – and you circumcise a man at a day of rest.
QUENYA: For this reason Moses gave you the circumcision – not that it is from Moses, but from the fathers – and you circumcise a man at a day of rest.

ENGLISH: If a man receives circumcision on the day of rest, that the law of Moses is not to be broken, are you angry at me because I gave perfect health to a man on the day of rest?
QUENYA: If a man receives circumcision on the day of rest, that the law of Moses is not to be broken, are you angry at me because I gave perfect health to a man on the day of rest?

ENGLISH: Do not judge as you see, but judge justly!”
QUENYA: Do not judge as you see, but judge justly!”

ENGLISH: Therefore some people from Jerusalem said: “Is not he the one that they are seeking to kill?
QUENYA: Therefore some people from Jerusalem said: “Is not he the one that they are seeking to kill?

ENGLISH: And look! he is speaking openly, and they say nothing to him. Surely the rulers have not really found that he is the Christ?
QUENYA: And look! he is speaking openly, and they say nothing to him. Surely the rulers have not really found that he is the Christ?

ENGLISH: But we know from where this man is. When Messiah shall come, nobody will know from where he is.”
QUENYA: But we know from where this man is. When Messiah shall come, nobody will know from where he is.”

ENGLISH: Therefore Jesus, when he taught in the temple, cried out and said: “Me you know, you know also from where I am. I have not come by myself, but who sent me is true, he whom you do not know.
QUENYA: Therefore Jesus, when he taught in the temple, cried out and said: “Me you know, you know also from where I am. I have not come by myself, but who sent me is true, he whom you do not know.

ENGLISH: I know him, for from him I come, and he sent me.”
QUENYA: I know him, for from him I come, and he sent me.”

ENGLISH: Then they tried to seize him, but nobody laid his hand on him, for his time still had not come.
QUENYA: Then they tried to seize him, but nobody laid his hand on him, for his time still had not come.

ENGLISH: But numerous ones of the crowd believed in him and said: “When the Christ shall come, surely he will not do deeds more numerous than that this man has done?”
QUENYA: But numerous ones of the crowd believed in him and said: “When the Christ shall come, surely he will not do deeds more numerous than that this man has done?”

ENGLISH: The Pharisees heard the crowd murmuring these things about him, and the chief priests and the Pharisees sent some officers to seize him.
