ENGLISH: All the things that the Father has are mine. Because of that I said that he receives out of my and makes them known to you.
QUENYA: All the things that the Father has are mine. Because of that I said that he receives out of my and makes them known to you.

ENGLISH: After a short time you will not see me more, and after another short time you will see me again.”
QUENYA: After a short time you will not see me more, and after another short time you will see me again.”

ENGLISH: Therefore some of his disciples said, one to the other: “What does this mean that he said to us: After a short time you will not see me more, and after another short time you shall see me again, and: Because I am going away to the Father – ?”
QUENYA: Therefore some of his disciples said, one to the other: “What does this mean that he said to us: After a short time you will not see me more, and after another short time you shall see me again, and: Because I am going away to the Father – ?”

ENGLISH: Thus they said: “What does this mean that he says: a short time? We do not understand what he is saying.”
QUENYA: Thus they said: “What does this mean that he says: a short time? We do not understand what he is saying.”

ENGLISH: Jesus knew that they wanted to inquire of him, and he said to them: “Are you inquiring among yourselves about this, because I said: After a short time you will not see me, and after another short time you will see me again – ?
QUENYA: Jesus knew that they wanted to inquire of him, and he said to them: “Are you inquiring among yourselves about this, because I said: After a short time you will not see me, and after another short time you will see me again – ?

ENGLISH: Truly, truly I say to you: You will weep and you will be wailing, but the world will rejoice; but your grief will be changed into joy.
QUENYA: Truly, truly I say to you: You will weep and you will be wailing, but the world will rejoice; but your grief will be changed into joy.

ENGLISH: A woman, when she is bearing a baby, has grief, because her time has come; but when she has borne the child, she does not more recall her tribulation, because of her joy that a man has been born into the world.
QUENYA: A woman, when she is bearing a baby, has grief, because her time has come; but when she has borne the child, she does not more recall her tribulation, because of her joy that a man has been born into the world.

ENGLISH: So you too have grief now. But I will see you again, and your heart shall have joy, and nobody will take your joy from you.
QUENYA: So you too have grief now. But I will see you again, and your heart shall have joy, and nobody will take your joy from you.

ENGLISH: For in that day you will not ask me about anything. Truly, truly I say to you: Anything that you pray for from the Father in my name he will give to you.
QUENYA: For in that day you will not ask me about anything. Truly, truly I say to you: Anything that you pray for from the Father in my name he will give to you.

ENGLISH: Until now you have not prayed for anything in my name. Pray and you shall receive, that your joy will be full.
QUENYA: Until now you have not prayed for anything in my name. Pray and you shall receive, that your joy will be full.

ENGLISH: These things I have spoken to you in comparisions. An hour is coming when I will no more speak to you in comparisons, but openly I will tell you about the Father.
QUENYA: These things I have spoken to you in comparisions. An hour is coming when I will no more speak to you in comparisons, but openly I will tell you about the Father.

ENGLISH: In that time you will not ask anything in my name, and I do not say to you that I will ask of the Father concerning you .
QUENYA: In that time you will not ask anything in my name, and I do not say to you that I will ask of the Father concerning you .

ENGLISH: For the Father himself loves you, because you have loved me and have believed that I came forth from God.
QUENYA: For the Father himself loves you, because you have loved me and have believed that I came forth from God.

ENGLISH: I have come forth from the Father and have come into the world. Furthermore, I go away from the world and go to the Father.
QUENYA: I have come forth from the Father and have come into the world. Furthermore, I go away from the world and go to the Father.

ENGLISH: His disciples said: “Look! Now you are speaking openly, and you do not speak comparison!
QUENYA: His disciples said: “Look! Now you are speaking openly, and you do not speak comparison!

ENGLISH: Now we know that you know all things and does not have need that anyone inquires of you. By this we know that you came forth from God.”
QUENYA: Now we know that you know all things and does not have need that anyone inquires of you. By this we know that you came forth from God.”

ENGLISH: Jesus answered them: “Now you believe?
QUENYA: Jesus answered them: “Now you believe?

ENGLISH: Look! The hour is coming, indeed it has come, when you shall be scattered everyone to his own house, and me you will leave alone, and yet I am not alone, since the Father is with me.
QUENYA: Look! The hour is coming, indeed it has come, when you shall be scattered everyone to his own house, and me you will leave alone, and yet I am not alone, since the Father is with me.

ENGLISH: I have spoken these things to you, that by me you will have peace. In this world you have tribulation, but have courage! I have conquered the world.”
QUENYA: I have spoken these things to you, that by me you will have peace. In this world you have tribulation, but have courage! I have conquered the world.”

ENGLISH: Jesus said these things, and raising his eyes to heaven he said: “Father, the hour has come; glorify your Son, that your Son will glorify you,
QUENYA: Jesus said these things, and raising his eyes to heaven he said: “Father, the hour has come; glorify your Son, that your Son will glorify you,

ENGLISH: since you have given him lordship over all flesh, that he will give eternal life to all that you have given him.
QUENYA: since you have given him lordship over all flesh, that he will give eternal life to all that you have given him.

ENGLISH: This is eternal life, that they know you, the sole true God, and whom you sent, Jesus Christ.
QUENYA: This is eternal life, that they know you, the sole true God, and whom you sent, Jesus Christ.

ENGLISH: I have glorified you on earth, completing the work that you have given me to do.
QUENYA: I have glorified you on earth, completing the work that you have given me to do.

ENGLISH: And now, Father, glorify me beside you with the glory that I had beside you before the world existed!
QUENYA: And now, Father, glorify me beside you with the glory that I had beside you before the world existed!

ENGLISH: I have revealed your name to the men that you gave me out of the world. They were yours, and you gave them to me, and they have abided by your word.
QUENYA: I have revealed your name to the men that you gave me out of the world. They were yours, and you gave them to me, and they have abided by your word.

ENGLISH: Now they know that all things that you gave me are from you,
QUENYA: Now they know that all things that you gave me are from you,

ENGLISH: for the sayings that you gave me I have given to them, and they have received them and indeed they know that you sent me.
QUENYA: for the sayings that you gave me I have given to them, and they have received them and indeed they know that you sent me.

ENGLISH: I make petition concerning them. I do not make petition concerning the world, but about that you have given me, since they are yours,
QUENYA: I make petition concerning them. I do not make petition concerning the world, but about that you have given me, since they are yours,

ENGLISH: and all my things are yours and yours are mine, and I have been glorified among them.
QUENYA: and all my things are yours and yours are mine, and I have been glorified among them.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, I am not more in the world, but they are in the world, and I am coming to you. Holy Father, protect them for your own name that you have given me, that they will be one, like us.
QUENYA: Furthermore, I am not more in the world, but they are in the world, and I am coming to you. Holy Father, protect them for your own name that you have given me, that they will be one, like us.

ENGLISH: When I was with them I protected them for your own name, and I have kept them, and none of them is destroyed except who was destined for destruction, to fulfill the scripture.
QUENYA: When I was with them I protected them for your own name, and I have kept them, and none of them is destroyed except who was destined for destruction, to fulfill the scripture.

ENGLISH: But now I am coming to you, and I say these things in the world that they will have full joy in themselves.
QUENYA: But now I am coming to you, and I say these things in the world that they will have full joy in themselves.

ENGLISH: I have given your word to them, but the world has hated them, since they are not a part of the world, as I am not a part of the world.
QUENYA: I have given your word to them, but the world has hated them, since they are not a part of the world, as I am not a part of the world.

ENGLISH: I ask of you, not that you take them out of the world, but that you protect them from evil.
QUENYA: I ask of you, not that you take them out of the world, but that you protect them from evil.

ENGLISH: They are not a part of the world, as I am not a part of the world.
QUENYA: They are not a part of the world, as I am not a part of the world.

ENGLISH: Sanctify them with truth; your word is truth.
QUENYA: Sanctify them with truth; your word is truth.

ENGLISH: As you sent me into the world, I too sent them into the world.
QUENYA: As you sent me into the world, I too sent them into the world.

ENGLISH: And I sanctify myself for them, that they will be sanctified with the truth.
QUENYA: And I sanctify myself for them, that they will be sanctified with the truth.

ENGLISH: I pray, not concerning them alone, but also concerning those who believe in me by their word,
QUENYA: I pray, not concerning them alone, but also concerning those who believe in me by their word,

ENGLISH: that they will all be one, as you, Father, is in me and I in you, that also they will be in us , that the world will believe that you sent me.
QUENYA: that they will all be one, as you, Father, is in me and I in you, that also they will be in us , that the world will believe that you sent me.

ENGLISH: Therefore, the glory that you have given me I have given them, that they will be one, as we are one,
QUENYA: Therefore, the glory that you have given me I have given them, that they will be one, as we are one,

ENGLISH: I in them and you in me, that they will be made perfect into one, that the world will know that you sent me and that you loved them, as you loved me.
QUENYA: I in them and you in me, that they will be made perfect into one, that the world will know that you sent me and that you loved them, as you loved me.

ENGLISH: Father, I wish that where I am, also that you have given me will be with me, that they will see my glory that you have given me, because you loved be before the world was established.
QUENYA: Father, I wish that where I am, also that you have given me will be with me, that they will see my glory that you have given me, because you loved be before the world was established.

ENGLISH: Just Father, the world does not know you, but I know you, and these people know that you sent me.
QUENYA: Just Father, the world does not know you, but I know you, and these people know that you sent me.

ENGLISH: And I have made your name known to them and I will make it known again, that the love with which you loved me will be in them, and I in them.
QUENYA: And I have made your name known to them and I will make it known again, that the love with which you loved me will be in them, and I in them.

ENGLISH: After saying these things, Jesus went out with his disciples across the brook called Kidron, to a place where was a garden, and he and his disciples went into it.
QUENYA: After saying these things, Jesus went out with his disciples across the brook called Kidron, to a place where was a garden, and he and his disciples went into it.

ENGLISH: But also Judas, who betrayed him, knew the place, since Jesus at numerous times met with with his disciples there.
QUENYA: But also Judas, who betrayed him, knew the place, since Jesus at numerous times met with with his disciples there.

ENGLISH: Therefore Judas took the soldier host and officers of the chief priests and Pharisees and came there, bringing torches and lamps and weapons.
QUENYA: Therefore Judas took the soldier host and officers of the chief priests and Pharisees and came there, bringing torches and lamps and weapons.

ENGLISH: Thus Jesus, knowing all the things coming upon him, went forward and said to them: “What are you seeking?”
QUENYA: Thus Jesus, knowing all the things coming upon him, went forward and said to them: “What are you seeking?”

ENGLISH: They said: “Jesus from Nazareth.” He said to them: “I he.” Also Judas, who betrayed him, stood among them.
QUENYA: They said: “Jesus from Nazareth.” He said to them: “I he.” Also Judas, who betrayed him, stood among them.

ENGLISH: But when he said to them: “I he,” they stood back and fell to the ground.
QUENYA: But when he said to them: “I he,” they stood back and fell to the ground.

ENGLISH: Therefore he answered them again: “Whom are you seeking?” They said: “Jesus from Nazareth.”
QUENYA: Therefore he answered them again: “Whom are you seeking?” They said: “Jesus from Nazareth.”

ENGLISH: Jesus answered: “I have said to you that I am he. Therefore, if me you are seeking, let them go away”
QUENYA: Jesus answered: “I have said to you that I am he. Therefore, if me you are seeking, let them go away”

ENGLISH: – in order to fulfill the word that he said: “Among that you gave to me none is lost to me.”
QUENYA: – in order to fulfill the word that he said: “Among that you gave to me none is lost to me.”

ENGLISH: Then Simon Peter, who had a sword, drew it and struck the servant of the chief priest and cut off his right ear. The servant’s name was Malchus.
QUENYA: Then Simon Peter, who had a sword, drew it and struck the servant of the chief priest and cut off his right ear. The servant’s name was Malchus.

ENGLISH: But Jesus said to Peter: “Put your sword in the sheath! The cup that the Father has given me, am I really not to drink it?”
QUENYA: But Jesus said to Peter: “Put your sword in the sheath! The cup that the Father has given me, am I really not to drink it?”

ENGLISH: Then the soldier host and the centurion and the officers of the Jews took Jesus and bound him.
QUENYA: Then the soldier host and the centurion and the officers of the Jews took Jesus and bound him.

ENGLISH: They brought him first to Annas, for he was the father of the wife of Caiaphas, who was the chief priest in that year.
QUENYA: They brought him first to Annas, for he was the father of the wife of Caiaphas, who was the chief priest in that year.

ENGLISH: Caiaphas was who said to the Jews that it was beneficial for them that one man died on behalf of the people.
QUENYA: Caiaphas was who said to the Jews that it was beneficial for them that one man died on behalf of the people.

ENGLISH: But Simon Peter and another disciple followed Jesus. That disciple was known to the chief priest and came with Jesus into the courtyard of the chief priest,
QUENYA: But Simon Peter and another disciple followed Jesus. That disciple was known to the chief priest and came with Jesus into the courtyard of the chief priest,

ENGLISH: but Peter remained on the outside by the gate. Therefore the other disciple, who was known to the chief priest, came out and spoke to who watched the gate and led Peter inside.
QUENYA: but Peter remained on the outside by the gate. Therefore the other disciple, who was known to the chief priest, came out and spoke to who watched the gate and led Peter inside.

ENGLISH: Then the maid who watched the gate said: “Are not you too of the disiples of that man?” He answered: “I am not.”
QUENYA: Then the maid who watched the gate said: “Are not you too of the disiples of that man?” He answered: “I am not.”

ENGLISH: The disciples and the officers had made a coal fire, for was cold, and they stood warming themselves. Also Peter stood with them warming himself.
QUENYA: The disciples and the officers had made a coal fire, for was cold, and they stood warming themselves. Also Peter stood with them warming himself.

ENGLISH: Then the chief priest asked Jesus about his disciples and about his teaching.
QUENYA: Then the chief priest asked Jesus about his disciples and about his teaching.

ENGLISH: Jesus answered him: “I have spoken to the world openly. Always I taught in synagogue and in the temple, where all Jews come together, and I said nothing in secret.
QUENYA: Jesus answered him: “I have spoken to the world openly. Always I taught in synagogue and in the temple, where all Jews come together, and I said nothing in secret.

ENGLISH: For what reason are you inquiring of me? Inquire of who heard what I said to them. Look! They know what I said.”
QUENYA: For what reason are you inquiring of me? Inquire of who heard what I said to them. Look! They know what I said.”

ENGLISH: After he said these things, one of the officers that stood by him beat Jesus in the face and said: “Are you answering the chief priest so?”
QUENYA: After he said these things, one of the officers that stood by him beat Jesus in the face and said: “Are you answering the chief priest so?”

ENGLISH: Jesus answered him: “If I say what is bad, witness about the badness, but if I said what is right, what is the reason that you beat me?”
QUENYA: Jesus answered him: “If I say what is bad, witness about the badness, but if I said what is right, what is the reason that you beat me?”

ENGLISH: Then Annas sent him bound to Caiaphas the chief priest.
QUENYA: Then Annas sent him bound to Caiaphas the chief priest.

ENGLISH: Now Simon Peter stood warming himself. Then he said to him: “Are not you too among his disciples?” He denied it and said: “I am not.”
QUENYA: Now Simon Peter stood warming himself. Then he said to him: “Are not you too among his disciples?” He denied it and said: “I am not.”

ENGLISH: Among the slaves of the chief priest was one of the family of the man whose ear Peter cut off, and he said: “Did I not see you in the garden with him?”
QUENYA: Among the slaves of the chief priest was one of the family of the man whose ear Peter cut off, and he said: “Did I not see you in the garden with him?”

ENGLISH: But Peter denied it again, and in the same moment a cock crowed .
QUENYA: But Peter denied it again, and in the same moment a cock crowed .

ENGLISH: Then they led Jesus from Caiaphas to the palace of the governor. Now was early. But they did not go into the palace of the governor, in order not to be unclean, but they might eat the pascal meal.
QUENYA: Then they led Jesus from Caiaphas to the palace of the governor. Now was early. But they did not go into the palace of the governor, in order not to be unclean, but they might eat the pascal meal.

ENGLISH: Then Pilate came outside to them and said: “What is the accusation that you are bringing against this man?”
QUENYA: Then Pilate came outside to them and said: “What is the accusation that you are bringing against this man?”

ENGLISH: They answered him: “If this man was not a criminal, we did not turn him over to you.”
QUENYA: They answered him: “If this man was not a criminal, we did not turn him over to you.”

ENGLISH: Then Pilate said to them: “You take him and judge him by your law.” The Jews said to him: “We may not kill anyone”
QUENYA: Then Pilate said to them: “You take him and judge him by your law.” The Jews said to him: “We may not kill anyone”

ENGLISH: – in order to fulfill the word that Jesus spoke to indicate the kind of death that he was to die.
QUENYA: – in order to fulfill the word that Jesus spoke to indicate the kind of death that he was to die.

ENGLISH: Therefore Pilate went into the palace of the governor and called Jesus and said to him: “Are you the king of Jews?”
QUENYA: Therefore Pilate went into the palace of the governor and called Jesus and said to him: “Are you the king of Jews?”

ENGLISH: Jesus answered: “Do you say this by yourself, or have others talked to you about me?”
QUENYA: Jesus answered: “Do you say this by yourself, or have others talked to you about me?”

ENGLISH: Pilate answered: “Surely I am not a Jew? Your own nation and the chief priests turned you over to me. What have you done?”
QUENYA: Pilate answered: “Surely I am not a Jew? Your own nation and the chief priests turned you over to me. What have you done?”

ENGLISH: Jesus answered: “My kingdom is not of this world. If my kingdom was of this world, my servants fought, that I would not be turned over to the Jews. But now my kingdom is not from here.”
QUENYA: Jesus answered: “My kingdom is not of this world. If my kingdom was of this world, my servants fought, that I would not be turned over to the Jews. But now my kingdom is not from here.”

ENGLISH: Therefore Pilate said to him: “Thus you are a king?” Jesus answered: “You yourself are saying that I am a king. For this thing I have been born, and for this thing I have come into the world, that I was to witness about the truth. Everyone who is of the truth listens to my voice.”
QUENYA: Therefore Pilate said to him: “Thus you are a king?” Jesus answered: “You yourself are saying that I am a king. For this thing I have been born, and for this thing I have come into the world, that I was to witness about the truth. Everyone who is of the truth listens to my voice.”

ENGLISH: Pilate said to him: “What is truth?”After saying this he went out again to the Jews and said to them: “I do not find guilt in him.
QUENYA: Pilate said to him: “What is truth?”After saying this he went out again to the Jews and said to them: “I do not find guilt in him.

ENGLISH: But you have a custom that I release to you a man at the Passover. Do you wish, then, that I release to you the king of Jews?”
QUENYA: But you have a custom that I release to you a man at the Passover. Do you wish, then, that I release to you the king of Jews?”

ENGLISH: Then they cried again, saying: “Not this man, but Barabbas!” But Barabbas was a robber.
QUENYA: Then they cried again, saying: “Not this man, but Barabbas!” But Barabbas was a robber.

ENGLISH: Then Pilate therefore took Jesus and flogged him.
QUENYA: Then Pilate therefore took Jesus and flogged him.

ENGLISH: And the soldiers made a crown of some thorns and put it on his head and threw a purple raiment around him,
QUENYA: And the soldiers made a crown of some thorns and put it on his head and threw a purple raiment around him,

ENGLISH: and they came before him and said: “Hail, King of Jews.” And they beat him in the face.
QUENYA: and they came before him and said: “Hail, King of Jews.” And they beat him in the face.

ENGLISH: And Pilate went outside again and said to them: “Look! I am bringing him out to you again, that you can know that I do not find guilt in him.”
QUENYA: And Pilate went outside again and said to them: “Look! I am bringing him out to you again, that you can know that I do not find guilt in him.”

ENGLISH: Therefore Jesus came out, bearing the crown of thorns and the purple raiment. And he said to them: “Behold the man!”
QUENYA: Therefore Jesus came out, bearing the crown of thorns and the purple raiment. And he said to them: “Behold the man!”

ENGLISH: But when the chief priests and the officers saw him, they cried saying: “Crucify him! Crucify him!” Pilate said to them: “You take him and crucify him, for I do not find guilt in him.”
QUENYA: But when the chief priests and the officers saw him, they cried saying: “Crucify him! Crucify him!” Pilate said to them: “You take him and crucify him, for I do not find guilt in him.”

ENGLISH: The Jews answered him: “We have a law, and by that law he is worthy of death, since he has made self God’s son.”
QUENYA: The Jews answered him: “We have a law, and by that law he is worthy of death, since he has made self God’s son.”

ENGLISH: Therefore, when Pilate heard this saying, he was more frightened,
QUENYA: Therefore, when Pilate heard this saying, he was more frightened,

ENGLISH: and he went into the palace again and said to Jesus: “Where do you come from?” But Jesus did not give him answer.
QUENYA: and he went into the palace again and said to Jesus: “Where do you come from?” But Jesus did not give him answer.

ENGLISH: Therefore Pilate said to him: “Do you not talk to me? Do you not know that I have authority to release you and authority to crucify you?”
QUENYA: Therefore Pilate said to him: “Do you not talk to me? Do you not know that I have authority to release you and authority to crucify you?”

ENGLISH: Jesus answered him: “You had no authority at all over me if it was not given you from on high. Because of this the man who turned me over to you has greater sin.”
QUENYA: Jesus answered him: “You had no authority at all over me if it was not given you from on high. Because of this the man who turned me over to you has greater sin.”

ENGLISH: Therefore Pilate sought a way of releasing him. But the Jews shouted, saying: “If you relase this man, you are not a friend of the High King ! Anyone who makes self a king rises up against the High King!”
QUENYA: Therefore Pilate sought a way of releasing him. But the Jews shouted, saying: “If you relase this man, you are not a friend of the High King ! Anyone who makes self a king rises up against the High King!”

ENGLISH: Therefore Pilate, after hearing these things, brought Jesus outside, and he sat down on his judge seat in a place called the Stone Court, or in Hebrew Gabbatha.
QUENYA: Therefore Pilate, after hearing these things, brought Jesus outside, and he sat down on his judge seat in a place called the Stone Court, or in Hebrew Gabbatha.

ENGLISH: Now was the preparation of the Passover; was around the night hour. And he said to the Jews: “Behold your king!”
QUENYA: Now was the preparation of the Passover; was around the night hour. And he said to the Jews: “Behold your king!”

ENGLISH: But they cried: “Take him away, take him away! Crucify him!” Pilate said to them: “Am I to crucify your king?” The chief priests answered: “We do not have king except the High King!”
QUENYA: But they cried: “Take him away, take him away! Crucify him!” Pilate said to them: “Am I to crucify your king?” The chief priests answered: “We do not have king except the High King!”

ENGLISH: Then, therefore, he turned Jesus over to them for crucifixion.So they took Jesus.
QUENYA: Then, therefore, he turned Jesus over to them for crucifixion.So they took Jesus.

ENGLISH: Carrying his cross for self he went out to the place called Skull Place, the Hebrew name of which is Golgotha.
QUENYA: Carrying his cross for self he went out to the place called Skull Place, the Hebrew name of which is Golgotha.

ENGLISH: There they crucified him, and two others with him, one on his right and one on his left, with Jesus in the middle.
QUENYA: There they crucified him, and two others with him, one on his right and one on his left, with Jesus in the middle.

ENGLISH: Pilate wrote also a sign and put it on the cross. was written: “Jesus from Nazareth, King of Jews.”
QUENYA: Pilate wrote also a sign and put it on the cross. was written: “Jesus from Nazareth, King of Jews.”

ENGLISH: Thus many of the Jews read this sign, since the place where Jesus was crucified lay near to the city, and it was written in Hebrew, in Latin and in Greek.
QUENYA: Thus many of the Jews read this sign, since the place where Jesus was crucified lay near to the city, and it was written in Hebrew, in Latin and in Greek.

ENGLISH: But the chief priests of Jews said to Pilate: “Do not write: King of Jews, but that he said: I am King of Jews.”
QUENYA: But the chief priests of Jews said to Pilate: “Do not write: King of Jews, but that he said: I am King of Jews.”

ENGLISH: Pilate answered: “What I have written I have written.”
QUENYA: Pilate answered: “What I have written I have written.”

ENGLISH: The soldiers, when they crucified Jesus, took his raiments and made four pieces, one piece for each soldier, and they took also his tunic. But the tunic was without seam , woven as a single piece from top to bottom.
QUENYA: The soldiers, when they crucified Jesus, took his raiments and made four pieces, one piece for each soldier, and they took also his tunic. But the tunic was without seam , woven as a single piece from top to bottom.

ENGLISH: Therefore they said, one to the other: “Let us not rend it, but let us cast lots about who will have it” – in order to fulfill the scripture that says: “They parted my robes among themselves, and about my tunic they cast lots.” And the soldiers indeed did so.
QUENYA: Therefore they said, one to the other: “Let us not rend it, but let us cast lots about who will have it” – in order to fulfill the scripture that says: “They parted my robes among themselves, and about my tunic they cast lots.” And the soldiers indeed did so.

ENGLISH: stood beside Jesus’ cross his mother and his mother’s sister, Mary the mother of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene.
QUENYA: stood beside Jesus’ cross his mother and his mother’s sister, Mary the mother of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene.

ENGLISH: Thus, when Jesus saw his mother and the disciple that he loved standing there, he said to his mother: “Woman, behold your son!”
QUENYA: Thus, when Jesus saw his mother and the disciple that he loved standing there, he said to his mother: “Woman, behold your son!”

ENGLISH: Then he said to the disciple: “Behold your mother!” And from that hour the disciple took her into his own house.
QUENYA: Then he said to the disciple: “Behold your mother!” And from that hour the disciple took her into his own house.

ENGLISH: Thereafter, when Jesus saw that everything was completed, he said in order to fulfill the scripture: “I am thirsty.”
QUENYA: Thereafter, when Jesus saw that everything was completed, he said in order to fulfill the scripture: “I am thirsty.”

ENGLISH: was there a bowl full of sour wine, and they put a sponge on a spear and brought it to his mouth.
QUENYA: was there a bowl full of sour wine, and they put a sponge on a spear and brought it to his mouth.

ENGLISH: After receiving the sour wine, Jesus said: “It is completed!”, and he let his head drop and expired.
QUENYA: After receiving the sour wine, Jesus said: “It is completed!”, and he let his head drop and expired.

ENGLISH: Since this happened on the day of Preparation, the Jews requested from Pilate that their legs were to be broken and the bodies taken away, that they would not remain on the cross on the day of rest, for that day of rest was great.
QUENYA: Since this happened on the day of Preparation, the Jews requested from Pilate that their legs were to be broken and the bodies taken away, that they would not remain on the cross on the day of rest, for that day of rest was great.

ENGLISH: Therefore the soldiers came and broke the legs of the first and the other who were crucified with him.
QUENYA: Therefore the soldiers came and broke the legs of the first and the other who were crucified with him.

ENGLISH: But coming to Jesus they saw that he was already dead and did not break his legs.
QUENYA: But coming to Jesus they saw that he was already dead and did not break his legs.

ENGLISH: And yet one of the soldiers pierced his side with a spear, and in the same moment blood and water came out.
QUENYA: And yet one of the soldiers pierced his side with a spear, and in the same moment blood and water came out.

ENGLISH: And who has seen it has witnessed, and his witness is true, and he knows that he is telling true things, that also you will believe.
QUENYA: And who has seen it has witnessed, and his witness is true, and he knows that he is telling true things, that also you will believe.

ENGLISH: For these things happened to fulfull the scripture: “A single bone of his body will not be broken.”
QUENYA: For these things happened to fulfull the scripture: “A single bone of his body will not be broken.”

ENGLISH: And again, a different scripture says: “They will look at whom they have pierced.”
QUENYA: And again, a different scripture says: “They will look at whom they have pierced.”

ENGLISH: After these things Joseph from Arimathea, who was a disciple of Jesus, but in secred for fear of the Jews, made request from Pilate to take away Jesus’ body, and Pilate allowed it. Therefore he came and took his body away.
QUENYA: After these things Joseph from Arimathea, who was a disciple of Jesus, but in secred for fear of the Jews, made request from Pilate to take away Jesus’ body, and Pilate allowed it. Therefore he came and took his body away.

ENGLISH: Also Nicodemus, the man who came to him at night in the beginning, came bringing a blend of fragrant resin and eaglewood , around a hundred pounds.
QUENYA: Also Nicodemus, the man who came to him at night in the beginning, came bringing a blend of fragrant resin and eaglewood , around a hundred pounds.

ENGLISH: Thus they took Jesus’ body and wrapped it in wraps with the fragrant herbs, according to Jews’ custom when they prepare a corpse for the grave.
QUENYA: Thus they took Jesus’ body and wrapped it in wraps with the fragrant herbs, according to Jews’ custom when they prepare a corpse for the grave.

ENGLISH: But in the place where he was crucified was a garden, and in the garden a new tomb, in which nobody was yet put .
QUENYA: But in the place where he was crucified was a garden, and in the garden a new tomb, in which nobody was yet put .

ENGLISH: Therefore they put Jesus’ body there, since that was Jews’ day of Preparation, and since the tomb was near.
QUENYA: Therefore they put Jesus’ body there, since that was Jews’ day of Preparation, and since the tomb was near.

ENGLISH: On the first day of the week Mary Magdalene came to the tomb early, when was still dark, and she saw that the rock was taken away from the tomb.
QUENYA: On the first day of the week Mary Magdalene came to the tomb early, when was still dark, and she saw that the rock was taken away from the tomb.

ENGLISH: Therefore she ran and came to Simon Peter and the other disciple, whom Jesus loved, and said to them: “They have taken the Lord out of the tomb, and we do not know where they have put him.”
QUENYA: Therefore she ran and came to Simon Peter and the other disciple, whom Jesus loved, and said to them: “They have taken the Lord out of the tomb, and we do not know where they have put him.”

ENGLISH: Then Peter went forth with the other disciple, and they went to the tomb.
QUENYA: Then Peter went forth with the other disciple, and they went to the tomb.

ENGLISH: Both men ran, but the other other disciple ran faster than Peter and came first to the tomb,
QUENYA: Both men ran, but the other other disciple ran faster than Peter and came first to the tomb,

ENGLISH: and he bent and saw the clothes lying there, but he did not go in.
QUENYA: and he bent and saw the clothes lying there, but he did not go in.

ENGLISH: Then Simon Peter came, following him, and he went into the tomb. He saw the wraps lying there,
QUENYA: Then Simon Peter came, following him, and he went into the tomb. He saw the wraps lying there,

ENGLISH: and the cloth that was on his head, not lying with the wraps, but rolled up in a separate place.
QUENYA: and the cloth that was on his head, not lying with the wraps, but rolled up in a separate place.

ENGLISH: Then the other disciple, who came first to the tomb, also went in; and he saw and he believed.
QUENYA: Then the other disciple, who came first to the tomb, also went in; and he saw and he believed.

ENGLISH: For still they did not know the scripture, that was necessary for him to rise from dead.
QUENYA: For still they did not know the scripture, that was necessary for him to rise from dead.

ENGLISH: Then the disciples returned to their homes.
QUENYA: Then the disciples returned to their homes.

ENGLISH: But Mary stood crying by the tomb. And while she cried she bent to look into the tomb,
QUENYA: But Mary stood crying by the tomb. And while she cried she bent to look into the tomb,

ENGLISH: and she saw two angels in white sit , one by the head and one by the feet where Jesus’ body had been lying.
QUENYA: and she saw two angels in white sit , one by the head and one by the feet where Jesus’ body had been lying.

ENGLISH: They said to her: “Woman, for what reason are you crying?” She said to them: “They have taken away my Lord, and I do not know where they have put him.”
QUENYA: They said to her: “Woman, for what reason are you crying?” She said to them: “They have taken away my Lord, and I do not know where they have put him.”

ENGLISH: Saying this, she turned and saw Jesus standing there, but she did not know that he was Jesus.
QUENYA: Saying this, she turned and saw Jesus standing there, but she did not know that he was Jesus.

ENGLISH: Jesus said to her: “Woman, for what reason are you crying? Whom are you seeking?” Supposing that he was the gardener, she said to him: “Lord, if you have carried him away, tell me the place where you have put him, and I will take him away.”
QUENYA: Jesus said to her: “Woman, for what reason are you crying? Whom are you seeking?” Supposing that he was the gardener, she said to him: “Lord, if you have carried him away, tell me the place where you have put him, and I will take him away.”

ENGLISH: Jesus said to her: “Mary!” Turning, she said to him in Hebrew: “Rabboni” – which means teacher.
QUENYA: Jesus said to her: “Mary!” Turning, she said to him in Hebrew: “Rabboni” – which means teacher.

ENGLISH: Jesus said to her: “Do not touch me, for I have not yet risen up to my Father. But go to my brothers and say to them: I am ascending to my Father and your Father, my God and your God.”
QUENYA: Jesus said to her: “Do not touch me, for I have not yet risen up to my Father. But go to my brothers and say to them: I am ascending to my Father and your Father, my God and your God.”

ENGLISH: Mary Magdalene came and brought the news to the disciples: “I have seen the Lord!”, and that he said these things to her.
QUENYA: Mary Magdalene came and brought the news to the disciples: “I have seen the Lord!”, and that he said these things to her.

ENGLISH: On the evening of that day, the first day of the week, when the doors were closed where the disciples were, for fear of the Jews, Jesus came and stood among them and said to them: “Peace be to you!”
QUENYA: On the evening of that day, the first day of the week, when the doors were closed where the disciples were, for fear of the Jews, Jesus came and stood among them and said to them: “Peace be to you!”

ENGLISH: After saying this she showed them his hands and his side. Then the disciples were happy when they saw the Lord.
QUENYA: After saying this she showed them his hands and his side. Then the disciples were happy when they saw the Lord.

ENGLISH: Jesus repeated to them: “Peace be to you! As the Father has sent me, so I send you.”
QUENYA: Jesus repeated to them: “Peace be to you! As the Father has sent me, so I send you.”

ENGLISH: And after saying this he breathed on them and said to them: “Receive the Holy Spirit!
QUENYA: And after saying this he breathed on them and said to them: “Receive the Holy Spirit!

ENGLISH: If you forgive peoples’ sins, they are forgiven them; if you retain peoples’ sins, they are retained.”
QUENYA: If you forgive peoples’ sins, they are forgiven them; if you retain peoples’ sins, they are retained.”

ENGLISH: But Thomas, one of the twelve, called the Twin, was not with them when Jesus came.
QUENYA: But Thomas, one of the twelve, called the Twin, was not with them when Jesus came.

ENGLISH: Thus the other disciples said to him: “We have seen the Lord!” But he said to them: “If I will not see in his hands the marks of the nails, and I do not put my hand in his side, I will not believe.”
QUENYA: Thus the other disciples said to him: “We have seen the Lord!” But he said to them: “If I will not see in his hands the marks of the nails, and I do not put my hand in his side, I will not believe.”

ENGLISH: Eight days after this his disciples were again in the house, and Thomas was with them. The doors were closed, but Jesus came to them and said: “Peace be to you!”
QUENYA: Eight days after this his disciples were again in the house, and Thomas was with them. The doors were closed, but Jesus came to them and said: “Peace be to you!”

ENGLISH: Then he said to Thomas: “Put your finger here, and see my hands, and send your hand, and put it in my side; do not be unbelieving , but believing.”
QUENYA: Then he said to Thomas: “Put your finger here, and see my hands, and send your hand, and put it in my side; do not be unbelieving , but believing.”

ENGLISH: Thomas answered him: “My Lord and my God!”
QUENYA: Thomas answered him: “My Lord and my God!”

ENGLISH: Jesus said to him: “Do you believe because of seeing me? Happy are those who have not seen and yet believe.”
QUENYA: Jesus said to him: “Do you believe because of seeing me? Happy are those who have not seen and yet believe.”

ENGLISH: Jesus did also many other signs before the disciples, that are not written in this book;
QUENYA: Jesus did also many other signs before the disciples, that are not written in this book;

ENGLISH: but these are written that you will believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and that believing you will have life by his name.
QUENYA: but these are written that you will believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and that believing you will have life by his name.

ENGLISH: After these things Jesus revealed himself to the disciples by the Sea Tiberias; and he revealed himself thus:
QUENYA: After these things Jesus revealed himself to the disciples by the Sea Tiberias; and he revealed himself thus:

ENGLISH: were together Simon Peter and Thomas, called the Twin, and Nathanael from Cana of Galilee and the sons of Zebedee and two other of his disciples.
QUENYA: were together Simon Peter and Thomas, called the Twin, and Nathanael from Cana of Galilee and the sons of Zebedee and two other of his disciples.

ENGLISH: Simon Peter said to them: “I am going to catch some fishes.” They said to him: “We too are coming with you.” They went out and went into the boat, but through that night they caught nothing.
QUENYA: Simon Peter said to them: “I am going to catch some fishes.” They said to him: “We too are coming with you.” They went out and went into the boat, but through that night they caught nothing.

ENGLISH: But when morning came, Jesus stood on the shore, but the disciples did not understand that he was Jesus.
QUENYA: But when morning came, Jesus stood on the shore, but the disciples did not understand that he was Jesus.

ENGLISH: Then Jesus said to them: “My children, have you not got fishes?” They said to him: “We have not.”
QUENYA: Then Jesus said to them: “My children, have you not got fishes?” They said to him: “We have not.”

ENGLISH: He said to them: “Throw the net at the right of the boat and you will find some fishes!” So they threw it, and then they could not draw it up for the number of fishes.
QUENYA: He said to them: “Throw the net at the right of the boat and you will find some fishes!” So they threw it, and then they could not draw it up for the number of fishes.

ENGLISH: Therefore the disciple whom Jesus loved said to Peter: “He is the Lord!” Thus Simon Peter, hearing that he was the Lord, girded himself with his jacket, for he was naked, and threw himself into the sea.
QUENYA: Therefore the disciple whom Jesus loved said to Peter: “He is the Lord!” Thus Simon Peter, hearing that he was the Lord, girded himself with his jacket, for he was naked, and threw himself into the sea.

ENGLISH: But the other disciples came in the boat – for they were not far from land, only around a hundred yards – drawing the net of fishes.
QUENYA: But the other disciples came in the boat – for they were not far from land, only around a hundred yards – drawing the net of fishes.

ENGLISH: But when they stood off onto land they saw a coal fire lie there and some fishes lying on it, and bread.
QUENYA: But when they stood off onto land they saw a coal fire lie there and some fishes lying on it, and bread.

ENGLISH: Jesus said to them: “Bring some fishes of those you caught now.”
QUENYA: Jesus said to them: “Bring some fishes of those you caught now.”

ENGLISH: Therefore Simon Peter went into the boat and drew the net ashore , full of a hundred and fifty-three huge fishes. But though they were that many, the net was not torn.
QUENYA: Therefore Simon Peter went into the boat and drew the net ashore , full of a hundred and fifty-three huge fishes. But though they were that many, the net was not torn.

ENGLISH: Jesus said to them: “Come, have breakfast!” No one of the disciples dared to ask him: “Who are you?”, since they knew that he was the Lord.
QUENYA: Jesus said to them: “Come, have breakfast!” No one of the disciples dared to ask him: “Who are you?”, since they knew that he was the Lord.

ENGLISH: Jesus came and took the bread and gave it to them, and also the fishes.
QUENYA: Jesus came and took the bread and gave it to them, and also the fishes.

ENGLISH: This was the third time that Jesus revealed himself to the disiciples after he was raised from dead.
QUENYA: This was the third time that Jesus revealed himself to the disiciples after he was raised from dead.

ENGLISH: When they had eaten the breakfast Jesus said to Simon Peter: “Simon son of John, do you love me more than them?” Peter said to him: “Yes, Lord, you know that you are dear to me.” He said to him: “Give food to my lambs.”
QUENYA: When they had eaten the breakfast Jesus said to Simon Peter: “Simon son of John, do you love me more than them?” Peter said to him: “Yes, Lord, you know that you are dear to me.” He said to him: “Give food to my lambs.”

ENGLISH: Again he said to him, a second time: “Simon Peter, do you love me?” He said to him: “Yes, Lord, you know that you are dear to me.” He said to him: “Be a shepherd for my sheep!”
QUENYA: Again he said to him, a second time: “Simon Peter, do you love me?” He said to him: “Yes, Lord, you know that you are dear to me.” He said to him: “Be a shepherd for my sheep!”

ENGLISH: He said to him a third time: “Simon son of John, am I dear to you?” Peter felt grief because he said to him a third time: “Am I dear to you?” Thus he said to him: “Lord, you know everything; you know that you are dar to me!” Jesus said to him: “Give food to my lambs.
QUENYA: He said to him a third time: “Simon son of John, am I dear to you?” Peter felt grief because he said to him a third time: “Am I dear to you?” Thus he said to him: “Lord, you know everything; you know that you are dar to me!” Jesus said to him: “Give food to my lambs.

ENGLISH: Truly, truly I say to you: When you were younger, you girded yourself and walked where you wished. But when you shall be old, you will reach out with your hands and another will gird you and lead you where you do not wish.”
QUENYA: Truly, truly I say to you: When you were younger, you girded yourself and walked where you wished. But when you shall be old, you will reach out with your hands and another will gird you and lead you where you do not wish.”

ENGLISH: This he said to show the kind of death by which he was going to bring glory to God. And after this he said to him: “Follow me.”
QUENYA: This he said to show the kind of death by which he was going to bring glory to God. And after this he said to him: “Follow me.”

ENGLISH: When he turned , Peter saw the disciple whom Jesus loved follow – the person who at the evening meal was leaning towards his chest and said: “Lord, who is who betrays you?”
QUENYA: When he turned , Peter saw the disciple whom Jesus loved follow – the person who at the evening meal was leaning towards his chest and said: “Lord, who is who betrays you?”

ENGLISH: Therefore, when Peter saw him, he said to Jesus: “Lord, what will this man do?”
QUENYA: Therefore, when Peter saw him, he said to Jesus: “Lord, what will this man do?”

ENGLISH: Jesus said to him: “If my will is that he will remain until I come, what is that to you? You follow me!”
QUENYA: Jesus said to him: “If my will is that he will remain until I come, what is that to you? You follow me!”

ENGLISH: Therefore this saying went out among the disciples: “That disciple will not die.” But Jesus did not say to him that he was not going to die, but: “If my will is that he will remain until I come, what is that to you?”
QUENYA: Therefore this saying went out among the disciples: “That disciple will not die.” But Jesus did not say to him that he was not going to die, but: “If my will is that he will remain until I come, what is that to you?”

ENGLISH: He is the disciple who witnesses about this and who has written these things, and we know that his witness is true.
QUENYA: He is the disciple who witnesses about this and who has written these things, and we know that his witness is true.

ENGLISH: But are also many other things that Jesus has done. If one were to write about every single thing, I suppose that there is not enough place in the world itself for the books being written.
QUENYA: But are also many other things that Jesus has done. If one were to write about every single thing, I suppose that there is not enough place in the world itself for the books being written.

ENGLISH: Jude, slave of Jesus Christ, but brother of Jacob , to the called ones that are loved by God the Father and kept for Jesus Christ:
QUENYA: Jude, slave of Jesus Christ, but brother of Jacob , to the called ones that are loved by God the Father and kept for Jesus Christ:

ENGLISH: May you have mercy and peace and love in abundance!
QUENYA: May you have mercy and peace and love in abundance!

ENGLISH: Beloved ones, though with every urgency I wanted to write to you about the salvation in which you and I alike have a part, it was necessary for me to write to you in order to exhort you: Fight for the faith that once and for always has been given to the holy ones!
QUENYA: Beloved ones, though with every urgency I wanted to write to you about the salvation in which you and I alike have a part, it was necessary for me to write to you in order to exhort you: Fight for the faith that once and for always has been given to the holy ones!

ENGLISH: For some people have cleverly come in, that long ago were reserved for judgement by the Scriptures – wicked ones, who turn the grace into an opportunity for loose conduct, and deny our sole Leader and Lord, Jesus Christ.
QUENYA: For some people have cleverly come in, that long ago were reserved for judgement by the Scriptures – wicked ones, who turn the grace into an opportunity for loose conduct, and deny our sole Leader and Lord, Jesus Christ.

ENGLISH: I want to remind you, though you know everything once and for always: The Lord, after saving a people out of Egypt, thereafter destroyed the ones that did not believe.
QUENYA: I want to remind you, though you know everything once and for always: The Lord, after saving a people out of Egypt, thereafter destroyed the ones that did not believe.

ENGLISH: And the angels that did not keep the positions that they had in the beginning, but abandoned their own place, he has reserved for everlasting bonds under gloom for the judgement on the great day.
QUENYA: And the angels that did not keep the positions that they had in the beginning, but abandoned their own place, he has reserved for everlasting bonds under gloom for the judgement on the great day.

ENGLISH: Thus also Sodom and Gomorra and the cities around them are put before us as a sign of danger, for they fornicated and had a lust for foreign flesh, and now they have received the punishment of eternal fire.
QUENYA: Thus also Sodom and Gomorra and the cities around them are put before us as a sign of danger, for they fornicated and had a lust for foreign flesh, and now they have received the punishment of eternal fire.

ENGLISH: Thus also these dreamy people stain the flesh and turn away lordship, blaspheming against glorious ones.
QUENYA: Thus also these dreamy people stain the flesh and turn away lordship, blaspheming against glorious ones.

ENGLISH: But when Michael the Chief Angel quarreled with the Devid and had a dispute concerning the body of Moses, he did not dare to speak to him with mockery, but he said: «May the Lord rebuke you!»
QUENYA: But when Michael the Chief Angel quarreled with the Devid and had a dispute concerning the body of Moses, he did not dare to speak to him with mockery, but he said: «May the Lord rebuke you!»

ENGLISH: And yet these men blaspheme against all the things that they do not understand, but the things that they do understand – by their nature, like animals without intellect – by those they corrupt themselves.
QUENYA: And yet these men blaspheme against all the things that they do not understand, but the things that they do understand – by their nature, like animals without intellect – by those they corrupt themselves.

ENGLISH: Woe to them, for they have walked in the path of Cain, and into the error of Balaam they have thrown themselves, to receive reward, and they have undone themselves in the uprising of Korah.
QUENYA: Woe to them, for they have walked in the path of Cain, and into the error of Balaam they have thrown themselves, to receive reward, and they have undone themselves in the uprising of Korah.

ENGLISH: They are the rocks hidden under water at your feasts of love, shepherds that feed themselves without fear, clouds without water, carried hither and thither by wind, trees in autumn, without fruit, two times having died, drawn up with their roots,
QUENYA: They are the rocks hidden under water at your feasts of love, shepherds that feed themselves without fear, clouds without water, carried hither and thither by wind, trees in autumn, without fruit, two times having died, drawn up with their roots,

ENGLISH: wild waves of the sea, foaming with their own reasons for being ashamed, errant stars, for whom the gloom of darkness is reserved forever.
QUENYA: wild waves of the sea, foaming with their own reasons for being ashamed, errant stars, for whom the gloom of darkness is reserved forever.

ENGLISH: Indeed the seventh in the descent from Adam , Enoch, spoke a prophecy about them, saying: «Behold! The Lord came with his holy myriads ,
QUENYA: Indeed the seventh in the descent from Adam , Enoch, spoke a prophecy about them, saying: «Behold! The Lord came with his holy myriads ,

ENGLISH: in order to do judgement against all, and to give rebuke to all the wicked ones about all their wicked deeds that they have done wickedly, and about all the blasphemies that the wicked sinners have spoken against him.»
QUENYA: in order to do judgement against all, and to give rebuke to all the wicked ones about all their wicked deeds that they have done wickedly, and about all the blasphemies that the wicked sinners have spoken against him.»

ENGLISH: These people are grumbling, speaking evil about their fate, walking in their own desires, and their mouths speak big words; with honey on their tongue they speak to others for their own gain.
QUENYA: These people are grumbling, speaking evil about their fate, walking in their own desires, and their mouths speak big words; with honey on their tongue they speak to others for their own gain.

ENGLISH: But you, beloved ones, remember the saying spoken beforehand by the apostles of Jesus Christ our lord,
QUENYA: But you, beloved ones, remember the saying spoken beforehand by the apostles of Jesus Christ our lord,

ENGLISH: how they said to you: «In the last time will come people speaking mockery, walking in their own desires of wicked things.»
QUENYA: how they said to you: «In the last time will come people speaking mockery, walking in their own desires of wicked things.»

ENGLISH: They are the ones causing splits, men like animals, lacking spirit.
QUENYA: They are the ones causing splits, men like animals, lacking spirit.

ENGLISH: But you, beloved ones, build yourselves with your most holy faith, and pray with Holy Spirit.
QUENYA: But you, beloved ones, build yourselves with your most holy faith, and pray with Holy Spirit.

ENGLISH: Thus keep yourselves in God's love, while you look forward to the mercy of Jesus Christ our Lord, in order to receive eternal life.
QUENYA: Thus keep yourselves in God's love, while you look forward to the mercy of Jesus Christ our Lord, in order to receive eternal life.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, have mercy on the people the faith of whom is unsteady;
QUENYA: Furthermore, have mercy on the people the faith of whom is unsteady;

ENGLISH: save them by snatching them out of the fire. On these people have mercy, but take heed, loathing even a cloth stained by the flesh.
QUENYA: save them by snatching them out of the fire. On these people have mercy, but take heed, loathing even a cloth stained by the flesh.

ENGLISH: To the one that can guard you from falling and put you unmarred before his glory with great joy,
QUENYA: To the one that can guard you from falling and put you unmarred before his glory with great joy,

ENGLISH: to the one God, to the one who saves us through Jesus Christ our Lord, be glory, majesty , power and lordship throughout the entire past eternity and now and forever! Amen!
QUENYA: to the one God, to the one who saves us through Jesus Christ our Lord, be glory, majesty , power and lordship throughout the entire past eternity and now and forever! Amen!

ENGLISH: Since numerous ones have taken into hand to compose an account about the things that have happened among us,
QUENYA: Since numerous ones have taken into hand to compose an account about the things that have happened among us,

ENGLISH: as we received them from who first were witnesses and servants of the word,
QUENYA: as we received them from who first were witnesses and servants of the word,

ENGLISH: it seemed good also to me, after following all things closely from the beginning, to write them as chronological account for you, glorious Theophilus,
QUENYA: it seemed good also to me, after following all things closely from the beginning, to write them as chronological account for you, glorious Theophilus,

ENGLISH: for you to know the firm foundation of the things about which you have been instructed.
QUENYA: for you to know the firm foundation of the things about which you have been instructed.

ENGLISH: In the days of Herod, king of Judea, was a priest called Zechariah, of the division of Abiah, and he had a wife of the daughters of Aaron, and her name was Elizabeth.
QUENYA: In the days of Herod, king of Judea, was a priest called Zechariah, of the division of Abiah, and he had a wife of the daughters of Aaron, and her name was Elizabeth.

ENGLISH: And they were both righteous before God, walking in all the commandments and laws in a perfect manner.
QUENYA: And they were both righteous before God, walking in all the commandments and laws in a perfect manner.

ENGLISH: But was not child with them, for Elizabeth could not conceive, and both had many years.
QUENYA: But was not child with them, for Elizabeth could not conceive, and both had many years.

ENGLISH: The turn came to his division, and he did the priest's work before God.
QUENYA: The turn came to his division, and he did the priest's work before God.

ENGLISH: By throwing lots, as the custom of the priests was, it fell upon him to go into God's santuary to burn incence.
QUENYA: By throwing lots, as the custom of the priests was, it fell upon him to go into God's santuary to burn incence.

ENGLISH: And the entire multitude of the people stood in prayer on the outside at the hour of burning incence.
QUENYA: And the entire multitude of the people stood in prayer on the outside at the hour of burning incence.

ENGLISH: Then the Lord's angel showed himself to him, standing at the right of the altar of incence.
QUENYA: Then the Lord's angel showed himself to him, standing at the right of the altar of incence.

ENGLISH: But Zechariah was troubled at seeing him, and fear fell upon him.
QUENYA: But Zechariah was troubled at seeing him, and fear fell upon him.

ENGLISH: But the angel said to him: “Do not fear, Zechariah, for your petition has been heard, and Elizabeth your wife will be mother to a son to you, and you are to give him the name John.
QUENYA: But the angel said to him: “Do not fear, Zechariah, for your petition has been heard, and Elizabeth your wife will be mother to a son to you, and you are to give him the name John.

ENGLISH: And you will have joy and happiness, and numerous ones will be happy since he has been born,
QUENYA: And you will have joy and happiness, and numerous ones will be happy since he has been born,

ENGLISH: for he will be great before the Lord, and wine and strong drink he is not to drink, and he will be filled with Holy Spirit all the way from his mother's womb.
