QUENYA: His winnowing fork is in his hand to cleanse his threshing floor, and he will gather his grain into the store, but the chaff he will burn with a fire that no one can extinguish.”

ENGLISH: Therefore he gave also many other urgings and preached the gospel to the people.
QUENYA: Therefore he gave also many other urgings and preached the gospel to the people.

ENGLISH: But Herod the farthing-ruler, when he was rebuked by him concerning Herodias his brother's wife and concerning the wicked deeds that Herod did,
QUENYA: But Herod the farthing-ruler, when he was rebuked by him concerning Herodias his brother's wife and concerning the wicked deeds that Herod did,

ENGLISH: added also this thing to all those deeds: he put John in prison.
QUENYA: added also this thing to all those deeds: he put John in prison.

ENGLISH: Now when the whole people was baptized, also Jesus was baptized, and as he prayed, heaven was opened
QUENYA: Now when the whole people was baptized, also Jesus was baptized, and as he prayed, heaven was opened

ENGLISH: and the Holy Spirit, in body-shape of a dove, came down upon him, and a voice came out of heaven: “You are my son, the beloved; of you I have thought well.”
QUENYA: and the Holy Spirit, in body-shape of a dove, came down upon him, and a voice came out of heaven: “You are my son, the beloved; of you I have thought well.”

ENGLISH: And Jesus himself, at the beginning of his labor, had around thirty years. He was, one supposed, son of Joseph, son of Heli,
QUENYA: And Jesus himself, at the beginning of his labor, had around thirty years. He was, one supposed, son of Joseph, son of Heli,

ENGLISH: son of Matthat, son of Levi, son of Melchi, son of Jannai, son of Joseph,
QUENYA: son of Matthat, son of Levi, son of Melchi, son of Jannai, son of Joseph,

ENGLISH: son of Mattathias, son of Amos, son of Nahum, son of Esli, son of Naggai,
QUENYA: son of Mattathias, son of Amos, son of Nahum, son of Esli, son of Naggai,

ENGLISH: son of Maath, son of Mattathias, son of Semein, son of Josech, son of Joda,
QUENYA: son of Maath, son of Mattathias, son of Semein, son of Josech, son of Joda,

ENGLISH: son of Joanan, son of Rhesa, son of Zerubbabel, son of Shealtiel, son of Neri,
QUENYA: son of Joanan, son of Rhesa, son of Zerubbabel, son of Shealtiel, son of Neri,

ENGLISH: son of Melchi, son of Addi, son of Cosam, son of Elmadam, son of Er,
QUENYA: son of Melchi, son of Addi, son of Cosam, son of Elmadam, son of Er,

ENGLISH: son of Jesus, son of Eliezer, son of Jorim, son of Matthat, son of Levi,
QUENYA: son of Jesus, son of Eliezer, son of Jorim, son of Matthat, son of Levi,

ENGLISH: son of Symeon, son of Judas, son of Josef, son of Jonam, son of Eliakim,
QUENYA: son of Symeon, son of Judas, son of Josef, son of Jonam, son of Eliakim,

ENGLISH: son of Melea, son of Menna, son of Mattatha, son of Nathan, son of David,
QUENYA: son of Melea, son of Menna, son of Mattatha, son of Nathan, son of David,

ENGLISH: son of Jesse, son of Odeb, son of Boaz, son of Salmon, son of Nahshon,
QUENYA: son of Jesse, son of Odeb, son of Boaz, son of Salmon, son of Nahshon,

ENGLISH: son of Amminadab, son of Arni, son of Hezron,
QUENYA: son of Amminadab, son of Arni, son of Hezron,

ENGLISH: son of Jacob, son of Isaac, son of Abraham, son of Terah, son of Nahor,
QUENYA: son of Jacob, son of Isaac, son of Abraham, son of Terah, son of Nahor,

ENGLISH: son of Serug, son of Reu, son of Peleg, son of Eber, son of Shelah,
QUENYA: son of Serug, son of Reu, son of Peleg, son of Eber, son of Shelah,

ENGLISH: son of Cainan, son of Arpachshad, son of Shem, son of Noah, son of Lamech,
QUENYA: son of Cainan, son of Arpachshad, son of Shem, son of Noah, son of Lamech,

ENGLISH: son of Methuselah, so of Enoch, son of Jared, son of Mahallaleel, son of Cainan,
QUENYA: son of Methuselah, so of Enoch, son of Jared, son of Mahallaleel, son of Cainan,

ENGLISH: son of Enosh, son of Set, son of Adam, God's son.
QUENYA: son of Enosh, son of Set, son of Adam, God's son.

ENGLISH: And Jesus, full of Holy Sprit, went away from Jordan and was led by the Spirit into the desert
QUENYA: And Jesus, full of Holy Sprit, went away from Jordan and was led by the Spirit into the desert

ENGLISH: for forty days, being tempted by the Devil. And he ate nothing in those days, and when they were gone, he was hungry.
QUENYA: for forty days, being tempted by the Devil. And he ate nothing in those days, and when they were gone, he was hungry.

ENGLISH: Then the Devil said to him: “If you are God's son, say to this stone: Be changed into bread!”
QUENYA: Then the Devil said to him: “If you are God's son, say to this stone: Be changed into bread!”

ENGLISH: But Jesus answered him: “ is written: Man shall not have life by bread alone.”
QUENYA: But Jesus answered him: “ is written: Man shall not have life by bread alone.”

ENGLISH: Then he led him up and showed him all the kingdoms of world in a single moment,
QUENYA: Then he led him up and showed him all the kingdoms of world in a single moment,

ENGLISH: and the Devil said to him: “I shall give you all this power and their glory, for it has been given to me, and I will give it to anyone that I wish.
QUENYA: and the Devil said to him: “I shall give you all this power and their glory, for it has been given to me, and I will give it to anyone that I wish.

ENGLISH: Therefore, if you worship me, everything shall be yours.”
QUENYA: Therefore, if you worship me, everything shall be yours.”

ENGLISH: In answer Jesus said to him: “ is written: The Lord your God you are to worship, and for him alone you are to serve.”
QUENYA: In answer Jesus said to him: “ is written: The Lord your God you are to worship, and for him alone you are to serve.”

ENGLISH: Now he led him into Jerusalem and put him on the wing of the temple and said to him: “If you are God's son, throw yourself down from here, for is written: He will command his angels concerning you, to keep you,
QUENYA: Now he led him into Jerusalem and put him on the wing of the temple and said to him: “If you are God's son, throw yourself down from here, for is written: He will command his angels concerning you, to keep you,

ENGLISH: and: They will carry you on their hands, to stop you from striking your foot against stone.”
QUENYA: and: They will carry you on their hands, to stop you from striking your foot against stone.”

ENGLISH: In answer Jesus said to him: “It is said: Do not test the Lord your God.”
QUENYA: In answer Jesus said to him: “It is said: Do not test the Lord your God.”

ENGLISH: Then the Devil, after completing the entire temptation, went away from him until another time.
QUENYA: Then the Devil, after completing the entire temptation, went away from him until another time.

ENGLISH: Now Jesus returned in the power of the Spirit into Galilee. And good talk about him spread throughout the entire around-lying country.
QUENYA: Now Jesus returned in the power of the Spirit into Galilee. And good talk about him spread throughout the entire around-lying country.

ENGLISH: And he taught in their synagogues, receiving praise from all.
QUENYA: And he taught in their synagogues, receiving praise from all.

ENGLISH: And he came to Nazareth, where he was raised, and as his habit was, he went into the synagogue, and he arose to read.
QUENYA: And he came to Nazareth, where he was raised, and as his habit was, he went into the synagogue, and he arose to read.

ENGLISH: Then the scroll of Isaiah the Prophet was given to him, and he opened the book and found the place where was written:
QUENYA: Then the scroll of Isaiah the Prophet was given to him, and he opened the book and found the place where was written:

ENGLISH: “The spirit of the Lord is on me, for he annointed me to give good news to poor ones; he sent me to make known to people in prison that they will be freed and to blind ones that they will receive sight, to send the broken ones away by a release,
QUENYA: “The spirit of the Lord is on me, for he annointed me to give good news to poor ones; he sent me to make known to people in prison that they will be freed and to blind ones that they will receive sight, to send the broken ones away by a release,

ENGLISH: to make known the Lord's year of good will.”
QUENYA: to make known the Lord's year of good will.”

ENGLISH: And he rolled up the book, gave it back to the servant and sat down; and the eyes of all that were in the synagogue were fixed on him.
QUENYA: And he rolled up the book, gave it back to the servant and sat down; and the eyes of all that were in the synagogue were fixed on him.

ENGLISH: Then he began to say to them: “Today this scripture has been made true while you heard it.”
QUENYA: Then he began to say to them: “Today this scripture has been made true while you heard it.”

ENGLISH: And all witenssed about him, and they were in wonder about the gracious words that came out of his mouth, and they said: “Is this man not Joseph's son?”
QUENYA: And all witenssed about him, and they were in wonder about the gracious words that came out of his mouth, and they said: “Is this man not Joseph's son?”

ENGLISH: Then he said to them: “Indeed you want to say to me this proverb: Healer, heal yourself! The things that we have heard happened in Capernaum, do them also here in your own region!”
QUENYA: Then he said to them: “Indeed you want to say to me this proverb: Healer, heal yourself! The things that we have heard happened in Capernaum, do them also here in your own region!”

ENGLISH: But he said: “Truly I say to you that there is not prophet that is well received in his own region.
QUENYA: But he said: “Truly I say to you that there is not prophet that is well received in his own region.

ENGLISH: For in truth I say to you: There were numerous widows in Israel in the days of Eliah, when heaven was shut for three years and six months, causing a great famine to fall upon the land;
QUENYA: For in truth I say to you: There were numerous widows in Israel in the days of Eliah, when heaven was shut for three years and six months, causing a great famine to fall upon the land;

ENGLISH: and yet Eliah was not sent to anyone among them, but to Zarephath in the land of Sidon, to a widowed woman there.
QUENYA: and yet Eliah was not sent to anyone among them, but to Zarephath in the land of Sidon, to a widowed woman there.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, were numerous skin-diseased ones in Israel at the time of Elisha the prophet, and yet no one among them was cleansed, but Naaman from Syria.”
QUENYA: Furthermore, were numerous skin-diseased ones in Israel at the time of Elisha the prophet, and yet no one among them was cleansed, but Naaman from Syria.”

ENGLISH: And all that heard these things in the synagogue were filled with rage,
QUENYA: And all that heard these things in the synagogue were filled with rage,

ENGLISH: and they arose and hurried him to the outside of the city, and their led him to the brow of the mountain on which their city was built, to throw him down from there.
QUENYA: and they arose and hurried him to the outside of the city, and their led him to the brow of the mountain on which their city was built, to throw him down from there.

ENGLISH: But he walked through their midst and went away.
QUENYA: But he walked through their midst and went away.

ENGLISH: And he went down to Capernaum, a city in Galilee. And he taught them on the day of rest,
QUENYA: And he went down to Capernaum, a city in Galilee. And he taught them on the day of rest,

ENGLISH: and they were filled with wonder by the manner that he taught, for his speech had power.
QUENYA: and they were filled with wonder by the manner that he taught, for his speech had power.

ENGLISH: And was in the synagoge a man possessed by a spirit, an unclean demon, and it cried with a mighty voice:
QUENYA: And was in the synagoge a man possessed by a spirit, an unclean demon, and it cried with a mighty voice:

ENGLISH: “Ah! What there to us and to you , Jesus from Nazareth? Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are, the Holy One of God!”
QUENYA: “Ah! What there to us and to you , Jesus from Nazareth? Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are, the Holy One of God!”

ENGLISH: And Jesus rebuked it, saying: “Be silent and come out of him!” And after throwing the man down in their midst, the demon came out of him, without hurting him.
QUENYA: And Jesus rebuked it, saying: “Be silent and come out of him!” And after throwing the man down in their midst, the demon came out of him, without hurting him.

ENGLISH: Then wonder fell upon all, and they talked one with the other, saying: “What kind of speech is this? For with power and with might he commands the unclean spirits, and they come out!”
QUENYA: Then wonder fell upon all, and they talked one with the other, saying: “What kind of speech is this? For with power and with might he commands the unclean spirits, and they come out!”

ENGLISH: And the news about him went out in every place in the around-lying country.
QUENYA: And the news about him went out in every place in the around-lying country.

ENGLISH: After leaving the synagoge he went into the house of Simon. But Simon's wife's mother was troubled by a great fever , and they made petition to him about her.
QUENYA: After leaving the synagoge he went into the house of Simon. But Simon's wife's mother was troubled by a great fever , and they made petition to him about her.

ENGLISH: And he stood above the woman and rebuked the fever, and that went away from her. In the same moment she arose and served for them.
QUENYA: And he stood above the woman and rebuked the fever, and that went away from her. In the same moment she arose and served for them.

ENGLISH: But at the setting of the sun, all that had people sick with various illnesses brought them to him. By putting his hands on them he healed them.
QUENYA: But at the setting of the sun, all that had people sick with various illnesses brought them to him. By putting his hands on them he healed them.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, demons came out from numerous ones, crying and saying: “You are God's son.” But he rebuked them and did not allow them to speak, since they knew that he was the Christ.
QUENYA: Furthermore, demons came out from numerous ones, crying and saying: “You are God's son.” But he rebuked them and did not allow them to speak, since they knew that he was the Christ.

ENGLISH: But when day came, he went out and went to a lonely place. But the crowds sought him, and they came to where he was, and they tried to stop him from going away from them.
QUENYA: But when day came, he went out and went to a lonely place. But the crowds sought him, and they came to where he was, and they tried to stop him from going away from them.

ENGLISH: But he said to them: “Also to the other cities it is necessary for me to make known the gospel, for that is the reason why I was sent forth.”
QUENYA: But he said to them: “Also to the other cities it is necessary for me to make known the gospel, for that is the reason why I was sent forth.”

ENGLISH: And he went preaching in the synagogues of Judea.
QUENYA: And he went preaching in the synagogues of Judea.

ENGLISH: At an occasion when the crowd pressed against him, listening to God's word, he stood by the lake Gennesaret.
QUENYA: At an occasion when the crowd pressed against him, listening to God's word, he stood by the lake Gennesaret.

ENGLISH: And he saw two boats lying by the lake, but the fishermen had gone out of them and were washing their nets.
QUENYA: And he saw two boats lying by the lake, but the fishermen had gone out of them and were washing their nets.

ENGLISH: Going into one of the boats, which was Simon's, he asked him to go a short distance from the land. Then he sat down, and from the boat he taught the crowds.When he ceased to speak, he said to Simon: “Go to where it is deep, and you put down your nets for a catch.”
QUENYA: Going into one of the boats, which was Simon's, he asked him to go a short distance from the land. Then he sat down, and from the boat he taught the crowds.When he ceased to speak, he said to Simon: “Go to where it is deep, and you put down your nets for a catch.”

ENGLISH: But in answer Simon said: “Teacher, throughout the entire night we have toiled and caught nothing, but at your order I will put the nets down.”
QUENYA: But in answer Simon said: “Teacher, throughout the entire night we have toiled and caught nothing, but at your order I will put the nets down.”

ENGLISH: When they did so, they enclosed a great multitude of fishes, and their nets were torn.
QUENYA: When they did so, they enclosed a great multitude of fishes, and their nets were torn.

ENGLISH: And they gestured to their partners in the other boat for them to come to help them, and they came, and they filled both boats, until they were going down.
QUENYA: And they gestured to their partners in the other boat for them to come to help them, and they came, and they filled both boats, until they were going down.

ENGLISH: When he saw that, Simon Peter fell down before Jesus' knees, saying: “Go away from me, for I am a sinful man, Lord!”
QUENYA: When he saw that, Simon Peter fell down before Jesus' knees, saying: “Go away from me, for I am a sinful man, Lord!”

ENGLISH: For by the catch of fishes he was struck with wonder, he and all that were with him,
QUENYA: For by the catch of fishes he was struck with wonder, he and all that were with him,

ENGLISH: and also both Jacob and John, the sons of Zebedee, that were partners with Simon. But Jesus said to Simon: “Do not be afraid! From now you will catch men alive.”
QUENYA: and also both Jacob and John, the sons of Zebedee, that were partners with Simon. But Jesus said to Simon: “Do not be afraid! From now you will catch men alive.”

ENGLISH: And they brought the boats to land and abandoned everything and followed him.
QUENYA: And they brought the boats to land and abandoned everything and followed him.

ENGLISH: And when he was in one of the cities, behold! a man full of skin-disease. When he saw Jesus he fell upon his face and begged of him, saying: “Lord, if you want to, you can cleanse me!”
QUENYA: And when he was in one of the cities, behold! a man full of skin-disease. When he saw Jesus he fell upon his face and begged of him, saying: “Lord, if you want to, you can cleanse me!”

ENGLISH: And reaching out with his hand Jesus touched him, saying: “I want to! Be cleansed!” And in the same moment the skin-disease disappeared from him.
QUENYA: And reaching out with his hand Jesus touched him, saying: “I want to! Be cleansed!” And in the same moment the skin-disease disappeared from him.

ENGLISH: And he commanded the man: “Tell nobody, but go away and show yourself to the priest, and as Moses commended made a sacrifice for your cleansing, as a witness to them.”
QUENYA: And he commanded the man: “Tell nobody, but go away and show yourself to the priest, and as Moses commended made a sacrifice for your cleansing, as a witness to them.”

ENGLISH: But the word about him scattered that much more, and great crowds came together to listen and to be healed from their sicknesses.
QUENYA: But the word about him scattered that much more, and great crowds came together to listen and to be healed from their sicknesses.

ENGLISH: But he went away into the deserts, praying.
QUENYA: But he went away into the deserts, praying.

ENGLISH: It happened in a day that he was teaching, and some Pharisees and teachers of the Law that had come from every village of Galilee and of Judea and of Jerusalem sat there, and the Lord's power was there, for him to be able to heal.
QUENYA: It happened in a day that he was teaching, and some Pharisees and teachers of the Law that had come from every village of Galilee and of Judea and of Jerusalem sat there, and the Lord's power was there, for him to be able to heal.

ENGLISH: And behold! some people bearing on a bed a man that was lame, and they sought to bring him forward and put him before Jesus.
QUENYA: And behold! some people bearing on a bed a man that was lame, and they sought to bring him forward and put him before Jesus.

ENGLISH: But when they did not find how they could carry him forward, by reason of the crowd, they climbed to the roof, and through the thatch they let him down with the bed, in the middle before Jesus.
QUENYA: But when they did not find how they could carry him forward, by reason of the crowd, they climbed to the roof, and through the thatch they let him down with the bed, in the middle before Jesus.

ENGLISH: And when he saw their faith he said: “Man, your sins are forgiven you!”
QUENYA: And when he saw their faith he said: “Man, your sins are forgiven you!”

ENGLISH: And the scribes an the Pharisees started to think, saying: “Who is this man that is speaking blasphemies? Who may forgive sins except God alone?”
QUENYA: And the scribes an the Pharisees started to think, saying: “Who is this man that is speaking blasphemies? Who may forgive sins except God alone?”

ENGLISH: But Jesus, perceiving their thoughts, said in answer to them: “About what are you thinking in your hearts?
QUENYA: But Jesus, perceiving their thoughts, said in answer to them: “About what are you thinking in your hearts?

ENGLISH: What is the more easily done, saying 'Your sins are forgiven to you' or saying: “Rise, take your bed and go to your house.'
QUENYA: What is the more easily done, saying 'Your sins are forgiven to you' or saying: “Rise, take your bed and go to your house.'

ENGLISH: But for you to know that the Son of Man has power on earth to forgive sins” – he said to the lame man: “I say to you, rise and take up your bed and go to your house.”
QUENYA: But for you to know that the Son of Man has power on earth to forgive sins” – he said to the lame man: “I say to you, rise and take up your bed and go to your house.”

ENGLISH: And in the same moment he arose before them, took up that on which he lay, and went to his house giving glory to God.
QUENYA: And in the same moment he arose before them, took up that on which he lay, and went to his house giving glory to God.

ENGLISH: Then all among them were beside themselves, and they gave glory to God and were filled with fear, saying: “We have seen wonders today!”
QUENYA: Then all among them were beside themselves, and they gave glory to God and were filled with fear, saying: “We have seen wonders today!”

ENGLISH: And after these things he went forth and saw a tax-collector called Levi sitting at the tax office, and he said to him: “Follow me.”
QUENYA: And after these things he went forth and saw a tax-collector called Levi sitting at the tax office, and he said to him: “Follow me.”

ENGLISH: And abandoning everything he arose and followed him.
QUENYA: And abandoning everything he arose and followed him.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, Levi made a great feast for him at his house, and was a great crowd, tax collectors and others, that were with them at the table.
QUENYA: Furthermore, Levi made a great feast for him at his house, and was a great crowd, tax collectors and others, that were with them at the table.

ENGLISH: And the Pharisees and their scribes grumbled against his disciples, saying: “How is that you eat and you drink with tax collectors and sinners?”
QUENYA: And the Pharisees and their scribes grumbled against his disciples, saying: “How is that you eat and you drink with tax collectors and sinners?”

ENGLISH: In answer Jesus said to them: “ that have health do not have need of a healer, but that are sickly.
QUENYA: In answer Jesus said to them: “ that have health do not have need of a healer, but that are sickly.

ENGLISH: I have come to call, not just ones, but sinners to repentence.”
QUENYA: I have come to call, not just ones, but sinners to repentence.”

ENGLISH: They said to him: “John's discipels frequently fast and make supplications, but your ones eat and drink.”
QUENYA: They said to him: “John's discipels frequently fast and make supplications, but your ones eat and drink.”

ENGLISH: Jesus said to them: “Surely you cannot compel the bridegroom's friends to fast when the bridegroom is with them? And yet days shall come in which the bridegroom will be taken away from them; then they shall fast, in those days.
QUENYA: Jesus said to them: “Surely you cannot compel the bridegroom's friends to fast when the bridegroom is with them? And yet days shall come in which the bridegroom will be taken away from them; then they shall fast, in those days.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, he spoke this comparison: “No one cuts a cloth-piece from a new cloak and sews it in an old cloak, but if one indeed does so, then the new cloth-piece tears away; furthermore, the cloth-piece from the new cloak is not similar to the old.
QUENYA: Furthermore, he spoke this comparison: “No one cuts a cloth-piece from a new cloak and sews it in an old cloak, but if one indeed does so, then the new cloth-piece tears away; furthermore, the cloth-piece from the new cloak is not similar to the old.

ENGLISH: And no one puts new wine in old skin-bottles, but if one indeed does so, then the new wine bursts the skin-bottles, and it flows out and the skin-bottles are destroyed.
QUENYA: And no one puts new wine in old skin-bottles, but if one indeed does so, then the new wine bursts the skin-bottles, and it flows out and the skin-bottles are destroyed.

ENGLISH: But it is necessary to put new wine in new skin-bottles!
QUENYA: But it is necessary to put new wine in new skin-bottles!

ENGLISH: No one who has drunk old wine wants new, for he says: 'The old is good.'”
QUENYA: No one who has drunk old wine wants new, for he says: 'The old is good.'”

ENGLISH: It happened on a day of restthat he went through some grain-fields , and his disciples picked and ate the heads of grain, crushing them in their hand.
QUENYA: It happened on a day of restthat he went through some grain-fields , and his disciples picked and ate the heads of grain, crushing them in their hand.

ENGLISH: But some of the Pharisees said: “How is that you are doing what is not allowed on the day of rest?”
QUENYA: But some of the Pharisees said: “How is that you are doing what is not allowed on the day of rest?”

ENGLISH: But Jesus answered them: “Have you not ever read about that which David did when he and the men with him were hungry?
QUENYA: But Jesus answered them: “Have you not ever read about that which David did when he and the men with him were hungry?

ENGLISH: He went into God's house and received the breads of presentation and ate and gave them to the men with him, though they are not permitted food for anyone except for the priests alone.”
QUENYA: He went into God's house and received the breads of presentation and ate and gave them to the men with him, though they are not permitted food for anyone except for the priests alone.”

ENGLISH: And he said to them: “The Son of Man is Lord of the day of rest.”
QUENYA: And he said to them: “The Son of Man is Lord of the day of rest.”

ENGLISH: It happened on another day of rest taht he went into the synagogue and taught. And was there a man whose right hand was withered.
QUENYA: It happened on another day of rest taht he went into the synagogue and taught. And was there a man whose right hand was withered.

ENGLISH: The scribes and the Pharisees watched him, to see if he was going to heal anyone on the day of rest, for them to find a way with which they could accuse him.
QUENYA: The scribes and the Pharisees watched him, to see if he was going to heal anyone on the day of rest, for them to find a way with which they could accuse him.

ENGLISH: But he knew how they thought, and yet he said to the man having the withered hand: “Rise and stand in the middle.” And he arose and stood there.
QUENYA: But he knew how they thought, and yet he said to the man having the withered hand: “Rise and stand in the middle.” And he arose and stood there.

ENGLISH: Then Jesus said to them: “I ask of you: Is it allowed on the day of rest to do good or to do evil, to save a person or to destroy him?”
QUENYA: Then Jesus said to them: “I ask of you: Is it allowed on the day of rest to do good or to do evil, to save a person or to destroy him?”

ENGLISH: And after he looked at all among them, from person to person, he said to the man: “Reach out with your hand!” He did so, and his hand was healed.
QUENYA: And after he looked at all among them, from person to person, he said to the man: “Reach out with your hand!” He did so, and his hand was healed.

ENGLISH: But they were filled with rage, and spoke about what they were going to do to Jesus.
QUENYA: But they were filled with rage, and spoke about what they were going to do to Jesus.

ENGLISH: It happened in those days that he went up into the mountain to pray, and he remained there through the night, in prayer to God
QUENYA: It happened in those days that he went up into the mountain to pray, and he remained there through the night, in prayer to God

ENGLISH: But when day came, he summoned his disciples and chose from among them twelve, that he also named apostles:
QUENYA: But when day came, he summoned his disciples and chose from among them twelve, that he also named apostles:

ENGLISH: Simon, whom he also called Peter, and Andrew his brother, and Jacob and John, and Phillip and Bartholomew
QUENYA: Simon, whom he also called Peter, and Andrew his brother, and Jacob and John, and Phillip and Bartholomew

ENGLISH: and Matthew and Thomas and Jacob the son of Alphaeus, and Simon who is called the Zealot,
QUENYA: and Matthew and Thomas and Jacob the son of Alphaeus, and Simon who is called the Zealot,

ENGLISH: and Judah son of Jacob, and Judas Iscariot, who betrayed him.
QUENYA: and Judah son of Jacob, and Judas Iscariot, who betrayed him.

ENGLISH: And he came down with them and stood on a plain, and was a multitude of people from all of Judea and Jerusalemn and from the sea-regions arbout Tyre and Sidon, that came to hear him and to be healed of their diseases.
QUENYA: And he came down with them and stood on a plain, and was a multitude of people from all of Judea and Jerusalemn and from the sea-regions arbout Tyre and Sidon, that came to hear him and to be healed of their diseases.

ENGLISH: Also that were tormented by unclean spirits were healed.
QUENYA: Also that were tormented by unclean spirits were healed.

ENGLISH: And the whole crowd sought to touch him, for power went out of him and healed all among them.
QUENYA: And the whole crowd sought to touch him, for power went out of him and healed all among them.

ENGLISH: And he raised his eyes towards his disciples and said: “Happy are the poor, for God's kingdom is yours!
QUENYA: And he raised his eyes towards his disciples and said: “Happy are the poor, for God's kingdom is yours!

ENGLISH: Happy are you that are hungry now, for you will be filled!Happy are you that are wailing, for you will laugh!
QUENYA: Happy are you that are hungry now, for you will be filled!Happy are you that are wailing, for you will laugh!

ENGLISH: Happy you are when men hate you, and when they turn from you and abuse you and throw out your name as evil, for the good of the Son of Man.
QUENYA: Happy you are when men hate you, and when they turn from you and abuse you and throw out your name as evil, for the good of the Son of Man.

ENGLISH: Have joy in that day and leap, for behold! your reward is great in heaven. For those are the same things that their fathers did to the prophets.
QUENYA: Have joy in that day and leap, for behold! your reward is great in heaven. For those are the same things that their fathers did to the prophets.

ENGLISH: But woe to you that are rich, for you have received your entire comfort!
QUENYA: But woe to you that are rich, for you have received your entire comfort!

ENGLISH: Woe to you that are full now, for you will be hungry!Woe to you that laugh now, for you will have grief and tears!
QUENYA: Woe to you that are full now, for you will be hungry!Woe to you that laugh now, for you will have grief and tears!

ENGLISH: Woe to you when all men speak well of you, for in the same manner their fathers spoke about the false prophets!
QUENYA: Woe to you when all men speak well of you, for in the same manner their fathers spoke about the false prophets!

ENGLISH: But I say to you that listen: Love your enemies and do well to that hate you,
QUENYA: But I say to you that listen: Love your enemies and do well to that hate you,

ENGLISH: bless that curse you and pray for who speak evil about you.
QUENYA: bless that curse you and pray for who speak evil about you.

ENGLISH: Towards that strikes you on one chin turn also the other, and that takes your cloak do not stop from taking also the tunic.
QUENYA: Towards that strikes you on one chin turn also the other, and that takes your cloak do not stop from taking also the tunic.

ENGLISH: Give to all that ask of you , and from that takes your things, do not ask to receive them back.
QUENYA: Give to all that ask of you , and from that takes your things, do not ask to receive them back.

ENGLISH: And as you wish that men will do to you, so do to them.
QUENYA: And as you wish that men will do to you, so do to them.

ENGLISH: And if you love that love you, how will that be beneficial for you? For also the sinners love that love them.
QUENYA: And if you love that love you, how will that be beneficial for you? For also the sinners love that love them.

ENGLISH: And if you do good to that do good to you, how will that be beneficial for you? Also the sinners do the same.
QUENYA: And if you do good to that do good to you, how will that be beneficial for you? Also the sinners do the same.

ENGLISH: And if you lend to people from whom you have hope of receiving, how will that be beneficial to you? Also sinners lend to sinners in order to receive back the same sum.
QUENYA: And if you lend to people from whom you have hope of receiving, how will that be beneficial to you? Also sinners lend to sinners in order to receive back the same sum.

ENGLISH: On the contrary, love your enemies and do good and lend to others, without hope of receiving back, and your reward will be great, and you will be sons of the Most High, for he is kind to who do not give thanks and to the evil ones.
QUENYA: On the contrary, love your enemies and do good and lend to others, without hope of receiving back, and your reward will be great, and you will be sons of the Most High, for he is kind to who do not give thanks and to the evil ones.

ENGLISH: Show mercy like your Father shows mercy!
QUENYA: Show mercy like your Father shows mercy!

ENGLISH: Furthermore, do not judge, and you will by no means be judged; do not say that others are worthy of punishment, and will not be said about you that you are worthy of punishment. Release, and you will be released.
QUENYA: Furthermore, do not judge, and you will by no means be judged; do not say that others are worthy of punishment, and will not be said about you that you are worthy of punishment. Release, and you will be released.

ENGLISH: Give, and one will give to you. A good measure – pressed down, shaken and abundant – they will place in your bosom. For by the measure with which you measure out, they will measure out to you.
QUENYA: Give, and one will give to you. A good measure – pressed down, shaken and abundant – they will place in your bosom. For by the measure with which you measure out, they will measure out to you.

ENGLISH: Then he also spoke this comparison: “Surely a blind person cannot lead a blind person? Will not both fall into a hollow?
QUENYA: Then he also spoke this comparison: “Surely a blind person cannot lead a blind person? Will not both fall into a hollow?

ENGLISH: who learns is not above who instructs, but everyone that has been fully instructed will be like who instructs.
QUENYA: who learns is not above who instructs, but everyone that has been fully instructed will be like who instructs.

ENGLISH: How is , then, that you look at the straw which is in your brother's eye, but you do not heed the plank which is in your own eye?
QUENYA: How is , then, that you look at the straw which is in your brother's eye, but you do not heed the plank which is in your own eye?

ENGLISH: How is it possible for you to say to your brother: 'Brother, allow me to take the straw out of your eye,' when you do not look at the plank in your own eye?
QUENYA: How is it possible for you to say to your brother: 'Brother, allow me to take the straw out of your eye,' when you do not look at the plank in your own eye?

ENGLISH: For does not exist good tree producing foul fruit; again does not exist foul tree producing good fruit.
QUENYA: For does not exist good tree producing foul fruit; again does not exist foul tree producing good fruit.

ENGLISH: For every tree is known by its fruit. For people do not gather figs from thorns; furthermore, they do not cut grapes from a thorn-bush.
QUENYA: For every tree is known by its fruit. For people do not gather figs from thorns; furthermore, they do not cut grapes from a thorn-bush.

ENGLISH: A good man brings good out of his heart's hidden treasure, but an evil man brings evil out of his evil treasure, for out of the heart's abundance his mouth speaks.
QUENYA: A good man brings good out of his heart's hidden treasure, but an evil man brings evil out of his evil treasure, for out of the heart's abundance his mouth speaks.

ENGLISH: How is that you call me 'Lord, Lord', and yet you do not do the things that I say?
QUENYA: How is that you call me 'Lord, Lord', and yet you do not do the things that I say?

ENGLISH: Everyone who comes to me and hears my words and does them – I will show you with whom one can compare him:
QUENYA: Everyone who comes to me and hears my words and does them – I will show you with whom one can compare him:

ENGLISH: He is like a person building a house, who dug and put the foundation upon the rock. Therefore, when was flood, the river beat against that house, but it could not shake it, since it was well built.
QUENYA: He is like a person building a house, who dug and put the foundation upon the rock. Therefore, when was flood, the river beat against that house, but it could not shake it, since it was well built.

ENGLISH: But who has heard and does not do, is like a man who built a house on the ground without a foundation. Against it the river beat, and in that moment it collapsed, and the collapse of that house was great.”
QUENYA: But who has heard and does not do, is like a man who built a house on the ground without a foundation. Against it the river beat, and in that moment it collapsed, and the collapse of that house was great.”

ENGLISH: After he completed all his sayings while the people listened, he went into Capernaum.
QUENYA: After he completed all his sayings while the people listened, he went into Capernaum.

ENGLISH: But the slave of a centurion, who was dear to him, was ailing and near to expiring.
QUENYA: But the slave of a centurion, who was dear to him, was ailing and near to expiring.

ENGLISH: When he heard about Jesus, he sent to him some elders of the Jews to request him to come and to deliver his slave.
QUENYA: When he heard about Jesus, he sent to him some elders of the Jews to request him to come and to deliver his slave.

ENGLISH: Then that came to Jesus made petition of him and said: “He is worthy that you do this thing for him,
QUENYA: Then that came to Jesus made petition of him and said: “He is worthy that you do this thing for him,

ENGLISH: for he loves our nation, and he built for us the synagoge.”
QUENYA: for he loves our nation, and he built for us the synagoge.”

ENGLISH: And Jesus went with them. But when he was not far from the house, the centurion beforehand sent some friends for them to say to him: “Lord, do not trouble yourself, for I am not worthy that you come under my roof.
QUENYA: And Jesus went with them. But when he was not far from the house, the centurion beforehand sent some friends for them to say to him: “Lord, do not trouble yourself, for I am not worthy that you come under my roof.

ENGLISH: Therefore I did not count myself worthy to come to you. But say the word and cause my slave to be healed.
QUENYA: Therefore I did not count myself worthy to come to you. But say the word and cause my slave to be healed.

ENGLISH: For I as well am a man under authority , having soldiers under me, and if I say to this one: Go! – then he goes, or to another: Come! – then he comes, or to my slave: Do so! – then he does that.”
QUENYA: For I as well am a man under authority , having soldiers under me, and if I say to this one: Go! – then he goes, or to another: Come! – then he comes, or to my slave: Do so! – then he does that.”

ENGLISH: And when Jesus heard these things he was filled with wonder about him, and he turned to the crowd following him and said: “I tell you, even in Israel I have not found a faith that great.”
QUENYA: And when Jesus heard these things he was filled with wonder about him, and he turned to the crowd following him and said: “I tell you, even in Israel I have not found a faith that great.”

ENGLISH: And that were sent, when they returned to the house, found the slave in health.
QUENYA: And that were sent, when they returned to the house, found the slave in health.

ENGLISH: And thereafter happened that he went into a city called Nain, and his disciples and a great crowd went with him.
QUENYA: And thereafter happened that he went into a city called Nain, and his disciples and a great crowd went with him.

ENGLISH: And when he came near to the gate of the city, a dead man was carried outside, the only-born son of his mother. Furthermore, her husband was dead. A great crowd from the city was also with the woman.
QUENYA: And when he came near to the gate of the city, a dead man was carried outside, the only-born son of his mother. Furthermore, her husband was dead. A great crowd from the city was also with the woman.

ENGLISH: And when the Lord saw her, his heart went out to her, and he said to her: “Do not be wailing!”
QUENYA: And when the Lord saw her, his heart went out to her, and he said to her: “Do not be wailing!”

ENGLISH: And having come near he touched the bier, and the bearers stopped, and he said: “Young man, I say to you: Rise!”
QUENYA: And having come near he touched the bier, and the bearers stopped, and he said: “Young man, I say to you: Rise!”

ENGLISH: And the dead man sat up and started to talk, and Jesus gave him to his mother.
QUENYA: And the dead man sat up and started to talk, and Jesus gave him to his mother.

ENGLISH: Now fear seized them all, and they gave glory to God, saying: “A great prophet has been raised up among us,” and: “God has heeded his people!”
QUENYA: Now fear seized them all, and they gave glory to God, saying: “A great prophet has been raised up among us,” and: “God has heeded his people!”

ENGLISH: And this word spread into all Judea and the whole around-lying country.
QUENYA: And this word spread into all Judea and the whole around-lying country.

ENGLISH: And John's disciples told him about all these things.
QUENYA: And John's disciples told him about all these things.

ENGLISH: And John called two of his disciples and sent them to the Lord to say: “Are you that was going to come, or is it necessary for us to look forward to another?”
QUENYA: And John called two of his disciples and sent them to the Lord to say: “Are you that was going to come, or is it necessary for us to look forward to another?”

ENGLISH: When they came to him, the men said: “John the Baptist sent us to you to say: Are you that was going to come, or is it necessary for us to look forward to another?”
QUENYA: When they came to him, the men said: “John the Baptist sent us to you to say: Are you that was going to come, or is it necessary for us to look forward to another?”

ENGLISH: In that hour he healed numerous ones, freeing them from illnesses and from sufferings and from wicked spirits, and many blind ones he caused to see.
QUENYA: In that hour he healed numerous ones, freeing them from illnesses and from sufferings and from wicked spirits, and many blind ones he caused to see.

ENGLISH: And he answered them : “Go away, tell John what you saw and heard: The blind receive sight, the skin-diseased are made clean and that lacked hearing hear, the dead ones are raised, and happy is that does not find in me a cause for falling.”
QUENYA: And he answered them : “Go away, tell John what you saw and heard: The blind receive sight, the skin-diseased are made clean and that lacked hearing hear, the dead ones are raised, and happy is that does not find in me a cause for falling.”

ENGLISH: After the men send by John went away, he began to speak to the crowds about John: “What did you go into the desert to look at? A reed moving by the wind?
QUENYA: After the men send by John went away, he began to speak to the crowds about John: “What did you go into the desert to look at? A reed moving by the wind?

ENGLISH: No, what did you go out to see? A man having soft clothes? Behold, those having soft clothes are in the houses of kings!
QUENYA: No, what did you go out to see? A man having soft clothes? Behold, those having soft clothes are in the houses of kings!

ENGLISH: But what your reason for going out? To see a prophet? Yes, I say to you, and much more than a prophet!
QUENYA: But what your reason for going out? To see a prophet? Yes, I say to you, and much more than a prophet!

ENGLISH: He was about whom it has been written: 'Behold! I send my herald before your face, to prepare your way before you.'
QUENYA: He was about whom it has been written: 'Behold! I send my herald before your face, to prepare your way before you.'

ENGLISH: I tell you: Among that were born of women is no one greater than John, but a person among the smaller in God's kingdom is greater than he.”
QUENYA: I tell you: Among that were born of women is no one greater than John, but a person among the smaller in God's kingdom is greater than he.”

ENGLISH: And the whole people and the tax collectors, when they heard that, said that God was just, they being baptized with John's baptism. But the Pharisees and the lawyers turned away which God wanted for them, they that were not baptized by him.
QUENYA: And the whole people and the tax collectors, when they heard that, said that God was just, they being baptized with John's baptism. But the Pharisees and the lawyers turned away which God wanted for them, they that were not baptized by him.

ENGLISH: “With whom, then, shall I compare this generation?
QUENYA: “With whom, then, shall I compare this generation?

ENGLISH: They are like children sitting in a market-place and crying one to the other: 'We played the flute for you, but you did not dance; we were wailing, but you did not have tears.'
QUENYA: They are like children sitting in a market-place and crying one to the other: 'We played the flute for you, but you did not dance; we were wailing, but you did not have tears.'

ENGLISH: For John the Baptist has come, not eating bread or drinking vine, but you say: He is possessed by a demon!
QUENYA: For John the Baptist has come, not eating bread or drinking vine, but you say: He is possessed by a demon!

ENGLISH: The Son of Man has come, eating and drinking, but you say: Look! A man over-eating and given to drinking vine, friend of tax collectors and sinners!'
QUENYA: The Son of Man has come, eating and drinking, but you say: Look! A man over-eating and given to drinking vine, friend of tax collectors and sinners!'

ENGLISH: And yet wisdom is shown just by all its children.”
QUENYA: And yet wisdom is shown just by all its children.”

ENGLISH: A person among the Pharisees requested that Jesus was to eat with him, and coming into the Pharisee's house he laid down by the table.
QUENYA: A person among the Pharisees requested that Jesus was to eat with him, and coming into the Pharisee's house he laid down by the table.

ENGLISH: And behold! a woman who was known in the city as a sinner learnt that he was at the table in the house of the Pharisees, and she bought a stone-box of fragrant oil,
QUENYA: And behold! a woman who was known in the city as a sinner learnt that he was at the table in the house of the Pharisees, and she bought a stone-box of fragrant oil,

ENGLISH: and standing in tears behind Jesus by his feet, the woman started to make his feet wet with her tears and wiped them off with the hair of her head, and she kissed his feet and annointed them with the fragrant oil.
QUENYA: and standing in tears behind Jesus by his feet, the woman started to make his feet wet with her tears and wiped them off with the hair of her head, and she kissed his feet and annointed them with the fragrant oil.

ENGLISH: Seeing that, the Pharisee who invited Jesus said to himself: “This man, if he was a prophet, would know who and of what kind is this woman that is touching him – that she is a sinner!”
QUENYA: Seeing that, the Pharisee who invited Jesus said to himself: “This man, if he was a prophet, would know who and of what kind is this woman that is touching him – that she is a sinner!”

ENGLISH: But in answer Jesus said to him: “Simon, I have something that I want to say to you.” He said: “Teacher, say it!”
QUENYA: But in answer Jesus said to him: “Simon, I have something that I want to say to you.” He said: “Teacher, say it!”

ENGLISH: “Two men had a debt to a person from whom they received money; one had a debt of five hundred denarii, the other, fifty.
QUENYA: “Two men had a debt to a person from whom they received money; one had a debt of five hundred denarii, the other, fifty.

ENGLISH: When they had nothing to give back to him, he foregave both. Then who among them will love him more?”
QUENYA: When they had nothing to give back to him, he foregave both. Then who among them will love him more?”

ENGLISH: In answer Simon said: “I suppose the person to whom he forgave the greatest sum.” He said to him: “You judged well.”
QUENYA: In answer Simon said: “I suppose the person to whom he forgave the greatest sum.” He said to him: “You judged well.”

ENGLISH: Then he turned to the woman and said to Simon: “Are you seeing this woman? I came into your house; you did not give me water for my feet. But this woman made my feet wet with her tears and wiped them away with her hair.
QUENYA: Then he turned to the woman and said to Simon: “Are you seeing this woman? I came into your house; you did not give me water for my feet. But this woman made my feet wet with her tears and wiped them away with her hair.

ENGLISH: You did not give me kiss, but this woman, from the hour that I came, did not cease to kiss my feet.
QUENYA: You did not give me kiss, but this woman, from the hour that I came, did not cease to kiss my feet.

ENGLISH: You did not anoint my head with oil, but this woman anointed my feet with fragrant oil.
QUENYA: You did not anoint my head with oil, but this woman anointed my feet with fragrant oil.

ENGLISH: For this reason I say to you: Her numerous sins are forgiven her, for she loved much; but to whom a little is forgiven, loves little.”
QUENYA: For this reason I say to you: Her numerous sins are forgiven her, for she loved much; but to whom a little is forgiven, loves little.”

ENGLISH: Then he said to her: “Your sins are forgiven.”
QUENYA: Then he said to her: “Your sins are forgiven.”

ENGLISH: But those who lay with him at the table began to say in themselves: “Who is this man that also forgives sins?”
QUENYA: But those who lay with him at the table began to say in themselves: “Who is this man that also forgives sins?”

ENGLISH: But he said to the woman: “Your faith has saved you; go in peace.”
QUENYA: But he said to the woman: “Your faith has saved you; go in peace.”

ENGLISH: And it happened thereafter that he went from city to city and from village to vilalge and taught and made known the gospel about God's kingdom, and the twelve followed him, as did some women that were healed from wicked spirit and illneses: Mary who was called Magdalene, from whom seven demons had gone out,
QUENYA: And it happened thereafter that he went from city to city and from village to vilalge and taught and made known the gospel about God's kingdom, and the twelve followed him, as did some women that were healed from wicked spirit and illneses: Mary who was called Magdalene, from whom seven demons had gone out,

ENGLISH: and Joanna the wife of Cuza, Herod's commander, and Susanna and numerous other women, who served him with their goods.
QUENYA: and Joanna the wife of Cuza, Herod's commander, and Susanna and numerous other women, who served him with their goods.

ENGLISH: Now when a great crowd had gathered with that went with him from city to city, he said to them in a comparison:
QUENYA: Now when a great crowd had gathered with that went with him from city to city, he said to them in a comparison:

ENGLISH: “A sower went out to sow. In his sowing some seeds fell beside the road and were trampled down, and the birds of heaven ate them.
QUENYA: “A sower went out to sow. In his sowing some seeds fell beside the road and were trampled down, and the birds of heaven ate them.

ENGLISH: Others fell upon the rock, and after they sprouted they withered, for lacking water.
QUENYA: Others fell upon the rock, and after they sprouted they withered, for lacking water.

ENGLISH: Others fell among the thorns, and the thorns that grew up with them choked them.
QUENYA: Others fell among the thorns, and the thorns that grew up with them choked them.

ENGLISH: Others fell upon the good soil, and after they sprouted they made fruit, a hundred added measures.” After telling these things, he cried: “May that has ears hear!”
QUENYA: Others fell upon the good soil, and after they sprouted they made fruit, a hundred added measures.” After telling these things, he cried: “May that has ears hear!”

ENGLISH: But his disciples asked him: “What does the comparison mean?”
QUENYA: But his disciples asked him: “What does the comparison mean?”

ENGLISH: He said: “To you is given to know the secrets of God's kingdom, but to the others it is in comparisons, causing them to look without seeing and hear without understanding.
QUENYA: He said: “To you is given to know the secrets of God's kingdom, but to the others it is in comparisons, causing them to look without seeing and hear without understanding.

ENGLISH: This is what the comparison means: The seed is God's word.
QUENYA: This is what the comparison means: The seed is God's word.

ENGLISH: that are beside the road are that have heard; then the Devil comes and takes away the word from their heart, to stop them from believing and from being saved.
QUENYA: that are beside the road are that have heard; then the Devil comes and takes away the word from their heart, to stop them from believing and from being saved.

ENGLISH: that are on the rock are that receive the word with joy when they hear it, but they do not have root; they believe for a time, but in a time of testing they fall away.
QUENYA: that are on the rock are that receive the word with joy when they hear it, but they do not have root; they believe for a time, but in a time of testing they fall away.

ENGLISH: that fell among the thorns, they are that have heard, but being carried away by the anxieties of this life and by riches and by joys, they are choked and complete nothing.
QUENYA: that fell among the thorns, they are that have heard, but being carried away by the anxieties of this life and by riches and by joys, they are choked and complete nothing.

ENGLISH: But that are on the good soil, they are that hear the word with a good and beautiful heard and keep it and make fruit by steadfastness.
QUENYA: But that are on the good soil, they are that hear the word with a good and beautiful heard and keep it and make fruit by steadfastness.

ENGLISH: is no one who, after kindling a lamp, covers it with a vessel or puts it under a bed, but he puts it on the lampstand, allowing that come inside to look at the light.
QUENYA: is no one who, after kindling a lamp, covers it with a vessel or puts it under a bed, but he puts it on the lampstand, allowing that come inside to look at the light.

ENGLISH: And is nothing hidden that will not be revealed, or anything veiled that will not ever be known or easily seen.
QUENYA: And is nothing hidden that will not be revealed, or anything veiled that will not ever be known or easily seen.

ENGLISH: Therefore take heed how you listen, for anyone who has, more will be given to him, but anyone who does not have, also which he believes he has will be taken from him.”
QUENYA: Therefore take heed how you listen, for anyone who has, more will be given to him, but anyone who does not have, also which he believes he has will be taken from him.”

ENGLISH: Now his mother and his brothers came to him, but they could not reach to him because of the crowd.
QUENYA: Now his mother and his brothers came to him, but they could not reach to him because of the crowd.

ENGLISH: But one told him: “Your mother and your brothers are standing on the outside, wishing to see you.”
QUENYA: But one told him: “Your mother and your brothers are standing on the outside, wishing to see you.”

ENGLISH: In answer he said to them: “My mother and my brothers are who hear God's word and do it.”
QUENYA: In answer he said to them: “My mother and my brothers are who hear God's word and do it.”

ENGLISH: It happened in one of the days that he and his disciples went into a boat, and he said to them: “Let us pass over to the other shore of the lake.” Thus they sailed away.
QUENYA: It happened in one of the days that he and his disciples went into a boat, and he said to them: “Let us pass over to the other shore of the lake.” Thus they sailed away.

ENGLISH: But while they sailed he slept. Now a storm fell upon the lake, and their boat was filled, and they were in danger.
QUENYA: But while they sailed he slept. Now a storm fell upon the lake, and their boat was filled, and they were in danger.

ENGLISH: In the end they went to him and woke him up, saying: “Teacher, teacher, we are dying!” But after rising he rebuked the wind and the violence of the water, and they were made at rest, and was a silence.
QUENYA: In the end they went to him and woke him up, saying: “Teacher, teacher, we are dying!” But after rising he rebuked the wind and the violence of the water, and they were made at rest, and was a silence.

ENGLISH: Then he said to them: “Where your faith?” But being scared they were in wonder, saying one to the other: “Who indeed is this man, for he commands also the winds and the water, and they do as he says?”
QUENYA: Then he said to them: “Where your faith?” But being scared they were in wonder, saying one to the other: “Who indeed is this man, for he commands also the winds and the water, and they do as he says?”

ENGLISH: And they sailed to country of the Gerasenes, which lies on the other shore from Galilee.
QUENYA: And they sailed to country of the Gerasenes, which lies on the other shore from Galilee.

ENGLISH: And when he went on land, met him a man from the city who was possessed by a a demon; for a long time he did not bear clothes, and he did not dwell in a house, but among the tombs.

QUENYA: When he saw Jesus, he cried and fell down before him, and he said in a mighty voice: “What for me and for you , Jesus, son of the Most High God? I beg of you, to not torment me!”

QUENYA: For he commanded the unclean spirit to come out of the man. Beforehand the demon for a long time kept the man fast, and he was bound by chains and by bonds on his feet, while guards watched him, but he tore over the bonds and was driven by the demon into the lonely places.

QUENYA: Jesus asked him: “What is your name?” He said, “Legion,” for numerous demons had gone into him.

QUENYA: And they requested of him that he would not send them into the abyss.

QUENYA: But was there a great flock of swine on pasture in the mountain, and they requested of him that he would allow them to pass into them. And he allowed them.

ENGLISH: Then the demons went out of the man and went into the swine, and the flock went rushing over the edge into the lake and drowned.

QUENYA: “Return to your home, and tell about the things that God has done for you.” And he went away through the entire city, making known everything that Jesus did for him.

QUENYA: When Jesus was on his way, the crowds pressed against him.

QUENYA: And a woman, who for twelve years suffered from a flood of blood, for whom it was not possible to get healing from anyone,

QUENYA: And Jesus said: “Who was that touched me?” When all denied it, Peter said: “Teacher, the crowds lie heavily on you and are pressing against you.”

QUENYA: And yet Jesus said: “A person touched me, for I perceived that went power out of me.”

QUENYA: Seeing that she did not escape notice, the woman came trembling and fell down before him and told before the whole people the reason why she touched Jesus and how she was healed in the same moment.

QUENYA: But people were wailing and beat themselves in grief about the maiden. And he said: “Do not be wailing, for she did not die, but she is asleep.”

QUENYA: But he took her hand and cried , saying: “Maiden, rise!”

QUENYA: And her spirit returned, and she arose in the same moment, and Jesus commanded that one gave her something to eat.

QUENYA: And her parents were beside themselves; but he instructed them that they were not to tell anyone about which had happened.

QUENYA: And he sent them to make known God's kingdom and to heal,

QUENYA: But when you go into a house, remain there and go away from there.

QUENYA: For in every place where people do not heed you, when you are going away from that city shake the dust from your feet as a witness to them.”

QUENYA: Then, going out, they went though the region from village to village, making known the gospel and healing people in every place.

QUENYA: Now Herod the farthing-ruler heard about everything that happened, and he was confused, since was said by some that John was raised out of dead,

QUENYA: but by others that Eliah had come, but by others that one among the ancient Prophets was raised.

QUENYA: Herod said: “John's head I cut off. Who, then, is this person of whom I hear such things?” And he sought to see him.

QUENYA: And when the apostles returned they told Jesus about all their deeds. Then he brought them and went to a lonely place, by a city called Bethsaida.

QUENYA: But the crowds, knowing whither he went, followed him. And he received them and talked to them about God's kingdom, and he healed who had need of healing.

QUENYA: Then, when the day was fading, the twelve came to him and said to him: “Send the crowd away, for them to go into the villages and fields around us, to find a place to remain and food, for here we are in a lonely place.”

QUENYA: But he said to them: “You give them something to eat.” They said: “We do not have more than five breads and two fish, if perhaps we are not to go and trade to ourselves food for all these people.”

QUENYA: And all ate and were filled, and the remaining pieces that they gathered filled twelve baskets.

QUENYA: Then he said to them: “But you, who do you say that I am?” In answer Peter said: “God's Christ!”

QUENYA: Then in harsh speech he instructed them that they were not to say so to anyone,

QUENYA: but he said: “It is necessary for the Son of Man to go through many sufferings and to be rejected the elders and chief priests and scribes, and to be slain, and on the third day he will be raised up.”

QUENYA: Then he said: “If anyone wants to come after me, it is necessary for him to deny himself and lift his cross every day and follow me.

QUENYA: For anyone who wishes to save his life, to him it will be lost, but anyone whose life is lost for my good, he will save it.

QUENYA: Indeed how is beneficial to a man if he obtains the whole world, but his own person is lost or destroyed to him?

QUENYA: But he said to him: “Let dead bring their dead to the grave, but you go and make the kingdom of heaven known!”

QUENYA: He said to them: “The harvest is abundant, but those who work are few. Therefore ask of the Lord of the harvest, for him to send people to gather his harvest.

QUENYA: Go out! Behold! I send you like lambs among wolves.

QUENYA: Do not carry a pouch, or a bag for food, or a pair of shoes; and do not greet anyone on the road.

ENGLISH: When you come into a house, first say: 'May this house have peace!'
QUENYA: When you come into a house, first say: 'May this house have peace!'

ENGLISH: And if is there a friend of peace, your peace will rest upon him. But if is not one, it will return to you.
QUENYA: And if is there a friend of peace, your peace will rest upon him. But if is not one, it will return to you.

ENGLISH: Therefore remain in that house, eating and drinking the things that they give you, for who works is worthy of his reward. Do not move from house to house.
QUENYA: Therefore remain in that house, eating and drinking the things that they give you, for who works is worthy of his reward. Do not move from house to house.

QUENYA: and heal the sick ones in it, and tell them: 'God's kingdom has come near to you.'

QUENYA: But whenever you come into a city and they do not receive you, go into their broad ways and say:

QUENYA: 'Also the dust which stuck to our feet from your city we shake away to you. But this thing you are to know, that God's kingdom has come near!'

QUENYA: I tell you: To Sodom the day of judgement will be more bearable than what it will be to that city.

QUENYA: Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the mighty deeds that have happened in you happened in Tyre and Sidon, long ago they found repentence, sitting in sack and ash.

QUENYA: who listens to you listens to me. And who fails to heed you, fails to heed me. Therefore, who fails to heed me, fails to heed who sent me.”

QUENYA: Then he said to them: “I saw Satan fallen like a flash out of heaven.

QUENYA: Behold! I have given you the power to trample under your feet serpents and scorpions and the entire might of the enemy, and nothing can wound you.
