QUENYA: But do not have joy about your control over the demons, but have joy since your names have been written in heaven.”

ENGLISH: At that time he was most happy by the Holy Spirit and said: “I praise you, Father, Lord over heaven and earth, for you have hidden these things from wise ones and from intelligent ones, and you have revealed them to babes. Yes, Father, for doing so was good in your eyes.
QUENYA: At that time he was most happy by the Holy Spirit and said: “I praise you, Father, Lord over heaven and earth, for you have hidden these things from wise ones and from intelligent ones, and you have revealed them to babes. Yes, Father, for doing so was good in your eyes.

ENGLISH: All things have been given over to me by my Father, and who the Son is nobody knows except the Father, and who the Father is, nobody knows except the Son, and anyone to whom the Son wishes to reveal him.”
QUENYA: All things have been given over to me by my Father, and who the Son is nobody knows except the Father, and who the Father is, nobody knows except the Son, and anyone to whom the Son wishes to reveal him.”

ENGLISH: And after turning towards the disciples he said: “Happy are the eyes that behold you behold.
QUENYA: And after turning towards the disciples he said: “Happy are the eyes that behold you behold.

ENGLISH: For I say to you: Numerous prophets and kings wished to see the things that you behold, but they did not see them, and hear the things that you hear, but they did not hear them.”
QUENYA: For I say to you: Numerous prophets and kings wished to see the things that you behold, but they did not see them, and hear the things that you hear, but they did not hear them.”

ENGLISH: And behold! a scribe arose, to test him, and he said: “Teacher, what am I to do to be heir of eternal life?”
QUENYA: And behold! a scribe arose, to test him, and he said: “Teacher, what am I to do to be heir of eternal life?”

ENGLISH: He said to him: “What is written in the Law? How do you read?”
QUENYA: He said to him: “What is written in the Law? How do you read?”

ENGLISH: In answer he said: “You are to love the Lord your God with your whole heart and with your whole soul and with your whole strenght and your whole mind, and your neighbor as yourself.”
QUENYA: In answer he said: “You are to love the Lord your God with your whole heart and with your whole soul and with your whole strenght and your whole mind, and your neighbor as yourself.”

ENGLISH: Jesus said to him: “You answered well; do so and you will have life.”
QUENYA: Jesus said to him: “You answered well; do so and you will have life.”

ENGLISH: But he, wishing to show that he was just, said to Jesus: “And who is my neighbor?”
QUENYA: But he, wishing to show that he was just, said to Jesus: “And who is my neighbor?”

ENGLISH: In answer Jesus said: “A man going down from Jerusalem to Jericho fell among robbers, that took his clothes and beat him, abandoning him between life and death.
QUENYA: In answer Jesus said: “A man going down from Jerusalem to Jericho fell among robbers, that took his clothes and beat him, abandoning him between life and death.

ENGLISH: As happened, a priest went down on that road, but when he saw him, he passed by in the other edge of the road.
QUENYA: As happened, a priest went down on that road, but when he saw him, he passed by in the other edge of the road.

ENGLISH: In the same manner also a Levite, when he came down to the place and saw him, passed by away from him.
QUENYA: In the same manner also a Levite, when he came down to the place and saw him, passed by away from him.

ENGLISH: But a Samaritan man travelling on the road came to him, and when he saw him, his heart went out to him.
QUENYA: But a Samaritan man travelling on the road came to him, and when he saw him, his heart went out to him.

ENGLISH: He came near to him and wrapped his wounds, pouring oil and wine over them. Then he placed him on his animal and brought him to an inn and heeded his needs.
QUENYA: He came near to him and wrapped his wounds, pouring oil and wine over them. Then he placed him on his animal and brought him to an inn and heeded his needs.

ENGLISH: And on the following day he took two denarii, gave them to the chief of the inn, and said: 'Heed his needs, and anything that you use beyond this, I will pay you back when I shall return hither.'
QUENYA: And on the following day he took two denarii, gave them to the chief of the inn, and said: 'Heed his needs, and anything that you use beyond this, I will pay you back when I shall return hither.'

ENGLISH: Who among these three do you think made himself a neighbor to the man who fell among the robbers?”
QUENYA: Who among these three do you think made himself a neighbor to the man who fell among the robbers?”

ENGLISH: He said: “ who had mercy on him.” Jesus thens said to him: “You go and do the same thing.”
QUENYA: He said: “ who had mercy on him.” Jesus thens said to him: “You go and do the same thing.”

ENGLISH: Now when they went away he went into a city. Here a woman called Martha received him into her house.
QUENYA: Now when they went away he went into a city. Here a woman called Martha received him into her house.

ENGLISH: was with this woman a sister whose name was Mary, who sat down by the feet of the Lord and listened to his word.
QUENYA: was with this woman a sister whose name was Mary, who sat down by the feet of the Lord and listened to his word.

ENGLISH: But Martha had her hands full with much work, and she came and said: “Lord, is it not important to you that my sister has left me alone in my work? Therefore say to her that it is necessary for her to help me.”
QUENYA: But Martha had her hands full with much work, and she came and said: “Lord, is it not important to you that my sister has left me alone in my work? Therefore say to her that it is necessary for her to help me.”

ENGLISH: In answer the Lord said to her: “Martha, Martha, you have anxiety and you are troubled about numerous things.
QUENYA: In answer the Lord said to her: “Martha, Martha, you have anxiety and you are troubled about numerous things.

ENGLISH: But of a single thing is need. Mary has chosen the good part, and it will not be taken from her.”
QUENYA: But of a single thing is need. Mary has chosen the good part, and it will not be taken from her.”

ENGLISH: And it happened , when he was in a place praying, that when he stopped one of his disciples said to him: “Lord, teach us to pray, like John also taught his disciples.”
QUENYA: And it happened , when he was in a place praying, that when he stopped one of his disciples said to him: “Lord, teach us to pray, like John also taught his disciples.”

ENGLISH: Then he said to them: “Whenever you pray, say: Father, let your name be holy. Let your kingdom come.
QUENYA: Then he said to them: “Whenever you pray, say: Father, let your name be holy. Let your kingdom come.

ENGLISH: Give us our daily bread day after day,
QUENYA: Give us our daily bread day after day,

ENGLISH: and forgive us our sins, for also we forgive everyone who has a debt to us; and do not lead us into temptation.”
QUENYA: and forgive us our sins, for also we forgive everyone who has a debt to us; and do not lead us into temptation.”

ENGLISH: And he said to them: “Who among you that has a friend will go to him in the midst of the night and will say to him: 'Friend, loan me three loaves,
QUENYA: And he said to them: “Who among you that has a friend will go to him in the midst of the night and will say to him: 'Friend, loan me three loaves,

ENGLISH: for a friend of mine has come to me from a journey and I have nothing to put before him'?
QUENYA: for a friend of mine has come to me from a journey and I have nothing to put before him'?

ENGLISH: And he from the inside says in answer: 'Do not trouble me! The door is shut, and my children are with me in the bed; it is not possible for me to rise to give you .'
QUENYA: And he from the inside says in answer: 'Do not trouble me! The door is shut, and my children are with me in the bed; it is not possible for me to rise to give you .'

ENGLISH: I say to you: If he does not rise and give to him since he is his friend, indeed he will rise and give to him because of his persistence .
QUENYA: I say to you: If he does not rise and give to him since he is his friend, indeed he will rise and give to him because of his persistence .

ENGLISH: Therefore I say to you: Ask, and will be given to you; seek, and you will find; knock, and it will be opened to you.
QUENYA: Therefore I say to you: Ask, and will be given to you; seek, and you will find; knock, and it will be opened to you.

ENGLISH: For everyone asking receives, and everyone seeking finds, and to everyone knocking will be opened.
QUENYA: For everyone asking receives, and everyone seeking finds, and to everyone knocking will be opened.

ENGLISH: Surely is not father among you who, if his son asks for a fish, will perhaps give him a serpent instead of a fish?
QUENYA: Surely is not father among you who, if his son asks for a fish, will perhaps give him a serpent instead of a fish?

ENGLISH: Or if he also asks for an egg, surely he will not give him a scorpion?
QUENYA: Or if he also asks for an egg, surely he will not give him a scorpion?

ENGLISH: Therefore, if you that are wicked know to give good gifts to your children, how more the heavenly Father will give Holy Spirit to those that ask of him!”
QUENYA: Therefore, if you that are wicked know to give good gifts to your children, how more the heavenly Father will give Holy Spirit to those that ask of him!”

ENGLISH: And he expelled a dumb demon. After the demon came out, the dumb man spoke. And the crowds were in wonder.
QUENYA: And he expelled a dumb demon. After the demon came out, the dumb man spoke. And the crowds were in wonder.

ENGLISH: But some among them said: “He expels the demons by the chief of of the demons, Belzebul.”
QUENYA: But some among them said: “He expels the demons by the chief of of the demons, Belzebul.”

ENGLISH: But others, in order to test him, sought from him a sign out of heaven.
QUENYA: But others, in order to test him, sought from him a sign out of heaven.

ENGLISH: Knowing their imaginations he said to them: “Every kingdom split against itself is undone, and a home split against itself falls.
QUENYA: Knowing their imaginations he said to them: “Every kingdom split against itself is undone, and a home split against itself falls.

ENGLISH: But if also Satan is split against himself, how will his kingdom stand? For you say that I expel the demons by Belzebub's power.
QUENYA: But if also Satan is split against himself, how will his kingdom stand? For you say that I expel the demons by Belzebub's power.

ENGLISH: If by the power of Beelsebul I throw out demons, by whom do your sons throw them out? For this reason they will be your judges.
QUENYA: If by the power of Beelsebul I throw out demons, by whom do your sons throw them out? For this reason they will be your judges.

ENGLISH: But if by God's finger I throw the demons out, God's kingdom has indeed come to you.
QUENYA: But if by God's finger I throw the demons out, God's kingdom has indeed come to you.

ENGLISH: When a strong man, having weapons, protects his own court, his goods are in peace.
QUENYA: When a strong man, having weapons, protects his own court, his goods are in peace.

ENGLISH: But when a man stronger than him comes and overpowers him, he takes away the weapons which the other thought were going to give him security, and he distributes the things that he stole from him.
QUENYA: But when a man stronger than him comes and overpowers him, he takes away the weapons which the other thought were going to give him security, and he distributes the things that he stole from him.

ENGLISH: who is not with me stands against me, and who does not gather, scatters.
QUENYA: who is not with me stands against me, and who does not gather, scatters.

ENGLISH: When an unclean spirit comes out of a man, it passes through try regions seeking a place of rest, and when it does not find one, it says: 'I will return to my house from which I moved.'
QUENYA: When an unclean spirit comes out of a man, it passes through try regions seeking a place of rest, and when it does not find one, it says: 'I will return to my house from which I moved.'

ENGLISH: And when it comes, it finds it made clean and adorned.
QUENYA: And when it comes, it finds it made clean and adorned.

ENGLISH: Then it goes away and brings with it seven other spirits, more wicked then itself, and after they come in they dwell there, and to that man the last state will be worse than the first.”
QUENYA: Then it goes away and brings with it seven other spirits, more wicked then itself, and after they come in they dwell there, and to that man the last state will be worse than the first.”

ENGLISH: Now when he was saying these things, a woman out of the crowd raised her voice and said to him: “Happy the womb that bore you and the teats from which you were suckled!”
QUENYA: Now when he was saying these things, a woman out of the crowd raised her voice and said to him: “Happy the womb that bore you and the teats from which you were suckled!”

ENGLISH: But he said: “ is better if you say: Happy are that hear God's word and keep it!”
QUENYA: But he said: “ is better if you say: Happy are that hear God's word and keep it!”

ENGLISH: When the crowds gathered, he said: “This generation is an evil generation. It asks for signs, but a sign will not be given to it, except the sign of Jonah.
QUENYA: When the crowds gathered, he said: “This generation is an evil generation. It asks for signs, but a sign will not be given to it, except the sign of Jonah.

ENGLISH: For like Jonah was made a sign to the people in Nineveh, so also the Son of Man will be a sign to this generation.
QUENYA: For like Jonah was made a sign to the people in Nineveh, so also the Son of Man will be a sign to this generation.

ENGLISH: The queen of the south will be raised in the judgement with this generation and will judge them evil, for she came from the end of the earth to hear Solomon's wisdom, and behold, here is more than Solomon.
QUENYA: The queen of the south will be raised in the judgement with this generation and will judge them evil, for she came from the end of the earth to hear Solomon's wisdom, and behold, here is more than Solomon.

ENGLISH: The people from Niniveh will rise in the judgement with this generation and will judge it evil. For they found repentence at the preaching of Jonah, and behold, here is more than Jonah!
QUENYA: The people from Niniveh will rise in the judgement with this generation and will judge it evil. For they found repentence at the preaching of Jonah, and behold, here is more than Jonah!

ENGLISH: After lighting a lamp, one does not put it in a vault or under a measuring basket, but on the lampstand, allowing those that come in to see the light.
QUENYA: After lighting a lamp, one does not put it in a vault or under a measuring basket, but on the lampstand, allowing those that come in to see the light.

ENGLISH: To the body, the lamp is your eye. When your eye is in health, your entire body is also bright, but when it is evil, your body is also dark.
QUENYA: To the body, the lamp is your eye. When your eye is in health, your entire body is also bright, but when it is evil, your body is also dark.

ENGLISH: Therefore take heed that that light which is in you is not darkness!
QUENYA: Therefore take heed that that light which is in you is not darkness!

ENGLISH: Thus, if your entire body is illuminated, not having part which is dark, everything will be illuminated as when the lamp illumulates you with its ray!”
QUENYA: Thus, if your entire body is illuminated, not having part which is dark, everything will be illuminated as when the lamp illumulates you with its ray!”

ENGLISH: After he said that, a Pharisee requested that he would eat a meal with him. Therefore he went inside and lay down at the table.
QUENYA: After he said that, a Pharisee requested that he would eat a meal with him. Therefore he went inside and lay down at the table.

ENGLISH: But the Pharisee was in wonder when he saw that he did not first wash himself before the meal.
QUENYA: But the Pharisee was in wonder when he saw that he did not first wash himself before the meal.

ENGLISH: But the Lord said to him: “Now, O Pharisees! You cleanse the outside of the cup and of the dish, but in the inside of you you are full of theft and wickedness!
QUENYA: But the Lord said to him: “Now, O Pharisees! You cleanse the outside of the cup and of the dish, but in the inside of you you are full of theft and wickedness!

ENGLISH: Senseless ones! who created the outside, did he not also create the inside?
QUENYA: Senseless ones! who created the outside, did he not also create the inside?

ENGLISH: But give gifts to poor ones out of which is in your inside, and behold! everything will be clean to you.
QUENYA: But give gifts to poor ones out of which is in your inside, and behold! everything will be clean to you.

ENGLISH: But woe to you, o Pharisees, since you give the tenth part of the mint and of the rue and of every vegetable, but you pass over the justice and the love for God! These things were necessary for you to do, without passing over the others.
QUENYA: But woe to you, o Pharisees, since you give the tenth part of the mint and of the rue and of every vegetable, but you pass over the justice and the love for God! These things were necessary for you to do, without passing over the others.

ENGLISH: Woe to you, o Pharisees, since you love to have the prominent seats in the synagoges and to receive the greatings in the market places.
QUENYA: Woe to you, o Pharisees, since you love to have the prominent seats in the synagoges and to receive the greatings in the market places.

ENGLISH: Woe to you, for you are like the tombs that are not easy to see, causing people to walk over them without knowing.”
QUENYA: Woe to you, for you are like the tombs that are not easy to see, causing people to walk over them without knowing.”

ENGLISH: In answer one among the lawyers said to him: “Teacher, by saying these things you give an evil name also to us.”
QUENYA: In answer one among the lawyers said to him: “Teacher, by saying these things you give an evil name also to us.”

ENGLISH: Then he said: “Woe also to you who are lawyers, for you put on men burders hard to bear, but you do not touch the burdens with a single one of your fingers!
QUENYA: Then he said: “Woe also to you who are lawyers, for you put on men burders hard to bear, but you do not touch the burdens with a single one of your fingers!

ENGLISH: Woe to you, for you build the tombs for the prophets, but your fathers killed them!
QUENYA: Woe to you, for you build the tombs for the prophets, but your fathers killed them!

ENGLISH: Indeed you are witnesses and think well of the deeds of your fathers, for they killed the prophets, but you build their tombs!
QUENYA: Indeed you are witnesses and think well of the deeds of your fathers, for they killed the prophets, but you build their tombs!

ENGLISH: For this reason God's wisdom said: I will send to them prophets and apostles, and they will kill and they will persecute some among them,
QUENYA: For this reason God's wisdom said: I will send to them prophets and apostles, and they will kill and they will persecute some among them,

ENGLISH: and so the blood of all the prophets that has been poured from the foundation of the world until now will be demanded from this generation,
QUENYA: and so the blood of all the prophets that has been poured from the foundation of the world until now will be demanded from this generation,

ENGLISH: from the blood of Abel until the blood of Zechariah, who was slain between the altar and the house. Yes, I tell you, it will be demanded from this generation!
QUENYA: from the blood of Abel until the blood of Zechariah, who was slain between the altar and the house. Yes, I tell you, it will be demanded from this generation!

ENGLISH: Woe to you that are scribes, for you have taken away the key of knowledge; you did not go inside, and who wished to go inside you stopped!”
QUENYA: Woe to you that are scribes, for you have taken away the key of knowledge; you did not go inside, and who wished to go inside you stopped!”

ENGLISH: When he went out from there the the scribes and the Pharisees started to press against him terribly and to pour upon him questions about other things,
QUENYA: When he went out from there the the scribes and the Pharisees started to press against him terribly and to pour upon him questions about other things,

ENGLISH: watching him to seize something out of his mouth.
QUENYA: watching him to seize something out of his mouth.

ENGLISH: At that time, when the crowd had gathered in tens of thousands, so numerous that one trampled the other down, he began to say to his disciples first: “Keep yourselves away from the leaven of the Pharisees, which is hypocrisy.
QUENYA: At that time, when the crowd had gathered in tens of thousands, so numerous that one trampled the other down, he began to say to his disciples first: “Keep yourselves away from the leaven of the Pharisees, which is hypocrisy.

ENGLISH: But is nothing hidden that will not be revealed, or secret that will not be known.
QUENYA: But is nothing hidden that will not be revealed, or secret that will not be known.

ENGLISH: Therefore, all things which you say in the darkness will be heard in the light, and what you whisper in your own chambers will be made known from the roofs of the houses.
QUENYA: Therefore, all things which you say in the darkness will be heard in the light, and what you whisper in your own chambers will be made known from the roofs of the houses.

ENGLISH: Moreover, I say to you that are my friends: Do not fear from that kill the body and thereafter cannot do more.
QUENYA: Moreover, I say to you that are my friends: Do not fear from that kill the body and thereafter cannot do more.

ENGLISH: But I will show you whom it is necessary for you to fear: Fear who after killing has the power of throwing into Gehenna. Yes, I say to you, fear him!”
QUENYA: But I will show you whom it is necessary for you to fear: Fear who after killing has the power of throwing into Gehenna. Yes, I say to you, fear him!”

ENGLISH: Two sparrows are sold for two copper pieces, no? And yet God does not fail to recall one among them .
QUENYA: Two sparrows are sold for two copper pieces, no? And yet God does not fail to recall one among them .

ENGLISH: But also the hairs of your head are all counted. Do not fear; you are more precious than many sparrows.
QUENYA: But also the hairs of your head are all counted. Do not fear; you are more precious than many sparrows.

ENGLISH: But I say to you: Everyone who confesses me before men, him the Son of Man will also confess before God's angels.
QUENYA: But I say to you: Everyone who confesses me before men, him the Son of Man will also confess before God's angels.

ENGLISH: But who denies me before men will be denied before God's angels.
QUENYA: But who denies me before men will be denied before God's angels.

ENGLISH: And to everyone who speaks a word against the Son of Man, that will be fogiven, but to who blasphemes agaist the Holy Sprit, that will not be forgiven.
QUENYA: And to everyone who speaks a word against the Son of Man, that will be fogiven, but to who blasphemes agaist the Holy Sprit, that will not be forgiven.

ENGLISH: But when they bring you before councils and governors and powers, do not have anxiety about how or with what you will defend yourselves, or about what you will say;
QUENYA: But when they bring you before councils and governors and powers, do not have anxiety about how or with what you will defend yourselves, or about what you will say;

ENGLISH: for the Holy Spirit will teach you in that hour about the things that it is necessary for you to say.”
QUENYA: for the Holy Spirit will teach you in that hour about the things that it is necessary for you to say.”

ENGLISH: Then a person in the crowd said to him: “Teacher, say to my brother that is necessary for him to give me a portion in the inheritance!”
QUENYA: Then a person in the crowd said to him: “Teacher, say to my brother that is necessary for him to give me a portion in the inheritance!”

ENGLISH: He said to him: “O man, who put me to judge you or to distribute to you your inheritance?”
QUENYA: He said to him: “O man, who put me to judge you or to distribute to you your inheritance?”

ENGLISH: Then he said to them: “Take heed and protect yourselves from all greed, for also when a person has abundance, his life does not come from his possessions.”
QUENYA: Then he said to them: “Take heed and protect yourselves from all greed, for also when a person has abundance, his life does not come from his possessions.”

ENGLISH: Furthermore, he spoke to them a comparison, saying: “The land of a rich man gave a big harvest.
QUENYA: Furthermore, he spoke to them a comparison, saying: “The land of a rich man gave a big harvest.

ENGLISH: And he made a consideration in his mind, saying: 'What am I to do, now when I lack a place where I can gather my harvest?'
QUENYA: And he made a consideration in his mind, saying: 'What am I to do, now when I lack a place where I can gather my harvest?'

ENGLISH: And he said: 'I will do so: I will tear down my stores, and I will build some stores larger than them, and there I will gather all my grain and all my good things,
QUENYA: And he said: 'I will do so: I will tear down my stores, and I will build some stores larger than them, and there I will gather all my grain and all my good things,

ENGLISH: and I will say do myself: 'Now you have numerous good things in store for many years. Rest, eat, drink, have joy!'
QUENYA: and I will say do myself: 'Now you have numerous good things in store for many years. Rest, eat, drink, have joy!'

ENGLISH: But God said to him: 'Senseless man! In this night they demand your life from you. Then who will have that you have gathered?' So will be for who gathers treasure for himself, but is not rich to God.”
QUENYA: But God said to him: 'Senseless man! In this night they demand your life from you. Then who will have that you have gathered?' So will be for who gathers treasure for himself, but is not rich to God.”

ENGLISH: Then he said to his disciples: “For this reason I say to you: Do not have anxiety about yourselves, about what you will eat, or about your bodies, about the things that you will wear.
QUENYA: Then he said to his disciples: “For this reason I say to you: Do not have anxiety about yourselves, about what you will eat, or about your bodies, about the things that you will wear.

ENGLISH: For the life is more precious than food, and the body than clothes.
QUENYA: For the life is more precious than food, and the body than clothes.

ENGLISH: Give heed to the ravens , that they do not sow or harvest, and they do not have stores or buildings for keeping thigns, and yet God gives them food. How more precious than birds you are!
QUENYA: Give heed to the ravens , that they do not sow or harvest, and they do not have stores or buildings for keeping thigns, and yet God gives them food. How more precious than birds you are!

ENGLISH: Who among you, by worrying, can add a single cubit to the length of his life?
QUENYA: Who among you, by worrying, can add a single cubit to the length of his life?

ENGLISH: If thus you cannot do the smallest thing, how is that you have worries about the remaining things?
QUENYA: If thus you cannot do the smallest thing, how is that you have worries about the remaining things?

ENGLISH: Heed how the lilies grow; they do not toil or weave, but I tell you: Also Solomon in all his glory was not adorned like one among them!
QUENYA: Heed how the lilies grow; they do not toil or weave, but I tell you: Also Solomon in all his glory was not adorned like one among them!

ENGLISH: If God so adorns the plants in the field, that exist today and tomorrow are thrown into an oven, how much more will he adorn you, you of little faith!
QUENYA: If God so adorns the plants in the field, that exist today and tomorrow are thrown into an oven, how much more will he adorn you, you of little faith!

ENGLISH: Therefore do not seek what you are to eat or what you are to drink, and do not have anxiety,
QUENYA: Therefore do not seek what you are to eat or what you are to drink, and do not have anxiety,

ENGLISH: for all these things are that the nations of the world seek, but your Father knows that you have need of these things.
QUENYA: for all these things are that the nations of the world seek, but your Father knows that you have need of these things.

ENGLISH: But seek first his kingdom, and these things will be added to you!
QUENYA: But seek first his kingdom, and these things will be added to you!

ENGLISH: Do not be afraid, o little flock, for your Father has thought well to give you the kingdom!
QUENYA: Do not be afraid, o little flock, for your Father has thought well to give you the kingdom!

ENGLISH: Sell that you have and give gifts to the poor. Make for yourselves pouches that will not ever wear, an unfailing treasure in heaven, where a thief does not come near or a moth devour.
QUENYA: Sell that you have and give gifts to the poor. Make for yourselves pouches that will not ever wear, an unfailing treasure in heaven, where a thief does not come near or a moth devour.

ENGLISH: For where your treasure is, there also your heart will be.
QUENYA: For where your treasure is, there also your heart will be.

ENGLISH: Keep the belt on your hips and your lamps burning,
QUENYA: Keep the belt on your hips and your lamps burning,

ENGLISH: and you be like men looking forward to their master's return from the marriage, for them to be able to open to him in the same moment that he comes knocking.
QUENYA: and you be like men looking forward to their master's return from the marriage, for them to be able to open to him in the same moment that he comes knocking.

ENGLISH: Happy are the thralls whose master, when he returns, finds them watching! Truly I say to you: He will bind around his hip and will allow them to lie at the table, and he will come to be a servant to them.
QUENYA: Happy are the thralls whose master, when he returns, finds them watching! Truly I say to you: He will bind around his hip and will allow them to lie at the table, and he will come to be a servant to them.

ENGLISH: And if he comes in the second watch, or in the third, and finds them so, happy they are!
QUENYA: And if he comes in the second watch, or in the third, and finds them so, happy they are!

ENGLISH: But know this thing, that if the master of the house knew the time when the thief was going to come, he was awake and did not allow anyone to break into his house.
QUENYA: But know this thing, that if the master of the house knew the time when the thief was going to come, he was awake and did not allow anyone to break into his house.

ENGLISH: You as well be ready, for the Son of Man is coming at a time that you do not think.
QUENYA: You as well be ready, for the Son of Man is coming at a time that you do not think.

ENGLISH: Then Peter said: “Lord, do you speak this comparison to us or also to all?”
QUENYA: Then Peter said: “Lord, do you speak this comparison to us or also to all?”

ENGLISH: And the Lord said: “Indeed who is the faithful steward, the intelligent one, in whose oversight his lord will place all his servants, for him to give them their food at the proper time?
QUENYA: And the Lord said: “Indeed who is the faithful steward, the intelligent one, in whose oversight his lord will place all his servants, for him to give them their food at the proper time?

ENGLISH: Happy is that thrall, whom his master when he comes will find doing so.
QUENYA: Happy is that thrall, whom his master when he comes will find doing so.

ENGLISH: Truly I say to you that over all his goods he will put him.
QUENYA: Truly I say to you that over all his goods he will put him.

ENGLISH: But if that thrall says in his heart: 'My master will not come soon', and he begins to strike the servants and the maidservants, and eats and drinks and fills himself with wine,
QUENYA: But if that thrall says in his heart: 'My master will not come soon', and he begins to strike the servants and the maidservants, and eats and drinks and fills himself with wine,

ENGLISH: that thrall's master will come in a day that he does not think and at an hour that he does not know, and he will cut him in two and give him his portion with the faithless ones.
QUENYA: that thrall's master will come in a day that he does not think and at an hour that he does not know, and he will cut him in two and give him his portion with the faithless ones.

ENGLISH: Then that thrall who understood his master's wish, but did not prepear himself or did his will, will be beaten with many blows.
QUENYA: Then that thrall who understood his master's wish, but did not prepear himself or did his will, will be beaten with many blows.

ENGLISH: But who did not understand it, and so did things worthy of beating, will be beaten with few blows. For from anyone to whom much has been given, much will be demanded, and from a person in whose oversight they have placed much, they will demand more than usual.
QUENYA: But who did not understand it, and so did things worthy of beating, will be beaten with few blows. For from anyone to whom much has been given, much will be demanded, and from a person in whose oversight they have placed much, they will demand more than usual.

ENGLISH: A fire I have come to throw upon earth, and what am I to wish if it has been kindled even now?
QUENYA: A fire I have come to throw upon earth, and what am I to wish if it has been kindled even now?

ENGLISH: A baptism I have that I will be baptized with, and how pressed I am until it has been completed!
QUENYA: A baptism I have that I will be baptized with, and how pressed I am until it has been completed!

ENGLISH: Do you think that I have come to give peace on earth? No, I say to you, but division!
QUENYA: Do you think that I have come to give peace on earth? No, I say to you, but division!

ENGLISH: For from now will be five split in a single house, three against two and two against three.
QUENYA: For from now will be five split in a single house, three against two and two against three.

ENGLISH: They will be split, father against son and son against father, mother against daughter and daughter against mother, and a woman against her son's wife, and the wife against her husband's mother.”
QUENYA: They will be split, father against son and son against father, mother against daughter and daughter against mother, and a woman against her son's wife, and the wife against her husband's mother.”

ENGLISH: Then he also said to the crowds: “When you see a cloud rising in the West, in the same moment you say: A storm is coming – and so it will be.
QUENYA: Then he also said to the crowds: “When you see a cloud rising in the West, in the same moment you say: A storm is coming – and so it will be.

ENGLISH: And when you see wind that blows from South, you say: It will be hot – and so it will be.
QUENYA: And when you see wind that blows from South, you say: It will be hot – and so it will be.

ENGLISH: Hypocrites, you know to read the appearance of earth and heaven, but how is that you do not know to read this time?
QUENYA: Hypocrites, you know to read the appearance of earth and heaven, but how is that you do not know to read this time?

ENGLISH: How is that you cannot judge also for yourselves what is just?
QUENYA: How is that you cannot judge also for yourselves what is just?

ENGLISH: For when you are going with your enemy to a judge, strive in the way to be free from your strife with him – or he will draw you before the judge, and the judge will give you over to the court servant , and the court-servant will throw you into jail.
QUENYA: For when you are going with your enemy to a judge, strive in the way to be free from your strife with him – or he will draw you before the judge, and the judge will give you over to the court servant , and the court-servant will throw you into jail.

ENGLISH: I tell you: You will not come out from there before you have paid the last small piece of copper!”
QUENYA: I tell you: You will not come out from there before you have paid the last small piece of copper!”

ENGLISH: At that time some that were there told him about the people from Galilee whose blood Pilate poured forth into the blood of their sacrifices.
QUENYA: At that time some that were there told him about the people from Galilee whose blood Pilate poured forth into the blood of their sacrifices.

ENGLISH: Therefore in answer he said to them: “Do you suppose that these people from Galilee were sinners greater than all others in Galilee, since they suffered that?
QUENYA: Therefore in answer he said to them: “Do you suppose that these people from Galilee were sinners greater than all others in Galilee, since they suffered that?

ENGLISH: By no means, I say to you; but if you do not find repentance, all among you will be destroyed in the same manner.
QUENYA: By no means, I say to you; but if you do not find repentance, all among you will be destroyed in the same manner.

ENGLISH: Or the eighteen upon whom the tower in Siloam fell, killing them – do you suppose that they had a debt greater than which all others that live in Jerusalem have?
QUENYA: Or the eighteen upon whom the tower in Siloam fell, killing them – do you suppose that they had a debt greater than which all others that live in Jerusalem have?

ENGLISH: By no means, I say to you; but if you do not find repentance, all among you will be destroyed in the same manner.
QUENYA: By no means, I say to you; but if you do not find repentance, all among you will be destroyed in the same manner.

ENGLISH: Then he spoke to them this comparison: “A man had a fig tree in his garden of vines, and he came to seek fruit on it, but he found nothing.
QUENYA: Then he spoke to them this comparison: “A man had a fig tree in his garden of vines, and he came to seek fruit on it, but he found nothing.

ENGLISH: Then he said to the gardener: 'Look, for three years I have come seeking fruit on this fig tree, but I have found nothing. Cut it down! What reason is for keeping it there, keeping the ground without giving fruit?'”
QUENYA: Then he said to the gardener: 'Look, for three years I have come seeking fruit on this fig tree, but I have found nothing. Cut it down! What reason is for keeping it there, keeping the ground without giving fruit?'”

ENGLISH: In answer he said to him: 'Lord, allow it do stand also this year, and I will dig around it and will place muck there.
QUENYA: In answer he said to him: 'Lord, allow it do stand also this year, and I will dig around it and will place muck there.

ENGLISH: If it will then give fruit in the coming year, very well. But if it does not, you will cut it down.'”
QUENYA: If it will then give fruit in the coming year, very well. But if it does not, you will cut it down.'”

ENGLISH: Now Jesus was teaching in one of the synagogues on the day of rest.
QUENYA: Now Jesus was teaching in one of the synagogues on the day of rest.

ENGLISH: And behold! was there a woman who for eighteen years was possessed by a spirit making her weak: She was bent, and it was not possible for her to stand straight.
QUENYA: And behold! was there a woman who for eighteen years was possessed by a spirit making her weak: She was bent, and it was not possible for her to stand straight.

ENGLISH: But when he saw the woman, Jesus called her to himself and said: “Woman, you are freed from the illness making you weak.”
QUENYA: But when he saw the woman, Jesus called her to himself and said: “Woman, you are freed from the illness making you weak.”

ENGLISH: And he put his hands on her, and in the same moment she arose to stand straight, and she gave glory to God.
QUENYA: And he put his hands on her, and in the same moment she arose to stand straight, and she gave glory to God.

ENGLISH: But the chief of the synagogue, being angry since Jesus healed on the day of rest, said to the crowd: “There are six days in which it is necessary to work. There come on them to be healed, and not on the day of rest!”
QUENYA: But the chief of the synagogue, being angry since Jesus healed on the day of rest, said to the crowd: “There are six days in which it is necessary to work. There come on them to be healed, and not on the day of rest!”

ENGLISH: But the Lord answered him: “Hypocrites, does not everyone among you on the day of rest loose his ox or his ass from the manger and lead it away to drink?
QUENYA: But the Lord answered him: “Hypocrites, does not everyone among you on the day of rest loose his ox or his ass from the manger and lead it away to drink?

ENGLISH: But this woman, who is a daughter of Abraham whom Satan has kept restrained for eighteen years – was it not necessary to loose her from this bond on the day of rest?”
QUENYA: But this woman, who is a daughter of Abraham whom Satan has kept restrained for eighteen years – was it not necessary to loose her from this bond on the day of rest?”

ENGLISH: And when he said that, all that stood against him were humiliated, and the entire crowd had joy concerning all the glorious things that happened by him.
QUENYA: And when he said that, all that stood against him were humiliated, and the entire crowd had joy concerning all the glorious things that happened by him.

ENGLISH: Therefore he said: “Like what God's kingdom, and with what am I to compare it?
QUENYA: Therefore he said: “Like what God's kingdom, and with what am I to compare it?

ENGLISH: It is like a seed of mustard, that a man took and put in his garden, and it grew into a tree, and the birds of heaven dwelt in its branches.”
QUENYA: It is like a seed of mustard, that a man took and put in his garden, and it grew into a tree, and the birds of heaven dwelt in its branches.”

ENGLISH: And again he said: “With what am I to compare God's kingdom?
QUENYA: And again he said: “With what am I to compare God's kingdom?

ENGLISH: It is like leaven, which a woman took and hid in three measures of meal, until everythign was leavened .”
QUENYA: It is like leaven, which a woman took and hid in three measures of meal, until everythign was leavened .”

ENGLISH: And he went from city to city and from village to village, teaching while he was travelling to Jerusalem.
QUENYA: And he went from city to city and from village to village, teaching while he was travelling to Jerusalem.

ENGLISH: Now a person said to him: “Lord, are the saved ones few?” He said to them:
QUENYA: Now a person said to him: “Lord, are the saved ones few?” He said to them:

ENGLISH: “Strive to go inside through the narrow door! For numerous ones, I say to you, will seek to go inside, but they will not be able,
QUENYA: “Strive to go inside through the narrow door! For numerous ones, I say to you, will seek to go inside, but they will not be able,

ENGLISH: from the hour that he master of the house has arisen and has closed the door, and you stand on the outside, knocking on the door, saying: 'Lord, open to us!' But in answer he will say to you: 'I do not know where you have come from.'
QUENYA: from the hour that he master of the house has arisen and has closed the door, and you stand on the outside, knocking on the door, saying: 'Lord, open to us!' But in answer he will say to you: 'I do not know where you have come from.'

ENGLISH: Then you will say: 'We ate and drank before you, and you taught in our streets!'
QUENYA: Then you will say: 'We ate and drank before you, and you taught in our streets!'

ENGLISH: But he will answer you so: 'I do not know where you have come from. Begone from me, all who do unrighteousness!'
QUENYA: But he will answer you so: 'I do not know where you have come from. Begone from me, all who do unrighteousness!'

ENGLISH: There your wailing and your grinding of teeth will be, when you see Abraham and Isaac and Jacob and all the prophets in God's kingdom, but you are thrown outside.
QUENYA: There your wailing and your grinding of teeth will be, when you see Abraham and Isaac and Jacob and all the prophets in God's kingdom, but you are thrown outside.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, people will come from East and West and North and South, and they will lie at the table in God's kingdom.
QUENYA: Furthermore, people will come from East and West and North and South, and they will lie at the table in God's kingdom.

ENGLISH: And behold! are some last ones that will be first, and are some first ones that will be last.”
QUENYA: And behold! are some last ones that will be first, and are some first ones that will be last.”

ENGLISH: At that time came some Pharisees that said to him: “Go out and go away from here, for Herod wishes to kill you!”
QUENYA: At that time came some Pharisees that said to him: “Go out and go away from here, for Herod wishes to kill you!”

ENGLISH: And he said to them: “Go and say to that fox: Behold, I throw out demons and I perform healing today and tomorrow, and on the third day I am finished.
QUENYA: And he said to them: “Go and say to that fox: Behold, I throw out demons and I perform healing today and tomorrow, and on the third day I am finished.

ENGLISH: And yet it is necessary for me to keep travelling on my road today and tomorrow and on the following day, for it is not allowed for a prophet to be destroyed outside of Jerusalem.
QUENYA: And yet it is necessary for me to keep travelling on my road today and tomorrow and on the following day, for it is not allowed for a prophet to be destroyed outside of Jerusalem.

ENGLISH: Jerusalem, Jerusalem, who kills the prophets and stones those that have been sent to her – how often I wanted to gather your children like a hen gathers her young under her wings! But you did not want to.
QUENYA: Jerusalem, Jerusalem, who kills the prophets and stones those that have been sent to her – how often I wanted to gather your children like a hen gathers her young under her wings! But you did not want to.

ENGLISH: Behold, your house is abandoned to yourselves! I tell you that you will by no means see me until you say: Blessed is who is coming in the name of the Lord!”
QUENYA: Behold, your house is abandoned to yourselves! I tell you that you will by no means see me until you say: Blessed is who is coming in the name of the Lord!”

ENGLISH: And on an occasion when he went into a house of a chief of the Pharisees to eat bread, they watched him closely.
QUENYA: And on an occasion when he went into a house of a chief of the Pharisees to eat bread, they watched him closely.

ENGLISH: And behold! was there a man before him who was swollen, having too much water in his body.
QUENYA: And behold! was there a man before him who was swollen, having too much water in his body.

ENGLISH: Therefore Jesus spoke to the lawyers, saying: “Is it allowed on the day of rest to heal, or not?”
QUENYA: Therefore Jesus spoke to the lawyers, saying: “Is it allowed on the day of rest to heal, or not?”

ENGLISH: But they were silent. Then he took the man, healed him and sent him away.
QUENYA: But they were silent. Then he took the man, healed him and sent him away.

ENGLISH: And he said to them: “Who among you, if his son or his ox falls into a well, does not pull him up on the day of rest?”
QUENYA: And he said to them: “Who among you, if his son or his ox falls into a well, does not pull him up on the day of rest?”

ENGLISH: And they could not answer these things.
QUENYA: And they could not answer these things.

ENGLISH: Then he told a comparison to the men that were invited, when he perceived how they close the most prominent places for themselves, saying to them:
QUENYA: Then he told a comparison to the men that were invited, when he perceived how they close the most prominent places for themselves, saying to them:

ENGLISH: “When you are summoned by a person to a wedding, do not lie down at the most prominent place. Perhaps a person more prominent than you has been invited by him,
QUENYA: “When you are summoned by a person to a wedding, do not lie down at the most prominent place. Perhaps a person more prominent than you has been invited by him,

ENGLISH: and the person who summoned you will come and say to you: 'Allow this man to have the place!' And then it is necessary for you to go humbled to the lowest place.
QUENYA: and the person who summoned you will come and say to you: 'Allow this man to have the place!' And then it is necessary for you to go humbled to the lowest place.

ENGLISH: But when you are invited, go and lie at the lowliest place. Thus, when the man who invited you comes, he will say to you: 'Friend, come up, higher!' Then you will have glory before the people that have been invited with you.
QUENYA: But when you are invited, go and lie at the lowliest place. Thus, when the man who invited you comes, he will say to you: 'Friend, come up, higher!' Then you will have glory before the people that have been invited with you.

ENGLISH: For everyone who raises himself will be humbled, but who humbles himself will be raised up.”
QUENYA: For everyone who raises himself will be humbled, but who humbles himself will be raised up.”

ENGLISH: Furthermore, he said to who invited him: “When you make an evening meal or a supper, do not summon your friends, or your brothers, or the people of your kin, or your rich neighbors. Perhaps they also will invite you again, and that will be for you a paying back.
QUENYA: Furthermore, he said to who invited him: “When you make an evening meal or a supper, do not summon your friends, or your brothers, or the people of your kin, or your rich neighbors. Perhaps they also will invite you again, and that will be for you a paying back.

ENGLISH: But when you make a feast, invite poor ones, cripples, lame ones, blind ones,
QUENYA: But when you make a feast, invite poor ones, cripples, lame ones, blind ones,

ENGLISH: and you will be happy, for they have nothing with which it is possible for them to repay you. For will be repaid to you in the rising of dead!”
QUENYA: and you will be happy, for they have nothing with which it is possible for them to repay you. For will be repaid to you in the rising of dead!”

ENGLISH: Hearing that, one among who lay at the table said: “Happy is who eats bread in God's kingdom!”
QUENYA: Hearing that, one among who lay at the table said: “Happy is who eats bread in God's kingdom!”

ENGLISH: Jesus said to him: “ was a man who prepared a great supper, and he invited numerous ones.
QUENYA: Jesus said to him: “ was a man who prepared a great supper, and he invited numerous ones.

ENGLISH: And he sent his servant at the hour of the supper, to say to who were invited: “Come, for now everything is ready!”
QUENYA: And he sent his servant at the hour of the supper, to say to who were invited: “Come, for now everything is ready!”

ENGLISH: But all among them started to give reasons not to come. The first said to him: 'I have bought a field, and it is necessary for me to go to see it. I beg of you, do not think evil about me since it is not possible for me to come!'
QUENYA: But all among them started to give reasons not to come. The first said to him: 'I have bought a field, and it is necessary for me to go to see it. I beg of you, do not think evil about me since it is not possible for me to come!'

ENGLISH: And another said: 'I have traded to myself five yokes of oxes, and I am going to test them. I beg of you, do not think evil about me since it is not possible for me to come.'
QUENYA: And another said: 'I have traded to myself five yokes of oxes, and I am going to test them. I beg of you, do not think evil about me since it is not possible for me to come.'

ENGLISH: And another said: 'I have married a woman, and therefore it is not possible for me to come.'
QUENYA: And another said: 'I have married a woman, and therefore it is not possible for me to come.'

ENGLISH: When he returned, the thrall told these things to his lord. Then the chief of the house was angry and said to his thrall: 'Go with speed into the streets and ways in the city, and bring here the poor ones and cripples and blind ones and lame ones!'
QUENYA: When he returned, the thrall told these things to his lord. Then the chief of the house was angry and said to his thrall: 'Go with speed into the streets and ways in the city, and bring here the poor ones and cripples and blind ones and lame ones!'

ENGLISH: And the thrall said: “Lord, what you commanded has been done, and still is place.”
QUENYA: And the thrall said: “Lord, what you commanded has been done, and still is place.”

ENGLISH: And the lord said to the thrall: “Go out into the roads and to the fenced fields and compel them to come inside, in order to fill my house.
QUENYA: And the lord said to the thrall: “Go out into the roads and to the fenced fields and compel them to come inside, in order to fill my house.

ENGLISH: For I say to you : No one among the men that were invited will taste my supper!'”
QUENYA: For I say to you : No one among the men that were invited will taste my supper!'”

ENGLISH: Now great crowds were travelling with him, and he turned and said to them:
QUENYA: Now great crowds were travelling with him, and he turned and said to them:

ENGLISH: “If anyone comes to me and does not hate his father and his mother and his wife and his sisters, indeed his own life, is not possible for him to be my disciple.
QUENYA: “If anyone comes to me and does not hate his father and his mother and his wife and his sisters, indeed his own life, is not possible for him to be my disciple.

ENGLISH: To who is not carrying his cross and coming after me, it is not possible to be my disciple.
QUENYA: To who is not carrying his cross and coming after me, it is not possible to be my disciple.

ENGLISH: For who among you that wishes to build a tower does not first sit down to calculate the sum of building, to know if he as enough money to complete it?
QUENYA: For who among you that wishes to build a tower does not first sit down to calculate the sum of building, to know if he as enough money to complete it?

ENGLISH: If he does not, perhaps he puts the foundation of the tower , but it is not possible for him to complete it, and all that are watching will perhaps start to speak mockery about him,
QUENYA: If he does not, perhaps he puts the foundation of the tower , but it is not possible for him to complete it, and all that are watching will perhaps start to speak mockery about him,

ENGLISH: saying: 'This man started to build, but it was not possible for him to finish.'
QUENYA: saying: 'This man started to build, but it was not possible for him to finish.'

ENGLISH: Or who is the king who will meet another king at war and does not first sit down to make a consideration whether he can with ten thousand warriors fight against who comes against him having twenty thousands?
QUENYA: Or who is the king who will meet another king at war and does not first sit down to make a consideration whether he can with ten thousand warriors fight against who comes against him having twenty thousands?

ENGLISH: If he cannot fight against him, he sends people who will speak on his behalf while the other is still far away, seeking peace.
QUENYA: If he cannot fight against him, he sends people who will speak on his behalf while the other is still far away, seeking peace.

ENGLISH: Thus, therefore, no one among you that does not say farewell to all his goods can be my disciple.
QUENYA: Thus, therefore, no one among you that does not say farewell to all his goods can be my disciple.

ENGLISH: Salt is indeed good, but if the taste of the salt is gone, with what will one give it taste again?
QUENYA: Salt is indeed good, but if the taste of the salt is gone, with what will one give it taste again?

ENGLISH: It is not good for soil or as manure alike. People throw it outside. Let who has ears to listen, listen!
QUENYA: It is not good for soil or as manure alike. People throw it outside. Let who has ears to listen, listen!

ENGLISH: All the tax collectors and sinners came near to him to hear him.
QUENYA: All the tax collectors and sinners came near to him to hear him.

ENGLISH: Therefore the Pharisees and the lawyers grumbled, saying: “This man receives sinners and eats with them!”
QUENYA: Therefore the Pharisees and the lawyers grumbled, saying: “This man receives sinners and eats with them!”

ENGLISH: Then he spoke this comparison to them:
QUENYA: Then he spoke this comparison to them:

ENGLISH: “Who is the man among you having a hundred sheep who does not, if one among them is lost, leave the ninety-nine in the wilderness and will seek the lost sheep until he finds it?
QUENYA: “Who is the man among you having a hundred sheep who does not, if one among them is lost, leave the ninety-nine in the wilderness and will seek the lost sheep until he finds it?

ENGLISH: And after finding it he will put it on his back, having joy.
QUENYA: And after finding it he will put it on his back, having joy.

ENGLISH: And after coming home he summons his friends and his neighbors and says to them: 'Be happy with me, for I have found my sheep, that was lost.'
QUENYA: And after coming home he summons his friends and his neighbors and says to them: 'Be happy with me, for I have found my sheep, that was lost.'

ENGLISH: I say to you that in the same manner, when one sinner finds repentance, is in heaven a joy greater than which is concerning ninety-nine sinners that do not have need of repentance.
QUENYA: I say to you that in the same manner, when one sinner finds repentance, is in heaven a joy greater than which is concerning ninety-nine sinners that do not have need of repentance.

ENGLISH: Or who is the woman who has ten drachmas who does not kindle a lamp and clean her house if one of them is lost, seeking closely until she finds it?
QUENYA: Or who is the woman who has ten drachmas who does not kindle a lamp and clean her house if one of them is lost, seeking closely until she finds it?

ENGLISH: And when she has found it, she gathers her friends and says: 'Be happy with me, for I have found the drachma that was lost to me!'
QUENYA: And when she has found it, she gathers her friends and says: 'Be happy with me, for I have found the drachma that was lost to me!'

ENGLISH: Thus, I say to you, will be joy among God's angels concerning one sinner who finds repentance.”
QUENYA: Thus, I say to you, will be joy among God's angels concerning one sinner who finds repentance.”

ENGLISH: Then he said: “ was a man with whom were two sons.
QUENYA: Then he said: “ was a man with whom were two sons.

ENGLISH: And the younger among them said to his father: “Father, give me the part of the goods that falls to my portion.” Then he divided his livelihood to them .
QUENYA: And the younger among them said to his father: “Father, give me the part of the goods that falls to my portion.” Then he divided his livelihood to them .

ENGLISH: Thereafter, after not many days, the younger son gathered everything and went away into a remote land, and here he threw away his money on a wild life.
QUENYA: Thereafter, after not many days, the younger son gathered everything and went away into a remote land, and here he threw away his money on a wild life.

ENGLISH: After he used everything, was a severe famine in that land, and he began to have need.
QUENYA: After he used everything, was a severe famine in that land, and he began to have need.

ENGLISH: He went attaching himself to one of the people that lived in that land, who sent him into his fields to watch pigs.
QUENYA: He went attaching himself to one of the people that lived in that land, who sent him into his fields to watch pigs.

ENGLISH: And he wished to fill himself with the pods that the pigs were eating, but no one gave him a thing.
QUENYA: And he wished to fill himself with the pods that the pigs were eating, but no one gave him a thing.

ENGLISH: But when he returned to keenness of perception he said: 'All the paid people that work for my father have an abundance of bread, while I am dying from famine!
QUENYA: But when he returned to keenness of perception he said: 'All the paid people that work for my father have an abundance of bread, while I am dying from famine!

ENGLISH: I will rise and I will go to my father, and I will say to him: Father, I have sinned against heaven and against you.
QUENYA: I will rise and I will go to my father, and I will say to him: Father, I have sinned against heaven and against you.

ENGLISH: I am not worthy to still be called your son, but make me like one of the paid people that work for you.'
QUENYA: I am not worthy to still be called your son, but make me like one of the paid people that work for you.'

ENGLISH: And he arose and came to his father. When he was still far away, the father saw him, and his heart went out to him, and running to him he fell upon his neck and kissed him.
QUENYA: And he arose and came to his father. When he was still far away, the father saw him, and his heart went out to him, and running to him he fell upon his neck and kissed him.

ENGLISH: But the son said: 'Father, I have sinned against heaven and against you.
QUENYA: But the son said: 'Father, I have sinned against heaven and against you.

ENGLISH: I am not worthy to still be called your son. Make me like one of the paid people that work for you.'
QUENYA: I am not worthy to still be called your son. Make me like one of the paid people that work for you.'

ENGLISH: But the father said to his servants: 'Quickly, bring a cloak, the best one, and put it on him, and put a ring on his hand and shoes on his feet,
QUENYA: But the father said to his servants: 'Quickly, bring a cloak, the best one, and put it on him, and put a ring on his hand and shoes on his feet,

ENGLISH: and bring the fattened young bull, kill it and let us eat and have joy!
QUENYA: and bring the fattened young bull, kill it and let us eat and have joy!

ENGLISH: For this son of mine was dead and has come back to life; he was lost and has been found!' And they began to have joy.
QUENYA: For this son of mine was dead and has come back to life; he was lost and has been found!' And they began to have joy.

ENGLISH: But his older brother was in the field, and when he came and went near to the house, he heard music and people dancing.
QUENYA: But his older brother was in the field, and when he came and went near to the house, he heard music and people dancing.

ENGLISH: He called one of the servants and asked about what these things meant.
QUENYA: He called one of the servants and asked about what these things meant.
