QUENYA: And was there a man whose name was Zacchaeus, and he was a chief tax collector and rich.

ENGLISH: And he tried to see Jesus, but he could not because of the crowd, and he was not tall.
QUENYA: And he tried to see Jesus, but he could not because of the crowd, and he was not tall.

ENGLISH: And running beforehand to a place before them, he climbed into a sycamore tree, to see him, for Jesus was going to pass by that place.
QUENYA: And running beforehand to a place before them, he climbed into a sycamore tree, to see him, for Jesus was going to pass by that place.

ENGLISH: And when he came thither, Jesus looked up and said: “Zacchaeus, come down quickly , for today it is necessary for me to stay in your house!”
QUENYA: And when he came thither, Jesus looked up and said: “Zacchaeus, come down quickly , for today it is necessary for me to stay in your house!”

ENGLISH: And he came quickly down and received him with joy.
QUENYA: And he came quickly down and received him with joy.

ENGLISH: And when all saw it, they were murmuring, saying: “With a man who is a sinner he went in to eat.”
QUENYA: And when all saw it, they were murmuring, saying: “With a man who is a sinner he went in to eat.”

ENGLISH: But Zacchaeus arose and said to the Lord: “Behold, half of my goods I will give to the poor, and if by compulsion I took money from anyone, I will give back four times the sum!”
QUENYA: But Zacchaeus arose and said to the Lord: “Behold, half of my goods I will give to the poor, and if by compulsion I took money from anyone, I will give back four times the sum!”

ENGLISH: Then Jesus said to him: “Today salvation has come to this house, for also he is a son of Abraham.
QUENYA: Then Jesus said to him: “Today salvation has come to this house, for also he is a son of Abraham.

ENGLISH: For the Son of Man came to seek and to save which was lost.”
QUENYA: For the Son of Man came to seek and to save which was lost.”

ENGLISH: While they listened to these things he also told them a comparison, since he was near to Jerusalem, and they thought that God's kingdom was going to show itself there and then.
QUENYA: While they listened to these things he also told them a comparison, since he was near to Jerusalem, and they thought that God's kingdom was going to show itself there and then.

ENGLISH: Therefore he said: “A man, an heir, was going to travel to a remote land to receive a kingdom and thereafter to return.
QUENYA: Therefore he said: “A man, an heir, was going to travel to a remote land to receive a kingdom and thereafter to return.

ENGLISH: He called ten servants and gave them ten minas and commanded them: 'Trade with them until I shall come.'
QUENYA: He called ten servants and gave them ten minas and commanded them: 'Trade with them until I shall come.'

ENGLISH: But people of his land hated him and sent behind him people that were going to speak for them, to say: 'We do not want this man as king over us.'
QUENYA: But people of his land hated him and sent behind him people that were going to speak for them, to say: 'We do not want this man as king over us.'

ENGLISH: And happened when he returned, after receiving the kingdom, that he commanded that they were to call to him these thralls that he gave the money to, for him to know what they got by trade.
QUENYA: And happened when he returned, after receiving the kingdom, that he commanded that they were to call to him these thralls that he gave the money to, for him to know what they got by trade.

ENGLISH: Then the first came and said: “Lord, your mina gained ten minas!”
QUENYA: Then the first came and said: “Lord, your mina gained ten minas!”

ENGLISH: Therefore he said to him: “Well done, good slave! Since you have been faithful in the smallest thing, have power over ten cities.”
QUENYA: Therefore he said to him: “Well done, good slave! Since you have been faithful in the smallest thing, have power over ten cities.”

ENGLISH: And the second came, saying: “Your mina, lord, made five minas!”
QUENYA: And the second came, saying: “Your mina, lord, made five minas!”

ENGLISH: He said also to this man: 'Then you rule five cities!'
QUENYA: He said also to this man: 'Then you rule five cities!'

ENGLISH: But the other came, saying: 'Lord, here is your mina, which I have kept lying in a cloth.
QUENYA: But the other came, saying: 'Lord, here is your mina, which I have kept lying in a cloth.

ENGLISH: For I feared you, since you are a harsh man; you take up what you did not put down and you reap what you did not sow.'
QUENYA: For I feared you, since you are a harsh man; you take up what you did not put down and you reap what you did not sow.'

ENGLISH: He said to him: 'Out of your own mouth I am judging you, wicked slave! You knew that I am a harsh man who take up what I did not put down and reap what I did not sow?
QUENYA: He said to him: 'Out of your own mouth I am judging you, wicked slave! You knew that I am a harsh man who take up what I did not put down and reap what I did not sow?

ENGLISH: Then how is that you did not put my money on a table? Then, when I came, I was going to receive it with an added sum.'
QUENYA: Then how is that you did not put my money on a table? Then, when I came, I was going to receive it with an added sum.'

ENGLISH: And he said to those that stood by him: 'Take the mina from him and give it to who has the ten minas!'
QUENYA: And he said to those that stood by him: 'Take the mina from him and give it to who has the ten minas!'

ENGLISH: But they said to him: 'Lord, he has ten minas!'
QUENYA: But they said to him: 'Lord, he has ten minas!'

ENGLISH: 'I say to you: To everyone that has, more will be given, but to that does not have, also what he has will be taken away.
QUENYA: 'I say to you: To everyone that has, more will be given, but to that does not have, also what he has will be taken away.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, these enemies of mine that did not want me as their king – bring them here and slay them before my eyes!'”
QUENYA: Furthermore, these enemies of mine that did not want me as their king – bring them here and slay them before my eyes!'”

ENGLISH: Thus, after he said these things, he went in front of them towards Jerusalem.
QUENYA: Thus, after he said these things, he went in front of them towards Jerusalem.

ENGLISH: And when he came near to Bethphage and Bethany on the mountain called Mount of Olives, he sent froth two of the disciples,
QUENYA: And when he came near to Bethphage and Bethany on the mountain called Mount of Olives, he sent froth two of the disciples,

ENGLISH: saying: “Go into the city before you! When you come thither, you will find a colt bound, that no one has ever sat upon. Loose it and bring it!
QUENYA: saying: “Go into the city before you! When you come thither, you will find a colt bound, that no one has ever sat upon. Loose it and bring it!

ENGLISH: But if anyone says to you: 'What is your reason for loosing it?', you are to say: The Lord has need of it.”
QUENYA: But if anyone says to you: 'What is your reason for loosing it?', you are to say: The Lord has need of it.”

ENGLISH: And that were sent forth found it just as he said to them .
QUENYA: And that were sent forth found it just as he said to them .

ENGLISH: But when they loosed the cold, that owned it said to them: “What is your reason for loosing the colt?”
QUENYA: But when they loosed the cold, that owned it said to them: “What is your reason for loosing the colt?”

ENGLISH: They said: “The Lord has need of it.”
QUENYA: They said: “The Lord has need of it.”

ENGLISH: And they led it to Jesus, and they threw their cloaks upon the colt and put Jesus on it.
QUENYA: And they led it to Jesus, and they threw their cloaks upon the colt and put Jesus on it.

ENGLISH: As he moved forward people spread their cloaks on the road.
QUENYA: As he moved forward people spread their cloaks on the road.

ENGLISH: When he came near to the decline down from the Mount of Olives the entire host of the disciples began to have joy and to praise God concerning all the mighty deeds that they saw,
QUENYA: When he came near to the decline down from the Mount of Olives the entire host of the disciples began to have joy and to praise God concerning all the mighty deeds that they saw,

ENGLISH: saying: “Blessed is who is coming, the King, in the name of the Lord. Peace on earth, and glory in the high places!”
QUENYA: saying: “Blessed is who is coming, the King, in the name of the Lord. Peace on earth, and glory in the high places!”

ENGLISH: But some of the Pharisees from the crowd said to him: “Teacher, rebuke your disciples!”
QUENYA: But some of the Pharisees from the crowd said to him: “Teacher, rebuke your disciples!”

ENGLISH: But in answer he said: “I tell you: If these people were silent, the stones would cry !”
QUENYA: But in answer he said: “I tell you: If these people were silent, the stones would cry !”

ENGLISH: And when he came near and saw the city, his tears flowed for it,
QUENYA: And when he came near and saw the city, his tears flowed for it,

ENGLISH: and he said: “Would that you knew in this day that lead to peace! But now they have been hidden from your eyes .
QUENYA: and he said: “Would that you knew in this day that lead to peace! But now they have been hidden from your eyes .

ENGLISH: For will come days when your enemies will surround you with a palisade and will press towards you from all directions,
QUENYA: For will come days when your enemies will surround you with a palisade and will press towards you from all directions,

ENGLISH: and they will throw you and your children to earth, and they will not allow stone to remain upon a stone in you, since you did not know the time when you were inspected!”
QUENYA: and they will throw you and your children to earth, and they will not allow stone to remain upon a stone in you, since you did not know the time when you were inspected!”

ENGLISH: And coming into the temple he began to throw out who sold ,
QUENYA: And coming into the temple he began to throw out who sold ,

ENGLISH: saying to them: “It has been written: 'And my house will be a house of prayer', but you make it a cave of robbers!”
QUENYA: saying to them: “It has been written: 'And my house will be a house of prayer', but you make it a cave of robbers!”

ENGLISH: And he taught every day in the temple. But the chielf priests and the scribes and the prominent ones of the people sought to destroy him,
QUENYA: And he taught every day in the temple. But the chielf priests and the scribes and the prominent ones of the people sought to destroy him,

ENGLISH: and yet they did not find what to do , for the entire people stuck to him to listen.
QUENYA: and yet they did not find what to do , for the entire people stuck to him to listen.

ENGLISH: And it happened in one of the days, when he instructed the people in the temple and made the gospel known, that came to him the chief priests and the elders
QUENYA: And it happened in one of the days, when he instructed the people in the temple and made the gospel known, that came to him the chief priests and the elders

ENGLISH: and said to him: “Say us by what authority you are doing these things, and who has given you this authority!”
QUENYA: and said to him: “Say us by what authority you are doing these things, and who has given you this authority!”

ENGLISH: In answer he said to them: “I too will ask you about thing, and you answer me:
QUENYA: In answer he said to them: “I too will ask you about thing, and you answer me:

ENGLISH: John's baptism, was it out of heaven or from men?”
QUENYA: John's baptism, was it out of heaven or from men?”

ENGLISH: They spoke among themselves and said: “If we say: Out of heaven, he will say: Then how is that you did not believe in him?
QUENYA: They spoke among themselves and said: “If we say: Out of heaven, he will say: Then how is that you did not believe in him?

ENGLISH: But if we say: From men, the entire people will kill us with stones, for they believe firmly that John was a prophet.”
QUENYA: But if we say: From men, the entire people will kill us with stones, for they believe firmly that John was a prophet.”

ENGLISH: Thus they said that they did not know.
QUENYA: Thus they said that they did not know.

ENGLISH: And Jesus said: “Then I as well will not tell you by what authority I to these things.”
QUENYA: And Jesus said: “Then I as well will not tell you by what authority I to these things.”

ENGLISH: And he began to speak this comparison to the people: “A man planted a garden of vines and allowed some cultivators to use it for money, and he went to another land for a long time.
QUENYA: And he began to speak this comparison to the people: “A man planted a garden of vines and allowed some cultivators to use it for money, and he went to another land for a long time.

ENGLISH: And when the time came, he sent a slave to the cultivators, for them to give him of the fruit from the garden of vines. But the cultivators, after beating him, sent him away empty.
QUENYA: And when the time came, he sent a slave to the cultivators, for them to give him of the fruit from the garden of vines. But the cultivators, after beating him, sent him away empty.

ENGLISH: But he sent also another slave. Him as well they sent away, after beating him and humiliating him.
QUENYA: But he sent also another slave. Him as well they sent away, after beating him and humiliating him.

ENGLISH: And yet he again sent a third; him as well they threw outside, after wounding him.
QUENYA: And yet he again sent a third; him as well they threw outside, after wounding him.

ENGLISH: Then the lord who had the garden of wines said: 'What am I to do? I will send my beloved son; for him they will have awe.'
QUENYA: Then the lord who had the garden of wines said: 'What am I to do? I will send my beloved son; for him they will have awe.'

ENGLISH: When the cultivators saw him, they spoke among themselves and said: 'That is the heir! Let us kill him, and we will possess his portion!'
QUENYA: When the cultivators saw him, they spoke among themselves and said: 'That is the heir! Let us kill him, and we will possess his portion!'

ENGLISH: And they threw him out of the garden of vines and killed him. Then what will the lord who has the garden do?
QUENYA: And they threw him out of the garden of vines and killed him. Then what will the lord who has the garden do?

ENGLISH: He will come and put an end to those cultivators and will give the garden to others.” When they heard that, they said: “May it not ever happen!”
QUENYA: He will come and put an end to those cultivators and will give the garden to others.” When they heard that, they said: “May it not ever happen!”

ENGLISH: But again he looked at them and said: “Then what does this thing mean that is written: 'The stone which the builders turned away, it has been made head of the corner' – ?
QUENYA: But again he looked at them and said: “Then what does this thing mean that is written: 'The stone which the builders turned away, it has been made head of the corner' – ?

ENGLISH: Everyone that falls against that stone will be broken. Anyone upon whom it falls, it will smash him.”
QUENYA: Everyone that falls against that stone will be broken. Anyone upon whom it falls, it will smash him.”

ENGLISH: And the scribes and the chief priests sought to put their hands upon him in that hour, but they feared the people. For they understood that he told this comparison about them.
QUENYA: And the scribes and the chief priests sought to put their hands upon him in that hour, but they feared the people. For they understood that he told this comparison about them.

ENGLISH: And after they watched him closely they sent some men that secretly received money to behave as if they were just, to try to catch him in speech, for them to give him over to those who ruled and into the power of the governor.
QUENYA: And after they watched him closely they sent some men that secretly received money to behave as if they were just, to try to catch him in speech, for them to give him over to those who ruled and into the power of the governor.

ENGLISH: And they asked him: “Teacher, we know that you speak and teach as is true, and it is not important to you who a person is, but you teach God's way by the truth.
QUENYA: And they asked him: “Teacher, we know that you speak and teach as is true, and it is not important to you who a person is, but you teach God's way by the truth.

ENGLISH: May we pay tax to the High King or not?”
QUENYA: May we pay tax to the High King or not?”

ENGLISH: But he perceived their cunning and said to them:
QUENYA: But he perceived their cunning and said to them:

ENGLISH: “Show me a denarius. Whose picture and writing does it have?” They said: “The High King's.”
QUENYA: “Show me a denarius. Whose picture and writing does it have?” They said: “The High King's.”

ENGLISH: And he saiad to them: “You are to give back, then, the High King's things to the High King, and God's things to God.”
QUENYA: And he saiad to them: “You are to give back, then, the High King's things to the High King, and God's things to God.”

ENGLISH: And it was not possible for them to seize him in this saying before the people, but they said nothing, in wonder at his answer.
QUENYA: And it was not possible for them to seize him in this saying before the people, but they said nothing, in wonder at his answer.

ENGLISH: But some of the Pharisees, that say that is not resurrection, came and said to him:
QUENYA: But some of the Pharisees, that say that is not resurrection, came and said to him:

ENGLISH: “Teacher, Moses has written for us: 'If a man's brother dies without child, after he married a woman, it is necessary for his brother to get married to the woman and rise up seed for his brother.'
QUENYA: “Teacher, Moses has written for us: 'If a man's brother dies without child, after he married a woman, it is necessary for his brother to get married to the woman and rise up seed for his brother.'

ENGLISH: But were seven brothers, and the first got married to a woman, but died without child.
QUENYA: But were seven brothers, and the first got married to a woman, but died without child.

ENGLISH: Also the second
QUENYA: Also the second

ENGLISH: and the third got married to her, in the same manner all the seven without a child to follow them, and they died.
QUENYA: and the third got married to her, in the same manner all the seven without a child to follow them, and they died.

ENGLISH: In the end also the woman died.
QUENYA: In the end also the woman died.

ENGLISH: Whose wife will she then be in the resurrection? For she was a wife for all the seven.”
QUENYA: Whose wife will she then be in the resurrection? For she was a wife for all the seven.”

ENGLISH: Jesus said to them: “The children of this age marry and are given in marriage,
QUENYA: Jesus said to them: “The children of this age marry and are given in marriage,

ENGLISH: but that are counted worthy for that age and for the resurrection of the dead do not marry or are given in marriage.
QUENYA: but that are counted worthy for that age and for the resurrection of the dead do not marry or are given in marriage.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, they cannot more die, for they are like angels, since they are children of God by being children of the resurrection.
QUENYA: Furthermore, they cannot more die, for they are like angels, since they are children of God by being children of the resurrection.

ENGLISH: But also Moses showed dead are raised, in the story about the thorn-bush, when he calls the Lord Abraham's God and Isaac's God and Jacob's God.
QUENYA: But also Moses showed dead are raised, in the story about the thorn-bush, when he calls the Lord Abraham's God and Isaac's God and Jacob's God.

ENGLISH: He is not God of dead, but of living ones, for all among them are alive to him.”
QUENYA: He is not God of dead, but of living ones, for all among them are alive to him.”

ENGLISH: In answer some of the scribes said: “Teacher, you spoke well!”
QUENYA: In answer some of the scribes said: “Teacher, you spoke well!”

ENGLISH: And they did not more dare to ask him a single question.
QUENYA: And they did not more dare to ask him a single question.

ENGLISH: But he said to them: “How is that they say that the Christ is David's son?
QUENYA: But he said to them: “How is that they say that the Christ is David's son?

ENGLISH: For David himself says in the book of psalms : The Lord said to my lord: Sit by my right hand,
QUENYA: For David himself says in the book of psalms : The Lord said to my lord: Sit by my right hand,

ENGLISH: until I shall put your enemies under your feet.
QUENYA: until I shall put your enemies under your feet.

ENGLISH: Thus David calls him lord. Then how is he his son?”
QUENYA: Thus David calls him lord. Then how is he his son?”

ENGLISH: While the entire people listened, he said to his disciples:
QUENYA: While the entire people listened, he said to his disciples:

ENGLISH: “Watch yourselves because of the scribes that wish to walk in robes and live greetings in the market places and the first seats in the synagogues and the prominent places at the suppers,
QUENYA: “Watch yourselves because of the scribes that wish to walk in robes and live greetings in the market places and the first seats in the synagogues and the prominent places at the suppers,

ENGLISH: and that devour the houses of widows and pray long prayes to be seen by others. They will receive a heavier judgement.”
QUENYA: and that devour the houses of widows and pray long prayes to be seen by others. They will receive a heavier judgement.”

ENGLISH: Now when he looked he saw the rich putting their gifts in the treasuries.
QUENYA: Now when he looked he saw the rich putting their gifts in the treasuries.

ENGLISH: Then he saw a poor widowed woman who threw in two small copper pieces,
QUENYA: Then he saw a poor widowed woman who threw in two small copper pieces,

ENGLISH: and he said: “I tell you truly: This poor widowed woman gave more than them all.
QUENYA: and he said: “I tell you truly: This poor widowed woman gave more than them all.

ENGLISH: For all these gave gifts out of their abundance, but this woman gave the entire livelihood that she had.”
QUENYA: For all these gave gifts out of their abundance, but this woman gave the entire livelihood that she had.”

ENGLISH: And when some talked about the temple, that it had lovely stones and was adorned with gifts, he said:
QUENYA: And when some talked about the temple, that it had lovely stones and was adorned with gifts, he said:

ENGLISH: “These things that you behold – days will come when stone will not remain upon a stone that will not be thrown down.”
QUENYA: “These things that you behold – days will come when stone will not remain upon a stone that will not be thrown down.”

ENGLISH: And they asked him: “Teacher, what is the time when these things will be, and what the sign that these things will soon happen?”
QUENYA: And they asked him: “Teacher, what is the time when these things will be, and what the sign that these things will soon happen?”

ENGLISH: And he said: “Take heed that you will not be caused to stray! For numerous ones will come in my name, saying: I am he!, and: The time is near. Do not go after them!
QUENYA: And he said: “Take heed that you will not be caused to stray! For numerous ones will come in my name, saying: I am he!, and: The time is near. Do not go after them!

ENGLISH: Furthermore, when you hear about wars and uprisings, do not be terrified! For it is necessary that these things will come first, but the end does not come at the same time.
QUENYA: Furthermore, when you hear about wars and uprisings, do not be terrified! For it is necessary that these things will come first, but the end does not come at the same time.

ENGLISH: Then he said to them: “Nation will rise against nation and kingdom against kingdom,
QUENYA: Then he said to them: “Nation will rise against nation and kingdom against kingdom,

ENGLISH: and there will be earthquakes, and in place after place pestilences and famines, and will be terrible things seen, and from heaven great signs.
QUENYA: and there will be earthquakes, and in place after place pestilences and famines, and will be terrible things seen, and from heaven great signs.

ENGLISH: But before all these things people will put their hands on you and will persecute you, giving you over to the synagogues and to the prisons, when you are drawn before kings and governors concerning my name.
QUENYA: But before all these things people will put their hands on you and will persecute you, giving you over to the synagogues and to the prisons, when you are drawn before kings and governors concerning my name.

ENGLISH: That will be for you an opportunity for witnessing.
QUENYA: That will be for you an opportunity for witnessing.

ENGLISH: Therefore be firm in your heart that you will not make plans beforehand about how you will speak for yourselves,
QUENYA: Therefore be firm in your heart that you will not make plans beforehand about how you will speak for yourselves,

ENGLISH: for I shall give you a mouth and wisdom against which all your enemies will not be able to stand or speak.
QUENYA: for I shall give you a mouth and wisdom against which all your enemies will not be able to stand or speak.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, you will be given over by parents and by brothers and by your kin and by friends, and they will cill some among you,
QUENYA: Furthermore, you will be given over by parents and by brothers and by your kin and by friends, and they will cill some among you,

ENGLISH: and you will be hated by all because of my name.
QUENYA: and you will be hated by all because of my name.

ENGLISH: And yet a hair on your head will by no means be destroyed.
QUENYA: And yet a hair on your head will by no means be destroyed.

ENGLISH: By your faithfulness you will save your lives.
QUENYA: By your faithfulness you will save your lives.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, when you shall see Jerusalem surrounded by armies, know that her destruction has come near.
QUENYA: Furthermore, when you shall see Jerusalem surrounded by armies, know that her destruction has come near.

ENGLISH: Then it is necessary for that are in Judea to flee to the mountains, and for that are in the midst of the city to leave, and for that are in the regions not to go into it,
QUENYA: Then it is necessary for that are in Judea to flee to the mountains, and for that are in the midst of the city to leave, and for that are in the regions not to go into it,

ENGLISH: for those days are days of vengeance, to make true all things that have been written.
QUENYA: for those days are days of vengeance, to make true all things that have been written.

ENGLISH: Woe to the pregnant women and to those that suckle babies in those days! For shall come a great need on the land and wrath upon this people,
QUENYA: Woe to the pregnant women and to those that suckle babies in those days! For shall come a great need on the land and wrath upon this people,

ENGLISH: and they shall fall by the sword and will be led away into all the nations, and Jerusalem will be trampled under foot by all the nations, until the times of the nations shall be completed.
QUENYA: and they shall fall by the sword and will be led away into all the nations, and Jerusalem will be trampled under foot by all the nations, until the times of the nations shall be completed.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, there will be signs in Sun and Moon and stars, and on earth anxiety of nations that do not see escape, by reason of the noise of the sea and its uprising,
QUENYA: Furthermore, there will be signs in Sun and Moon and stars, and on earth anxiety of nations that do not see escape, by reason of the noise of the sea and its uprising,

ENGLISH: when men shall be sick with fear, foreseeing the things coming upon world. For the powers of heaven will be shaken.
QUENYA: when men shall be sick with fear, foreseeing the things coming upon world. For the powers of heaven will be shaken.

ENGLISH: And then they will see the Son of Man come in a cloud with power and great glory.
QUENYA: And then they will see the Son of Man come in a cloud with power and great glory.

ENGLISH: But when these things begin to happen, stand tall and raise your head, for your deliverance is coming near.
QUENYA: But when these things begin to happen, stand tall and raise your head, for your deliverance is coming near.

ENGLISH: And he spoke to them a comparison: “Notice the fig-tree and all the other trees:
QUENYA: And he spoke to them a comparison: “Notice the fig-tree and all the other trees:

ENGLISH: Also when they have twigs, you know to yourselves by examining that now the summer is near.
QUENYA: Also when they have twigs, you know to yourselves by examining that now the summer is near.

ENGLISH: Thus you will also know, when you shall see these things happen, that God's kingdom is near.
QUENYA: Thus you will also know, when you shall see these things happen, that God's kingdom is near.

ENGLISH: Truly I say to you: This generation will not pass before all things shall happen.
QUENYA: Truly I say to you: This generation will not pass before all things shall happen.

ENGLISH: Heaven and earth shall pass , but my words will not ever pass .
QUENYA: Heaven and earth shall pass , but my words will not ever pass .

ENGLISH: But watch yourselves, to stop your heart from being heavy with over-eating and over-drinking and the anxiety of life, and suddenly that day will come upon you
QUENYA: But watch yourselves, to stop your heart from being heavy with over-eating and over-drinking and the anxiety of life, and suddenly that day will come upon you

ENGLISH: like a snare. For it shall come upon all that dwell on the surface of the entire earth.
QUENYA: like a snare. For it shall come upon all that dwell on the surface of the entire earth.

ENGLISH: But be awake, always praying that you shall be able to excape all these things that will come, and stand before the Son of Man.”
QUENYA: But be awake, always praying that you shall be able to excape all these things that will come, and stand before the Son of Man.”

ENGLISH: In the days he was in the temple, teaching, but at night he went out and stayed at the mountain called Mount of Olives,
QUENYA: In the days he was in the temple, teaching, but at night he went out and stayed at the mountain called Mount of Olives,

ENGLISH: and the entire people came early to him in the temple to hear him.
QUENYA: and the entire people came early to him in the temple to hear him.

ENGLISH: Now the festival of Unleavened Breads, which is called Passover, was near.
QUENYA: Now the festival of Unleavened Breads, which is called Passover, was near.

ENGLISH: And the chief priests and the scribes sought how they could destroy him, since they feared the people.
QUENYA: And the chief priests and the scribes sought how they could destroy him, since they feared the people.

ENGLISH: But Satan went into Judas, the one called Iscariot, who was counted among the twelve,
QUENYA: But Satan went into Judas, the one called Iscariot, who was counted among the twelve,

ENGLISH: and he went away and spoke with the chief priests and the temple captains about how he was going to give him over to them.
QUENYA: and he went away and spoke with the chief priests and the temple captains about how he was going to give him over to them.

ENGLISH: Then they were happy and said that they were willing to give him money.
QUENYA: Then they were happy and said that they were willing to give him money.

ENGLISH: And he said yes to what they suggested and sought a good moment to give him over when was not a crowd with them.
QUENYA: And he said yes to what they suggested and sought a good moment to give him over when was not a crowd with them.

ENGLISH: Now came the day of unleavened breads, on which it was necessary to kill the lamb of passover,
QUENYA: Now came the day of unleavened breads, on which it was necessary to kill the lamb of passover,

ENGLISH: and he sent Peter and John, saying: “Go and prepare for us the passover, for us to eat.”
QUENYA: and he sent Peter and John, saying: “Go and prepare for us the passover, for us to eat.”

ENGLISH: They said to him: “Where do you wish that we are to make it ready?”
QUENYA: They said to him: “Where do you wish that we are to make it ready?”

ENGLISH: He said to them : “Behold, when you go into the city, a man who is carrying an earthen vessel will meet you . Follow him into the house into which he shall go.
QUENYA: He said to them : “Behold, when you go into the city, a man who is carrying an earthen vessel will meet you . Follow him into the house into which he shall go.

ENGLISH: And you are to say to who has the house: “The Teacher says to you: Where is the place where I can eat the passover with my disciples?”
QUENYA: And you are to say to who has the house: “The Teacher says to you: Where is the place where I can eat the passover with my disciples?”

ENGLISH: And that man will show you a big furnished upper room. Prepare there!”
QUENYA: And that man will show you a big furnished upper room. Prepare there!”

ENGLISH: And they went away and fount the things as he said to them , and they prepared for the passover.
QUENYA: And they went away and fount the things as he said to them , and they prepared for the passover.

ENGLISH: And when the time came, Jesus lay at the table, and the apostles with him.
QUENYA: And when the time came, Jesus lay at the table, and the apostles with him.

ENGLISH: And he said to them: “I have much desired to eat this passover with you before I suffer,
QUENYA: And he said to them: “I have much desired to eat this passover with you before I suffer,

ENGLISH: for I say to you: I will not eat it again before it shall be completed in God's kingdom.”
QUENYA: for I say to you: I will not eat it again before it shall be completed in God's kingdom.”

ENGLISH: And receiving a cup he gave thanks and said: “Take this and send it from person to person among you.
QUENYA: And receiving a cup he gave thanks and said: “Take this and send it from person to person among you.

ENGLISH: For I say to you: From now I shall not drink from the fruit of the vine before God's kingdom shall come.”
QUENYA: For I say to you: From now I shall not drink from the fruit of the vine before God's kingdom shall come.”

ENGLISH: Furthermore, he took a bread, gave thanks, broke it and said: “This is my body, that will be given on your behalf. Do this to recall me.”
QUENYA: Furthermore, he took a bread, gave thanks, broke it and said: “This is my body, that will be given on your behalf. Do this to recall me.”

ENGLISH: And the cup in the same manner after they ate the evening meal, he saying: “This cup is the new covenant by means of my body, which will be poured out on your behalf.
QUENYA: And the cup in the same manner after they ate the evening meal, he saying: “This cup is the new covenant by means of my body, which will be poured out on your behalf.

ENGLISH: But behold, my betrayer's hand is with me on the table.
QUENYA: But behold, my betrayer's hand is with me on the table.

ENGLISH: For the Son of Man is going away, as he is destined; and yet woe for the person through whom he is given over!”
QUENYA: For the Son of Man is going away, as he is destined; and yet woe for the person through whom he is given over!”

ENGLISH: Therefore they began to talk among themselves about who among them was that was going to do this thing.
QUENYA: Therefore they began to talk among themselves about who among them was that was going to do this thing.

ENGLISH: But was also a quarrel between them about who among them seemed to be the greatest.
QUENYA: But was also a quarrel between them about who among them seemed to be the greatest.

ENGLISH: But he said to them: “The kings of the nations are their lords, and that have power over them are called benefactors.
QUENYA: But he said to them: “The kings of the nations are their lords, and that have power over them are called benefactors.

ENGLISH: But you do not be so. It is necessary for who is the greatest among you to be like the youngest, and for who rules, to be like a servant.
QUENYA: But you do not be so. It is necessary for who is the greatest among you to be like the youngest, and for who rules, to be like a servant.

ENGLISH: For who is the greatest, who lies at the table or the servant? Is it not who lies at the table? But among you I am like the servant.
QUENYA: For who is the greatest, who lies at the table or the servant? Is it not who lies at the table? But among you I am like the servant.

ENGLISH: But you are that have remained with me in my trials,
QUENYA: But you are that have remained with me in my trials,

ENGLISH: and I make a covenant with you, like my Father has made with me a covenant, about a kingdom,
QUENYA: and I make a covenant with you, like my Father has made with me a covenant, about a kingdom,

ENGLISH: for you to eat and for you to drink at my table in my kingdom, and for you to sit on thones to judge the twelve tribes of Israel.
QUENYA: for you to eat and for you to drink at my table in my kingdom, and for you to sit on thones to judge the twelve tribes of Israel.

ENGLISH: Simon, Simon, behold! Satan has demanded to sift you like grain!
QUENYA: Simon, Simon, behold! Satan has demanded to sift you like grain!

ENGLISH: But I have prayed concerning you, that your faith will not be insufficient, and when at time you have returned, bring strength to your brothers.”
QUENYA: But I have prayed concerning you, that your faith will not be insufficient, and when at time you have returned, bring strength to your brothers.”

ENGLISH: Then he said to him: “Lord, I am ready to go with you into prison and death alike!”
QUENYA: Then he said to him: “Lord, I am ready to go with you into prison and death alike!”

ENGLISH: But he said: “I say to you, Peter: A cock will not sound today before you have said thrice that you do not know me.”
QUENYA: But he said: “I say to you, Peter: A cock will not sound today before you have said thrice that you do not know me.”

ENGLISH: And he said to them: “When I sent you without purse and food-box and shoes, surely you did not lack a single thing?” They said: “We did not.”
QUENYA: And he said to them: “When I sent you without purse and food-box and shoes, surely you did not lack a single thing?” They said: “We did not.”

ENGLISH: Then he said to them: “But now it is necessary for who has a purse to bring it, in the same manner a food-box, and it is necesssary for how lacks a sword to sell his cloak and get a sword for the money.
QUENYA: Then he said to them: “But now it is necessary for who has a purse to bring it, in the same manner a food-box, and it is necesssary for how lacks a sword to sell his cloak and get a sword for the money.

ENGLISH: For I say to you that it is necessary that this thing written about me will be made true: 'And he was counted among lawless ones.' For which concerns me will be completed.”
QUENYA: For I say to you that it is necessary that this thing written about me will be made true: 'And he was counted among lawless ones.' For which concerns me will be completed.”

ENGLISH: Then they said: “Lord, see, here are two swords.” He said to them: “They are enough.”
QUENYA: Then they said: “Lord, see, here are two swords.” He said to them: “They are enough.”

ENGLISH: After he went out he went, as his habit was, to the Mountain of Olives, and his disciples followed him.
QUENYA: After he went out he went, as his habit was, to the Mountain of Olives, and his disciples followed him.

ENGLISH: Having come to the place he said to them: “Pray, to stop yourselves from coming into temptation!”
QUENYA: Having come to the place he said to them: “Pray, to stop yourselves from coming into temptation!”

ENGLISH: And he went away from them, about a stone's throw, and he fell to his knees and prayed,
QUENYA: And he went away from them, about a stone's throw, and he fell to his knees and prayed,

ENGLISH: saying: “Father, if you wish, take this cup from me! And yet, may your will happen, not mine.”
QUENYA: saying: “Father, if you wish, take this cup from me! And yet, may your will happen, not mine.”

QUENYA: Then an angel from heaven showed himself to him and brought him strength.

QUENYA: But coming into an agony he prayed still more arduously, and his face was wet with what was like drops of blood, falling to the ground.

ENGLISH: And he arose from prayer, went to the discuples and found them asleep with grief,
QUENYA: And he arose from prayer, went to the discuples and found them asleep with grief,

ENGLISH: and he said to them: “What is your reason for being asleep? Rise and pray, to stop yourselves from coming into temptation!”
QUENYA: and he said to them: “What is your reason for being asleep? Rise and pray, to stop yourselves from coming into temptation!”

ENGLISH: While still he spoke, behold! a crowd, and the man called Judas, one of the twelve, went in front of them. He came to Jesus to kiss him.
QUENYA: While still he spoke, behold! a crowd, and the man called Judas, one of the twelve, went in front of them. He came to Jesus to kiss him.

QUENYA: But Jesus said to him: “Judas, do you betray the Son of Man with a kiss?”

ENGLISH: When the people with him saw what was going to happen, they said: “Lord, are we to strike with the sword?”
QUENYA: When the people with him saw what was going to happen, they said: “Lord, are we to strike with the sword?”

ENGLISH: And one among them struck the chief priest's slave and cut off his right ear.
QUENYA: And one among them struck the chief priest's slave and cut off his right ear.

ENGLISH: But in answer Jesus said: “Let this as well happen.” And he touched the ear and healed him.
QUENYA: But in answer Jesus said: “Let this as well happen.” And he touched the ear and healed him.

ENGLISH: Jesus then said to the chief priests and to the temple captains and to the elders that were come there to seize him: “Have you come having swords and clubs, as upon a robber?
QUENYA: Jesus then said to the chief priests and to the temple captains and to the elders that were come there to seize him: “Have you come having swords and clubs, as upon a robber?

ENGLISH: Day after day I was with you in the temple, and you did not put your hands on me. But this is your hour, and darkness rules.”
QUENYA: Day after day I was with you in the temple, and you did not put your hands on me. But this is your hour, and darkness rules.”

ENGLISH: Then they seized him andd led him away and brought him into the chief priests's house, but Peter followed nearby.
QUENYA: Then they seized him andd led him away and brought him into the chief priests's house, but Peter followed nearby.

ENGLISH: When they lit a fire in the middle of the courtyard and sat down together, Peter sat among them.
QUENYA: When they lit a fire in the middle of the courtyard and sat down together, Peter sat among them.

ENGLISH: But was a maidservant who saw him by the fire, and after watching Peter she said: “Also this man was with them.”
QUENYA: But was a maidservant who saw him by the fire, and after watching Peter she said: “Also this man was with them.”

ENGLISH: But he denied it, saying: “I do not know him, woman!”
QUENYA: But he denied it, saying: “I do not know him, woman!”

ENGLISH: After a short time another person, seeing him, said: “You as well one among them!” But Peter said: “Man, I am not!”
QUENYA: After a short time another person, seeing him, said: “You as well one among them!” But Peter said: “Man, I am not!”

ENGLISH: And after about an hour was past, another man said firmly: “Indeed this man was with him! He is also from Galilee!”
QUENYA: And after about an hour was past, another man said firmly: “Indeed this man was with him! He is also from Galilee!”

ENGLISH: But Peter said: “Man, I do not know what you are saying!” And in that moment, while he was still speaking, a cock sounded.
QUENYA: But Peter said: “Man, I do not know what you are saying!” And in that moment, while he was still speaking, a cock sounded.

ENGLISH: And the Lord turned and looked at Peter, and Peter recalled the saying of the Kord when he said to him: “Before a cock sounds today, you will deny me thrice.”
QUENYA: And the Lord turned and looked at Peter, and Peter recalled the saying of the Kord when he said to him: “Before a cock sounds today, you will deny me thrice.”

QUENYA: And he went outside and broke down in tears.

QUENYA: Now the men that had him in custody behaved towards with with scorn, striking him.

QUENYA: And after they covered him they asked: “Speak like a prophet! Who was that struck you?”

ENGLISH: And numerous other blasphemies they spoke to him.
QUENYA: And numerous other blasphemies they spoke to him.

ENGLISH: When the day came, the council of elders of the people, the chief priests and the scribes alike, assembled. And they drew him before their council, saying:
QUENYA: When the day came, the council of elders of the people, the chief priests and the scribes alike, assembled. And they drew him before their council, saying:

ENGLISH: “If you are the Christ, tell us!” But he said to them: “Also if I told you, you were by no means going to believe it.
QUENYA: “If you are the Christ, tell us!” But he said to them: “Also if I told you, you were by no means going to believe it.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, if I told you, you were by no means going to give me an answer.
QUENYA: Furthermore, if I told you, you were by no means going to give me an answer.

ENGLISH: But from now the Son of Man shall sit beside God's right hand of power.”
QUENYA: But from now the Son of Man shall sit beside God's right hand of power.”

ENGLISH: Then all among them said: “Are you, then, God's son?”
QUENYA: Then all among them said: “Are you, then, God's son?”

ENGLISH: He said to them: “You say that I am.”
QUENYA: He said to them: “You say that I am.”

ENGLISH: They said: “What more need do we have of witnesses? For we ourselves have heard it from his own mouth!”
QUENYA: They said: “What more need do we have of witnesses? For we ourselves have heard it from his own mouth!”

ENGLISH: And after their entire multitude arose, they led him to Pilate.
QUENYA: And after their entire multitude arose, they led him to Pilate.

ENGLISH: They began to speak about his supposed crimes, saying: “This man we have found subverting our nation and forbidding that anyone pay taxes to the High King, and he says about himself that he is Christ, a king.”
QUENYA: They began to speak about his supposed crimes, saying: “This man we have found subverting our nation and forbidding that anyone pay taxes to the High King, and he says about himself that he is Christ, a king.”

QUENYA: But Pilate asked him: “Are you king of Jews?” In answer he said: “You say it.”

ENGLISH: But Pilate said to the chief priests and to the crowds: “I do not find crime on this man.”
QUENYA: But Pilate said to the chief priests and to the crowds: “I do not find crime on this man.”

ENGLISH: But they pressed him, saying: “He stirs up the people, teaching through the entire Judea, and after beginning in Galilee he has come also here!”
QUENYA: But they pressed him, saying: “He stirs up the people, teaching through the entire Judea, and after beginning in Galilee he has come also here!”

ENGLISH: But Pilate, when he heard that, asked if the man was from Galilee.
QUENYA: But Pilate, when he heard that, asked if the man was from Galilee.

ENGLISH: And after he knew that he was indeed from Herod's kingdom, he sent him to Herod, since also he was in Jerusalem in those days.
QUENYA: And after he knew that he was indeed from Herod's kingdom, he sent him to Herod, since also he was in Jerusalem in those days.

ENGLISH: But Herod, when he saw Jesus, had great joy, for beforehand he long wished to meet him, after hearing about him, and he had the hope that he was going to see a sign happen by him.
QUENYA: But Herod, when he saw Jesus, had great joy, for beforehand he long wished to meet him, after hearing about him, and he had the hope that he was going to see a sign happen by him.

ENGLISH: He asked him many questions, but he answered him nothing.
QUENYA: He asked him many questions, but he answered him nothing.

ENGLISH: But the chief priests and the scribes arose and talked about crimes that they said he did.
QUENYA: But the chief priests and the scribes arose and talked about crimes that they said he did.

ENGLISH: Then Herod and his guards thought that he was nothing, and in mockery they covered him with a bright garment and sent him back to Pilate.
QUENYA: Then Herod and his guards thought that he was nothing, and in mockery they covered him with a bright garment and sent him back to Pilate.

ENGLISH: On that day Herod and Pilate started a friendship, one with the other, for before this they were enemies.
QUENYA: On that day Herod and Pilate started a friendship, one with the other, for before this they were enemies.

ENGLISH: Pilate then assembled the chief priests and the people
QUENYA: Pilate then assembled the chief priests and the people

ENGLISH: and said to them: “You brought this man to me as one who stirs up the people, and behold! I examined him before you, but I did not find in him guilt concerning the things that you say he has done.
QUENYA: and said to them: “You brought this man to me as one who stirs up the people, and behold! I examined him before you, but I did not find in him guilt concerning the things that you say he has done.

ENGLISH: Indeed also Herod did not , for he sent him back to us, and behold! nothing worthy of death has been done by him.
QUENYA: Indeed also Herod did not , for he sent him back to us, and behold! nothing worthy of death has been done by him.

ENGLISH: Therefore I will chastise him; then I will release him.
QUENYA: Therefore I will chastise him; then I will release him.

ENGLISH: But their entire host cried: “Take away this man, but release to us Barabbas!”
QUENYA: But their entire host cried: “Take away this man, but release to us Barabbas!”

ENGLISH: He was a man thrown into prison by reason of an uprising that had happened in the city, and of murder.
QUENYA: He was a man thrown into prison by reason of an uprising that had happened in the city, and of murder.

ENGLISH: Again Pilate called them, since he wanted to release Jesus.
QUENYA: Again Pilate called them, since he wanted to release Jesus.

ENGLISH: Then they cried, saying: “Crucify him, crucify him!”
QUENYA: Then they cried, saying: “Crucify him, crucify him!”

ENGLISH: For the third time he said to them: “Than what evil has this man done? Nothing worthy of death I found in him. After giving him chastisement I will therefore release him.”
QUENYA: For the third time he said to them: “Than what evil has this man done? Nothing worthy of death I found in him. After giving him chastisement I will therefore release him.”

ENGLISH: But they pressed him with loud shouts, demanding his crucifixion, and their shouts prevailed.
QUENYA: But they pressed him with loud shouts, demanding his crucifixion, and their shouts prevailed.

ENGLISH: And Pilate judged that they were going to get what they wanted.
QUENYA: And Pilate judged that they were going to get what they wanted.

QUENYA: He released to them the man thrown into prison because of an uprising and because of murder, whom they asked for, but Jesus he gave over to their will.

ENGLISH: And when they led him away, they seized a person called Simon from Cyrene who came from the fields, and they compelled him to carry his cross.
QUENYA: And when they led him away, they seized a person called Simon from Cyrene who came from the fields, and they compelled him to carry his cross.

ENGLISH: But followed him a great multitude from the people, and some women that struck themselves with grief and were wailing for him.
QUENYA: But followed him a great multitude from the people, and some women that struck themselves with grief and were wailing for him.

ENGLISH: Jesus turned towards them and said: “Daughters of Jerusalem, do not be wailing for me! Be wailing for yourselves and for your children, for behold! days are coming in which people will say: 'Happy are the women without fruit, and the wombs that did not conceive and he nipples that did not suckle!'
QUENYA: Jesus turned towards them and said: “Daughters of Jerusalem, do not be wailing for me! Be wailing for yourselves and for your children, for behold! days are coming in which people will say: 'Happy are the women without fruit, and the wombs that did not conceive and he nipples that did not suckle!'

QUENYA: Then they will begin to say to the mountains: 'Fall upon us!', and to the hills: 'Cover us!'

ENGLISH: For if they do thest things when the tree is moist, what will happen when it has withered?”
QUENYA: For if they do thest things when the tree is moist, what will happen when it has withered?”

QUENYA: But two other men, evildoers, were also led thither to be slain with him.

QUENYA: But Jesus said: “Father, forgive them, for they do not know what they are doing.” Furthermore, to distribute his garments they threw lots.

ENGLISH: And the people watched. But the rulers talked with mockery, saying: “Others he has saved; let him save himself, if this man is God's Christ, the chosen one.”
QUENYA: And the people watched. But the rulers talked with mockery, saying: “Others he has saved; let him save himself, if this man is God's Christ, the chosen one.”

QUENYA: Also the soldiers behaved towards him with scorn. They came near and presented him with sour wine

QUENYA: and said: “If you are king of Jews, save yourself!”

QUENYA: Also was a writing above him: “This is the king of Jews.”

QUENYA: But one of the hanging evildoers blasphemed him: ”Are you not the Christ? Save yourself and us!”

QUENYA: In answer the other rebuked him and said: ”Do you not fear God, now that you are under the same judgement?

QUENYA: And we justly so, for we are receiving that to which we are worthy by the things that we have done, but this man has done nothing evil.”

QUENYA: And he said to him: “Jesus, recall me when you come in your kingdom!”

ENGLISH: And he said to him: “Truly I say to you: Today you will be with be in Paradise.”
QUENYA: And he said to him: “Truly I say to you: Today you will be with be in Paradise.”

QUENYA: Now the hour was around the eighth, and darkness fell upon the entire earth until the ninth hour,

QUENYA: since the sunlight failed. Then the curtain in the temple was torn down the middle.

QUENYA: And crying with a mighty voice, Jesus said: “Father, into your hands I give over my spirit!” After saying that he expired.

QUENYA: When the centurion saw what happened, he gave glory to God and said: “Truly this man was just!”

ENGLISH: And all the crowds that were gathered for this sight, when they saw that happened, went away beating their chest.
QUENYA: And all the crowds that were gathered for this sight, when they saw that happened, went away beating their chest.

QUENYA: But that knew Jesus stood far away, also the women that came with him from Galilee, watching these things.

ENGLISH: And came a man whose name was Joseph, a person of the Council, a good and just man.
QUENYA: And came a man whose name was Joseph, a person of the Council, a good and just man.

ENGLISH: He did not say yes to their plan or their deed. He came from Arimathea, a city of the Jews, and looked forward to God's kingdom.
QUENYA: He did not say yes to their plan or their deed. He came from Arimathea, a city of the Jews, and looked forward to God's kingdom.

ENGLISH: After going inside to Pilate he asked for Jesus' body.
QUENYA: After going inside to Pilate he asked for Jesus' body.

ENGLISH: And he took it down and wrapped it with linen, and he put him in a carved-out tomb in the rock, in which no one had lain before.
QUENYA: And he took it down and wrapped it with linen, and he put him in a carved-out tomb in the rock, in which no one had lain before.

ENGLISH: This was the day of Preparation, and the beginning of the sabbath was near.
QUENYA: This was the day of Preparation, and the beginning of the sabbath was near.

ENGLISH: But the women that came with him from Galilee followed and saw the tomb and the place where his body was placed.
QUENYA: But the women that came with him from Galilee followed and saw the tomb and the place where his body was placed.

ENGLISH: Then they went back to prepare spices and fragrant oils. But they rested on the sabbath, according to the commandment.
QUENYA: Then they went back to prepare spices and fragrant oils. But they rested on the sabbath, according to the commandment.

ENGLISH: On the first day of the week they went very early to the tomb, bearing the spices prepared by them.
QUENYA: On the first day of the week they went very early to the tomb, bearing the spices prepared by them.

ENGLISH: But they found the stone rolled away from the grave, and when they went inside, they did not find the body of the Lord Jesus Christ.
QUENYA: But they found the stone rolled away from the grave, and when they went inside, they did not find the body of the Lord Jesus Christ.

ENGLISH: While they were in wonder about this, behold! two men with radiant garments stood beside them.

QUENYA: Then the Pharisees went out, and they were quick to make plans against him with the Herodians, to undo him.

ENGLISH: But Jesus and his disciples returned to the sea, and a great host from Galillee and Judea followed him.
QUENYA: But Jesus and his disciples returned to the sea, and a great host from Galillee and Judea followed him.

ENGLISH: Also from Jerusalem and Idumea and from beyond Jordan and from the region around Tyre and Sidon a great host came to him, since they heard about all the things that he did.
QUENYA: Also from Jerusalem and Idumea and from beyond Jordan and from the region around Tyre and Sidon a great host came to him, since they heard about all the things that he did.

ENGLISH: And he said to his disciples that they were to have a boat ready for him, to stop the crowd from pressing in on him.
QUENYA: And he said to his disciples that they were to have a boat ready for him, to stop the crowd from pressing in on him.

ENGLISH: For he healed numerous ones, and so all that had painful illnesses fell upon him in order to touch him.
QUENYA: For he healed numerous ones, and so all that had painful illnesses fell upon him in order to touch him.

ENGLISH: And the unclean spirits, whenever they saw him, threw themselves down before him and cried , saying: “You are the Son of God!”
QUENYA: And the unclean spirits, whenever they saw him, threw themselves down before him and cried , saying: “You are the Son of God!”

ENGLISH: But with many words he spoke firmly to them, to stop them from making him known.
QUENYA: But with many words he spoke firmly to them, to stop them from making him known.

ENGLISH: And he went up into a mountain and called to himself the people he wanted, and they went to him.
QUENYA: And he went up into a mountain and called to himself the people he wanted, and they went to him.

ENGLISH: And he chose twelve, whom he also called apostles, for them to be with him and for him to sent them out to preach
QUENYA: And he chose twelve, whom he also called apostles, for them to be with him and for him to sent them out to preach

ENGLISH: and for them to have the power of throwing out demons.
QUENYA: and for them to have the power of throwing out demons.

ENGLISH: And the twelve that he chose were Simon, to whom he gave the after-name Peter,
QUENYA: And the twelve that he chose were Simon, to whom he gave the after-name Peter,

ENGLISH: and John the son of Zebedee and John Jacob's brother – to whom he gave the after-name Boanerges, which means Sons of Thunder –
QUENYA: and John the son of Zebedee and John Jacob's brother – to whom he gave the after-name Boanerges, which means Sons of Thunder –

ENGLISH: and Andrew and Philip and Bartholomew and Mathhew and Jacob the son of Alpheus, and Thaddeus, and Simon the Cananite,
QUENYA: and Andrew and Philip and Bartholomew and Mathhew and Jacob the son of Alpheus, and Thaddeus, and Simon the Cananite,

ENGLISH: and Judas Iscariot, who after betrayed him.
QUENYA: and Judas Iscariot, who after betrayed him.

ENGLISH: And he went into a house.
QUENYA: And he went into a house.

ENGLISH: Again the crowd gathered, and so it was not even possible for them to eat their food.
QUENYA: Again the crowd gathered, and so it was not even possible for them to eat their food.

ENGLISH: But when his family heard it, they went to seize him, for they said: “He had gone out of his mind!”
QUENYA: But when his family heard it, they went to seize him, for they said: “He had gone out of his mind!”

ENGLISH: Furthermore, the scribes that came down from Jerusalem said: “He is possessed by Beelsebub, and he throws the demons out by the power of the lord of the demons!”
QUENYA: Furthermore, the scribes that came down from Jerusalem said: “He is possessed by Beelsebub, and he throws the demons out by the power of the lord of the demons!”

ENGLISH: And after calling them to himself, he said to them by means of comparisons: “How can Satan throw Satan out?
QUENYA: And after calling them to himself, he said to them by means of comparisons: “How can Satan throw Satan out?

ENGLISH: For if a kingdom is split against itself, that kingdom cannot stand;
QUENYA: For if a kingdom is split against itself, that kingdom cannot stand;

ENGLISH: and if a house is split against itself, that house will not be able to stand.
QUENYA: and if a house is split against itself, that house will not be able to stand.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, if Satan has arisen against himself and is split, he cannot stand, but is coming to his end.
QUENYA: Furthermore, if Satan has arisen against himself and is split, he cannot stand, but is coming to his end.

ENGLISH: Indeed no one who has come into a strong man's house can steal his goods if he does not first bind the strong man, and then he will steal the things in his house.
QUENYA: Indeed no one who has come into a strong man's house can steal his goods if he does not first bind the strong man, and then he will steal the things in his house.

ENGLISH: Truly I say to you that all things will be forgiven to men, all the sins and blasphemies with which they blaspheme.
QUENYA: Truly I say to you that all things will be forgiven to men, all the sins and blasphemies with which they blaspheme.

ENGLISH: But anyone who blasphemes against the Holy Spirit will not ever receive forgiveness, but carries the guilt of eternal sin.”
QUENYA: But anyone who blasphemes against the Holy Spirit will not ever receive forgiveness, but carries the guilt of eternal sin.”

ENGLISH: That he said because they said: “He has an unclean spirit.”
QUENYA: That he said because they said: “He has an unclean spirit.”

ENGLISH: Now his mother and his brothers came, and standing on the outside they sent inside to him, to call him .
QUENYA: Now his mother and his brothers came, and standing on the outside they sent inside to him, to call him .

ENGLISH: A crowd sat around him, and they said to him: “Behold! Your mother and your brothers on the outside are seeking you.”
QUENYA: A crowd sat around him, and they said to him: “Behold! Your mother and your brothers on the outside are seeking you.”

ENGLISH: But he answered them: “Who are my mother and my brothers?”
QUENYA: But he answered them: “Who are my mother and my brothers?”

ENGLISH: And after looking from person to person among who sat around him in a circle, he said: “Behold my mother and my brothers!
QUENYA: And after looking from person to person among who sat around him in a circle, he said: “Behold my mother and my brothers!

ENGLISH: Anyone who does God's will, (s)he is my brother and my sister and my mother.”
QUENYA: Anyone who does God's will, (s)he is my brother and my sister and my mother.”

ENGLISH: And again he began to teach by the sea. A great host gathered near to him, and therefore he went into a boat and sat in the sea, but the whole crowd by the sea was on the shore.
QUENYA: And again he began to teach by the sea. A great host gathered near to him, and therefore he went into a boat and sat in the sea, but the whole crowd by the sea was on the shore.

ENGLISH: And he taught them numerous things by comparisons and said to them in his teaching:
QUENYA: And he taught them numerous things by comparisons and said to them in his teaching:

ENGLISH: “Listen! Behold, the sower went out to sow.
QUENYA: “Listen! Behold, the sower went out to sow.

ENGLISH: And in his sowing some seeds fell by the road, and the birds came and ate them.
QUENYA: And in his sowing some seeds fell by the road, and the birds came and ate them.

ENGLISH: Other seeds fell upon the rock, where they did not have deep soil, and they rose up quickly , for lacking deep soil.
QUENYA: Other seeds fell upon the rock, where they did not have deep soil, and they rose up quickly , for lacking deep soil.

ENGLISH: But when the Sun arose, they were burnt , and for lacking root they withered.
QUENYA: But when the Sun arose, they were burnt , and for lacking root they withered.

ENGLISH: Other seeds fell among the thorns, and the thorns came up and strangled them, and they did not give fruit.
QUENYA: Other seeds fell among the thorns, and the thorns came up and strangled them, and they did not give fruit.

ENGLISH: But others fell upon the good earth, and they arose and grew and made fruit, and they bore added measures, thirty and sixty and a hundred.”
QUENYA: But others fell upon the good earth, and they arose and grew and made fruit, and they bore added measures, thirty and sixty and a hundred.”

ENGLISH: And he said: “Who has ears for hearing, let him hear!”
QUENYA: And he said: “Who has ears for hearing, let him hear!”

ENGLISH: And when he was alone, the people around him with the twelve asked him about the comparisons.
QUENYA: And when he was alone, the people around him with the twelve asked him about the comparisons.

ENGLISH: And he said to them: “To you the secret of the kingdom of heaven is given, but to those who are on the outside everything happens in comparison,
QUENYA: And he said to them: “To you the secret of the kingdom of heaven is given, but to those who are on the outside everything happens in comparison,

ENGLISH: so that they can look and look, but not see, and so that they can hear and hear, but not understand – not ever turning themselves around, and so receiving forgiveness.
QUENYA: so that they can look and look, but not see, and so that they can hear and hear, but not understand – not ever turning themselves around, and so receiving forgiveness.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, he said to them: “You do not know this comparison; then how will you understand all the other comparisons?
QUENYA: Furthermore, he said to them: “You do not know this comparison; then how will you understand all the other comparisons?

ENGLISH: The sower sows the word.
QUENYA: The sower sows the word.

ENGLISH: who are by the road are the people in whom the word is sown, but when they hear it, Satan comes in the same moment and takes away the word that was sown in them.
QUENYA: who are by the road are the people in whom the word is sown, but when they hear it, Satan comes in the same moment and takes away the word that was sown in them.

ENGLISH: And in the same manner, these people are the ones sown on the rock: In the moment that they hear the word, they receive it with joy.
QUENYA: And in the same manner, these people are the ones sown on the rock: In the moment that they hear the word, they receive it with joy.

ENGLISH: But they do not have root in themselves, but remain for a time; then, as soon as tribulation or persecution happens by the word, they fall away.
QUENYA: But they do not have root in themselves, but remain for a time; then, as soon as tribulation or persecution happens by the word, they fall away.

ENGLISH: Others are the ones sown among the thorns; these are who have heard the word,
QUENYA: Others are the ones sown among the thorns; these are who have heard the word,

ENGLISH: but the concerns of this world and the temptation of riches and the desires for the other things come in and choke the world, and it does not give fruit.
QUENYA: but the concerns of this world and the temptation of riches and the desires for the other things come in and choke the world, and it does not give fruit.

ENGLISH: But the ones sown on good soil are who listen to the word and receive it and bear fruit – one, thirty added measures, and another, sixty, and another, a hundred.
QUENYA: But the ones sown on good soil are who listen to the word and receive it and bear fruit – one, thirty added measures, and another, sixty, and another, a hundred.

ENGLISH: And he said to them: “Surely a lamp is not brought to be put under a box or under a bed? Is it not brought to be put on the lampstand?
QUENYA: And he said to them: “Surely a lamp is not brought to be put under a box or under a bed? Is it not brought to be put on the lampstand?

ENGLISH: For there is nothing that is hidden except in order to be revealed; nothing has been concealed except for it to come into the open.
QUENYA: For there is nothing that is hidden except in order to be revealed; nothing has been concealed except for it to come into the open.

ENGLISH: If anyone has ears to hear , let him hear.”
QUENYA: If anyone has ears to hear , let him hear.”

ENGLISH: And he said to them: “Heed what you are hearing: By the measure with which you measure will be measured to you; indeed more will be added to you.
QUENYA: And he said to them: “Heed what you are hearing: By the measure with which you measure will be measured to you; indeed more will be added to you.

ENGLISH: For who has, to him will be given; and who does not have, also what he has will be taken from him.”
QUENYA: For who has, to him will be given; and who does not have, also what he has will be taken from him.”

ENGLISH: And he said: “Thus God's kingdom is like when a man throws seed upon the earth,
QUENYA: And he said: “Thus God's kingdom is like when a man throws seed upon the earth,

ENGLISH: and he is asleep at night and rises at day, and the seed sprouts and grows tall – the man does not know how.
QUENYA: and he is asleep at night and rises at day, and the seed sprouts and grows tall – the man does not know how.

ENGLISH: By itself the earth bears fruit: first leaves, then it makes head of the straw, finally full grain in head of the straw.
QUENYA: By itself the earth bears fruit: first leaves, then it makes head of the straw, finally full grain in head of the straw.

ENGLISH: As soon as the fruit is ripe, the man sends the sickle, since the harvest has come.
QUENYA: As soon as the fruit is ripe, the man sends the sickle, since the harvest has come.

ENGLISH: And he said: “With what shall we compare God's kingdom, and what is the comparison that we shall make concerning it?
QUENYA: And he said: “With what shall we compare God's kingdom, and what is the comparison that we shall make concerning it?

ENGLISH: It is like a seed of mustard, which at the time that it is sown in the earth is the smallest of all seeds which are on earth –
QUENYA: It is like a seed of mustard, which at the time that it is sown in the earth is the smallest of all seeds which are on earth –

ENGLISH: but when it is sown, it comes up to be larger than all other vegetables and makes huge branches, until heaven's birds can dwell in its shadow.”
QUENYA: but when it is sown, it comes up to be larger than all other vegetables and makes huge branches, until heaven's birds can dwell in its shadow.”

ENGLISH: Thus with many such comparisons he spoke to them the word, everything that they could listen to.
QUENYA: Thus with many such comparisons he spoke to them the word, everything that they could listen to.

ENGLISH: Except by a comparison he did not speak to them, but when he was alone with his disciples, he gave them insight concerning all things.
QUENYA: Except by a comparison he did not speak to them, but when he was alone with his disciples, he gave them insight concerning all things.

ENGLISH: And on that day, when evening had come, he said to his disciples: “Let us cross to the other shore.”
QUENYA: And on that day, when evening had come, he said to his disciples: “Let us cross to the other shore.”

ENGLISH: And after sending away the crowd he their brought him with them using the boat in which he sat, and were other boats with him.
QUENYA: And after sending away the crowd he their brought him with them using the boat in which he sat, and were other boats with him.

ENGLISH: Then a mighty storm arose, and the waves beat into the boat, until the boat was near to being filled.
QUENYA: Then a mighty storm arose, and the waves beat into the boat, until the boat was near to being filled.

ENGLISH: But he was in the back of the boat, asleep on a pillow, and they woke him up and said to him: “Lord, is it not important to you that we are dying?”
QUENYA: But he was in the back of the boat, asleep on a pillow, and they woke him up and said to him: “Lord, is it not important to you that we are dying?”

ENGLISH: Then he roused himself and spoke firmly to the wind and said to the sea: “Be silent, be at rest!” And the wind ceased, and was a great silence.
QUENYA: Then he roused himself and spoke firmly to the wind and said to the sea: “Be silent, be at rest!” And the wind ceased, and was a great silence.

ENGLISH: And he said to them: “How is it you are fearful? Do you still not have faith?”
QUENYA: And he said to them: “How is it you are fearful? Do you still not have faith?”

ENGLISH: But great fear seized them, and they said one to the other: “Who indeed is he, since also wind and sea do as he says?”
QUENYA: But great fear seized them, and they said one to the other: “Who indeed is he, since also wind and sea do as he says?”

ENGLISH: And they came to the other shore of the sea, into region of the Gerasenes.
QUENYA: And they came to the other shore of the sea, into region of the Gerasenes.

ENGLISH: In the same moment that they left the boat, a man having an unclean spirit met them, coming from the tombs.
QUENYA: In the same moment that they left the boat, a man having an unclean spirit met them, coming from the tombs.

ENGLISH: He had his haunt among the graves, and until that time no one yet could bind him, also not with fetters.
QUENYA: He had his haunt among the graves, and until that time no one yet could bind him, also not with fetters.

ENGLISH: Numerous times he was bound with bonds on his feet and with chains, but he tore the fetters and broke the bonds, and no one had the strenght to control him.
QUENYA: Numerous times he was bound with bonds on his feet and with chains, but he tore the fetters and broke the bonds, and no one had the strenght to control him.

ENGLISH: Always, at night and at day, he was among the graves and in the mountains, crying and beating himself with stones.
QUENYA: Always, at night and at day, he was among the graves and in the mountains, crying and beating himself with stones.

ENGLISH: When he saw Jesus from afar, he ran and fell down before him.
QUENYA: When he saw Jesus from afar, he ran and fell down before him.

ENGLISH: Crying with a great voice he said: “What is to me and to you, Jesus, son of God Highest? I put you under oath by God, do not torment me!”
QUENYA: Crying with a great voice he said: “What is to me and to you, Jesus, son of God Highest? I put you under oath by God, do not torment me!”

ENGLISH: For Jesus said to him: “Unclean spirit, come out of the man!”
QUENYA: For Jesus said to him: “Unclean spirit, come out of the man!”

ENGLISH: And he asked him: “What is your name?” And he answered: “My name is Legion, for we are numerous.”
QUENYA: And he asked him: “What is your name?” And he answered: “My name is Legion, for we are numerous.”

ENGLISH: Then he urgently prayed that Jesus would not send them out of the region.
QUENYA: Then he urgently prayed that Jesus would not send them out of the region.

ENGLISH: But there was there by the mountain a huge pig-herd eating .
QUENYA: But there was there by the mountain a huge pig-herd eating .

ENGLISH: And they petitioned him, saying: “Send us into the pigs, so we can come into them!”
QUENYA: And they petitioned him, saying: “Send us into the pigs, so we can come into them!”

ENGLISH: And he allowed them. Then the unclean spirits came out and went into the pigs, and the herd went rushing over the edge into the sea, a number around two thousand, and they drowned in the sea.
QUENYA: And he allowed them. Then the unclean spirits came out and went into the pigs, and the herd went rushing over the edge into the sea, a number around two thousand, and they drowned in the sea.

ENGLISH: But their herders looking after them fled and told it in the city and in the fields, and people came to see what had happened.
QUENYA: But their herders looking after them fled and told it in the city and in the fields, and people came to see what had happened.

ENGLISH: Thus they came to Jesus, and they saw the man who previously was demon-possessed sitting in health of mind, he who formerly was possessed by the legion, and they were terrified.
QUENYA: Thus they came to Jesus, and they saw the man who previously was demon-possessed sitting in health of mind, he who formerly was possessed by the legion, and they were terrified.

ENGLISH: who saw it told them about which had happened to the demon-possessed and to the pigs.
QUENYA: who saw it told them about which had happened to the demon-possessed and to the pigs.

ENGLISH: And they started to petition him, for him to leave their regions .
QUENYA: And they started to petition him, for him to leave their regions .

ENGLISH: When he went into the boat, the man who formerly was demon-possessed asked to be with Jesus.
QUENYA: When he went into the boat, the man who formerly was demon-possessed asked to be with Jesus.

ENGLISH: But he did not allow him, but said to him: “Go to your house and to your kin, and tell them about everything that the Lord has done to you and the mercy that he had on you.”
QUENYA: But he did not allow him, but said to him: “Go to your house and to your kin, and tell them about everything that the Lord has done to you and the mercy that he had on you.”

ENGLISH: And he went away and started to make known througout the Ten Cities everything that Jesus did for him, and all were filled with wonder.
QUENYA: And he went away and started to make known througout the Ten Cities everything that Jesus did for him, and all were filled with wonder.

ENGLISH: After Jesus again crossed to the other side with the boat, a large host gathered to him, and he was beside the sea.
QUENYA: After Jesus again crossed to the other side with the boat, a large host gathered to him, and he was beside the sea.

ENGLISH: Now came one of the synagogue chiefs, whose name was Jairus. Seeing Jesus he fell down before his feet
QUENYA: Now came one of the synagogue chiefs, whose name was Jairus. Seeing Jesus he fell down before his feet

ENGLISH: and petitioned him with urgency, saying: “My little daughter is at life's brink ! Come and put your hands on her, for her to be saved and keep her life!”
QUENYA: and petitioned him with urgency, saying: “My little daughter is at life's brink ! Come and put your hands on her, for her to be saved and keep her life!”

ENGLISH: Then he went off with him. And a large crowd followed him, pressing towards him.
QUENYA: Then he went off with him. And a large crowd followed him, pressing towards him.
