ENGLISH: And were there a woman tormented by a stream of blood for twelve years.
QUENYA: And were there a woman tormented by a stream of blood for twelve years.

ENGLISH: She was put to many pains by many healers, and after using everything that she had she received nothing helpful; on the contrary, she was now more ill.
QUENYA: She was put to many pains by many healers, and after using everything that she had she received nothing helpful; on the contrary, she was now more ill.

ENGLISH: When she heard about Jesus, she came behind him in the crowd and touched his robe,
QUENYA: When she heard about Jesus, she came behind him in the crowd and touched his robe,

ENGLISH: for she said to herself: “If I just touch his robe, I shall be healed!”
QUENYA: for she said to herself: “If I just touch his robe, I shall be healed!”

ENGLISH: And in the same moment the stream of blood ceased, and she perceived in her body that she was healed from her painful illness.
QUENYA: And in the same moment the stream of blood ceased, and she perceived in her body that she was healed from her painful illness.

ENGLISH: In the same moment Jesus perceived in himself how power went out from him, and he turned and said: “Who touched my robe?”
QUENYA: In the same moment Jesus perceived in himself how power went out from him, and he turned and said: “Who touched my robe?”

ENGLISH: But his disciples sait to him: “You are seeing the crowd press against you, and then you say: Who touched me?”
QUENYA: But his disciples sait to him: “You are seeing the crowd press against you, and then you say: Who touched me?”

ENGLISH: But he looked around himself to see the person who did this.
QUENYA: But he looked around himself to see the person who did this.

ENGLISH: But the woman, terrified and trembling, knowing which had happened to her, came and fell down before him and told him the whole truth.
QUENYA: But the woman, terrified and trembling, knowing which had happened to her, came and fell down before him and told him the whole truth.

ENGLISH: Jesus said to her: “Daughter, your faith has saved you. Go in peace, and be in health from your painful illness.”
QUENYA: Jesus said to her: “Daughter, your faith has saved you. Go in peace, and be in health from your painful illness.”

ENGLISH: Before he finished speaking, some came from the house of the synagogue ruler and said: “Your daugher is dead. Why are you still troubling the teacher?”
QUENYA: Before he finished speaking, some came from the house of the synagogue ruler and said: “Your daugher is dead. Why are you still troubling the teacher?”

ENGLISH: But Jesus, hearing which was said, said to the synagoge ruler: “Do not fear, only believe!”
QUENYA: But Jesus, hearing which was said, said to the synagoge ruler: “Do not fear, only believe!”

ENGLISH: Now he did not allow anyone to come with him except Peter and Jacob and John, Jacob's brother.
QUENYA: Now he did not allow anyone to come with him except Peter and Jacob and John, Jacob's brother.

ENGLISH: And they came to the house of the synagogue ruler, and he noticed the clamour and the wailing people and those who shouted with many wailings,
QUENYA: And they came to the house of the synagogue ruler, and he noticed the clamour and the wailing people and those who shouted with many wailings,

ENGLISH: and going in he said to them: “What is your reason for making clamour and wailing? The child has not died, but she is asleep.”
QUENYA: and going in he said to them: “What is your reason for making clamour and wailing? The child has not died, but she is asleep.”

ENGLISH: Then they laughed at him with scorn. But he, after sending them all outside, brought the child's father and mother and who were with him, and he went to the room where the child was.
QUENYA: Then they laughed at him with scorn. But he, after sending them all outside, brought the child's father and mother and who were with him, and he went to the room where the child was.

ENGLISH: And taking the child's hand he said to her: Talitha cumi!, which means: “Maiden, I am saying to you, rise!”
QUENYA: And taking the child's hand he said to her: Talitha cumi!, which means: “Maiden, I am saying to you, rise!”

ENGLISH: And in that moment the maiden arose and walked, for she had twelve years. Then, in the same moment, they were beside themselves with great wonder.
QUENYA: And in that moment the maiden arose and walked, for she had twelve years. Then, in the same moment, they were beside themselves with great wonder.

ENGLISH: But he commanded them again and again: “Do not let anyone know this!”, and he said that they were to give the maiden something to eat.
QUENYA: But he commanded them again and again: “Do not let anyone know this!”, and he said that they were to give the maiden something to eat.

ENGLISH: And he went away from there and came to his home territory , and his disciples followed him.
QUENYA: And he went away from there and came to his home territory , and his disciples followed him.

ENGLISH: When the day of rest came, he started to instruct in the synagogue, and numerous ones among who listened marveled, and they said: “From where did this man receive these things? And what this wisdom that has been given to this man, and such mighty doings that happen by his hands?
QUENYA: When the day of rest came, he started to instruct in the synagogue, and numerous ones among who listened marveled, and they said: “From where did this man receive these things? And what this wisdom that has been given to this man, and such mighty doings that happen by his hands?

ENGLISH: Is he not the carpenter, Mary's son, and the brother of Jacob and Joseph and Judas and Simon? And are his sisters not here with us?” And they would not receive him.
QUENYA: Is he not the carpenter, Mary's son, and the brother of Jacob and Joseph and Judas and Simon? And are his sisters not here with us?” And they would not receive him.

ENGLISH: But Jesus said to them: “A prophet does not lack praise except at his and among his kin and in his own house.”
QUENYA: But Jesus said to them: “A prophet does not lack praise except at his and among his kin and in his own house.”

ENGLISH: And he could not do a single great deed there, except that he put his hands on a few sick ones and healed them.
QUENYA: And he could not do a single great deed there, except that he put his hands on a few sick ones and healed them.

ENGLISH: And he was in wonder about their lack of faith. Then he went from place to place in a circle to the villages, teaching.
QUENYA: And he was in wonder about their lack of faith. Then he went from place to place in a circle to the villages, teaching.

ENGLISH: Now he summoned the twelve, and he began sending them , two and two , and he gave them power over the unclean spirits.
QUENYA: Now he summoned the twelve, and he began sending them , two and two , and he gave them power over the unclean spirits.

ENGLISH: And he commanded them to carry nothing for the journey except a staff alone – not bread, not a food-pouch, not copper in the belt,
QUENYA: And he commanded them to carry nothing for the journey except a staff alone – not bread, not a food-pouch, not copper in the belt,

ENGLISH: but they were to bind on themselves shoes, and it was not permitted to them to carry two tunics.
QUENYA: but they were to bind on themselves shoes, and it was not permitted to them to carry two tunics.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, he said to them: “Every house into which you come, remain there until you go away from that place.
QUENYA: Furthermore, he said to them: “Every house into which you come, remain there until you go away from that place.

ENGLISH: And at every place that does not receive you or hear you, when you go away from there shake off the dust which clings under your feet, as a witness to them.”
QUENYA: And at every place that does not receive you or hear you, when you go away from there shake off the dust which clings under your feet, as a witness to them.”

ENGLISH: And they went and preached to people for them to find repentance ,
QUENYA: And they went and preached to people for them to find repentance ,

ENGLISH: and they threw out many demons and annointed many sick ones with oil and healed them.
QUENYA: and they threw out many demons and annointed many sick ones with oil and healed them.

ENGLISH: And King Herod heard about Jesus, for his name was now known widely, and people said: “John the Baptist has been raised from the dead, and therefore the mighty deeds are working in him.”
QUENYA: And King Herod heard about Jesus, for his name was now known widely, and people said: “John the Baptist has been raised from the dead, and therefore the mighty deeds are working in him.”

ENGLISH: But others said: “He is Elijah.” Still others said: “He is a prophet, like one of the prophets of the past.”
QUENYA: But others said: “He is Elijah.” Still others said: “He is a prophet, like one of the prophets of the past.”

ENGLISH: But when Herod heard it, he said: “That John whose head I cut off, he has been raised!” For Herod himself sent and seized John and bound him, by reason of Heriodias, wife of Philip his brother, since Herod got married to her.
QUENYA: But when Herod heard it, he said: “That John whose head I cut off, he has been raised!” For Herod himself sent and seized John and bound him, by reason of Heriodias, wife of Philip his brother, since Herod got married to her.

ENGLISH: For John said to Herod: “You may not have your brother's wife.”
QUENYA: For John said to Herod: “You may not have your brother's wife.”

ENGLISH: But Herodias had a hatred for John and wanted to kill him, but could not.
QUENYA: But Herodias had a hatred for John and wanted to kill him, but could not.

ENGLISH: For Herod feared John, knowing that he was a just and holy man, and he protected him. After hearing him, he was very uncertain about what was the best thing for him to do, and yet he heard him with joy.
QUENYA: For Herod feared John, knowing that he was a just and holy man, and he protected him. After hearing him, he was very uncertain about what was the best thing for him to do, and yet he heard him with joy.

ENGLISH: But a day of opportunity came when Herod, on his birthday, made a feast for the most prominent men and the commanders and the eminent men of Galilee.
QUENYA: But a day of opportunity came when Herod, on his birthday, made a feast for the most prominent men and the commanders and the eminent men of Galilee.

ENGLISH: And Herodias' daughter came herself and danced and pleased Herod and the people at the table with him. The king said to the maiden: “Ask of me anything that you want, and I shall give it to you.”
QUENYA: And Herodias' daughter came herself and danced and pleased Herod and the people at the table with him. The king said to the maiden: “Ask of me anything that you want, and I shall give it to you.”

ENGLISH: Indeed he gave her his oath: “Anything that you ask of me, I shall give it do you, until half of my kingdom!”
QUENYA: Indeed he gave her his oath: “Anything that you ask of me, I shall give it do you, until half of my kingdom!”

ENGLISH: And the maiden went out and said to her mother: “What am I to ask?” She said: “John the Baptist's head!”
QUENYA: And the maiden went out and said to her mother: “What am I to ask?” She said: “John the Baptist's head!”

ENGLISH: Quickly she went straight to the king and asked: “I wish that you give me, in this hour, John the Baptist's head on a dish.”
QUENYA: Quickly she went straight to the king and asked: “I wish that you give me, in this hour, John the Baptist's head on a dish.”

ENGLISH: Deep grief seized the king, and yet he did not want to reject that the maiden asked, since he gave his oaths before the people at the table.
QUENYA: Deep grief seized the king, and yet he did not want to reject that the maiden asked, since he gave his oaths before the people at the table.

ENGLISH: Thus, in the same moment, the king sent his bodyguard, commanding him to bring John's head. And he went away and cut off his head in the prison.
QUENYA: Thus, in the same moment, the king sent his bodyguard, commanding him to bring John's head. And he went away and cut off his head in the prison.

ENGLISH: He boright his head in a dish and gave it to the maiden, and the maiden gave it to her mother.
QUENYA: He boright his head in a dish and gave it to the maiden, and the maiden gave it to her mother.

ENGLISH: When his disciples heard it, they came and took up his corpse and put it in a tomb.
QUENYA: When his disciples heard it, they came and took up his corpse and put it in a tomb.

ENGLISH: And the disciples gathered before Jesus and told him all the things that they did and taught.
QUENYA: And the disciples gathered before Jesus and told him all the things that they did and taught.

ENGLISH: And he said to them: “Come, you yourselves alone, to a lonely place and rest a little.” For numerous came and went, and they did not have time even to eat.
QUENYA: And he said to them: “Come, you yourselves alone, to a lonely place and rest a little.” For numerous came and went, and they did not have time even to eat.

ENGLISH: And they went away by the boat to a lonely place, they alone.
QUENYA: And they went away by the boat to a lonely place, they alone.

ENGLISH: But people saw them when they left, and many knew, and from all the cities they ran there on foot and came before them.
QUENYA: But people saw them when they left, and many knew, and from all the cities they ran there on foot and came before them.

ENGLISH: And when he went out of the boat he saw a great crowd, but his heart went out to them, since they were like sheep without a shepherd. And he began to teach them numerous things.
QUENYA: And when he went out of the boat he saw a great crowd, but his heart went out to them, since they were like sheep without a shepherd. And he began to teach them numerous things.

ENGLISH: Now the hour was late, and his disciples came to him and said: “The place is lonely, and even now the hour is late.
QUENYA: Now the hour was late, and his disciples came to him and said: “The place is lonely, and even now the hour is late.

ENGLISH: Send them away, for them to go to the around-lying fields and villages, to buy themselves food.”
QUENYA: Send them away, for them to go to the around-lying fields and villages, to buy themselves food.”

ENGLISH: He answered them: “You give them what they are to eat!” Then they said to him: “Are we to go and get breads for two hundred denarii to give to the people to eat?”
QUENYA: He answered them: “You give them what they are to eat!” Then they said to him: “Are we to go and get breads for two hundred denarii to give to the people to eat?”

ENGLISH: He said to them: “What number of breads to you have? Go and see!” After inquiring they said: “Five, and also two fishes.”
QUENYA: He said to them: “What number of breads to you have? Go and see!” After inquiring they said: “Five, and also two fishes.”

ENGLISH: And he commanded all the people to lie down on the green grass, group by group.
QUENYA: And he commanded all the people to lie down on the green grass, group by group.

ENGLISH: And they sat down, row by row, in hundreds and fifties .
QUENYA: And they sat down, row by row, in hundreds and fifties .

ENGLISH: Taking the five breads and the two fishes he lifted his eyes towards heaven and said a blessing, and he broke the breads and gave them to his disciples, for them to put them before the people, and he divided the two fishes to them.
QUENYA: Taking the five breads and the two fishes he lifted his eyes towards heaven and said a blessing, and he broke the breads and gave them to his disciples, for them to put them before the people, and he divided the two fishes to them.

ENGLISH: And all among them ate and were filled.
QUENYA: And all among them ate and were filled.

ENGLISH: And they took up bread-pieces, filling twelve baskets, and were also the fishes.
QUENYA: And they took up bread-pieces, filling twelve baskets, and were also the fishes.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, those who ate of the breads were fixe thousand men.
QUENYA: Furthermore, those who ate of the breads were fixe thousand men.

ENGLISH: Then, quickly, he compelled his disciples to go into the boat and go before himself to the other shore, to Bethsaida, while he sent away the crowd.
QUENYA: Then, quickly, he compelled his disciples to go into the boat and go before himself to the other shore, to Bethsaida, while he sent away the crowd.

ENGLISH: But after saying farewell to them he went up into a mountain to pray.
QUENYA: But after saying farewell to them he went up into a mountain to pray.

ENGLISH: Now evening was come, and the boat was in the middle of the sea, but he was alone on land.
QUENYA: Now evening was come, and the boat was in the middle of the sea, but he was alone on land.

ENGLISH: And when he saw that to them it was difficult to move forward, for the wind was in their face, around the fourth watch he came to them, walking on the sea, but he wanted to go past them.
QUENYA: And when he saw that to them it was difficult to move forward, for the wind was in their face, around the fourth watch he came to them, walking on the sea, but he wanted to go past them.

ENGLISH: When they saw him walking on the sea, they thought: “That is a ghost!”, and they cried out.
QUENYA: When they saw him walking on the sea, they thought: “That is a ghost!”, and they cried out.

ENGLISH: For all among them saw him and were scared. But in the same moment he spoke to them, and he said to them: “Courage! It is I; do not fear.”
QUENYA: For all among them saw him and were scared. But in the same moment he spoke to them, and he said to them: “Courage! It is I; do not fear.”

ENGLISH: And he came into the boat with them, and the wind died down
QUENYA: And he came into the boat with them, and the wind died down

ENGLISH: But they were filled with great wonder, for they did not get understanding by the breads, but their heart was still hard.
QUENYA: But they were filled with great wonder, for they did not get understanding by the breads, but their heart was still hard.

ENGLISH: And after crossing to the land they came to Gennesareth and fastened the boat there.
QUENYA: And after crossing to the land they came to Gennesareth and fastened the boat there.

ENGLISH: But when they went out of the boat people quickly recognized Jesus,
QUENYA: But when they went out of the boat people quickly recognized Jesus,

ENGLISH: and they ran around that entire region, and they started to put all that were sick on stretchers and to carry them to where they heard that he was. And every place where he went into villages and cities and fields, they put the sick ones in the market-places, and they begged of him touch just the rim of his raiment, and all the people touching it were healed.
QUENYA: and they ran around that entire region, and they started to put all that were sick on stretchers and to carry them to where they heard that he was. And every place where he went into villages and cities and fields, they put the sick ones in the market-places, and they begged of him touch just the rim of his raiment, and all the people touching it were healed.

ENGLISH: Now gathered around Jesus the Pharisees and some of the scibes that were come from Jerusalem.
QUENYA: Now gathered around Jesus the Pharisees and some of the scibes that were come from Jerusalem.

ENGLISH: They saw some of his disciples eat their food with unholy – that is, unwashed – hands.
QUENYA: They saw some of his disciples eat their food with unholy – that is, unwashed – hands.

ENGLISH: But Pharisees and all Jews do not eat without washing their hands as far as the elbow, keeping the custom of the ancients,
QUENYA: But Pharisees and all Jews do not eat without washing their hands as far as the elbow, keeping the custom of the ancients,

ENGLISH: and returning from the market-place they do not eat without cleansing themselves by throwing water. There are numerous other customs that they have received and keep, dipping cups and pitchers and coppers.
QUENYA: and returning from the market-place they do not eat without cleansing themselves by throwing water. There are numerous other customs that they have received and keep, dipping cups and pitchers and coppers.

ENGLISH: And the Pharisees the the scribes said to him: “How is that your disciples do not behave according to the custom of the ancients, but eat their food with unholy hands?”
QUENYA: And the Pharisees the the scribes said to him: “How is that your disciples do not behave according to the custom of the ancients, but eat their food with unholy hands?”

ENGLISH: He said to them: “Isaiah spoke well as a prophet about you hypocrites , as is written: 'This people gives glory to me with their lips, but their heart is far from me.
QUENYA: He said to them: “Isaiah spoke well as a prophet about you hypocrites , as is written: 'This people gives glory to me with their lips, but their heart is far from me.

ENGLISH: In vain they worship me, teaching Men's teachings.'
QUENYA: In vain they worship me, teaching Men's teachings.'

ENGLISH: Abandoning God's commandment you keep men's custom.”
QUENYA: Abandoning God's commandment you keep men's custom.”

ENGLISH: Furthermore, he said to them: “Cleverly you put away God's commandment, in order to keep your own custom.
QUENYA: Furthermore, he said to them: “Cleverly you put away God's commandment, in order to keep your own custom.

ENGLISH: For Moses said: Give glory to your father and to your mother, and: Who speaks evil about father or mother will die.
QUENYA: For Moses said: Give glory to your father and to your mother, and: Who speaks evil about father or mother will die.

ENGLISH: But you say: When a man says to his father or to his mother: Anything useful that you were to receive from me is a corban (that is, a gift to God),
QUENYA: But you say: When a man says to his father or to his mother: Anything useful that you were to receive from me is a corban (that is, a gift to God),

ENGLISH: you no longer allow him to do a single thing for his father or for his mother.
QUENYA: you no longer allow him to do a single thing for his father or for his mother.

ENGLISH: Thus, by the custom that you pass on , you cause God's word to lack power. And many similar things you do.”
QUENYA: Thus, by the custom that you pass on , you cause God's word to lack power. And many similar things you do.”

ENGLISH: And again summoning the crowd he said to them: “Listen to me, all of you, and understand!
QUENYA: And again summoning the crowd he said to them: “Listen to me, all of you, and understand!

ENGLISH: is nothing from outside that can make a person unclean by coming into him, but the things that come out from a person are that make him unclean.
QUENYA: is nothing from outside that can make a person unclean by coming into him, but the things that come out from a person are that make him unclean.

ENGLISH: Hear, whoever has ears to hear !”
QUENYA: Hear, whoever has ears to hear !”

ENGLISH: And when he went into a house, away from the crowd, his disciples asked him about the comparison.
QUENYA: And when he went into a house, away from the crowd, his disciples asked him about the comparison.

ENGLISH: Then he said to then; “Then you as well lack understanding? Do you know know that nothing from outside that comes into a man can soil him,
QUENYA: Then he said to then; “Then you as well lack understanding? Do you know know that nothing from outside that comes into a man can soil him,

ENGLISH: since that goes, not into his heart, but into his entrails, and passes into the sewer .” Thus he indicated that food of every kind is clean.
QUENYA: since that goes, not into his heart, but into his entrails, and passes into the sewer .” Thus he indicated that food of every kind is clean.

ENGLISH: And he said: “What comes out of a person is what soils a person,
QUENYA: And he said: “What comes out of a person is what soils a person,

ENGLISH: for from inside, out of men's heart, come the evil thoughts: fornications, thefts, killings,
QUENYA: for from inside, out of men's heart, come the evil thoughts: fornications, thefts, killings,

ENGLISH: cases of marriage-breaking, greedy feelings, wicked deeds, falsehood, loose conduct, evil eye, blasphemy, pride, unreason.
QUENYA: cases of marriage-breaking, greedy feelings, wicked deeds, falsehood, loose conduct, evil eye, blasphemy, pride, unreason.

ENGLISH: All these evils come from inside and soil a person.”
QUENYA: All these evils come from inside and soil a person.”

ENGLISH: From there he arose and went into the regions of Tyre and Sidon. And he went into a house and did not wish that anyone was to know, but he could not remain hidden.
QUENYA: From there he arose and went into the regions of Tyre and Sidon. And he went into a house and did not wish that anyone was to know, but he could not remain hidden.

ENGLISH: Soon a woman whose daughter was possessed by an unclean spirit heart about him and came and fell down before his feet.
QUENYA: Soon a woman whose daughter was possessed by an unclean spirit heart about him and came and fell down before his feet.

ENGLISH: The woman was Greek, of Syro-Phonecian descent, and she petitioned of him that he would throw out the demon from her daughter.
QUENYA: The woman was Greek, of Syro-Phonecian descent, and she petitioned of him that he would throw out the demon from her daughter.

ENGLISH: But Jesus said to her: “First let the children fill themselves, for it is not proper to take the bread of the children and to throw it to the dogs.”
QUENYA: But Jesus said to her: “First let the children fill themselves, for it is not proper to take the bread of the children and to throw it to the dogs.”

ENGLISH: But she answered him: “Yes, Lord, and yet the dogs under the table eat the crumbs of the children.”
QUENYA: But she answered him: “Yes, Lord, and yet the dogs under the table eat the crumbs of the children.”

ENGLISH: Then he said to the woman: “Since you said this, go; the demon has gone out of your daughter.”
QUENYA: Then he said to the woman: “Since you said this, go; the demon has gone out of your daughter.”

ENGLISH: And the woman went away to her house and found the child lying upon the bed, and the demon was gone.
QUENYA: And the woman went away to her house and found the child lying upon the bed, and the demon was gone.

ENGLISH: And returning from the regions of Tyre, Jesus went through Sidon to the sea of Galilee, up through the middle of the regions where the Ten Cities lay.
QUENYA: And returning from the regions of Tyre, Jesus went through Sidon to the sea of Galilee, up through the middle of the regions where the Ten Cities lay.

ENGLISH: Here they brought to him a man who was deaf and dumb, and they petitioned of him that he would put his hand on him.
QUENYA: Here they brought to him a man who was deaf and dumb, and they petitioned of him that he would put his hand on him.

ENGLISH: And he led him away from the crowd to a lonely place and put his fingers into the man's ears and, after spitting, he touched his tongue.
QUENYA: And he led him away from the crowd to a lonely place and put his fingers into the man's ears and, after spitting, he touched his tongue.

ENGLISH: After looking up towards heaven Jesus sighed and said to him: “Ephphatha!” – that is: “Be opened!”
QUENYA: After looking up towards heaven Jesus sighed and said to him: “Ephphatha!” – that is: “Be opened!”

ENGLISH: And his hearing was opened, and the bond of his tongue was loosed, and he spoke normally.
QUENYA: And his hearing was opened, and the bond of his tongue was loosed, and he spoke normally.

ENGLISH: And he commended them that they would say nothing to anyone, but the more he commanded them, the more they made it known.
QUENYA: And he commended them that they would say nothing to anyone, but the more he commanded them, the more they made it known.

ENGLISH: Indeed they were filled with deepest wonder and said: “He has done all things well, and he causes the deaf to hear and the dumb to speak.”
QUENYA: Indeed they were filled with deepest wonder and said: “He has done all things well, and he causes the deaf to hear and the dumb to speak.”

ENGLISH: In those days, while again there was a huge crowd with him and they had nothing to eat, he summoned his disciples and said to them:
QUENYA: In those days, while again there was a huge crowd with him and they had nothing to eat, he summoned his disciples and said to them:

ENGLISH: “My heart goes out to the crowd, for even now they have remained with me for three days, and they have nothing to eat.
QUENYA: “My heart goes out to the crowd, for even now they have remained with me for three days, and they have nothing to eat.

ENGLISH: If I send them away home emptyhanded, they will become too tired on the road. Furthermore, some among them have come from afar.”
QUENYA: If I send them away home emptyhanded, they will become too tired on the road. Furthermore, some among them have come from afar.”

ENGLISH: But his disciples answered him: “From where will anyone, in this lonely place, get breads sufficient for these people?”
QUENYA: But his disciples answered him: “From where will anyone, in this lonely place, get breads sufficient for these people?”

ENGLISH: But he asked them: “What number of breads do you have?” They said: “Seven.”
QUENYA: But he asked them: “What number of breads do you have?” They said: “Seven.”

ENGLISH: And he commanded the crowd to lie down upon the ground, and he took the seven breads, gave thanks, broke them and gave them to his disciples, for them to put them before the people, and they put them before the crowd.
QUENYA: And he commanded the crowd to lie down upon the ground, and he took the seven breads, gave thanks, broke them and gave them to his disciples, for them to put them before the people, and they put them before the crowd.

ENGLISH: They had also a few fishes, and after blessing those, he commanded them to put also them before the people.
QUENYA: They had also a few fishes, and after blessing those, he commanded them to put also them before the people.

ENGLISH: And they ate and were filled, and they gathered the remaining pieces, filling seven food-baskets .
QUENYA: And they ate and were filled, and they gathered the remaining pieces, filling seven food-baskets .

ENGLISH: And yet the number of people was around four thousand. And he sent them away.
QUENYA: And yet the number of people was around four thousand. And he sent them away.

ENGLISH: Then, quickly, he went into the boat with his disciples and came to the regions around Dalmanutha.
QUENYA: Then, quickly, he went into the boat with his disciples and came to the regions around Dalmanutha.

ENGLISH: Here the Pharisees came out and started to quarrel with him, seeking from him a sign from heaven, in order to test him.
QUENYA: Here the Pharisees came out and started to quarrel with him, seeking from him a sign from heaven, in order to test him.

ENGLISH: And he sighted in his spirit and said: “What is the reason that this generation seeks a sign? Truly I say: This generation will not receive a sign.”
QUENYA: And he sighted in his spirit and said: “What is the reason that this generation seeks a sign? Truly I say: This generation will not receive a sign.”

ENGLISH: And leaving them he went back to the boat and went away to the other shore.
QUENYA: And leaving them he went back to the boat and went away to the other shore.

ENGLISH: But they did not remember to bring breads with them, and except for one bread they had nothing in the boat.
QUENYA: But they did not remember to bring breads with them, and except for one bread they had nothing in the boat.

ENGLISH: And he commanded them, saying: “Take head, watch out concerning the leaven of the Pharisees and Herod's leaven.”
QUENYA: And he commanded them, saying: “Take head, watch out concerning the leaven of the Pharisees and Herod's leaven.”

ENGLISH: And they had a dispute, one with the other, about their lacking breads.
QUENYA: And they had a dispute, one with the other, about their lacking breads.

ENGLISH: Noticing this, he said to them: “What is your reason for having a dispute about lacking breads? Do you still not perceive and understand? Is your heart slow of understanding?
QUENYA: Noticing this, he said to them: “What is your reason for having a dispute about lacking breads? Do you still not perceive and understand? Is your heart slow of understanding?

ENGLISH: Having eyes, do you really not see, and having ears, do you really not hear? And do you not recall,
QUENYA: Having eyes, do you really not see, and having ears, do you really not hear? And do you not recall,

ENGLISH: when I broke the five breads for the five thousand men, the number of baskets full of pieces you gathered?” They said to him: “Twelve.”
QUENYA: when I broke the five breads for the five thousand men, the number of baskets full of pieces you gathered?” They said to him: “Twelve.”

ENGLISH: “When I broke the seven for the four thousand men, what number of big provision baskets full of pieces did you gather?” And they said to him: “Seven.”
QUENYA: “When I broke the seven for the four thousand men, what number of big provision baskets full of pieces did you gather?” And they said to him: “Seven.”

ENGLISH: Then he said to them: “Do you still not understand?”
QUENYA: Then he said to them: “Do you still not understand?”

ENGLISH: And they came to Bethsaida. Here people carried to him a blind man, and they petitioned of him to touch him.
QUENYA: And they came to Bethsaida. Here people carried to him a blind man, and they petitioned of him to touch him.

ENGLISH: And he took the blind man's hand and brought him outside of the village, and after spitting at his eyes he put his hands on him and asked him: “Are you seeing anything?”
QUENYA: And he took the blind man's hand and brought him outside of the village, and after spitting at his eyes he put his hands on him and asked him: “Are you seeing anything?”

ENGLISH: And the man looked up and said: “I see the people, for I look at what seems like walking trees!”
QUENYA: And the man looked up and said: “I see the people, for I look at what seems like walking trees!”

ENGLISH: Then he again put his hands on his eyes, and he saw fully well; he was restored and saw the shapes of all things.
QUENYA: Then he again put his hands on his eyes, and he saw fully well; he was restored and saw the shapes of all things.

ENGLISH: Then he sent him home, saying: “Do not go into the village!”
QUENYA: Then he sent him home, saying: “Do not go into the village!”

ENGLISH: Jesus and his disciples now went away to the villages in Caesarea Philippi, and on the road he asked his disciples, saying to them: “Who do people say that I am?”
QUENYA: Jesus and his disciples now went away to the villages in Caesarea Philippi, and on the road he asked his disciples, saying to them: “Who do people say that I am?”

ENGLISH: They said to him: “John the Baptist, and others: Elijah, and others: One among the prophets.”
QUENYA: They said to him: “John the Baptist, and others: Elijah, and others: One among the prophets.”

ENGLISH: And he asked them: “But who do you say that I am?” Peter answered him: “You are the Christ!”
QUENYA: And he asked them: “But who do you say that I am?” Peter answered him: “You are the Christ!”

ENGLISH: Then he commanded them firmly that they they were not to tell anyone about him.
QUENYA: Then he commanded them firmly that they they were not to tell anyone about him.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, he started to teach them that it was necessary for the Son of Man to endure numerous tortures and to be rejected by the elders and the chief priests and the scribes, and to be slain, and to rise after three days.
QUENYA: Furthermore, he started to teach them that it was necessary for the Son of Man to endure numerous tortures and to be rejected by the elders and the chief priests and the scribes, and to be slain, and to rise after three days.

ENGLISH: Indeed he said that openly. But Peter led him to a private place and started to speak against him.
QUENYA: Indeed he said that openly. But Peter led him to a private place and started to speak against him.

ENGLISH: But Jesus turned, and seeing his disciples he spoke firmly to Peter, saying: “Begone, Satan, for your thoughts are not God's thoughts, but the ones of men.”
QUENYA: But Jesus turned, and seeing his disciples he spoke firmly to Peter, saying: “Begone, Satan, for your thoughts are not God's thoughts, but the ones of men.”

ENGLISH: Then he summoned the crowd to himself with his disciples and said to them: “If anyone wants to come after me, it is necessary for him to reject himself and lift up his cross and follow me.
QUENYA: Then he summoned the crowd to himself with his disciples and said to them: “If anyone wants to come after me, it is necessary for him to reject himself and lift up his cross and follow me.

ENGLISH: For anyone who wants to save his life, to him it will be lost, but anyone whose life is lost for my good or for the good of the gospel, shall save it.
QUENYA: For anyone who wants to save his life, to him it will be lost, but anyone whose life is lost for my good or for the good of the gospel, shall save it.

ENGLISH: Indeed how is helpful for a person if he receives the whole world, but his life is lost?
QUENYA: Indeed how is helpful for a person if he receives the whole world, but his life is lost?

ENGLISH: Indeed what will a person give in exchange for his life?
QUENYA: Indeed what will a person give in exchange for his life?

ENGLISH: For anyone who is shamed concerning me and my words in this generation that breaks marriage and is full of sin, about him the Son of Man will be shamed when he shall come in his father's glory with the holy angels.”
QUENYA: For anyone who is shamed concerning me and my words in this generation that breaks marriage and is full of sin, about him the Son of Man will be shamed when he shall come in his father's glory with the holy angels.”

ENGLISH: Furthermore, he said to them: “Truly I say to you: There are people who are standing here that will by no means taste death before they have seen God's kingdom come in power.”
QUENYA: Furthermore, he said to them: “Truly I say to you: There are people who are standing here that will by no means taste death before they have seen God's kingdom come in power.”

ENGLISH: And after six days Jesus lead away Peter and James and John with himself and brought them into a lofty mountain, they alone. And he was changed before them,
QUENYA: And after six days Jesus lead away Peter and James and John with himself and brought them into a lofty mountain, they alone. And he was changed before them,

ENGLISH: and his garments glittered with a whiteness far beyond which anyone washing clothes on earth can whiten.
QUENYA: and his garments glittered with a whiteness far beyond which anyone washing clothes on earth can whiten.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, Elijah and Moses showed themselves to them, and they spoke with Jesus.
QUENYA: Furthermore, Elijah and Moses showed themselves to them, and they spoke with Jesus.

ENGLISH: Then Peter spoke and said to Jesus: “Rabbi, it is good that we are here! Let us erect three tents, one for you and one for Moses and one for Elijah”
QUENYA: Then Peter spoke and said to Jesus: “Rabbi, it is good that we are here! Let us erect three tents, one for you and one for Moses and one for Elijah”

ENGLISH: – for he did not know what was the best for him to say, for they were terrified.
QUENYA: – for he did not know what was the best for him to say, for they were terrified.

ENGLISH: And there was a cloud overshadowing them, and a voice came out of the cloud: “This is my son, the beloved; listen to him!”
QUENYA: And there was a cloud overshadowing them, and a voice came out of the cloud: “This is my son, the beloved; listen to him!”

ENGLISH: Suddenly, when they looked around themselves, they no more saw anyone except Jesus alone.
QUENYA: Suddenly, when they looked around themselves, they no more saw anyone except Jesus alone.

ENGLISH: And while they went down from the mountain he commanded them that they were not to tell anyone about that they saw , until after the Son of Man was raised from dead.
QUENYA: And while they went down from the mountain he commanded them that they were not to tell anyone about that they saw , until after the Son of Man was raised from dead.

ENGLISH: They heeded the word, but they spoke among themselves about what “rising from the dead” meant.
QUENYA: They heeded the word, but they spoke among themselves about what “rising from the dead” meant.

ENGLISH: And they asked him, saying: “How is that the scribes say that first it is necessary for Elijah to come?”
QUENYA: And they asked him, saying: “How is that the scribes say that first it is necessary for Elijah to come?”

ENGLISH: He said to them: “Elijah indeed comes first and shall renew all things, but what is the reason that is written about the Son of Man that it is necessary for him to bear many tortures and to be counted as nothing?
QUENYA: He said to them: “Elijah indeed comes first and shall renew all things, but what is the reason that is written about the Son of Man that it is necessary for him to bear many tortures and to be counted as nothing?

ENGLISH: But I say to you that Elijah has indeed come, and they did to him everything that they wanted, as is written about him.”
QUENYA: But I say to you that Elijah has indeed come, and they did to him everything that they wanted, as is written about him.”

ENGLISH: And when they came to the other disciples, they saw a great crowd around them, and scrubes quarrelling with them.
QUENYA: And when they came to the other disciples, they saw a great crowd around them, and scrubes quarrelling with them.

ENGLISH: But as soon as the whole crowd saw him, they were startled, and running to him they greeted him.
QUENYA: But as soon as the whole crowd saw him, they were startled, and running to him they greeted him.

ENGLISH: And he asked them: “About what are you having a dispute with them?”
QUENYA: And he asked them: “About what are you having a dispute with them?”

ENGLISH: And one of the crowd answered him: “Teacher, I brought my son to you since he is possessed by a dumb demon, and every time when it seizes him, it throws him to ground, and he foams and grinds his teeth and is made stiff. And I petitioned of your disciples that they would throw it out, but they could not.”
QUENYA: And one of the crowd answered him: “Teacher, I brought my son to you since he is possessed by a dumb demon, and every time when it seizes him, it throws him to ground, and he foams and grinds his teeth and is made stiff. And I petitioned of your disciples that they would throw it out, but they could not.”

ENGLISH: And he spoke and said to them; “Unfaithful generation, how long is it necessary for me to be with you? How long is it necessary for me to endure you? Bring him to me!”
QUENYA: And he spoke and said to them; “Unfaithful generation, how long is it necessary for me to be with you? How long is it necessary for me to endure you? Bring him to me!”

ENGLISH: And they brought him to him. But when the spirit saw him, it quickly caused the boy to twitch, and after falling down he was rolling on the ground, foaming.
QUENYA: And they brought him to him. But when the spirit saw him, it quickly caused the boy to twitch, and after falling down he was rolling on the ground, foaming.

ENGLISH: And Jesus asked his father: “How long has this been happening to him?” He said: “From he was a child.
QUENYA: And Jesus asked his father: “How long has this been happening to him?” He said: “From he was a child.

ENGLISH: Many times it has thrown him into fire and into water alike, to undo him. But if you can, help us , having mercy on us!”
QUENYA: Many times it has thrown him into fire and into water alike, to undo him. But if you can, help us , having mercy on us!”

ENGLISH: Jesus said to him: “This word: If you can! All things are possible for who believes!”
QUENYA: Jesus said to him: “This word: If you can! All things are possible for who believes!”

ENGLISH: In the same moment, crying , the child's father said: “I believe! Help me where I lack believing!”
QUENYA: In the same moment, crying , the child's father said: “I believe! Help me where I lack believing!”

ENGLISH: Jesus, when he noticed a crowd gathering, spoke firmly to the unclean spirit, saying to it: “O dumb and deaf spirit, I command you: Pass from him and do not go into him again!”
QUENYA: Jesus, when he noticed a crowd gathering, spoke firmly to the unclean spirit, saying to it: “O dumb and deaf spirit, I command you: Pass from him and do not go into him again!”

ENGLISH: And after crying and causing many spasms it went out; and the boy was as sead. Therefore the majority said: “He has died.”
QUENYA: And after crying and causing many spasms it went out; and the boy was as sead. Therefore the majority said: “He has died.”

ENGLISH: But Jesus took his hand and raised him up, and he arose.
QUENYA: But Jesus took his hand and raised him up, and he arose.

ENGLISH: And after Jesus went into a house, his disciples asked him while they were alone: “How is that we could not throw it out?”
QUENYA: And after Jesus went into a house, his disciples asked him while they were alone: “How is that we could not throw it out?”

ENGLISH: And he said to them: “A demon of this sort cannot be thrown out except by prayer.”
QUENYA: And he said to them: “A demon of this sort cannot be thrown out except by prayer.”

ENGLISH: From there they went away and went through Galilee, but he did not wish that anyone was to know that.
QUENYA: From there they went away and went through Galilee, but he did not wish that anyone was to know that.

ENGLISH: For he taught his disciples and told them: “The Son of Man will be given into the hands of men, and they will kill him, but though he shall be slain, he shall rise after three days.”
QUENYA: For he taught his disciples and told them: “The Son of Man will be given into the hands of men, and they will kill him, but though he shall be slain, he shall rise after three days.”

ENGLISH: But they did not understand the saying, and they were afraid of asking him.
QUENYA: But they did not understand the saying, and they were afraid of asking him.

ENGLISH: Again they came into Capernaum. While he was in the house he asked them: “About what did you have a dispute on the road?”
QUENYA: Again they came into Capernaum. While he was in the house he asked them: “About what did you have a dispute on the road?”

ENGLISH: They were silent, for on the road they had a dispute about who among them was greatest.
QUENYA: They were silent, for on the road they had a dispute about who among them was greatest.

ENGLISH: Therefore he sat down and called the twelve and said to them: “If anyone wishes to be first, it is necessary for him to be last of all and to be everyone's servant.”
QUENYA: Therefore he sat down and called the twelve and said to them: “If anyone wishes to be first, it is necessary for him to be last of all and to be everyone's servant.”

ENGLISH: And he took a child, made it to stand in their midst and put his arms around it and said to them:
QUENYA: And he took a child, made it to stand in their midst and put his arms around it and said to them:

ENGLISH: “Anyone who receives such children by my name, receives me; and anyone who receives me, does not receive me, but who sent me.”
QUENYA: “Anyone who receives such children by my name, receives me; and anyone who receives me, does not receive me, but who sent me.”

ENGLISH: John said to him: “Teacher, we saw a person throwing out demons, and we tried to stop him, since he did not follow us.”
QUENYA: John said to him: “Teacher, we saw a person throwing out demons, and we tried to stop him, since he did not follow us.”

ENGLISH: But Jesus said: “Do not try to stop him, for there is no one who will do a mighty deed by my name who will soon speak evil about me.
QUENYA: But Jesus said: “Do not try to stop him, for there is no one who will do a mighty deed by my name who will soon speak evil about me.

ENGLISH: For who does not stand against us, is for us.
QUENYA: For who does not stand against us, is for us.

ENGLISH: For anyone who gives you a cup of water to drink because of your being Christ's – truly I say to you, his reward will not be lost to him.
QUENYA: For anyone who gives you a cup of water to drink because of your being Christ's – truly I say to you, his reward will not be lost to him.

ENGLISH: But anyone who causes the fall of one of these little ones who believe in me, it is better for him if a mill-stone of the kind drawn by an ass is put around his neck, and he is thrown into sea.
QUENYA: But anyone who causes the fall of one of these little ones who believe in me, it is better for him if a mill-stone of the kind drawn by an ass is put around his neck, and he is thrown into sea.

ENGLISH: And if your hand is causing your fall, cut it off; going into life without a body-part is better for you than passing with two hands into Gehenna, into the fire that burns forever.
QUENYA: And if your hand is causing your fall, cut it off; going into life without a body-part is better for you than passing with two hands into Gehenna, into the fire that burns forever.

ENGLISH: And if your foot is causing your fall, cut it off; going lame into life is better for you than being thrown into Gehenna having two feet.
QUENYA: And if your foot is causing your fall, cut it off; going lame into life is better for you than being thrown into Gehenna having two feet.

ENGLISH: And if your eye is causing your fall, throw it away, for going into God's kingdom having one eye is better for you than than being thrown into Gehenna having two eyes,
QUENYA: And if your eye is causing your fall, throw it away, for going into God's kingdom having one eye is better for you than than being thrown into Gehenna having two eyes,

ENGLISH: where their worm does not die and the fire is not extinguished.
QUENYA: where their worm does not die and the fire is not extinguished.

ENGLISH: For everyone will be made salty with salt.
QUENYA: For everyone will be made salty with salt.

ENGLISH: Salt is good, but if the power of the salt has gone, with what will you give taste to the salt itself? Have salt in yourselves, and keep peace between person and person.”
QUENYA: Salt is good, but if the power of the salt has gone, with what will you give taste to the salt itself? Have salt in yourselves, and keep peace between person and person.”

ENGLISH: And from there he arose and came to the regions of Judea and to beyond the Jordan, and again crowds gathered to him, and by his habit he again taught them.
QUENYA: And from there he arose and came to the regions of Judea and to beyond the Jordan, and again crowds gathered to him, and by his habit he again taught them.

ENGLISH: Some Pharisees came to him, and in order to test him they asked of him if a man may divorce his wife.
QUENYA: Some Pharisees came to him, and in order to test him they asked of him if a man may divorce his wife.

ENGLISH: He answered and said to them: “What did Moses command you?”
QUENYA: He answered and said to them: “What did Moses command you?”

ENGLISH: They said: “Moses allowed the writing of a letter of dismissal and that one divorces her .”
QUENYA: They said: “Moses allowed the writing of a letter of dismissal and that one divorces her .”

ENGLISH: But Jesus said to them: “Because of your hard heart he wrote you this commandment.
QUENYA: But Jesus said to them: “Because of your hard heart he wrote you this commandment.

ENGLISH: But from creation's beginning He made them male and female.
QUENYA: But from creation's beginning He made them male and female.

ENGLISH: Therefore a man shall abandon his father and his mother,
QUENYA: Therefore a man shall abandon his father and his mother,

ENGLISH: and the two shall be one flesh. Thus they are no more two, but one flesh.
QUENYA: and the two shall be one flesh. Thus they are no more two, but one flesh.

ENGLISH: Therefore, which God had made one, man is not to divide.”
QUENYA: Therefore, which God had made one, man is not to divide.”

ENGLISH: While they were in the house the disciples again asked him about this.
QUENYA: While they were in the house the disciples again asked him about this.

ENGLISH: And he said to them: “Anyone who divorces his wife and gets married to another commits adultery against her,
QUENYA: And he said to them: “Anyone who divorces his wife and gets married to another commits adultery against her,

ENGLISH: and if a woman, after divorsing her husband, gets married to another, she commits adultery.”
QUENYA: and if a woman, after divorsing her husband, gets married to another, she commits adultery.”

ENGLISH: Now people brought to him some children, for him to touch them, but the disciples spoke to them in a harsh manner.
QUENYA: Now people brought to him some children, for him to touch them, but the disciples spoke to them in a harsh manner.

ENGLISH: But Jesus, seeing this, was wroth and said to them: “Allow the children to come to me; do not try to stop them, for of such ones God's kingdom is.
QUENYA: But Jesus, seeing this, was wroth and said to them: “Allow the children to come to me; do not try to stop them, for of such ones God's kingdom is.

ENGLISH: Truly I say to you: Anyone who does not receive God's kingdom as a child , will by no means come into it.”
QUENYA: Truly I say to you: Anyone who does not receive God's kingdom as a child , will by no means come into it.”

ENGLISH: And he took the children into his arms and blessed them, putting his hands on them.
QUENYA: And he took the children into his arms and blessed them, putting his hands on them.

ENGLISH: And when he went off on his way, a man ran to him and fell to his knees before him and asked of him: “Good teacher, what is necessary for me to do, in order to be heir of eternal life?”
QUENYA: And when he went off on his way, a man ran to him and fell to his knees before him and asked of him: “Good teacher, what is necessary for me to do, in order to be heir of eternal life?”

ENGLISH: Jesus said to him: “How is that you call me good? No one is good, except one, God.
QUENYA: Jesus said to him: “How is that you call me good? No one is good, except one, God.

ENGLISH: The commandments you know: Do not kill, do not commit adultery , do not steal, do not speak untrue witness, do not be false, give glory to your father and to your mother.”
QUENYA: The commandments you know: Do not kill, do not commit adultery , do not steal, do not speak untrue witness, do not be false, give glory to your father and to your mother.”

ENGLISH: The man said to him: “Teacher, all these things I have kept from my youth.”
QUENYA: The man said to him: “Teacher, all these things I have kept from my youth.”

ENGLISH: Jesus looked at him and loved him, and he said to him: “One thing you lack. Go, sell everything that you have and give it to poor, and you shall have a treasure in heaven. Then come and follow me.”
QUENYA: Jesus looked at him and loved him, and he said to him: “One thing you lack. Go, sell everything that you have and give it to poor, and you shall have a treasure in heaven. Then come and follow me.”

ENGLISH: But his heart fell at the saying, and he went away in grief, for he had many goods.
QUENYA: But his heart fell at the saying, and he went away in grief, for he had many goods.

ENGLISH: After looking from person to person Jesus said to his disciples: “How difficult coming into God's kingdom is for people having money!”
QUENYA: After looking from person to person Jesus said to his disciples: “How difficult coming into God's kingdom is for people having money!”

ENGLISH: But his disciples marveled at his words. But Jesus spoke again and said to them: “Children, how difficult coming into God's kingdom is!
QUENYA: But his disciples marveled at his words. But Jesus spoke again and said to them: “Children, how difficult coming into God's kingdom is!

ENGLISH: For a camel to go through a needle's eye is easier than for a rich person to come into God's kingdom.”
QUENYA: For a camel to go through a needle's eye is easier than for a rich person to come into God's kingdom.”

ENGLISH: They were completely startled and said among themselves: “Then who can be saved?”
QUENYA: They were completely startled and said among themselves: “Then who can be saved?”

ENGLISH: Looking at them, Jesus said: “To men it is impossible, but not to God, for all things are possible to God.”
QUENYA: Looking at them, Jesus said: “To men it is impossible, but not to God, for all things are possible to God.”

ENGLISH: Peter began to say to him: “Behold, we have abandoned everything and have followed you.”
QUENYA: Peter began to say to him: “Behold, we have abandoned everything and have followed you.”

ENGLISH: Jesus said: “Truly I say to you: is no one who has abandoned house or brothers or sisters or mother or father or fields for my good or for the good of the gospel,
QUENYA: Jesus said: “Truly I say to you: is no one who has abandoned house or brothers or sisters or mother or father or fields for my good or for the good of the gospel,

ENGLISH: who will not receive a hundred added measures in this age, houses and brothers and sisters and mothers and children and fields, with persecutions – and in the coming age eternal life.
QUENYA: who will not receive a hundred added measures in this age, houses and brothers and sisters and mothers and children and fields, with persecutions – and in the coming age eternal life.

ENGLISH: But many who are first shall be last, and the last ones first.”
QUENYA: But many who are first shall be last, and the last ones first.”

ENGLISH: Now they were on the road rising towards Jerusalem, and Jesus went before them. And they were in wonder, but who followed were afraid. Again he brought the twelve to a private place and began to speak to them about that were going to happen to him: “Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man will be given over to the chief priests and to the scribes, and they shall judge him to death and give him over to the gentiles,
QUENYA: Now they were on the road rising towards Jerusalem, and Jesus went before them. And they were in wonder, but who followed were afraid. Again he brought the twelve to a private place and began to speak to them about that were going to happen to him: “Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man will be given over to the chief priests and to the scribes, and they shall judge him to death and give him over to the gentiles,

ENGLISH: and they will laugh at him with scorn and will spit at him and will flog him and will kill him, but after three days he shall rise.”
QUENYA: and they will laugh at him with scorn and will spit at him and will flog him and will kill him, but after three days he shall rise.”

ENGLISH: And James and John, the two sons of Zebedee, came to him and said to him: “Teacher, we wish that you will to for us what we ask of you.”
QUENYA: And James and John, the two sons of Zebedee, came to him and said to him: “Teacher, we wish that you will to for us what we ask of you.”

ENGLISH: He said to them: “What do you wish that I will do for you?”
QUENYA: He said to them: “What do you wish that I will do for you?”

ENGLISH: They said to him: “Give us that we will sit, one by your right hand and one by your left hand, in your glory.”
QUENYA: They said to him: “Give us that we will sit, one by your right hand and one by your left hand, in your glory.”

ENGLISH: But Jesus said to them: “You do not know what you are asking. Can you drink the cup that I am drinking, or be baptized with the baptism with which I am baptized?” They said: “We can.” Then Jesus said to them: “The cup that I am drinking you shall drink, and the baptism with which I am baptized you shall be baptized.
QUENYA: But Jesus said to them: “You do not know what you are asking. Can you drink the cup that I am drinking, or be baptized with the baptism with which I am baptized?” They said: “We can.” Then Jesus said to them: “The cup that I am drinking you shall drink, and the baptism with which I am baptized you shall be baptized.

ENGLISH: But the sitting down at my right or at my left is not for me to give, but it is for the people to whom it has been reserved.”
QUENYA: But the sitting down at my right or at my left is not for me to give, but it is for the people to whom it has been reserved.”

ENGLISH: When the other ten heard about this, they began to be angry with James and John.
QUENYA: When the other ten heard about this, they began to be angry with James and John.

ENGLISH: But having called them to himself, Jesus said to them: “As you know, the people who seem to be lords of nations have lordship over them, and their great ones have power over them.
QUENYA: But having called them to himself, Jesus said to them: “As you know, the people who seem to be lords of nations have lordship over them, and their great ones have power over them.

ENGLISH: But it is not so among you. On the contrary, for anyone who wishes to be great among you it is necessary to be your servant,
QUENYA: But it is not so among you. On the contrary, for anyone who wishes to be great among you it is necessary to be your servant,

ENGLISH: and for anyone who wishes to be first among you it is necessary to be slave of all.
QUENYA: and for anyone who wishes to be first among you it is necessary to be slave of all.

ENGLISH: For also the Son of Man came, not to have servants, but to be a servant and to give his life as a ransom in exchange for numerous ones.
QUENYA: For also the Son of Man came, not to have servants, but to be a servant and to give his life as a ransom in exchange for numerous ones.

ENGLISH: And they came into Jericho. But while he and his disciples and a great crowd were on their way out of Jericho, Bartimaeus the son of Timaeus, a bind beggar, sat by the road.
QUENYA: And they came into Jericho. But while he and his disciples and a great crowd were on their way out of Jericho, Bartimaeus the son of Timaeus, a bind beggar, sat by the road.

ENGLISH: When he heard that this was Jesus from Nazareth, he began to shout and say: “Son of David, Jesus, have mercy on me!”
QUENYA: When he heard that this was Jesus from Nazareth, he began to shout and say: “Son of David, Jesus, have mercy on me!”

ENGLISH: Then many spoke firmly to him for him to be silent , but the more he cried: “Son of David, have mercy on me!”
QUENYA: Then many spoke firmly to him for him to be silent , but the more he cried: “Son of David, have mercy on me!”

ENGLISH: And having halted Jesus said: “Call him!” And they called the blind man, saying to him: “Courage! Rise, he is calling you!”
QUENYA: And having halted Jesus said: “Call him!” And they called the blind man, saying to him: “Courage! Rise, he is calling you!”

ENGLISH: Throwing off his cloak he leaped up and came to Jesus.
QUENYA: Throwing off his cloak he leaped up and came to Jesus.

ENGLISH: And Jesus spoke to him and said: “What do you wish that I am to do for you?” The blind man said to him: “Rabboni, let me receive sight.”
QUENYA: And Jesus spoke to him and said: “What do you wish that I am to do for you?” The blind man said to him: “Rabboni, let me receive sight.”

ENGLISH: And Jesus said to him: “Go! Your faith has saved you.” And in the same moment he received sight, and he followed him on the road.
QUENYA: And Jesus said to him: “Go! Your faith has saved you.” And in the same moment he received sight, and he followed him on the road.

ENGLISH: And when they came near to Jerusalem, towards Bethphage and Bethany and the Mount of Olives, he sent to of his disciples
QUENYA: And when they came near to Jerusalem, towards Bethphage and Bethany and the Mount of Olives, he sent to of his disciples

ENGLISH: and said to them: “Go into yonder village before you, and as soon as you come into it, you will find a colt bound, that no one of men has sat upon until now; loose it and lead it hither.
QUENYA: and said to them: “Go into yonder village before you, and as soon as you come into it, you will find a colt bound, that no one of men has sat upon until now; loose it and lead it hither.

ENGLISH: And if anyone says to you: What is your reason for doing this?, then say: The Lord has need of it, and soon he will send it back.”
QUENYA: And if anyone says to you: What is your reason for doing this?, then say: The Lord has need of it, and soon he will send it back.”

ENGLISH: And they went off and found the colt bound by the boor, on the outside in the side-street, and they loosed it.
QUENYA: And they went off and found the colt bound by the boor, on the outside in the side-street, and they loosed it.

ENGLISH: But some among those who stood there said to them: “What are you doing loosing the colt?”
QUENYA: But some among those who stood there said to them: “What are you doing loosing the colt?”

ENGLISH: They said to them just as Jesus commanded, and they let them go off.
QUENYA: They said to them just as Jesus commanded, and they let them go off.

ENGLISH: And they brought the colt to Jesus, and they put their clothes on it, and Jesus sat upon it.
QUENYA: And they brought the colt to Jesus, and they put their clothes on it, and Jesus sat upon it.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, many put their cloaks on the road, but others cut branches from the fields.
QUENYA: Furthermore, many put their cloaks on the road, but others cut branches from the fields.

ENGLISH: And who went before him and who came behind him cried: “Hosanna! Blessed be who is coming in the name of the Lord!
QUENYA: And who went before him and who came behind him cried: “Hosanna! Blessed be who is coming in the name of the Lord!

ENGLISH: Blessed be the coming kingdom of David our father! Hosanna in the high places!”
QUENYA: Blessed be the coming kingdom of David our father! Hosanna in the high places!”

ENGLISH: And he went into Jerusalem, into the temple, and he looked at all things. But even then the hour was late, and so he wet out to Bethany with the twelve.
QUENYA: And he went into Jerusalem, into the temple, and he looked at all things. But even then the hour was late, and so he wet out to Bethany with the twelve.

ENGLISH: On the following day, when they had come out of Bethany, he was hungry.
QUENYA: On the following day, when they had come out of Bethany, he was hungry.

ENGLISH: From afar he saw a fig tree with leaves, and he went to see if maybe he would find some figs on it. But when he came to it, he found nothing except leaves, for that was not the time of figs.
QUENYA: From afar he saw a fig tree with leaves, and he went to see if maybe he would find some figs on it. But when he came to it, he found nothing except leaves, for that was not the time of figs.

ENGLISH: And he spoke and said: “May nobody ever eat fruit from you again!” And his disciples heard it.
QUENYA: And he spoke and said: “May nobody ever eat fruit from you again!” And his disciples heard it.

ENGLISH: Now they came to Jerusalem. There he went into the temple and started to throw out those who sold and traded to themselves in the temple, and he overturned the tables of the people who exchanged money and the chairs of who sold doves,
QUENYA: Now they came to Jerusalem. There he went into the temple and started to throw out those who sold and traded to themselves in the temple, and he overturned the tables of the people who exchanged money and the chairs of who sold doves,

ENGLISH: and he did not allow anyone to carry a tool through the temple.
QUENYA: and he did not allow anyone to carry a tool through the temple.

ENGLISH: But he taught and said to it: “Is not written: 'My house shall be called a house of prayer for all the nations?' But you have made it a cave of robbers!”
QUENYA: But he taught and said to it: “Is not written: 'My house shall be called a house of prayer for all the nations?' But you have made it a cave of robbers!”

ENGLISH: And the chief priests heard it, and they sought how they could undo him, for they feared him, for his teaching filled the entire crowd with wonder.
QUENYA: And the chief priests heard it, and they sought how they could undo him, for they feared him, for his teaching filled the entire crowd with wonder.

ENGLISH: When the hour was late, they went out of the city.
QUENYA: When the hour was late, they went out of the city.

ENGLISH: But when they passed by in an early hour, they saw the fig tree withered up from the roots.
QUENYA: But when they passed by in an early hour, they saw the fig tree withered up from the roots.

ENGLISH: And recalling it, Peter said to him: “Rabbi ,behold! The fig tree that you cursed is withered up.”
QUENYA: And recalling it, Peter said to him: “Rabbi ,behold! The fig tree that you cursed is withered up.”

ENGLISH: And he answered and said: “Have faith in God.
QUENYA: And he answered and said: “Have faith in God.

ENGLISH: Truly I say to you that anyone who says to this mountain: 'Be lifted up and thrown into sea!', and he is not uncertain in his heart but believes that what he is saying will happen, for him it will happen.
QUENYA: Truly I say to you that anyone who says to this mountain: 'Be lifted up and thrown into sea!', and he is not uncertain in his heart but believes that what he is saying will happen, for him it will happen.

ENGLISH: Therefore I say to you: All the things about which you pray and petition, believe that you have received them, and that will happen for you.
QUENYA: Therefore I say to you: All the things about which you pray and petition, believe that you have received them, and that will happen for you.

ENGLISH: And when you stand praying, forgive anything that you have against anyone. Then your Father who is in heaven will also forgive you your crimes.”
QUENYA: And when you stand praying, forgive anything that you have against anyone. Then your Father who is in heaven will also forgive you your crimes.”

ENGLISH: And they came again to Jerusalem. Then the chief priests and the scribes and the elders came to him
QUENYA: And they came again to Jerusalem. Then the chief priests and the scribes and the elders came to him

ENGLISH: and said to him: “What is your authority for doing these things? Or who gave you this authority for doing these things?”
QUENYA: and said to him: “What is your authority for doing these things? Or who gave you this authority for doing these things?”

ENGLISH: Jesus said to them: “I will ask you one question. You answer me, and I too will tell you about the authority with which I do these things.
QUENYA: Jesus said to them: “I will ask you one question. You answer me, and I too will tell you about the authority with which I do these things.

ENGLISH: John's baptism, was it from heaven or from men? Answer me!”
QUENYA: John's baptism, was it from heaven or from men? Answer me!”

ENGLISH: And they considered it among themselves, saying: “If we say: From heaven, he will say: Then how is that you did not believe in him?
QUENYA: And they considered it among themselves, saying: “If we say: From heaven, he will say: Then how is that you did not believe in him?

ENGLISH: But dare we say: From men – ?” They feared the crowd, for all the people believed that John indeed was a prophet.
QUENYA: But dare we say: From men – ?” They feared the crowd, for all the people believed that John indeed was a prophet.

ENGLISH: And they answered Jesus and said: “We do not know.” And Jesus said to them: “Then I too refuse to tell you about the authority by which I do these things.”
QUENYA: And they answered Jesus and said: “We do not know.” And Jesus said to them: “Then I too refuse to tell you about the authority by which I do these things.”

ENGLISH: And he began to say to them with comparisons:“A man planted a garden of vines , surrounded it with a fence, dug a hollow for the vine-press and built a tower. Then he let cultivators use it for money, and went to a foreign country.
QUENYA: And he began to say to them with comparisons:“A man planted a garden of vines , surrounded it with a fence, dug a hollow for the vine-press and built a tower. Then he let cultivators use it for money, and went to a foreign country.

ENGLISH: When the time came, he sent a slave to the cultivators in order to receive from the cultivators some fruits from the garden.
QUENYA: When the time came, he sent a slave to the cultivators in order to receive from the cultivators some fruits from the garden.

ENGLISH: But they took the slave, beat him and sent him away empty.
QUENYA: But they took the slave, beat him and sent him away empty.

ENGLISH: And again he sent to them another slave, and him they hit on the head and behaved towards him with scorn.
QUENYA: And again he sent to them another slave, and him they hit on the head and behaved towards him with scorn.

ENGLISH: And another he sent, and him they killed, and numerous others: Some they flayed and some they killed.
QUENYA: And another he sent, and him they killed, and numerous others: Some they flayed and some they killed.

ENGLISH: There was with him one more, a beloved son. He sent to him to them last, saying: “They will have awe for my son.”
QUENYA: There was with him one more, a beloved son. He sent to him to them last, saying: “They will have awe for my son.”

ENGLISH: But the cultivators said among themselves: “This is the heir. Come, let us kill him, and we shall possess the part of the heir!”
QUENYA: But the cultivators said among themselves: “This is the heir. Come, let us kill him, and we shall possess the part of the heir!”

ENGLISH: And they took him and killed him, and they threw him out of the garden.
QUENYA: And they took him and killed him, and they threw him out of the garden.

ENGLISH: What, then, shall the garden-master do? He shall come and shall destroy the cultivators and will give the garden to others.
QUENYA: What, then, shall the garden-master do? He shall come and shall destroy the cultivators and will give the garden to others.

ENGLISH: Did you really not read this scripture? 'The stone which the builders turned away, it has become head of the corner.
QUENYA: Did you really not read this scripture? 'The stone which the builders turned away, it has become head of the corner.

ENGLISH: From the Lord this thing has come, and it is a wonder in our eyes.'”
QUENYA: From the Lord this thing has come, and it is a wonder in our eyes.'”

ENGLISH: And they tried to seize him, but they feared the crowd. For they knew that about them he spoke the comparison. And they went from him and went off.
QUENYA: And they tried to seize him, but they feared the crowd. For they knew that about them he spoke the comparison. And they went from him and went off.

ENGLISH: Then they sent to him some of the Pharisees and Herodians, in order to catch him in his speech.
QUENYA: Then they sent to him some of the Pharisees and Herodians, in order to catch him in his speech.

ENGLISH: After coming to him they said to him: “Teacher, we know that you are true and does not heed anyone, for you do not look at men's faces, but teach God's way in truth: May we pay tax to the high king , or not? Is it necessary for us to pay, or not do pay?”
QUENYA: After coming to him they said to him: “Teacher, we know that you are true and does not heed anyone, for you do not look at men's faces, but teach God's way in truth: May we pay tax to the high king , or not? Is it necessary for us to pay, or not do pay?”

ENGLISH: But he, perceiving their hypocrisy, said to them: “What is your reason for testing me? Bring me a denarius, for me to see it!”
QUENYA: But he, perceiving their hypocrisy, said to them: “What is your reason for testing me? Bring me a denarius, for me to see it!”

ENGLISH: They brought him one. And he said to them: “Whose is this picture, and the writing?” They said to him: “The High King's.”
QUENYA: They brought him one. And he said to them: “Whose is this picture, and the writing?” They said to him: “The High King's.”

ENGLISH: Then Jesus said to them: “Pay back to the High King the High King's things, but God's things to God.” And they were in wonder concerning him.
QUENYA: Then Jesus said to them: “Pay back to the High King the High King's things, but God's things to God.” And they were in wonder concerning him.

ENGLISH: Then came to him some Sadducees, who say that there is not resurrection, and they said to him:
QUENYA: Then came to him some Sadducees, who say that there is not resurrection, and they said to him:

ENGLISH: “Teacher, Moses wrote to us that if anyone's brother dies and leaves a wife, but there was no child with him, compels for his brother to marry the woman and raise up seed for his brother.
QUENYA: “Teacher, Moses wrote to us that if anyone's brother dies and leaves a wife, but there was no child with him, compels for his brother to marry the woman and raise up seed for his brother.

ENGLISH: There were seven brothers, and the first married a woman, but when he died, he did not leave seed .
QUENYA: There were seven brothers, and the first married a woman, but when he died, he did not leave seed .

ENGLISH: And the second married her, but he died without leaving seed, and so also the third.
QUENYA: And the second married her, but he died without leaving seed, and so also the third.

ENGLISH: Indeed all the seven did not leave seed. Last of all the woman also died.
QUENYA: Indeed all the seven did not leave seed. Last of all the woman also died.

ENGLISH: In the resurrection, when they shall rise, who among the men will have her as wife? For she was wife of all seven men.”
QUENYA: In the resurrection, when they shall rise, who among the men will have her as wife? For she was wife of all seven men.”

ENGLISH: Jesus said to them: “Is not this the reason of your mistake, your failing to know the Scriptures and God's power alike?
QUENYA: Jesus said to them: “Is not this the reason of your mistake, your failing to know the Scriptures and God's power alike?

ENGLISH: For when they rise from the dead, men do not marry and women are not given in marriage, bu they are as the angels in heaven.
QUENYA: For when they rise from the dead, men do not marry and women are not given in marriage, bu they are as the angels in heaven.

ENGLISH: But concerning the dead, that they are raised, did you not read in the book of Moses, in the story of the thorn-bush, how God said to him: “I Abraham's God and Isaac's God and Jacob's God' – ?”
QUENYA: But concerning the dead, that they are raised, did you not read in the book of Moses, in the story of the thorn-bush, how God said to him: “I Abraham's God and Isaac's God and Jacob's God' – ?”

ENGLISH: He is not God of the dead, but of living. You err to a wide extent.”
QUENYA: He is not God of the dead, but of living. You err to a wide extent.”

ENGLISH: And after hearing their quarrel, one of the scribes came near, for he perceived that Jesus answered them well. He asked him: “What is the first of all commandments?”
QUENYA: And after hearing their quarrel, one of the scribes came near, for he perceived that Jesus answered them well. He asked him: “What is the first of all commandments?”

ENGLISH: Jesus answered: “The first is: Hear, Israel! The Lord our God, the Lord is one;
QUENYA: Jesus answered: “The first is: Hear, Israel! The Lord our God, the Lord is one;

ENGLISH: and you are to love the Lord your God with your whole heart and your whole soul and your whole mind and your whole might.
