QUENYA: and you are to love the Lord your God with your whole heart and your whole soul and your whole mind and your whole might.

ENGLISH: The second is this: You are to love your neighbor as yourself. There is not commandment greater than these.
QUENYA: The second is this: You are to love your neighbor as yourself. There is not commandment greater than these.

ENGLISH: The scribe said to him: “Teacher, you spoke well as is true: He is one, and there is nobody except him;
QUENYA: The scribe said to him: “Teacher, you spoke well as is true: He is one, and there is nobody except him;

ENGLISH: and loving him with one's whole heart and whole understanding and whole might, and loving one's neighbor as oneself, is far more valuable than all burnt sacrifices and slain sacrifices.
QUENYA: and loving him with one's whole heart and whole understanding and whole might, and loving one's neighbor as oneself, is far more valuable than all burnt sacrifices and slain sacrifices.

ENGLISH: Then Jesus, noticing that he answered with understanding, said to him: “You are not far from God's kingdom.” And nobody more dared to ask him anymore.
QUENYA: Then Jesus, noticing that he answered with understanding, said to him: “You are not far from God's kingdom.” And nobody more dared to ask him anymore.

ENGLISH: But Jesus spoke and said while he taught in the temple: “How is that the scribes say: 'The Christ is David's son' – ?
QUENYA: But Jesus spoke and said while he taught in the temple: “How is that the scribes say: 'The Christ is David's son' – ?

ENGLISH: By the Holy Spirit David himself said: “The Lord said to my lord: 'Sit beside my right hand until I put your enemies under your feet.'
QUENYA: By the Holy Spirit David himself said: “The Lord said to my lord: 'Sit beside my right hand until I put your enemies under your feet.'

ENGLISH: David himself calls him lord; then how is he his son?”And the great crowd listened to him with joy.
QUENYA: David himself calls him lord; then how is he his son?”And the great crowd listened to him with joy.

ENGLISH: And in his teaching he said: “Watch yourselves about the scribes that want to walk in long cloaks and want to be greeted in the market-places
QUENYA: And in his teaching he said: “Watch yourselves about the scribes that want to walk in long cloaks and want to be greeted in the market-places

ENGLISH: and want the first seats in the synagogues and the most prominent places at the evening meals,
QUENYA: and want the first seats in the synagogues and the most prominent places at the evening meals,

ENGLISH: and who devour the houses of widows and make long prayers in order to be seen by others. They will receive a heavier judgment.”
QUENYA: and who devour the houses of widows and make long prayers in order to be seen by others. They will receive a heavier judgment.”

ENGLISH: And he sat down near to the treasury and watched how the crowd threw money into the treasury, and many rich ones threw many coins into it.
QUENYA: And he sat down near to the treasury and watched how the crowd threw money into the treasury, and many rich ones threw many coins into it.

ENGLISH: Then a poor widow came and gave two little copper-pieces, that were not valuable.
QUENYA: Then a poor widow came and gave two little copper-pieces, that were not valuable.

ENGLISH: And Jesus called his disciples to himself and said to them: “Truly I say to you: This poor widow gave more than all the others who gave to the treasury.
QUENYA: And Jesus called his disciples to himself and said to them: “Truly I say to you: This poor widow gave more than all the others who gave to the treasury.

ENGLISH: For all among them gave out of their abundance, but she out of her need gave everything that she had, her entire livelihood.”
QUENYA: For all among them gave out of their abundance, but she out of her need gave everything that she had, her entire livelihood.”

ENGLISH: And when he went out from the temple one among his disciples said to him: “Teacher, look! Behold the stones and behold the buildings! ”
QUENYA: And when he went out from the temple one among his disciples said to him: “Teacher, look! Behold the stones and behold the buildings! ”

ENGLISH: But Jesus said to him: “Are you seeing these huge buildings? By no means will stone here remain upon stone that will not be thrown down.”
QUENYA: But Jesus said to him: “Are you seeing these huge buildings? By no means will stone here remain upon stone that will not be thrown down.”

ENGLISH: And while he sat on the Mount of Olives across from the temple, Peter and James and Andrew asked him, now that they were alone:
QUENYA: And while he sat on the Mount of Olives across from the temple, Peter and James and Andrew asked him, now that they were alone:

ENGLISH: “Tell us, what the time when these things will happen, and what is the sign that all these things will be close to being completed?”
QUENYA: “Tell us, what the time when these things will happen, and what is the sign that all these things will be close to being completed?”

ENGLISH: And Jesus began to say to them: “Take heed that nobody will cause you to stray.
QUENYA: And Jesus began to say to them: “Take heed that nobody will cause you to stray.

ENGLISH: Numerous ones will come in my name saying: “I he!”, and they will cause numerous ones to stray.
QUENYA: Numerous ones will come in my name saying: “I he!”, and they will cause numerous ones to stray.

ENGLISH: And when you hear about wars and news of wars, do not be scared! These things will by necessity happen, but the end is not yet.
QUENYA: And when you hear about wars and news of wars, do not be scared! These things will by necessity happen, but the end is not yet.

ENGLISH: For nation shall arise against nation and kingdom against kingdom, there will be earthquakes in numerous places, there will be famines. These things are a beginning of pains.
QUENYA: For nation shall arise against nation and kingdom against kingdom, there will be earthquakes in numerous places, there will be famines. These things are a beginning of pains.

ENGLISH: And you, watch yourselves! People will give you over to courts , and you will be beaten in synagogues and made to stand before governors and kings concerning me, as a witness to them.
QUENYA: And you, watch yourselves! People will give you over to courts , and you will be beaten in synagogues and made to stand before governors and kings concerning me, as a witness to them.

ENGLISH: And by necessity the gospel will first be made known in all the nations.
QUENYA: And by necessity the gospel will first be made known in all the nations.

ENGLISH: But when they lead you forward to give you over, do not trouble yourselves beforehand about what you are going to say; but everything that shall be given to you at that time, say that, for you are not the ones who are speaking, but the Holy Spirit .
QUENYA: But when they lead you forward to give you over, do not trouble yourselves beforehand about what you are going to say; but everything that shall be given to you at that time, say that, for you are not the ones who are speaking, but the Holy Spirit .

ENGLISH: Furthermore, brother shall give brother over to death, and a father a child, and children shall rise against parents and cause their death,
QUENYA: Furthermore, brother shall give brother over to death, and a father a child, and children shall rise against parents and cause their death,

ENGLISH: and you will be hated by all concerning my name. But who is enduring to the end, he shall be saved.
QUENYA: and you will be hated by all concerning my name. But who is enduring to the end, he shall be saved.

ENGLISH: But when you see the Contemptible Thing of Destruction stand where is not its proper place” – let the one who is reading understand – “then it compels for those who are in Judea to flee into the mountains. The map on the roof of his house is not to come down or go inside to take anything out of his house,
QUENYA: But when you see the Contemptible Thing of Destruction stand where is not its proper place” – let the one who is reading understand – “then it compels for those who are in Judea to flee into the mountains. The map on the roof of his house is not to come down or go inside to take anything out of his house,

ENGLISH: and the man in the field is not to return to the place that he came from to get his cloak.
QUENYA: and the man in the field is not to return to the place that he came from to get his cloak.

ENGLISH: Woe to the pregnant women and to those who suckle babies in those days!
QUENYA: Woe to the pregnant women and to those who suckle babies in those days!

ENGLISH: Pray that it will not happen in winter,
QUENYA: Pray that it will not happen in winter,

ENGLISH: for in those days will come a tribulation of a kind that has not happened from the beginning of the creation that God created until that time, and it will not happen again.
QUENYA: for in those days will come a tribulation of a kind that has not happened from the beginning of the creation that God created until that time, and it will not happen again.

ENGLISH: And if the Lord did not stop short the days, there would be flesh at all being saved. But for the chosen ones that he has chosen he has stopped short the days.
QUENYA: And if the Lord did not stop short the days, there would be flesh at all being saved. But for the chosen ones that he has chosen he has stopped short the days.

ENGLISH: And if anyone then says to you: “Behold! Here is the Christ!”, or: “Look, there he is!”, do not believe .
QUENYA: And if anyone then says to you: “Behold! Here is the Christ!”, or: “Look, there he is!”, do not believe .

ENGLISH: For false Christs and false prophets shall arise and will do signs and wonders, in order to cause to stray – if that is possible – the chosen ones.
QUENYA: For false Christs and false prophets shall arise and will do signs and wonders, in order to cause to stray – if that is possible – the chosen ones.

ENGLISH: But you take heed; I have told you everything beforehand.
QUENYA: But you take heed; I have told you everything beforehand.

ENGLISH: But in those days, after that tribulation, the Sun will become black, and the Moon will not give its light,
QUENYA: But in those days, after that tribulation, the Sun will become black, and the Moon will not give its light,

ENGLISH: and the stars will fall from heaven, and the powers that exist in heaven will be shaken.
QUENYA: and the stars will fall from heaven, and the powers that exist in heaven will be shaken.

ENGLISH: And then they will see the Son of Man come on clouds with mighty power and glory.
QUENYA: And then they will see the Son of Man come on clouds with mighty power and glory.

ENGLISH: Then he will send the angels and will gather his chosen ones from the four winds, from the border of earth to the border of heaven.
QUENYA: Then he will send the angels and will gather his chosen ones from the four winds, from the border of earth to the border of heaven.

ENGLISH: From the fig tree learn this comparison: As soon as its branch is made soft and it sprouts its leaves, you know summer is near.
QUENYA: From the fig tree learn this comparison: As soon as its branch is made soft and it sprouts its leaves, you know summer is near.

ENGLISH: Thus you as well, when you see that these things happen, know that he is near, before the doors.
QUENYA: Thus you as well, when you see that these things happen, know that he is near, before the doors.

ENGLISH: Truly I say to you that this generation shall not pass away before all these things happen.
QUENYA: Truly I say to you that this generation shall not pass away before all these things happen.

ENGLISH: Heaven and earth shall pass away, but my words shall not pass away.
QUENYA: Heaven and earth shall pass away, but my words shall not pass away.

ENGLISH: About that day and hour nobody knows, not the angels in heaven and not the Son, but the Father alone.
QUENYA: About that day and hour nobody knows, not the angels in heaven and not the Son, but the Father alone.

ENGLISH: Take heed, be awake, for you do not know when the hour shall come.
QUENYA: Take heed, be awake, for you do not know when the hour shall come.

ENGLISH: This is as when a man goes to another country, going away from his house and giving his thralls authority, to everyone concerning his own work, and commanding the gatekeeper to be awake.
QUENYA: This is as when a man goes to another country, going away from his house and giving his thralls authority, to everyone concerning his own work, and commanding the gatekeeper to be awake.

ENGLISH: Therefore be awake, for you do not know the time when the house-master shall come, late or in the middle of the night or when the cock sounds or early
QUENYA: Therefore be awake, for you do not know the time when the house-master shall come, late or in the middle of the night or when the cock sounds or early

ENGLISH: – that he shall not come suddenly and find you asleep.
QUENYA: – that he shall not come suddenly and find you asleep.

ENGLISH: But what I say to you, I say to all: Be awake!”
QUENYA: But what I say to you, I say to all: Be awake!”

ENGLISH: Now two days remained before the Passover and the Festival of Unleavened Breads. And the chief priests and the scribes sought how they would seize Jesus with a cunning device and were going to kill him.
QUENYA: Now two days remained before the Passover and the Festival of Unleavened Breads. And the chief priests and the scribes sought how they would seize Jesus with a cunning device and were going to kill him.

ENGLISH: But they said: “Not at the festival, or there will be an uprising among the people!”
QUENYA: But they said: “Not at the festival, or there will be an uprising among the people!”

ENGLISH: And while he was at Bethany, at the table in the house of Simon the Leper, came a woman having an stone-box of fragrant oil, genuine nard, very precious. She broke open the box and poured the oil upon Jesus' head.
QUENYA: And while he was at Bethany, at the table in the house of Simon the Leper, came a woman having an stone-box of fragrant oil, genuine nard, very precious. She broke open the box and poured the oil upon Jesus' head.

ENGLISH: Then, by rage, some said among themselves: “What is the reason for throwing away this fragrant oil?
QUENYA: Then, by rage, some said among themselves: “What is the reason for throwing away this fragrant oil?

ENGLISH: For this oil one could sell for a sum of money over three hundred denarii and give it to the poor!” And they were wroth against her.
QUENYA: For this oil one could sell for a sum of money over three hundred denarii and give it to the poor!” And they were wroth against her.

ENGLISH: But Jesus said: “Let her be! What is your reason for making things difficult for her? a good deed she has done for me.
QUENYA: But Jesus said: “Let her be! What is your reason for making things difficult for her? a good deed she has done for me.

ENGLISH: For the poor you always have among you, and whenever you want you can do good for them, but me you do not always have.
QUENYA: For the poor you always have among you, and whenever you want you can do good for them, but me you do not always have.

ENGLISH: She did what she could; beforehand she has put fragrant oil on my body before it is brought to the tomb.
QUENYA: She did what she could; beforehand she has put fragrant oil on my body before it is brought to the tomb.

ENGLISH: Truly I say to you: In every place where the gospel is made known, in the whole world, also what this woman did will be told to commemorate her.”
QUENYA: Truly I say to you: In every place where the gospel is made known, in the whole world, also what this woman did will be told to commemorate her.”

ENGLISH: And Judas Iscariot, one of the twelve, went away to the chief priests to give Jesus over to them.
QUENYA: And Judas Iscariot, one of the twelve, went away to the chief priests to give Jesus over to them.

ENGLISH: When they heard it, they were happy and gave him a promise that they would give him money. And he sought how he was going to give Jesus over when it was possible for him.
QUENYA: When they heard it, they were happy and gave him a promise that they would give him money. And he sought how he was going to give Jesus over when it was possible for him.

ENGLISH: At the first day of the Festival of Unleavened Breads, when they killed the Pascal sacrifice, his disciples said to him: “To where do you wish that we are to go to prepare, for you to eat the Passover?”
QUENYA: At the first day of the Festival of Unleavened Breads, when they killed the Pascal sacrifice, his disciples said to him: “To where do you wish that we are to go to prepare, for you to eat the Passover?”

ENGLISH: And he sent two of his disciples and said to them: “Go into the city, an a man carrying a vessel of water will meet you. Follow him,
QUENYA: And he sent two of his disciples and said to them: “Go into the city, an a man carrying a vessel of water will meet you. Follow him,

ENGLISH: and where he goes inside say to the master of the house: The Teacher says: Where is my guest-room, where I can eat the Passover with my disciples?”
QUENYA: and where he goes inside say to the master of the house: The Teacher says: Where is my guest-room, where I can eat the Passover with my disciples?”

ENGLISH: And he will show you a great upper hall, with what is needed and prepared. There prepare for us.”
QUENYA: And he will show you a great upper hall, with what is needed and prepared. There prepare for us.”

ENGLISH: And the two disciples went away and went into the city and found everything as he said, and they prepared for the Passover.
QUENYA: And the two disciples went away and went into the city and found everything as he said, and they prepared for the Passover.

ENGLISH: After evening fell he came with the twelve.
QUENYA: After evening fell he came with the twelve.

ENGLISH: And while they were at the table, eating, Jesus said: “Truly I say to you: One among you, who is eating with me, will give me over.”
QUENYA: And while they were at the table, eating, Jesus said: “Truly I say to you: One among you, who is eating with me, will give me over.”

ENGLISH: The began to have grief and to say to him, one after the other: “Surely I am not he?”
QUENYA: The began to have grief and to say to him, one after the other: “Surely I am not he?”

ENGLISH: He said to them: “He is one of the twelve, who dips with me in the same bowl.
QUENYA: He said to them: “He is one of the twelve, who dips with me in the same bowl.

ENGLISH: The Son of Man indeed goes away, as is written about him, but alas for that man by whom the Son of Man is given over. It was better for that man if he was not born.”
QUENYA: The Son of Man indeed goes away, as is written about him, but alas for that man by whom the Son of Man is given over. It was better for that man if he was not born.”

ENGLISH: As they were eating he took a bread, said a blessing, broke it and gave it to them, and he said: “Take it, this is my body.”
QUENYA: As they were eating he took a bread, said a blessing, broke it and gave it to them, and he said: “Take it, this is my body.”

ENGLISH: And taking a cup he said grace and gave it to them, and all among them drank from it.
QUENYA: And taking a cup he said grace and gave it to them, and all among them drank from it.

ENGLISH: And he said to them: “This is my blood, the blood of the covenant, that will be poured out for many.”
QUENYA: And he said to them: “This is my blood, the blood of the covenant, that will be poured out for many.”

ENGLISH: Truly I say to you: I will by no means drink again from the fruit of the vine until that day when I shall drink it new in God's kingdom.”
QUENYA: Truly I say to you: I will by no means drink again from the fruit of the vine until that day when I shall drink it new in God's kingdom.”

ENGLISH: And after singing hymns , they went out to the Mount of Olives.
QUENYA: And after singing hymns , they went out to the Mount of Olives.

ENGLISH: And Jesus said to them: “All among you shall be caused to fall, for is written: I shall strike the shepherd, and the sheep shall be scattered.
QUENYA: And Jesus said to them: “All among you shall be caused to fall, for is written: I shall strike the shepherd, and the sheep shall be scattered.

ENGLISH: But after I shall be raised I will go before you to Galilee.”
QUENYA: But after I shall be raised I will go before you to Galilee.”

ENGLISH: But Peter said to him: “Also if all the others are caused to fall, still I shall not !”
QUENYA: But Peter said to him: “Also if all the others are caused to fall, still I shall not !”

ENGLISH: Then Jesus said to him: “Truly I say to you: Today, indeed in this night, before a cock sounds two times, thrice you will deny me.”
QUENYA: Then Jesus said to him: “Truly I say to you: Today, indeed in this night, before a cock sounds two times, thrice you will deny me.”

ENGLISH: But Peter said again and again: “Also if it is necessary for me to die with you, I shall by no means deny you!” So spoke also all the others.
QUENYA: But Peter said again and again: “Also if it is necessary for me to die with you, I shall by no means deny you!” So spoke also all the others.

ENGLISH: Then they came to the place called Gethsemane, and Jesus said to his disciples: “Sit here while I pray.”
QUENYA: Then they came to the place called Gethsemane, and Jesus said to his disciples: “Sit here while I pray.”

ENGLISH: And he brought Peter and James and John with himself, and he began to have oppressive feelings and to be troubled.
QUENYA: And he brought Peter and James and John with himself, and he began to have oppressive feelings and to be troubled.

ENGLISH: And he said to them: “My soul is heavy until death with grief. Remain here and keep yourselves awake!”
QUENYA: And he said to them: “My soul is heavy until death with grief. Remain here and keep yourselves awake!”

ENGLISH: After going a short walk forward, he fell to earth and prayed that the hour was to pass from him, if that was possible.
QUENYA: After going a short walk forward, he fell to earth and prayed that the hour was to pass from him, if that was possible.

ENGLISH: And he said: “Abba, Father, all things are possible to you; take away this cup from me! And yet not which I want, but which you want!
QUENYA: And he said: “Abba, Father, all things are possible to you; take away this cup from me! And yet not which I want, but which you want!

ENGLISH: And he came and found them asleep, and he said to Peter: “Simon, are you asleep? Did you really not have the strength to be awake for one hour?
QUENYA: And he came and found them asleep, and he said to Peter: “Simon, are you asleep? Did you really not have the strength to be awake for one hour?

ENGLISH: You be awake and pray, that you do not come into temptation. The spirit is willing, but the flesh is weak.
QUENYA: You be awake and pray, that you do not come into temptation. The spirit is willing, but the flesh is weak.

ENGLISH: And he went away again and prayed, saying the same word.
QUENYA: And he went away again and prayed, saying the same word.

ENGLISH: And again he came and found them asleep, for their eyes were heavy, and they did not know what they were going to answer him.
QUENYA: And again he came and found them asleep, for their eyes were heavy, and they did not know what they were going to answer him.

ENGLISH: And he came the third time and said to them: “Are you still asleep and at rest? That is enough! The hour has come! Behold, the Son of Man is given over into the hands of sinners.
QUENYA: And he came the third time and said to them: “Are you still asleep and at rest? That is enough! The hour has come! Behold, the Son of Man is given over into the hands of sinners.

ENGLISH: Rise, let us go! Look, who gives me over has come near!”
QUENYA: Rise, let us go! Look, who gives me over has come near!”

QUENYA: And in that moment, while Jesus still spoke, came Judas, one of the twelve, and with him a crowd having swords and clubs, from the chief priests and the scribes and the elders.

QUENYA: who was going to give him over gave them beforehand a sign, saying: “The person that I kiss, that is he; seize him and lead him away securely.”

ENGLISH: Then they put their hands on him and seized him.
QUENYA: Then they put their hands on him and seized him.

QUENYA: But one among who stood there drew his sword and struck the chief priest's slave and cut off his ear.

QUENYA: But Jesus spoke and said to them: “Have you come out with swords and clubs, as against a robber whom you will lead away?

QUENYA: Day after day I was with you in the temple teaching, and yet you did not seize me. But it happens to fulfill the Scriptures.”

ENGLISH: And all forsook him and fled.
QUENYA: And all forsook him and fled.

QUENYA: But there was a young man who followed him, having a linen raiment over his naked body; and they tried to seize him,

QUENYA: but he abandoned the linen raiment and fled naked.

QUENYA: Now they led Jesus away to the chief priest, and all the chief priests and the elders and the scribes assembled.

ENGLISH: But Peter from afar followed him into the courtyard of the chief priest, and he was sitting before a fire with the servants to be warm.
QUENYA: But Peter from afar followed him into the courtyard of the chief priest, and he was sitting before a fire with the servants to be warm.

QUENYA: But the chief priests and the entire High Council sought a testimony against Jesus so that they could kill him , but they found nothing.

ENGLISH: Numerous ones gave lying testimony against him,, but the testimonies were not similar .
QUENYA: Numerous ones gave lying testimony against him,, but the testimonies were not similar .

ENGLISH: And some arose and spoke lies against him, saying:
QUENYA: And some arose and spoke lies against him, saying:

QUENYA: “We have heard him say: I will thrown down this temple which was built by hands, and in three days I shall build another that is not made by hands.”

ENGLISH: But also in this matter their testimony was not similar .
QUENYA: But also in this matter their testimony was not similar .

QUENYA: In the end the chief priest arose in their midst and asked Jesus: “Are you answering nothing? What are the things that these people witness against you?”

ENGLISH: But he was silent and answered nothing. Again the chief priest asked him, and he said: “Are you the Christ, son of the Blessed One?”
QUENYA: But he was silent and answered nothing. Again the chief priest asked him, and he said: “Are you the Christ, son of the Blessed One?”

ENGLISH: And Jesus said: “I am; and you shall see the Son of Man sitting by the right hand of the Power and coming with the clouds of heaven.”
QUENYA: And Jesus said: “I am; and you shall see the Son of Man sitting by the right hand of the Power and coming with the clouds of heaven.”

QUENYA: Then the chief priest tore his tunic and said: “What more need do we have of testimony?

QUENYA: You heard the blasphemy! What do you think?” The judgement of all among them was that he was worthy of death.

QUENYA: And some began to spit at him and to cover his face and to strike him and say to him: “Play the prophet!” And striking his face, the court attendants took him away.

QUENYA: Now while Peter was beneath in the court, one among the maidservants came,

QUENYA: and when she saw Peter stand there warming himself, she looked at him and said: “You too was with the man from Nazareth, this Jesus.”

ENGLISH: But he denied it, saying: “I do not know him and I do not understand what you are saying!” Then he went out to the vestibule .
QUENYA: But he denied it, saying: “I do not know him and I do not understand what you are saying!” Then he went out to the vestibule .

ENGLISH: There the maidservant, seeing him, again started to say to those who stood there: “This man is among them!”
QUENYA: There the maidservant, seeing him, again started to say to those who stood there: “This man is among them!”

ENGLISH: Again he denied it. And after a short time those who stood there again said to Peter: “Indeed you are among them, for you are from Galilee!”
QUENYA: Again he denied it. And after a short time those who stood there again said to Peter: “Indeed you are among them, for you are from Galilee!”

ENGLISH: But he started to curse and to give his oath: “I do not know this man that you are talking about!”
QUENYA: But he started to curse and to give his oath: “I do not know this man that you are talking about!”

QUENYA: And as soon as dawn came, the chief priest with the elders and the scribes and the entire High Council made a consideration; and they bound Jesus and led him away and gave him over to Pilate.

QUENYA: And Pilate asked him: “Are you king of the Jews?” He answered: “You say it.”

QUENYA: But the chief priests said he was done many evils.

QUENYA: And Pilate asked him again, saying: “Are you answering nothing? Behold all the evils that they are saying that you have done!”

ENGLISH: But Jesus answered nothing more, and that filled Pilate with wonder.
QUENYA: But Jesus answered nothing more, and that filled Pilate with wonder.

ENGLISH: But from festival to festival he freed to them one bound man, the person that they asked for.
QUENYA: But from festival to festival he freed to them one bound man, the person that they asked for.

ENGLISH: At that time the man called Barabbas was in fetters with those that had risen up , that did murder in their uprising.
QUENYA: At that time the man called Barabbas was in fetters with those that had risen up , that did murder in their uprising.

ENGLISH: And the crowd came up and began to ask that was done to them as the custom was.
QUENYA: And the crowd came up and began to ask that was done to them as the custom was.

ENGLISH: But Pilate asked them, saying: “Do you wish that I free to you the king of the Jews?”
QUENYA: But Pilate asked them, saying: “Do you wish that I free to you the king of the Jews?”

ENGLISH: For he knew that envy was what caused the chief priests to give him over.
QUENYA: For he knew that envy was what caused the chief priests to give him over.

ENGLISH: But the chief priests stirred up the crowd to ask that he would free to them Barabbas in the place .
QUENYA: But the chief priests stirred up the crowd to ask that he would free to them Barabbas in the place .

ENGLISH: But Pilate asked again and said to them: “Then what do you wish that I am to do to who you call king of the Jews?”
QUENYA: But Pilate asked again and said to them: “Then what do you wish that I am to do to who you call king of the Jews?”

ENGLISH: Again they cried: “Crucify him!”
QUENYA: Again they cried: “Crucify him!”

ENGLISH: But Pilate said to them: “Then what is the evil that he has done?” But they cried with a terrible clamor: “Crucify him!”
QUENYA: But Pilate said to them: “Then what is the evil that he has done?” But they cried with a terrible clamor: “Crucify him!”

ENGLISH: Then Pilate, trying to do what the crowd wanted, freed to them Barabbas.
QUENYA: Then Pilate, trying to do what the crowd wanted, freed to them Barabbas.

ENGLISH: But having flayed Jesus he gave him over to be crucified.
QUENYA: But having flayed Jesus he gave him over to be crucified.

QUENYA: Then the soldiers led him away into the courtyard, that is the palace, and they gathered the entire soldier-host.

QUENYA: Then they put on him a purple cloak and made a crown of thorns and put it on him.

QUENYA: And they began to greet him: “Good day , king of the Jews!”

QUENYA: Furthermore, they struck him on his head with a reed and spat at him and went down on their knees and fell down before him.

QUENYA: And having laughed at him with scorn they took from him the purple cloak and put on him his own raiment. Then they brought him outside to crucify him.

QUENYA: And they brought him tot he place called Golgotha, which means Skull Place .

QUENYA: And they crucified him and distributed his raiments by throwing lots about who was going to get what.

ENGLISH: They crucified him at the third hour.
QUENYA: They crucified him at the third hour.

QUENYA: And on the sign indicating the accusation against him was written: “King of the Jews.”

QUENYA: Furthermore, they crucified two robbers with him, one on his right and one on his left.

QUENYA: And those who passed by blasphemed against him, wagging their head and saying: “Ugh! You who were to throw down the temple and to rebuild it in three days,

ENGLISH: save yourself by coming down from the cross!”
QUENYA: save yourself by coming down from the cross!”

QUENYA: Let the Christ, king of Israel, come down from the cross that we can see and believe ”. Also those who were crucified with him blasphemed against him.

QUENYA: When the sixth hour came, darkness fell on the whole land until the ninth hour.

QUENYA: And at the nights hour Jesus cried with a great voice: “Eli, eli, lama sabacthani?”, which means: “My God, my God, what is your reason for abandoning me?”

QUENYA: And some among who stood there, when they heard that, said: “Listen! He is calling Elijah!”

QUENYA: But one ran, filled a sponge with sour wine, put it on a reed, and let him drink, saying: “Let him be! Let us see if Elijah comes to take him down.”

QUENYA: But Jesus cried with a great voice and expired.

QUENYA: And the screen in the sanctuary was torn in two, top to bottom .

QUENYA: There were also some women who were watching from afar. Among them were Mary Magdalene and the Mary who was the mother of James the Younger and of Joses, and Salome,

QUENYA: Now evening was near, and was Preparation, that is, the day before the day of rest.

QUENYA: Therefore Josef of Arimathea came, a well-known man of the Council, who also himself looked forward to the coming of God's kingdom. He dared to go in to Pilate and asked for Jesus' body.

QUENYA: But Pilate could not believe that he died that soon, and he called the centurion and asked him: “Is he now dead?”

QUENYA: And after buying linen he took him down, and he wrapped him with the linen and put him in a rockhewn tomb , and he rolled a stone before the door of the tomb.

QUENYA: But Mary Magdalene and Mary mother of Joses saw the place where Jesus was put.

QUENYA: And very early, on the first day of the week, they came to the tomb, after sunrise.

ENGLISH: And they were saying, one to the other: “Who will roll away the stone from the tomb for us?”
QUENYA: And they were saying, one to the other: “Who will roll away the stone from the tomb for us?”

ENGLISH: But when they looked up, they saw that the stone was rolled away, though it was very big.
QUENYA: But when they looked up, they saw that the stone was rolled away, though it was very big.

ENGLISH: Having gone into the tomb they saw a young man sit on the right, having a white long-tunic , and they were startled.

ENGLISH: But he said to them: “Do not be startled! You are seeking Jesus from Nazareth, who was crucified. He was raised, he is not here! Look at the place where they put him!
QUENYA: But he said to them: “Do not be startled! You are seeking Jesus from Nazareth, who was crucified. He was raised, he is not here! Look at the place where they put him!

QUENYA: But go, tell his disciples and Peter: He will go before you into Galilee. There you will see him, as he said to you.”
