QUENYA: And after coming outside they fled from the tomb, for they were seized by trembling and were beside themselves, and they told nothing to anyone, for they were afraid.

ENGLISH: Genealogy of Jesus Christ, David's son, Abraham's son:
QUENYA: Genealogy of Jesus Christ, David's son, Abraham's son:

ENGLISH: Abraham begat Isaac, and Isaac begat Jacob, and Jakob begat Juda and his brothers,
QUENYA: Abraham begat Isaac, and Isaac begat Jacob, and Jakob begat Juda and his brothers,

ENGLISH: Juda begat Perez and Zerah with Tamar, and Perez begat Hezron, and Hezron begat Ram,
QUENYA: Juda begat Perez and Zerah with Tamar, and Perez begat Hezron, and Hezron begat Ram,

ENGLISH: and Ram begat Amminadab, and Amminadab begat Nahshon, and Nahshon begat Salmon,
QUENYA: and Ram begat Amminadab, and Amminadab begat Nahshon, and Nahshon begat Salmon,

ENGLISH: and Salmon begat Boaz with Rahab, and Boaz begat Obed with Ruth, and Obed begat Jesse,
QUENYA: and Salmon begat Boaz with Rahab, and Boaz begat Obed with Ruth, and Obed begat Jesse,

ENGLISH: and Jesse begat David the king. And David begat Solomon by the wife of Uriah,
QUENYA: and Jesse begat David the king. And David begat Solomon by the wife of Uriah,

ENGLISH: and Solomon begat Rehoboam, and Rehoboam begat Abijah, and Abijah begat Asa,
QUENYA: and Solomon begat Rehoboam, and Rehoboam begat Abijah, and Abijah begat Asa,

ENGLISH: and Asa begat Joshaphat, and Joshaphat begat Joram, and Joram begat Uzziah,
QUENYA: and Asa begat Joshaphat, and Joshaphat begat Joram, and Joram begat Uzziah,

ENGLISH: and Uzziah begat Jotham, and Jotham begat Ahaz, and Ahaz begat Hezekiah,
QUENYA: and Uzziah begat Jotham, and Jotham begat Ahaz, and Ahaz begat Hezekiah,

ENGLISH: and Hezeciah begat Manasseh, and Manasseh begat Amon,
QUENYA: and Hezeciah begat Manasseh, and Manasseh begat Amon,

ENGLISH: and Amon begat Jeconiah and his brothers, at the time that the people was led away as exiles to Babel .
QUENYA: and Amon begat Jeconiah and his brothers, at the time that the people was led away as exiles to Babel .

ENGLISH: After the deportation to Babel Jeconiah begat Shealtiel, and Shealtiel begat Zerubbabel,
QUENYA: After the deportation to Babel Jeconiah begat Shealtiel, and Shealtiel begat Zerubbabel,

ENGLISH: and Zerubbabel begad Abiud, and Abiud begat Eliakim, and Eliakim begat Azor,
QUENYA: and Zerubbabel begad Abiud, and Abiud begat Eliakim, and Eliakim begat Azor,

ENGLISH: and Azor begat Zadok, and Zadok begat Achim, and Achim begat Eliud,
QUENYA: and Azor begat Zadok, and Zadok begat Achim, and Achim begat Eliud,

ENGLISH: and Eliud begat Eleazar, ar Eleazar begat Matthan, and Matthan begat Jacob,
QUENYA: and Eliud begat Eleazar, ar Eleazar begat Matthan, and Matthan begat Jacob,

ENGLISH: and Jacob begat Joseph the husband of Mary , by whom Jesus, who is called Christ, was born.
QUENYA: and Jacob begat Joseph the husband of Mary , by whom Jesus, who is called Christ, was born.

ENGLISH: Thus all the generations from Abraham to David were fourteen, and from David to the deportation to Babel there are fourteen generations, and from the deportation to Babel to Christ fourteen generations.
QUENYA: Thus all the generations from Abraham to David were fourteen, and from David to the deportation to Babel there are fourteen generations, and from the deportation to Babel to Christ fourteen generations.

ENGLISH: But Jesus Christ was born in this manner: When his mother Mary was obliged to marry Joseph, she was found with child by Holy Spirit, before they were united.
QUENYA: But Jesus Christ was born in this manner: When his mother Mary was obliged to marry Joseph, she was found with child by Holy Spirit, before they were united.

ENGLISH: But Joseph her husband, who was just and did not wish to humiliate her, wanted to release her secretly.
QUENYA: But Joseph her husband, who was just and did not wish to humiliate her, wanted to release her secretly.

ENGLISH: But after he thought this, behold! the Lord's angel came to him in a dream, saying: “Joseph son of David, do not be afraid of taking Mary your wife to your house, for which is conceived in her is by the Holy Spirit.
QUENYA: But after he thought this, behold! the Lord's angel came to him in a dream, saying: “Joseph son of David, do not be afraid of taking Mary your wife to your house, for which is conceived in her is by the Holy Spirit.

ENGLISH: She will bear a son, and you will name him Jesus, for he will deliver his people from their sins.”
QUENYA: She will bear a son, and you will name him Jesus, for he will deliver his people from their sins.”

ENGLISH: All these things happened in order to make true which the Lord said by his herald , saying:
QUENYA: All these things happened in order to make true which the Lord said by his herald , saying:

ENGLISH: “Behold! the maiden will be with child and will bear a son, and they will give him the name Immanuel” – which means “With us God.”
QUENYA: “Behold! the maiden will be with child and will bear a son, and they will give him the name Immanuel” – which means “With us God.”

ENGLISH: Then Joseph, after his awakening from his sleep, did as the Lord's angel had commanded him, and he took his wife to his house.
QUENYA: Then Joseph, after his awakening from his sleep, did as the Lord's angel had commanded him, and he took his wife to his house.

ENGLISH: But he did not know her before she bore a son, and he gave him the name Jesus.
QUENYA: But he did not know her before she bore a son, and he gave him the name Jesus.

ENGLISH: After Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judea, in the days of Herod the king, behold! star-gazers from eastern regions came to Jerusalem,
QUENYA: After Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judea, in the days of Herod the king, behold! star-gazers from eastern regions came to Jerusalem,

ENGLISH: saying: “Where is who has been born king of the Jews? For in the East we saw his star, and we have come to bow before him.”
QUENYA: saying: “Where is who has been born king of the Jews? For in the East we saw his star, and we have come to bow before him.”

ENGLISH: When he heard this, King Herod was stirred up, and all of Jerusalem with him,
QUENYA: When he heard this, King Herod was stirred up, and all of Jerusalem with him,

ENGLISH: and gathering all the chief priests and the scribes among the people, he asked them about where the Christ was to be born.
QUENYA: and gathering all the chief priests and the scribes among the people, he asked them about where the Christ was to be born.

ENGLISH: They said to him: “In Bethlehem of Judea, for so is written by the prophet:
QUENYA: They said to him: “In Bethlehem of Judea, for so is written by the prophet:

ENGLISH: 'And you, Bethlehem of Judea, is by no means the smallest among the governors of Judea; for from you shall come a ruler, who will be a shepherd for my people Israel.”
QUENYA: 'And you, Bethlehem of Judea, is by no means the smallest among the governors of Judea; for from you shall come a ruler, who will be a shepherd for my people Israel.”

ENGLISH: Then Herod secretly summoned the star-gazers and asked them about the first time that they saw the star.
QUENYA: Then Herod secretly summoned the star-gazers and asked them about the first time that they saw the star.

ENGLISH: He sent them to Bethlehem saying: “Go, seek the child, and when you have found him, tell me, for me to be able to go to bow before him, I as well.”
QUENYA: He sent them to Bethlehem saying: “Go, seek the child, and when you have found him, tell me, for me to be able to go to bow before him, I as well.”

ENGLISH: When they heard the king they went away, and look! the star that they had seen in the East went before them, until it stopped above the place where the child was.
QUENYA: When they heard the king they went away, and look! the star that they had seen in the East went before them, until it stopped above the place where the child was.

ENGLISH: Seeing the star gave them great joy.
QUENYA: Seeing the star gave them great joy.

ENGLISH: They went inside the house and saw the child with Mary its mother, and falling down they bowed to him. They opened their treasures and gave to him gifts: gold and frankincense and fragrant resin.
QUENYA: They went inside the house and saw the child with Mary its mother, and falling down they bowed to him. They opened their treasures and gave to him gifts: gold and frankincense and fragrant resin.

ENGLISH: But when they were told in a dream about the danger of returning to Herod, they went to their land by another road.
QUENYA: But when they were told in a dream about the danger of returning to Herod, they went to their land by another road.

ENGLISH: After they went away, look! an angel of the Lord showed himself to Joseph in a dream, saying: “Rise, take the child and its mother and flee to Egypt, and remain there until I shall tell you; for Herod will seek the child to kill it.”
QUENYA: After they went away, look! an angel of the Lord showed himself to Joseph in a dream, saying: “Rise, take the child and its mother and flee to Egypt, and remain there until I shall tell you; for Herod will seek the child to kill it.”

ENGLISH: And he arose and took the child and its mother with him at night, and he went away to Egypt,
QUENYA: And he arose and took the child and its mother with him at night, and he went away to Egypt,

ENGLISH: and he remained there until Herod's death. Thus was made true what was said by the Lord through his prophet , saying: “Out of Egypt I called my son.”
QUENYA: and he remained there until Herod's death. Thus was made true what was said by the Lord through his prophet , saying: “Out of Egypt I called my son.”

ENGLISH: Then Herod, seeing that he was made a fool by the star-gazers, was filled with great rage, and he sent soldiers to kill all boys in Bethlehem and in all the regions surrounding it, from two years and under that, according to the time of which he had received knowledge from the star-gazers.
QUENYA: Then Herod, seeing that he was made a fool by the star-gazers, was filled with great rage, and he sent soldiers to kill all boys in Bethlehem and in all the regions surrounding it, from two years and under that, according to the time of which he had received knowledge from the star-gazers.

ENGLISH: Then was made true which was spoken through Jeremiah the Prophet, saying:
QUENYA: Then was made true which was spoken through Jeremiah the Prophet, saying:

ENGLISH: “A voice was heard in Rama, wailing and great lament – Rachel wailing for her children, and she did not want comfort, for they are gone.”
QUENYA: “A voice was heard in Rama, wailing and great lament – Rachel wailing for her children, and she did not want comfort, for they are gone.”

ENGLISH: After Herod's death, behold! an angel of the Lord showed himself to Joseph in a dream in Egypt,
QUENYA: After Herod's death, behold! an angel of the Lord showed himself to Joseph in a dream in Egypt,

ENGLISH: and he said: “Rise, take the child and go into the land of Israel, for those who want to take the child's life are dead.”
QUENYA: and he said: “Rise, take the child and go into the land of Israel, for those who want to take the child's life are dead.”

ENGLISH: He arose and took the child and its mother and went into the land of Israel.
QUENYA: He arose and took the child and its mother and went into the land of Israel.

ENGLISH: But when he heard that Arcelaus ruled in Judea in the place of Herod his father, he feared to go there. In a dream he was told about his danger, and he went away into the region of Galilee.
QUENYA: But when he heard that Arcelaus ruled in Judea in the place of Herod his father, he feared to go there. In a dream he was told about his danger, and he went away into the region of Galilee.

ENGLISH: He came and dwelt in a city called Nazareth, to make true which was spoken through the prophets: “He will be called a Nazarene.”
QUENYA: He came and dwelt in a city called Nazareth, to make true which was spoken through the prophets: “He will be called a Nazarene.”

ENGLISH: In those days came John the Baptist, making known in the wilderness of Judea:
QUENYA: In those days came John the Baptist, making known in the wilderness of Judea:

ENGLISH: “Find repentance, for the kingdom of heaven has come near.”
QUENYA: “Find repentance, for the kingdom of heaven has come near.”

ENGLISH: For this man was of whom Isaiah the Prophet spoke when he said: “The voice of person crying in the wilderness: You are to prepare the Lord's way, make his paths straight!”
QUENYA: For this man was of whom Isaiah the Prophet spoke when he said: “The voice of person crying in the wilderness: You are to prepare the Lord's way, make his paths straight!”

ENGLISH: John was wrapped in a cloak of hairs of camels and had a leather-belt around his hips, and his food was grasshoppers and wild honey.
QUENYA: John was wrapped in a cloak of hairs of camels and had a leather-belt around his hips, and his food was grasshoppers and wild honey.

ENGLISH: Then Jerusalem and all of Judea and the entire land surrounding Jordan went out to him,
QUENYA: Then Jerusalem and all of Judea and the entire land surrounding Jordan went out to him,

ENGLISH: and they were baptized by him in the river Jordan, confessing their sins.
QUENYA: and they were baptized by him in the river Jordan, confessing their sins.

ENGLISH: When he saw many Pharisees and Sadducees come to the baptism, he said to them: “Offspring of serpents, who taught you to escape from the coming wrath?
QUENYA: When he saw many Pharisees and Sadducees come to the baptism, he said to them: “Offspring of serpents, who taught you to escape from the coming wrath?

ENGLISH: Then bear fruit worthy of the repentance!
QUENYA: Then bear fruit worthy of the repentance!

ENGLISH: And do not think that you may say to yourselves: 'Our father is Abraham' – for I say to you that God can rise up children to Abraham from these stones.
QUENYA: And do not think that you may say to yourselves: 'Our father is Abraham' – for I say to you that God can rise up children to Abraham from these stones.

ENGLISH: Even now the ax is lying by the roots of the trees: Thus every three that does not bear good fruit will be cut down and thrown into the fire.
QUENYA: Even now the ax is lying by the roots of the trees: Thus every three that does not bear good fruit will be cut down and thrown into the fire.

ENGLISH: I baptize you with water, into repentance. But that comes after me is mightier than I – I am not worthy to take the shoes from his feet. He will baptize you with Holy Spirit and with fire.
QUENYA: I baptize you with water, into repentance. But that comes after me is mightier than I – I am not worthy to take the shoes from his feet. He will baptize you with Holy Spirit and with fire.

ENGLISH: His winnowing fork is in his hand, and he will cleanse his threshing floor. He will gather his grain into the store, but the chaff he will burn with a fire that nobody can extinguish.
QUENYA: His winnowing fork is in his hand, and he will cleanse his threshing floor. He will gather his grain into the store, but the chaff he will burn with a fire that nobody can extinguish.

ENGLISH: Then Jesus went from Galilee to Jordan and came to John to be baptized by him.
QUENYA: Then Jesus went from Galilee to Jordan and came to John to be baptized by him.

ENGLISH: But John denied him, and he said: “My need is that I will be baptized by you, and you are coming to me!”
QUENYA: But John denied him, and he said: “My need is that I will be baptized by you, and you are coming to me!”

ENGLISH: But in answer Jesus said: “Allow it to happen, for thus it is proper for us to do everything that is just.” Then he allowed him .
QUENYA: But in answer Jesus said: “Allow it to happen, for thus it is proper for us to do everything that is just.” Then he allowed him .

ENGLISH: After Jesus was baptized he came straightway out of the water, and behold! heaven was opened to him, and he saw God's Spirit coming down upon him like a dove.
QUENYA: After Jesus was baptized he came straightway out of the water, and behold! heaven was opened to him, and he saw God's Spirit coming down upon him like a dove.

ENGLISH: Behold! was also a voice from heaven that said: “This is my son, the beloved, with whom I am pleased!”
QUENYA: Behold! was also a voice from heaven that said: “This is my son, the beloved, with whom I am pleased!”

ENGLISH: Then Jesus was led by the spirit up into the desert, to be tempted by the Devil.
QUENYA: Then Jesus was led by the spirit up into the desert, to be tempted by the Devil.

ENGLISH: He did not eat for forty days and forty nights, and after this time he was hungry.
QUENYA: He did not eat for forty days and forty nights, and after this time he was hungry.

ENGLISH: And the Tempter came to him and said: “If you are God's son, say to these stones: Become breads!”
QUENYA: And the Tempter came to him and said: “If you are God's son, say to these stones: Become breads!”

ENGLISH: But in answer he said: “It is written: Man does not live only by bread, but by every word that comes from God's mouth.”
QUENYA: But in answer he said: “It is written: Man does not live only by bread, but by every word that comes from God's mouth.”

ENGLISH: Then the Devil led him to the holy city and put him at the pinnacle of the temple.
QUENYA: Then the Devil led him to the holy city and put him at the pinnacle of the temple.

ENGLISH: He said to him: “If you are God's son, throw yourself down, for is written: He will command his angels concerning you, and they will carry you on their hands, to stop your foot from striking against stone.”
QUENYA: He said to him: “If you are God's son, throw yourself down, for is written: He will command his angels concerning you, and they will carry you on their hands, to stop your foot from striking against stone.”

ENGLISH: Jesus said: “Again is written: Do not test the Lord your God!”
QUENYA: Jesus said: “Again is written: Do not test the Lord your God!”

ENGLISH: Again the Devil brought him to an extremely high mountain, and showed him all the kingdoms of earth and their glory.
QUENYA: Again the Devil brought him to an extremely high mountain, and showed him all the kingdoms of earth and their glory.

ENGLISH: And he said to him: “All these things I will give to you if you fall down and you worship me.”
QUENYA: And he said to him: “All these things I will give to you if you fall down and you worship me.”

ENGLISH: Then Jesus said to him: “Begone, Satan! For is written: The Lord your God you are to worship, and he alone you are to serve.”
QUENYA: Then Jesus said to him: “Begone, Satan! For is written: The Lord your God you are to worship, and he alone you are to serve.”

ENGLISH: Then the Devil went away from him, and behold! angels came and served him.
QUENYA: Then the Devil went away from him, and behold! angels came and served him.

ENGLISH: After hearing that John was put in prison, he went off into Galilee.
QUENYA: After hearing that John was put in prison, he went off into Galilee.

ENGLISH: He went away from Nazareth and came and dwelt in Capernaum beside sea, in Zebulon's and Naphtali's regions,
QUENYA: He went away from Nazareth and came and dwelt in Capernaum beside sea, in Zebulon's and Naphtali's regions,

ENGLISH: to make true which was said through Isaiah the Prophet when he said:
QUENYA: to make true which was said through Isaiah the Prophet when he said:

ENGLISH: “O land of Zebulon and Naphtali, the sea-road beyond Jordan, Galilee of the nations!
QUENYA: “O land of Zebulon and Naphtali, the sea-road beyond Jordan, Galilee of the nations!

ENGLISH: The people sitting in darkness saw a great light, and to who sat in the region of death-shadow, light arose.”
QUENYA: The people sitting in darkness saw a great light, and to who sat in the region of death-shadow, light arose.”

ENGLISH: From that time he made his message known and said: “Find repentance, for the kingdom of heaven has come near!”
QUENYA: From that time he made his message known and said: “Find repentance, for the kingdom of heaven has come near!”

ENGLISH: Walking by the Sea of Galilee he saw two brothers, Simon who is called Peter and Andrew his brother, throwing a net into the sea, for they were fishers.
QUENYA: Walking by the Sea of Galilee he saw two brothers, Simon who is called Peter and Andrew his brother, throwing a net into the sea, for they were fishers.

ENGLISH: And he said to them: “Come, follow me, and I will make you fishers of men.”
QUENYA: And he said to them: “Come, follow me, and I will make you fishers of men.”

ENGLISH: In the same moment they left their net and followed him.
QUENYA: In the same moment they left their net and followed him.

ENGLISH: Going from there he saw also two others who were brothers, James son of Zebedee and John his brother, in the boat with Zebedee their father, repairing their nets – and he called them.
QUENYA: Going from there he saw also two others who were brothers, James son of Zebedee and John his brother, in the boat with Zebedee their father, repairing their nets – and he called them.

ENGLISH: In the same moment they abandoned the boat and their father, and followed him.
QUENYA: In the same moment they abandoned the boat and their father, and followed him.

ENGLISH: And he went through all of Galilee, teaching in their synagogues and making known the gospel about the kingdom and healing every illness and every sickness among the people.
QUENYA: And he went through all of Galilee, teaching in their synagogues and making known the gospel about the kingdom and healing every illness and every sickness among the people.

ENGLISH: And the story about him went into all of Syria, and they brought to him all ill ones, tormented by illnesses and by torments of many kinds: demon-possessed ones and moon-sick ones and impeded ones – and he healed them.
QUENYA: And the story about him went into all of Syria, and they brought to him all ill ones, tormented by illnesses and by torments of many kinds: demon-possessed ones and moon-sick ones and impeded ones – and he healed them.

ENGLISH: And great crowds followed him, from Galile and the Ten Cities and Jerusalem and Judea, and from the country beyond the Jordan.
QUENYA: And great crowds followed him, from Galile and the Ten Cities and Jerusalem and Judea, and from the country beyond the Jordan.

ENGLISH: Seeing the crowds he went up into the mountain, and when he sat down his disciples came to him.
QUENYA: Seeing the crowds he went up into the mountain, and when he sat down his disciples came to him.

ENGLISH: And he opened his mouth and instructed them, saying:
QUENYA: And he opened his mouth and instructed them, saying:

ENGLISH: “Happy are the lacking ones in spirit, for they will possess the kingdom of heaven!
QUENYA: “Happy are the lacking ones in spirit, for they will possess the kingdom of heaven!

ENGLISH: Happy are the ones that have grief, for they shall be comforted!
QUENYA: Happy are the ones that have grief, for they shall be comforted!

ENGLISH: Happy are the gentle ones, for they shall be heirs of earth!
QUENYA: Happy are the gentle ones, for they shall be heirs of earth!

ENGLISH: Happy are the ones hungry and thirsty for righteousness, for they shall be filled!
QUENYA: Happy are the ones hungry and thirsty for righteousness, for they shall be filled!

ENGLISH: Happy are the ones that give mercy, for they will receive mercy!
QUENYA: Happy are the ones that give mercy, for they will receive mercy!

ENGLISH: Happy are the pure of heart, for they shall see God!
QUENYA: Happy are the pure of heart, for they shall see God!

ENGLISH: Happy are the ones that make peace, or they will be called God's sons!
QUENYA: Happy are the ones that make peace, or they will be called God's sons!

ENGLISH: Happy are the ones persecuted because of righteousness, for the kingdom of heaven is for them!
QUENYA: Happy are the ones persecuted because of righteousness, for the kingdom of heaven is for them!

ENGLISH: Happy are you when people abuse you and persecute you and lying say every evil about you, by reason of me.
QUENYA: Happy are you when people abuse you and persecute you and lying say every evil about you, by reason of me.

ENGLISH: You be happy and leap for joy, for great is your reward in heaven.
QUENYA: You be happy and leap for joy, for great is your reward in heaven.

ENGLISH: You are the salt of earth; but if the strength goes away from the salt, how will its salty taste come back? It is not more good for a single thing, but is thrown outside, where people will trample upon it.
QUENYA: You are the salt of earth; but if the strength goes away from the salt, how will its salty taste come back? It is not more good for a single thing, but is thrown outside, where people will trample upon it.

ENGLISH: You are the world's light. A city upon a mountain is not possible to hide.
QUENYA: You are the world's light. A city upon a mountain is not possible to hide.

ENGLISH: One does not light a lamp and put it under a vessel, but on the lampstand, and it shines on everyone in the house.
QUENYA: One does not light a lamp and put it under a vessel, but on the lampstand, and it shines on everyone in the house.

ENGLISH: Thus you as well cause your light to shine upon men, for them to see your good deeds and for them to give glory to your Father, who is in heaven.
QUENYA: Thus you as well cause your light to shine upon men, for them to see your good deeds and for them to give glory to your Father, who is in heaven.

ENGLISH: Do not think that I have come to take away the Law or the Prophets. I have not come to take away, but to make real!
QUENYA: Do not think that I have come to take away the Law or the Prophets. I have not come to take away, but to make real!

ENGLISH: For I say to you that heaven and earth will pass before a single smallest letter or a single mark will pass away from the Law, before everything has been made true.
QUENYA: For I say to you that heaven and earth will pass before a single smallest letter or a single mark will pass away from the Law, before everything has been made true.

ENGLISH: Thus, everyone that breaks one among the smallest commandments and teaches men so, he will be called the smallest, in the kingdom of heaven. But everyone who follows it and instructs others about it, he shall he called great in the kingdom of heaven.
QUENYA: Thus, everyone that breaks one among the smallest commandments and teaches men so, he will be called the smallest, in the kingdom of heaven. But everyone who follows it and instructs others about it, he shall he called great in the kingdom of heaven.

ENGLISH: For I say to you that of your righteousness is not greater than the righteousness of the scribes and the Pharisees, you will by no means come into the kingdom of heaven.
QUENYA: For I say to you that of your righteousness is not greater than the righteousness of the scribes and the Pharisees, you will by no means come into the kingdom of heaven.

ENGLISH: You heard that was said to the old ones: Do not kill, but anyone that does kill will come under judgement!
QUENYA: You heard that was said to the old ones: Do not kill, but anyone that does kill will come under judgement!

ENGLISH: But I say to you that anyone who is angry with his brother will come under judgement, and anyone who says to his brother: 'Ráca' will be judged by the High Council, but anyone who says: 'Fool!' will be destined for Gehenna's fire!
QUENYA: But I say to you that anyone who is angry with his brother will come under judgement, and anyone who says to his brother: 'Ráca' will be judged by the High Council, but anyone who says: 'Fool!' will be destined for Gehenna's fire!

ENGLISH: If, then, you are coming to the altar bringing your gift, and there you recall that your brother has a quarrel with you,
QUENYA: If, then, you are coming to the altar bringing your gift, and there you recall that your brother has a quarrel with you,

ENGLISH: you are to leave your gift there before the altar, and go away: First make your peace with your brother, and then, when you have returned, you may bring your gift.
QUENYA: you are to leave your gift there before the altar, and go away: First make your peace with your brother, and then, when you have returned, you may bring your gift.

ENGLISH: Be quick to make peace with your enemy while you are still with him on the road – or the enemy will give you over to the judge, and the judge to the court attendant , and you will be thrown into prison.
QUENYA: Be quick to make peace with your enemy while you are still with him on the road – or the enemy will give you over to the judge, and the judge to the court attendant , and you will be thrown into prison.

ENGLISH: Truly I say to you: You will not come out from there before you have payed the last small piece of silver!
QUENYA: Truly I say to you: You will not come out from there before you have payed the last small piece of silver!

ENGLISH: You have heard that it has been said: 'Do not break marriage!'
QUENYA: You have heard that it has been said: 'Do not break marriage!'

ENGLISH: But I say to you that everyone who looks at a woman longing for her, has even then broken marriage with her in his heart.
QUENYA: But I say to you that everyone who looks at a woman longing for her, has even then broken marriage with her in his heart.

ENGLISH: If your right eye seduces you, tear it out and throw it away from you! For if one among your body parts is lost, that is for you better than that your entire body is thrown into Gehenna.
QUENYA: If your right eye seduces you, tear it out and throw it away from you! For if one among your body parts is lost, that is for you better than that your entire body is thrown into Gehenna.

ENGLISH: And if your right hand seduces you, cut it off and throw it away from you. For if one among your body-parts is lost, that is for you better than that your entire body comes into Gehenna.
QUENYA: And if your right hand seduces you, cut it off and throw it away from you. For if one among your body-parts is lost, that is for you better than that your entire body comes into Gehenna.

ENGLISH: It is said: It is necessary for the one who divorces his wife to give her a writing of divorce .
QUENYA: It is said: It is necessary for the one who divorces his wife to give her a writing of divorce .

ENGLISH: But I say to you: Everyone who divorces his wife except by reason of fonication, causes her to break marriage. And who gets married to a woman who has been sent away, breaks marriage.
QUENYA: But I say to you: Everyone who divorces his wife except by reason of fonication, causes her to break marriage. And who gets married to a woman who has been sent away, breaks marriage.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, you have heard that was said to the old ones: “Do not give a lying oath, but keep for the Lord the oaths that you have given.
QUENYA: Furthermore, you have heard that was said to the old ones: “Do not give a lying oath, but keep for the Lord the oaths that you have given.

ENGLISH: But I say to you: Do not give oaths at all, not by heaven , for it is the throne of God,
QUENYA: But I say to you: Do not give oaths at all, not by heaven , for it is the throne of God,

ENGLISH: or by earth, for it is the support for his feet, or by Jerusalem, for it is the city of the mighty king.
QUENYA: or by earth, for it is the support for his feet, or by Jerusalem, for it is the city of the mighty king.

ENGLISH: Also do not give oaths by your head, for you cannot make a single hair white or black.
QUENYA: Also do not give oaths by your head, for you cannot make a single hair white or black.

ENGLISH: Your speech will be yes, yes – no, no! which is beyond this, is of evil.
QUENYA: Your speech will be yes, yes – no, no! which is beyond this, is of evil.

ENGLISH: You have heard that has been said: “An eye for an eye, and a tooth for a tooth!
QUENYA: You have heard that has been said: “An eye for an eye, and a tooth for a tooth!

ENGLISH: But I say to you: Do not stand against that does evil to you. If anyone strikes you on your right chin, turn also the other one towards him.
QUENYA: But I say to you: Do not stand against that does evil to you. If anyone strikes you on your right chin, turn also the other one towards him.

ENGLISH: If anyone wants to go to a judge with you to take your tunic, allow him to take also your cloak.
QUENYA: If anyone wants to go to a judge with you to take your tunic, allow him to take also your cloak.

ENGLISH: And if anyone compels you to follow him one mile, go with him two miles.
QUENYA: And if anyone compels you to follow him one mile, go with him two miles.

ENGLISH: Give to who asks of you, and do not turn from who wants to use anything that you have.
QUENYA: Give to who asks of you, and do not turn from who wants to use anything that you have.

ENGLISH: You have heard that is said: Love your neighbor and hate your enemy!
QUENYA: You have heard that is said: Love your neighbor and hate your enemy!

ENGLISH: But I say to you: Love your enemies, bless the ones that curse you, do well to those that hate you, and pray for those that pursue you,
QUENYA: But I say to you: Love your enemies, bless the ones that curse you, do well to those that hate you, and pray for those that pursue you,

ENGLISH: for you to be children of your Father in heaven. For he causes his sun to rise over wicked ones and good ones, and lets rain fall upon just ones and unjust ones.
QUENYA: for you to be children of your Father in heaven. For he causes his sun to rise over wicked ones and good ones, and lets rain fall upon just ones and unjust ones.

ENGLISH: If you love who love you, what is your reward? Do not the tax collectors do the same thing?
QUENYA: If you love who love you, what is your reward? Do not the tax collectors do the same thing?

ENGLISH: And if you greet only your brothers, how is this a great thing? Do not people of the nations do the same?
QUENYA: And if you greet only your brothers, how is this a great thing? Do not people of the nations do the same?

ENGLISH: Be, then, perfect, as your Father in heaven is perfect.
QUENYA: Be, then, perfect, as your Father in heaven is perfect.

ENGLISH: Take heed that you do not do your righteousness in front of men to be watched by them, or you will not have reward from your Father in heaven.
QUENYA: Take heed that you do not do your righteousness in front of men to be watched by them, or you will not have reward from your Father in heaven.

ENGLISH: Therefore, when you give gifts of mercy, do not sound a trumpet before you, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and on the roads, to receive glory from them. Truly I say to you: They are receiving their whole reward.
QUENYA: Therefore, when you give gifts of mercy, do not sound a trumpet before you, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and on the roads, to receive glory from them. Truly I say to you: They are receiving their whole reward.

ENGLISH: But you, when you give gifts of mercy, do not let your left hand know what your right hand is doing;
QUENYA: But you, when you give gifts of mercy, do not let your left hand know what your right hand is doing;

ENGLISH: thus your gifts of mercy will be in secret; then your father, who is watching in secret, will reward you.
QUENYA: thus your gifts of mercy will be in secret; then your father, who is watching in secret, will reward you.

ENGLISH: Therefore, when you pray, do not be like the hypocrites, for they love to pray when they are standing on the corners of the roads, in order to be visible to men.
QUENYA: Therefore, when you pray, do not be like the hypocrites, for they love to pray when they are standing on the corners of the roads, in order to be visible to men.

ENGLISH: Truly I tell you: They are receiving their entire reward.
QUENYA: Truly I tell you: They are receiving their entire reward.

ENGLISH: But you , when you pray, go into your own room, and after closing your door, pray to your Father who is in secret; then your Father who is secretly watching, will pay you.
QUENYA: But you , when you pray, go into your own room, and after closing your door, pray to your Father who is in secret; then your Father who is secretly watching, will pay you.

ENGLISH: But when you are praying, do not say the same things in monotonous repetition, as people of the nations do, for they think that they will be being heard by using numerous words.
QUENYA: But when you are praying, do not say the same things in monotonous repetition, as people of the nations do, for they think that they will be being heard by using numerous words.

ENGLISH: Therefore, do not be like them, for God your Father know your needs before you request from him.
QUENYA: Therefore, do not be like them, for God your Father know your needs before you request from him.

ENGLISH: Pray, then, thus: Our Father in heaven, holy be your name!
QUENYA: Pray, then, thus: Our Father in heaven, holy be your name!

ENGLISH: Let your kingdom come! Let your will be done on earth as in heaven!
QUENYA: Let your kingdom come! Let your will be done on earth as in heaven!

ENGLISH: Give us today our daily bread,
QUENYA: Give us today our daily bread,

ENGLISH: and forgive us our sins as we forgive them to them that sin against us.
QUENYA: and forgive us our sins as we forgive them to them that sin against us.

ENGLISH: Do not lead us into temptation but deliver us from evil! Amen!
QUENYA: Do not lead us into temptation but deliver us from evil! Amen!

ENGLISH: If you forgive men their crimes, your Father in heaven will also forgive you;
QUENYA: If you forgive men their crimes, your Father in heaven will also forgive you;

ENGLISH: but if you do not forgive men, your Father will in the same manner not forgive your crimes to you.
QUENYA: but if you do not forgive men, your Father will in the same manner not forgive your crimes to you.

ENGLISH: When you keep a fast, do not be like the hypocrites, who make their face disfigured in order to make their fast visible to men. Truly I say to you: They are receiving their entire reward.
QUENYA: When you keep a fast, do not be like the hypocrites, who make their face disfigured in order to make their fast visible to men. Truly I say to you: They are receiving their entire reward.

ENGLISH: But you , when you keep a fast, put oil on your head and wash your face.
QUENYA: But you , when you keep a fast, put oil on your head and wash your face.

ENGLISH: Thus your fasting will not be visible to men, but to your Father who is in secret; and your Father, who secretly is watching, will pay you.
QUENYA: Thus your fasting will not be visible to men, but to your Father who is in secret; and your Father, who secretly is watching, will pay you.

ENGLISH: Do not gather for yourselves treasures on earth, where moth and erosion devour, and where thieves break in and steal.
QUENYA: Do not gather for yourselves treasures on earth, where moth and erosion devour, and where thieves break in and steal.

ENGLISH: But gather for yourselves treasures in heaven, where moth and erosion do not devour, and where thieves do not break in and steal.
QUENYA: But gather for yourselves treasures in heaven, where moth and erosion do not devour, and where thieves do not break in and steal.

ENGLISH: For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.
QUENYA: For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.

ENGLISH: Your body's lamp is the eye. Therefore, if your eye is in health, your entire body will be bright,
QUENYA: Your body's lamp is the eye. Therefore, if your eye is in health, your entire body will be bright,

ENGLISH: but if your eye is wicked, your entire body will be dark. If the light that is in you is darkness, how great the darkness is!
QUENYA: but if your eye is wicked, your entire body will be dark. If the light that is in you is darkness, how great the darkness is!

ENGLISH: Nobody can be a slave for two lords; he will hate the one and love the other, or he will stick to the one and loathe the other. You cannot be slaves for God and for Mammon alike.
QUENYA: Nobody can be a slave for two lords; he will hate the one and love the other, or he will stick to the one and loathe the other. You cannot be slaves for God and for Mammon alike.

ENGLISH: Therefore I say to you: Do not be troubled about yourselves, about what you will eat or what you will drink, or about your bodies, concerning the clothers you will wear. Is the life not more than food and the body than the clothes?
QUENYA: Therefore I say to you: Do not be troubled about yourselves, about what you will eat or what you will drink, or about your bodies, concerning the clothers you will wear. Is the life not more than food and the body than the clothes?

ENGLISH: Notice the birds of heaven, that they do not sow or reap or gather into barns , and yet your heavenly Father gives them food. Are you not more important than them?
QUENYA: Notice the birds of heaven, that they do not sow or reap or gather into barns , and yet your heavenly Father gives them food. Are you not more important than them?

ENGLISH: Who among you can add a single cubit to his life?
QUENYA: Who among you can add a single cubit to his life?

ENGLISH: Furthermore, concerning clothes, what is your reason for being troubled? Learn from the lilies of the field, how they do not labour and do not twine ,
QUENYA: Furthermore, concerning clothes, what is your reason for being troubled? Learn from the lilies of the field, how they do not labour and do not twine ,

ENGLISH: but I tell you that Solomon in his glory was not clad as a single among them.
QUENYA: but I tell you that Solomon in his glory was not clad as a single among them.

ENGLISH: If God so adorns the plants in the field, that exist today and will be gone tomorrow, how much more richly will he cover you, you of little faith?
QUENYA: If God so adorns the plants in the field, that exist today and will be gone tomorrow, how much more richly will he cover you, you of little faith?

ENGLISH: Therefore, do not be troubled and say: “What will we eat?” or “With what are we to cover ourselves?”
QUENYA: Therefore, do not be troubled and say: “What will we eat?” or “With what are we to cover ourselves?”

ENGLISH: For all these things the nations pursue. But your heavenly Father knows that you have need of all these things.
QUENYA: For all these things the nations pursue. But your heavenly Father knows that you have need of all these things.

ENGLISH: Seek first the kingdom and his righteousness, and all these things will be added to you.
QUENYA: Seek first the kingdom and his righteousness, and all these things will be added to you.

ENGLISH: Therefore, do not be troubled about the following day, for the following day will have its own troubles. Every day's evil suffices for it.
QUENYA: Therefore, do not be troubled about the following day, for the following day will have its own troubles. Every day's evil suffices for it.

ENGLISH: Do not judge, so as not to be judged,
QUENYA: Do not judge, so as not to be judged,

ENGLISH: for by the judgment with which you are judging you will be judged, and by the measure with which you measure out, will be measured out to you.
QUENYA: for by the judgment with which you are judging you will be judged, and by the measure with which you measure out, will be measured out to you.

ENGLISH: Then how is that you look at the sedge in your brother's eye, but does not heed the rafter in your own eye?
QUENYA: Then how is that you look at the sedge in your brother's eye, but does not heed the rafter in your own eye?

ENGLISH: Or how is it possible for you to say to your brother: 'Allow me to pull the sedge out of your eye', when behold! there is a rafter in your own eye?
QUENYA: Or how is it possible for you to say to your brother: 'Allow me to pull the sedge out of your eye', when behold! there is a rafter in your own eye?

ENGLISH: Hypocrite! First pull he rafter out from your own eye, and then you can see how to pull the sedge out of your brother's eye.
QUENYA: Hypocrite! First pull he rafter out from your own eye, and then you can see how to pull the sedge out of your brother's eye.

ENGLISH: Do not give what is holy to the dogs; in the same manner, do not throw your pearls before swine, or they will trample them under their feet and will turn themselves and tear you .
QUENYA: Do not give what is holy to the dogs; in the same manner, do not throw your pearls before swine, or they will trample them under their feet and will turn themselves and tear you .

ENGLISH: Ask, and will be given you; seek, and you shall find, knock, and will be opened to you.
QUENYA: Ask, and will be given you; seek, and you shall find, knock, and will be opened to you.

ENGLISH: For everyone asking receives, and everyone seeking finds, and to everyone knocking will be opened.
QUENYA: For everyone asking receives, and everyone seeking finds, and to everyone knocking will be opened.

ENGLISH: Who among you, if his son asks for a bread, will give him a stone?
QUENYA: Who among you, if his son asks for a bread, will give him a stone?

ENGLISH: Or if he asks for a fish – surely he will not give him a snake?
QUENYA: Or if he asks for a fish – surely he will not give him a snake?

ENGLISH: Therefore, if you that are wicked know to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your Father who is in heaven give good things to those that ask of him?
QUENYA: Therefore, if you that are wicked know to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your Father who is in heaven give good things to those that ask of him?

ENGLISH: Therefore, all things that you want done to you by men, do them in the same manner. That is what the Law and the Prophets mean.
QUENYA: Therefore, all things that you want done to you by men, do them in the same manner. That is what the Law and the Prophets mean.

ENGLISH: Go inside through the narrow gate, for broad and wide is the road that leads away to destruction, and numerous are the ones that go inside through it,
QUENYA: Go inside through the narrow gate, for broad and wide is the road that leads away to destruction, and numerous are the ones that go inside through it,

ENGLISH: but narrow is the gate and narrow is the road leading into life, and few are that find it.
QUENYA: but narrow is the gate and narrow is the road leading into life, and few are that find it.

ENGLISH: Watch yourselves concerning the false prophets that come to you in sheep's clothing, but on the inside they are devouring wolves.
QUENYA: Watch yourselves concerning the false prophets that come to you in sheep's clothing, but on the inside they are devouring wolves.

ENGLISH: By their fruits you will know them. People do not gather grapes from thorns or figs from thistles, no?
QUENYA: By their fruits you will know them. People do not gather grapes from thorns or figs from thistles, no?

ENGLISH: Thus every good tree bears good fruit, but every rotten tree produces foul fruit.
QUENYA: Thus every good tree bears good fruit, but every rotten tree produces foul fruit.

ENGLISH: A good tree cannot bear worthless fruit; in the same manner, a rotten tree cannot bear good fruit.
QUENYA: A good tree cannot bear worthless fruit; in the same manner, a rotten tree cannot bear good fruit.

ENGLISH: Every tree that does not bear good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.
QUENYA: Every tree that does not bear good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.

ENGLISH: Indeed by their fruit you will know them!
QUENYA: Indeed by their fruit you will know them!

ENGLISH: Not everyone who says to me: Lord, Lord, will come into the kingdom of heaven, but who does the will of my Father who is in heaven.
QUENYA: Not everyone who says to me: Lord, Lord, will come into the kingdom of heaven, but who does the will of my Father who is in heaven.

ENGLISH: Numerous ones will say to me in that day: 'Lord, Lord, did we not speak as prophets in your name, and throw out demons in your name, and do many mighty deeds in your name?'
QUENYA: Numerous ones will say to me in that day: 'Lord, Lord, did we not speak as prophets in your name, and throw out demons in your name, and do many mighty deeds in your name?'

ENGLISH: But then I will tell them: 'I did not ever know you! Away from me, you who break the law!'
QUENYA: But then I will tell them: 'I did not ever know you! Away from me, you who break the law!'

ENGLISH: Therefore everyone who hears these words of mine will be like an intelligent man, who built his house on the rock.
QUENYA: Therefore everyone who hears these words of mine will be like an intelligent man, who built his house on the rock.

ENGLISH: And the rain poured down, and the floods came, and the winds blew and beat against that house, but it did not fall, for it was founded on the rock.
QUENYA: And the rain poured down, and the floods came, and the winds blew and beat against that house, but it did not fall, for it was founded on the rock.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, everyone that hears these words of mine and does not do according to them is like an unintelligent man, who built his house on the sand.
QUENYA: Furthermore, everyone that hears these words of mine and does not do according to them is like an unintelligent man, who built his house on the sand.

ENGLISH: And the rain poured down, and the floods came, and the winds blew and struck against that house, and it collapsed, and its fall was great!”
QUENYA: And the rain poured down, and the floods came, and the winds blew and struck against that house, and it collapsed, and its fall was great!”

ENGLISH: Now when Jesus finished all these words, the crowds were in wonder at his teaching,
QUENYA: Now when Jesus finished all these words, the crowds were in wonder at his teaching,

ENGLISH: for he taught them as a person having authority, and not like their scribes.
QUENYA: for he taught them as a person having authority, and not like their scribes.

ENGLISH: And after he came down from the mountain huge throngs followed him.
QUENYA: And after he came down from the mountain huge throngs followed him.

ENGLISH: And look, a leprous person cane to him and fell down before him, saying: “Lord, if you wish, you can cleanse me!”
QUENYA: And look, a leprous person cane to him and fell down before him, saying: “Lord, if you wish, you can cleanse me!”

ENGLISH: And reaching out with his hand he touched him, saying: “I want to! Be clean!” And in the same moment he was cleansed from his leprosy .
QUENYA: And reaching out with his hand he touched him, saying: “I want to! Be clean!” And in the same moment he was cleansed from his leprosy .

ENGLISH: And Jesus said to him: “See that you say nothing to anyone, but go, show yourself to the priest, and sacrifice the gift that Moses commanded, as a witness to them!”
QUENYA: And Jesus said to him: “See that you say nothing to anyone, but go, show yourself to the priest, and sacrifice the gift that Moses commanded, as a witness to them!”

ENGLISH: And when he went into Capernaum, a centurion came to him, petitioning of him
QUENYA: And when he went into Capernaum, a centurion came to him, petitioning of him

ENGLISH: and saying: “Lord, my servant lies lame in the house, having terrible pains!”
QUENYA: and saying: “Lord, my servant lies lame in the house, having terrible pains!”

ENGLISH: And he said to him: “When I come, I shall heal him!”
QUENYA: And he said to him: “When I come, I shall heal him!”

ENGLISH: But the centurion answered him: “Lord, I am not worthy that you come under my roof, but if you solely say the word, my servant will be healed.
QUENYA: But the centurion answered him: “Lord, I am not worthy that you come under my roof, but if you solely say the word, my servant will be healed.

ENGLISH: For I as well am a man put under authority, having soldiers under me, and if I say to this person: Go!, then he is going, and to another: Come!, then he is coming, and to my servant: Do this!, then he does it!”
QUENYA: For I as well am a man put under authority, having soldiers under me, and if I say to this person: Go!, then he is going, and to another: Come!, then he is coming, and to my servant: Do this!, then he does it!”

ENGLISH: Hearing that, Jesus was filled with wonder and said to that followed him: “I truly say to you, such faith I have not found in anyone in Israel.
QUENYA: Hearing that, Jesus was filled with wonder and said to that followed him: “I truly say to you, such faith I have not found in anyone in Israel.

ENGLISH: But I say to you that numerous ones will come from East and West and will lie at the table with Abraham and Isaac and Jacob in the kingdom of heaven,
QUENYA: But I say to you that numerous ones will come from East and West and will lie at the table with Abraham and Isaac and Jacob in the kingdom of heaven,

ENGLISH: while the sons of the kingdom will be thrown into the darkness on the outside. There will be their waiting and their grinding of teeth!
QUENYA: while the sons of the kingdom will be thrown into the darkness on the outside. There will be their waiting and their grinding of teeth!

ENGLISH: Then Jesus said to the centurion: “Go! As you have believed, so let it happen for you!” And the servant was healed in that hour.
QUENYA: Then Jesus said to the centurion: “Go! As you have believed, so let it happen for you!” And the servant was healed in that hour.

ENGLISH: And Jesus, when he came into Peter's house, saw his wife's mother bedridden and sick with a fever.
QUENYA: And Jesus, when he came into Peter's house, saw his wife's mother bedridden and sick with a fever.

ENGLISH: And Jesus touched her hand, and the fever vanished from her. And she arose and ministered to him.
QUENYA: And Jesus touched her hand, and the fever vanished from her. And she arose and ministered to him.

ENGLISH: But after evening came, people brought to him many that were possessed by demons, and he threw out the demons with a word, and he healed all that were suffering,
QUENYA: But after evening came, people brought to him many that were possessed by demons, and he threw out the demons with a word, and he healed all that were suffering,

ENGLISH: making true what was written through Isaiah the Prophet, saying: “He took our illnesses and bore our sicknesses!”
QUENYA: making true what was written through Isaiah the Prophet, saying: “He took our illnesses and bore our sicknesses!”

ENGLISH: When Jesus saw a throng that surrounded him, he commanded that they were to go to the other shore.
QUENYA: When Jesus saw a throng that surrounded him, he commanded that they were to go to the other shore.

ENGLISH: And a scribe came to him and said to him: “Teacher, I will follow you to every place that you go!”
QUENYA: And a scribe came to him and said to him: “Teacher, I will follow you to every place that you go!”

ENGLISH: But Jesus said to him: “Foxes have holes and the birds of heaven have nests, but the Son of Man does not have a place where he may put his head!”
QUENYA: But Jesus said to him: “Foxes have holes and the birds of heaven have nests, but the Son of Man does not have a place where he may put his head!”

ENGLISH: Then another among his disciples sayd to him: “Lord, let me first go away and bring my father to his grave!”
QUENYA: Then another among his disciples sayd to him: “Lord, let me first go away and bring my father to his grave!”

ENGLISH: Jesus said to him: “Follow me, and let the dead bring their dead ones to their graves!”
QUENYA: Jesus said to him: “Follow me, and let the dead bring their dead ones to their graves!”

ENGLISH: And when he went into a boat, his disciples followed him.
QUENYA: And when he went into a boat, his disciples followed him.

ENGLISH: And look, there was an uprising in the sea, covering the boat with the waves, but he was asleep.
QUENYA: And look, there was an uprising in the sea, covering the boat with the waves, but he was asleep.

ENGLISH: And they came and woke him up, saying: “Lord, save us, we are dying!”
QUENYA: And they came and woke him up, saying: “Lord, save us, we are dying!”

ENGLISH: But he said to them: “How is that you are timid, people of little faith?” Then, standing up, he rebuked the winds and the sea, and there was a deep silence.
QUENYA: But he said to them: “How is that you are timid, people of little faith?” Then, standing up, he rebuked the winds and the sea, and there was a deep silence.

ENGLISH: But the men were filled with wonder and said: “Of what kind is this man, since also the winds and the sea do as he says?”
QUENYA: But the men were filled with wonder and said: “Of what kind is this man, since also the winds and the sea do as he says?”

ENGLISH: When he came to the other shore, into the land of the Gadarenes, two men possessed by demons met him, coming from the graves, extremely fierce. Therefore nobody had the courage to choose that road.
QUENYA: When he came to the other shore, into the land of the Gadarenes, two men possessed by demons met him, coming from the graves, extremely fierce. Therefore nobody had the courage to choose that road.

ENGLISH: And behold! they cried , saying: “What is to us and to you, Son of God? Have you come hither to torment us before the time?”
QUENYA: And behold! they cried , saying: “What is to us and to you, Son of God? Have you come hither to torment us before the time?”

ENGLISH: But far from them was a herd of many pigs on pasture.
QUENYA: But far from them was a herd of many pigs on pasture.

ENGLISH: The demons asked of him, saying: “If you throw us out, send us into the herd of pigs!”
QUENYA: The demons asked of him, saying: “If you throw us out, send us into the herd of pigs!”

ENGLISH: And he said to them: “Go!” And after coming out they went into the pigs, and behold! the entire herd wend rushing over the precipice into the sea, and they died in the waters.
QUENYA: And he said to them: “Go!” And after coming out they went into the pigs, and behold! the entire herd wend rushing over the precipice into the sea, and they died in the waters.

ENGLISH: But the shepherds fled, and going into the city they told everything, also concerning the demon-possessed ones.
QUENYA: But the shepherds fled, and going into the city they told everything, also concerning the demon-possessed ones.

ENGLISH: And behold! the entire city went out to meet Jesus, and after seeing him, they urged him to go away from their regions.
QUENYA: And behold! the entire city went out to meet Jesus, and after seeing him, they urged him to go away from their regions.

ENGLISH: And going into the boat he crossed the sea and went into his own city.
QUENYA: And going into the boat he crossed the sea and went into his own city.

ENGLISH: And behold, they brought to him a lame man lying on a bed. Seeing their faith Jesus said to the lame one: “Courage, child! Your sins are forgiven!”
QUENYA: And behold, they brought to him a lame man lying on a bed. Seeing their faith Jesus said to the lame one: “Courage, child! Your sins are forgiven!”

ENGLISH: And behold, some among the scribes said to themselves: “This man is blaspheming!”
QUENYA: And behold, some among the scribes said to themselves: “This man is blaspheming!”

ENGLISH: And Jesus, knowing their thoughts, said: “How is that you are thinking wicked things in your heart?
QUENYA: And Jesus, knowing their thoughts, said: “How is that you are thinking wicked things in your heart?

ENGLISH: For what is the more easy thing to say: Your sins are forgiven, or: Rise and walk – ? But for you to know that the Son of Man has power on earth to forgive sins – ” then he said to the lame one: “Rise, take your bed and go to your home!”
QUENYA: For what is the more easy thing to say: Your sins are forgiven, or: Rise and walk – ? But for you to know that the Son of Man has power on earth to forgive sins – ” then he said to the lame one: “Rise, take your bed and go to your home!”

ENGLISH: And he arose and went to his home.
QUENYA: And he arose and went to his home.

ENGLISH: Seeing that, the crowds were terrified and gave glory to God, who gave such power to men.
QUENYA: Seeing that, the crowds were terrified and gave glory to God, who gave such power to men.

ENGLISH: And going away from there Jesus saw a man sit at the tax office, called Matthew, and he said to him: “Follow me!” And he arose and followed him.
QUENYA: And going away from there Jesus saw a man sit at the tax office, called Matthew, and he said to him: “Follow me!” And he arose and followed him.

ENGLISH: Thereafter, when he lay by the table in the house, behold! many tax collectors and sinners came and lay there with Jesus and his disciples.
QUENYA: Thereafter, when he lay by the table in the house, behold! many tax collectors and sinners came and lay there with Jesus and his disciples.

ENGLISH: But seeing that, the Pharisees were saying to his disciples: “How is that your teacher eats with the tax collectors and sinners?
QUENYA: But seeing that, the Pharisees were saying to his disciples: “How is that your teacher eats with the tax collectors and sinners?

ENGLISH: Hearing it he said: “People in health do not have need of a healer, but the ailing ones .
QUENYA: Hearing it he said: “People in health do not have need of a healer, but the ailing ones .

ENGLISH: Go and learn what this means: I want mercy and not sacrifice. For I came to call, not righteous ones, but sinners!”
QUENYA: Go and learn what this means: I want mercy and not sacrifice. For I came to call, not righteous ones, but sinners!”

ENGLISH: Then John the Baptist's disciples came to him and asked: “How is that we and the Pharisees keep fasts, but your disciples do not keep fasts?”
QUENYA: Then John the Baptist's disciples came to him and asked: “How is that we and the Pharisees keep fasts, but your disciples do not keep fasts?”

ENGLISH: And Jesus said to them: “The friends of the bridegroom surely cannot have grief while the bridegroom is with them? But days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them, and then they will keep fasts.
QUENYA: And Jesus said to them: “The friends of the bridegroom surely cannot have grief while the bridegroom is with them? But days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them, and then they will keep fasts.

ENGLISH: No one fastens a patch of unshrunk cloth on an old cloak, for its full power will pull from it, and there will be a worse tearing.
QUENYA: No one fastens a patch of unshrunk cloth on an old cloak, for its full power will pull from it, and there will be a worse tearing.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, no one puts new wine in old skin-bottles, but if one does do so, the skin-bottles are ruptured and the wine pours out and the skin-bottles are destroyed. But people put new wine in new skin-bottles, and both remain!”
QUENYA: Furthermore, no one puts new wine in old skin-bottles, but if one does do so, the skin-bottles are ruptured and the wine pours out and the skin-bottles are destroyed. But people put new wine in new skin-bottles, and both remain!”

ENGLISH: While he told them these things, behold! a ruler came near and bowed to him, saying: “My daughter died a little while ago, but come and put your hand on her, and she will return to life!”
QUENYA: While he told them these things, behold! a ruler came near and bowed to him, saying: “My daughter died a little while ago, but come and put your hand on her, and she will return to life!”

ENGLISH: Then Jesus arose and followed him, with his disciples.
QUENYA: Then Jesus arose and followed him, with his disciples.

ENGLISH: And behold! a woman having a flood of blood for twelve years came behind him and touched the rim of his cloak,
QUENYA: And behold! a woman having a flood of blood for twelve years came behind him and touched the rim of his cloak,

ENGLISH: for she said to herself: “If only I touch his cloak I shall be saved!”
QUENYA: for she said to herself: “If only I touch his cloak I shall be saved!”

ENGLISH: Jesus turned and, noticing her, said: “Courage, daughter! Your faith has saved you!” And from that time the woman had health.
QUENYA: Jesus turned and, noticing her, said: “Courage, daughter! Your faith has saved you!” And from that time the woman had health.

ENGLISH: When he came to the house of the ruler and saw the flute-players and the crowd making clamour,
QUENYA: When he came to the house of the ruler and saw the flute-players and the crowd making clamour,

ENGLISH: Jesus said: “Go away from here, for the maiden did not die, but she is asleep. Then they laughed at him with scorn.
QUENYA: Jesus said: “Go away from here, for the maiden did not die, but she is asleep. Then they laughed at him with scorn.

ENGLISH: After sending the crowd outside he went inside and took her hand, and the maiden arose.
QUENYA: After sending the crowd outside he went inside and took her hand, and the maiden arose.

ENGLISH: And this story went out to that entire region.
QUENYA: And this story went out to that entire region.

ENGLISH: When Jesus passed along from there, two blind men followed him, crying and saying: “Have mercy on us, Son of David!”
QUENYA: When Jesus passed along from there, two blind men followed him, crying and saying: “Have mercy on us, Son of David!”

ENGLISH: After going into the house, the sightless ones came to him, and Jesus said to them: “Do you believe that I can do this?” They answered him: “Yes, Lord!”
QUENYA: After going into the house, the sightless ones came to him, and Jesus said to them: “Do you believe that I can do this?” They answered him: “Yes, Lord!”

ENGLISH: Then he touched their eyes, saying: “May it happen to you as you believe!”
QUENYA: Then he touched their eyes, saying: “May it happen to you as you believe!”

ENGLISH: And their eyes received sight. Furthermore, Jesus firmly commanded them, saying: “See that no one knows it!”
QUENYA: And their eyes received sight. Furthermore, Jesus firmly commanded them, saying: “See that no one knows it!”

ENGLISH: But they, when they went outside, told about him to in that entire region.
QUENYA: But they, when they went outside, told about him to in that entire region.

ENGLISH: Now, when he went away, behold! people brought him a dumb man possessed by a demon,
QUENYA: Now, when he went away, behold! people brought him a dumb man possessed by a demon,

QUENYA: But the Pharisees said: “By the lord of the demons he throws out the demons!”

QUENYA: When he saw the crowds, his heart went out to them, for they were naked and scattered like sheep without a shepherd.

QUENYA: Then he said to his disciples: “The harvest is great, but who work are few. Therefore ask of the Lord of the harvest that he will send workers to his harvest!”

QUENYA: names of the twelve disciples are these: First Simon who is called Peter, and Andrew his brother, and Jacob the son of Zebedee, and John his brother,

QUENYA: Philip and Bartholomew, Thomas and Matthew the tax collector, Jacob the brother of Alpheus and Thaddeus,

QUENYA: Simon the Cananean and Judas Iscariot, who after gave him over.

QUENYA: These twelve Jesus sent forth, giving them these commands: “Do not go on the road to the nations, and do not come into a Samaritan city.

QUENYA: Instead go to the lost sheep from the house of Israel!

QUENYA: While you go, make known the message, saying: 'The kingdom of heaven has come near.'

QUENYA: Do not put gold or silver or copper in your belt

QUENYA: or bring a food-pouch for the journey, or two tunics, or shoes or a staff, for who works is worthy of his food.

ENGLISH: In every city or village into which you come, find out who in it is worthy, and remain there until you go away.
QUENYA: In every city or village into which you come, find out who in it is worthy, and remain there until you go away.

ENGLISH: When you come into the house, greet it,
QUENYA: When you come into the house, greet it,

QUENYA: and if the house is worthy, may the peace that you wish for it come upon it, but if it is not worthy, may the peace from you return to you.

QUENYA: Whenever anyone does not receive you or listens to your words, when you go away form that house or from that city, shake the dust from your feet .

QUENYA: Truly I say to you: The Day of Judgement will be more bearable for the land of Sodom than for that city!

QUENYA: Behold! I send you like sheep among wolves. Therefore be intelligent like serpents and guiltless like doves.

QUENYA: Watch yourselves against men, for they will give you over to tribunals and will flay you in their synagogues.

QUENYA: You will be led before governors and kings concernin me, as a witness to them and to the nations.

QUENYA: But when they give you over, do not be troubled about how or what you are to say, for which you are to say will be given to you in that hour.

ENGLISH: For that speak are not only you, but your Father's Spirit that speaks by you.
QUENYA: For that speak are not only you, but your Father's Spirit that speaks by you.

QUENYA: Furthermore, brother will give brother over to death, and a father his child, and children will rise against their parents and will cause their death.

QUENYA: And you will be hated by all concerning my name, but who endures to the end, he will he saved.

QUENYA: When they pursue you in this city, flee to another, for truly I say to you: By no means will you complete the circuit of the cities of Israel before the Son of Man shall come.

QUENYA: A disciple is not above who instructs him, or a slave above his lord.

QUENYA: It suffices for the disciple if he becomes like who instructs him, and the slave like his lord. If people called the householder Beelzebul, how much more will they call the people of his house so?

QUENYA: And not do fear those that kills the body but cannot kill the soul; sooner fear that can undo soul and body alike in Gehenna.

QUENYA: But also all the hairs on your head are counted.

QUENYA: Therefore everyone that confesses me before men, I as well will confess before my father who is in heaven;

QUENYA: and a man's enemies are the people of his house.

QUENYA: When they went away, Jesus began to speak to the crowd concerning John: “What did you go forth into the desert to see? A sedge moving by the wind?

QUENYA: No, what did you go forth to see? A man having soft clothes? Behold, those that have soft clothes are in the houses of kings!

QUENYA: But for what reason did you go forth? Seeing a prophet? Yes, I say to you, and far more than a prophet!

For if the mighty deeds that have happened in you happened in Tyre or Sidon, long ago they sought repentance in sackcloth and ash!

For if the mighty deeds that have happened in you happened in Tyre or Sidon, long ago they sought repentance in sackcloth and ash!

QUENYA: Therefore I say to you: To Tyre and Sidon the Day of Judgement will be more bearable than it will be for you .

QUENYA: At that time Jesus rose his voice and said: “I praise you, Father, Lord over heaven and earth, since you have hid these things from the wise and intelligent, and has revealed them to babes!

QUENYA: Yes, Father, for doing so was what pleased you!

QUENYA: All things are given to me by my Father, and no one wholly knows the Son except the Father; furthermore, no one wholly knows the Father except the Son and anyone to whom the Son wishes to reveal him.

QUENYA: For my yoke is gentle, and my burden light.

QUENYA: And seeing this the Pharisees said to him: “Behold! Your disiciples do what is not alloewd to do on the day of rest!”

QUENYA: He said to them: “Have you not read about what David did when he and the men with him were hungry.

QUENYA: He went into God's house and ate the breads of showing, which were not allowed food for him or for those that were with him, but for the priests alone?

QUENYA: For the Son of Man is Lord of the day of rest!”

QUENYA: And behold! was there a man having a withered hand.

QUENYA: He said to them: “Who is the man among you having a single sheep who does not, if this sheep falls into a hollow on the day of rest, take hold of it and lift it out?

QUENYA: But how more precious than a sheep is a man! Thus is allowed to do good on the day of rest!”

QUENYA: Then he said to the man: “Reach out with your hand!” And he reached out with it, and it was renewed and was like the other hand.

QUENYA: And in his name the nations shall put their hope!”

QUENYA: Knowing their thoughts, he said to them: “Every kingdom split against itself is made void, and every city and house split against itself will not stand.

QUENYA: And if Satan throws out Satan, he is split against himself; then how will his kingdom stand?

QUENYA: For anyone who speaks a word against the Son of Man, to him it will be forgiven, but who speaks against the Holy spirit, that will not be forgiven him, in this age and the coming one alike.

QUENYA: In answer he said to them: “A wicked and unfaithful generation is seeking a sign, but a sign will not be given to it, except the sign of Jonah the Prophet.

QUENYA: For like Jonah was in the inward part of the big fish for three days and three nights, so the Son of Man will be in the heart of the earth for three days and three nights.

QUENYA: Men from Ninive will arise in the judgement with this generation and will judge it evil, for they found repentance when Jonah made his message known, but behold! here is what is greater than Jonah!

QUENYA: The queen of the South will rise in the judgment with this generation and will judge it evil, for she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon, and behold! here is what is greater than Solomon.

QUENYA: When an unclean spirit comes out from a man, it passes through dry places seeking a place of rest, but it does not find .
