ENGLISH: John's baptism, where was it from? From heaven or from men?” But they made a consideration among themselves, saying: “If we say: From heaven, he will say to us: Then how is that you did not believe in him?
QUENYA: John's baptism, where was it from? From heaven or from men?” But they made a consideration among themselves, saying: “If we say: From heaven, he will say to us: Then how is that you did not believe in him?

ENGLISH: But if we say: From men, we will fear the crowd, for all mong them beliee that John was a prophet!”
QUENYA: But if we say: From men, we will fear the crowd, for all mong them beliee that John was a prophet!”

ENGLISH: And in answer they said to Jesus: “We do not know!” He as well said to them: “Then I alike do not tell you about the authority with which I do these things!”
QUENYA: And in answer they said to Jesus: “We do not know!” He as well said to them: “Then I alike do not tell you about the authority with which I do these things!”

ENGLISH: But what do you think? was a man with two children. He went to the first one and said: Child, today work in the garden of wines!
QUENYA: But what do you think? was a man with two children. He went to the first one and said: Child, today work in the garden of wines!

ENGLISH: He said: I am going, lord! – but he did not go.
QUENYA: He said: I am going, lord! – but he did not go.

ENGLISH: Going to the other, he said the same thing. But in answer he said: I do not want to. But afterwards he changed his mind and went.
QUENYA: Going to the other, he said the same thing. But in answer he said: I do not want to. But afterwards he changed his mind and went.

ENGLISH: Who among the two did the father's will?” They said: “The second one!” Jesus said to them: “Truly I say to you: The tax collectors and the harlots go before you into God's kingdom.
QUENYA: Who among the two did the father's will?” They said: “The second one!” Jesus said to them: “Truly I say to you: The tax collectors and the harlots go before you into God's kingdom.

ENGLISH: For John came to you in the way of righteousness, but you did not believe in him. But the tax collectors and the harlots believed in him, and you, though you saw that, did not afterwards change your mind so as to believe in him.
QUENYA: For John came to you in the way of righteousness, but you did not believe in him. But the tax collectors and the harlots believed in him, and you, though you saw that, did not afterwards change your mind so as to believe in him.

ENGLISH: Hear another comparison: There was a man, a householder, who planted a garden of vines , surrounded it with a fence, dug a wine-press and built a tower. Then he let some cultivators use it for money, and went to foreign country.
QUENYA: Hear another comparison: There was a man, a householder, who planted a garden of vines , surrounded it with a fence, dug a wine-press and built a tower. Then he let some cultivators use it for money, and went to foreign country.

ENGLISH: When the time of fruits came, he sent his servants to get his fruits.
QUENYA: When the time of fruits came, he sent his servants to get his fruits.

ENGLISH: But the cultivators took his servants, and one they beat up, another they slew, on another they threw stones until he died.
QUENYA: But the cultivators took his servants, and one they beat up, another they slew, on another they threw stones until he died.

ENGLISH: Again he sent other servants, more numerous than the first ones, but they did the same to them.
QUENYA: Again he sent other servants, more numerous than the first ones, but they did the same to them.

ENGLISH: In the end he sent his son to them, saying: “They will have awe for my son!”
QUENYA: In the end he sent his son to them, saying: “They will have awe for my son!”

ENGLISH: Seeing the son, the cultivators said among themselves: “This is the heir; come, let us kill him and get his inheritance!”
QUENYA: Seeing the son, the cultivators said among themselves: “This is the heir; come, let us kill him and get his inheritance!”

ENGLISH: And seizing him, they threw him out of the garden and killed him.
QUENYA: And seizing him, they threw him out of the garden and killed him.

ENGLISH: Therefore, when the garden-master shall come, what will he do to these cultivators?”
QUENYA: Therefore, when the garden-master shall come, what will he do to these cultivators?”

ENGLISH: They said: “To these evil ones he will give an evil end, and he will let other cultivators use the garden, that will give him the fruits when the time has come!”
QUENYA: They said: “To these evil ones he will give an evil end, and he will let other cultivators use the garden, that will give him the fruits when the time has come!”

ENGLISH: Jesus said to them: “Have you really not read in the scriptures: The rock which the builders turned away, it has become head of the corner. From the Lord this has come, and it is a wonder in our eyes – ?
QUENYA: Jesus said to them: “Have you really not read in the scriptures: The rock which the builders turned away, it has become head of the corner. From the Lord this has come, and it is a wonder in our eyes – ?

ENGLISH: Therefore I say to you: The Kingdom of God will be taken away from you and given to a nation making its fruits.
QUENYA: Therefore I say to you: The Kingdom of God will be taken away from you and given to a nation making its fruits.

ENGLISH: And who falls upon this rock will be broken, but whoever it falls upon – it will completely break him asunder.
QUENYA: And who falls upon this rock will be broken, but whoever it falls upon – it will completely break him asunder.

ENGLISH: And when the chief priests and the Pharisees heard his comparisons, they knew that he spoke about them,
QUENYA: And when the chief priests and the Pharisees heard his comparisons, they knew that he spoke about them,

ENGLISH: and though they sought to seize him they feared the crowd, since they thought of him as a prophet.
QUENYA: and though they sought to seize him they feared the crowd, since they thought of him as a prophet.

ENGLISH: And in answer Jesus again spoke to them in comparisons, saying:
QUENYA: And in answer Jesus again spoke to them in comparisons, saying:

ENGLISH: “The kingdom of heaven is like a man, a king, who made a feast of marriage for his son.
QUENYA: “The kingdom of heaven is like a man, a king, who made a feast of marriage for his son.

ENGLISH: And he sent his servants to call those that were called to the feast of marriage, but they did not want to come.
QUENYA: And he sent his servants to call those that were called to the feast of marriage, but they did not want to come.

ENGLISH: Again he sent other servants, saying: Tell the ones invited: 'Behold, I have prepared my meal, my bulls and my fattened animals have been slaughtered, and everything is ready! Come to the feast of marriage!'
QUENYA: Again he sent other servants, saying: Tell the ones invited: 'Behold, I have prepared my meal, my bulls and my fattened animals have been slaughtered, and everything is ready! Come to the feast of marriage!'

ENGLISH: But they did not give heed and went off, one to his own field, one to his business;
QUENYA: But they did not give heed and went off, one to his own field, one to his business;

ENGLISH: but the others, seizing his servants, behaved towards them with scorn and killed them.
QUENYA: but the others, seizing his servants, behaved towards them with scorn and killed them.

ENGLISH: But the king became angry, and he sent his armies and destroyed those murderers and burnt their city.
QUENYA: But the king became angry, and he sent his armies and destroyed those murderers and burnt their city.

ENGLISH: Then he said to his servants: The feast of marriage is indeed ready, but the ones called were not worthy.
QUENYA: Then he said to his servants: The feast of marriage is indeed ready, but the ones called were not worthy.

ENGLISH: Therefore go to the roads that lead out of the city, and call anyone that you find to the feast of marriage.
QUENYA: Therefore go to the roads that lead out of the city, and call anyone that you find to the feast of marriage.

ENGLISH: And these servants went out and gathered all that they found, wicked ones and good ones alike, and the room in which they made the feast of marriage was filled by those that lay at the table.
QUENYA: And these servants went out and gathered all that they found, wicked ones and good ones alike, and the room in which they made the feast of marriage was filled by those that lay at the table.

ENGLISH: When the king came in to look at the ones lying at the table, he saw a man who was not adorned in clothes of marriage.
QUENYA: When the king came in to look at the ones lying at the table, he saw a man who was not adorned in clothes of marriage.

ENGLISH: And he said to him: “Friend, how did you come in here without clothes of marriage?” He had nothing that he could say.
QUENYA: And he said to him: “Friend, how did you come in here without clothes of marriage?” He had nothing that he could say.

ENGLISH: Then the king said to his servants: Bind him on feet and hands and throw him out into the darkness on the outside; there will be the wailing and the grinding of teeth.'
QUENYA: Then the king said to his servants: Bind him on feet and hands and throw him out into the darkness on the outside; there will be the wailing and the grinding of teeth.'

ENGLISH: For numerous ones are called, but few are chosen!”
QUENYA: For numerous ones are called, but few are chosen!”

ENGLISH: Then the Pharisees went and made plans together, to trap him in his speech.
QUENYA: Then the Pharisees went and made plans together, to trap him in his speech.

ENGLISH: And they sent to him their disciples with the Herodians, that said: “Teacher, we know that you are true and teach God's way in truth, and you do not give heed to anyone , for you do not look at the face of Men.
QUENYA: And they sent to him their disciples with the Herodians, that said: “Teacher, we know that you are true and teach God's way in truth, and you do not give heed to anyone , for you do not look at the face of Men.

ENGLISH: Therefore say to us what you think: Is it allowed to give tax to the High King, or not?
QUENYA: Therefore say to us what you think: Is it allowed to give tax to the High King, or not?

ENGLISH: But Jesus, knowing their evil, said: “How is that you test me, hypocrites?
QUENYA: But Jesus, knowing their evil, said: “How is that you test me, hypocrites?

ENGLISH: Show me a silver-piece of the tax!” They brought to him a denarius. And he said to them: “Whose picture and writing is this?”
QUENYA: Show me a silver-piece of the tax!” They brought to him a denarius. And he said to them: “Whose picture and writing is this?”

ENGLISH: They said: “The High King's!” Then he said to them: “Therefore pay the High King's things to the High King, but God's things to God!”
QUENYA: They said: “The High King's!” Then he said to them: “Therefore pay the High King's things to the High King, but God's things to God!”

ENGLISH: And when they heard that, they were in wonder, and going away from him they went off.
QUENYA: And when they heard that, they were in wonder, and going away from him they went off.

ENGLISH: In that day came to him some Sadducees, that say that is no resurrection, and they asked him:
QUENYA: In that day came to him some Sadducees, that say that is no resurrection, and they asked him:

ENGLISH: “Teacher, Moses said: If anyone dies without children, it is necessary for his brother to marry his wife and raise up seed to his brother.
QUENYA: “Teacher, Moses said: If anyone dies without children, it is necessary for his brother to marry his wife and raise up seed to his brother.

ENGLISH: were with us seven brothers, and the first, after he got married to a woman, died; and since he lacked child, he left his wife for his brother.
QUENYA: were with us seven brothers, and the first, after he got married to a woman, died; and since he lacked child, he left his wife for his brother.

ENGLISH: The same thing happened also to the second and to the third, indeed until the seventh.
QUENYA: The same thing happened also to the second and to the third, indeed until the seventh.

ENGLISH: As the last the woman died.
QUENYA: As the last the woman died.

ENGLISH: Then who will have her as wife in the resurrection? For all among them had her!”
QUENYA: Then who will have her as wife in the resurrection? For all among them had her!”

ENGLISH: In answer Jesus said to them: “You err, since you do not know the Scriptures and God's power alike.
QUENYA: In answer Jesus said to them: “You err, since you do not know the Scriptures and God's power alike.

ENGLISH: For in the resurrection they do not get married to others or are married off, but they are like the angels of heaven.
QUENYA: For in the resurrection they do not get married to others or are married off, but they are like the angels of heaven.

ENGLISH: But concerning the resurrection of the dead, did you not read what was said to you by God, when he said:
QUENYA: But concerning the resurrection of the dead, did you not read what was said to you by God, when he said:

ENGLISH: I Abraham's God and Isaac's God and Jacob's God – ? He is not the God of dead ones, but of living ones!”
QUENYA: I Abraham's God and Isaac's God and Jacob's God – ? He is not the God of dead ones, but of living ones!”

ENGLISH: Hearing that, the crowds were filled with wonder at his teaching.
QUENYA: Hearing that, the crowds were filled with wonder at his teaching.

ENGLISH: When the Pharisees heard how he stopped the mouth of the Sadducees, they gathered together.
QUENYA: When the Pharisees heard how he stopped the mouth of the Sadducees, they gathered together.

ENGLISH: And one among them, a lawyer, asked to test him:
QUENYA: And one among them, a lawyer, asked to test him:

ENGLISH: “Teacher, what is the greatest commandment in the Law?”
QUENYA: “Teacher, what is the greatest commandment in the Law?”

ENGLISH: He said to him: “'You shall love the Lord your God with your whole heart and your whole soul and your whole mind.'
QUENYA: He said to him: “'You shall love the Lord your God with your whole heart and your whole soul and your whole mind.'

ENGLISH: That is the greatest and first commandment.
QUENYA: That is the greatest and first commandment.

ENGLISH: The second one is similar: You shall love your neighbor as yourself.
QUENYA: The second one is similar: You shall love your neighbor as yourself.

ENGLISH: These are the two commandments by which the entire Law hangs, and the Prophets!”
QUENYA: These are the two commandments by which the entire Law hangs, and the Prophets!”

ENGLISH: Now while the Pharisees were gathered Jesus said to them:
QUENYA: Now while the Pharisees were gathered Jesus said to them:

ENGLISH: “What do you think about the Christ? Whose son is he?” They said to him: “David's!”
QUENYA: “What do you think about the Christ? Whose son is he?” They said to him: “David's!”

ENGLISH: He said to them: “How, then, may David by the Spirit call him Lord, saying:
QUENYA: He said to them: “How, then, may David by the Spirit call him Lord, saying:

ENGLISH: The Lord said to my lord: Sit by my right hand until I place your enemies under your feet'– ?
QUENYA: The Lord said to my lord: Sit by my right hand until I place your enemies under your feet'– ?

ENGLISH: If, then, David calls him Lord, how is he his son?”
QUENYA: If, then, David calls him Lord, how is he his son?”

ENGLISH: And nobody was able to say to him a single word; furthermore, was not anyone who dared to ask him more.
QUENYA: And nobody was able to say to him a single word; furthermore, was not anyone who dared to ask him more.

ENGLISH: Then Jesus spoke to the crowds and to the disciples, saying:
QUENYA: Then Jesus spoke to the crowds and to the disciples, saying:

ENGLISH: “The scribes and the Pharisees are sitting on the chair of Moses.
QUENYA: “The scribes and the Pharisees are sitting on the chair of Moses.

ENGLISH: Therefore do and keep all the things that they tell you, but to do do according to their deeds, for they say it, but do not perform.
QUENYA: Therefore do and keep all the things that they tell you, but to do do according to their deeds, for they say it, but do not perform.

ENGLISH: They bind heavy burdens and put them on people's back, but they do not wish to touch them with their finger.
QUENYA: They bind heavy burdens and put them on people's back, but they do not wish to touch them with their finger.

ENGLISH: All their doings they do in order to be seen by men, for they make their phylacteries broad and their fringes broad.
QUENYA: All their doings they do in order to be seen by men, for they make their phylacteries broad and their fringes broad.

ENGLISH: They love to have the most prominent places at meals and the first seats in the synagogues,
QUENYA: They love to have the most prominent places at meals and the first seats in the synagogues,

ENGLISH: and to receive greetings in the market-places and to be called Rabbi by men.
QUENYA: and to receive greetings in the market-places and to be called Rabbi by men.

ENGLISH: But you, do not allow anyone to call you Rabbi, for one is your teacher, but all among you are brothers.
QUENYA: But you, do not allow anyone to call you Rabbi, for one is your teacher, but all among you are brothers.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, do not call anyone on earth your father, for you have a single Father, the heavenly one.
QUENYA: Furthermore, do not call anyone on earth your father, for you have a single Father, the heavenly one.

ENGLISH: And do not be called leaders, for you have a single Leader, the Christ.
QUENYA: And do not be called leaders, for you have a single Leader, the Christ.

ENGLISH: But for who is the greatest among you it is necessary to be your servant.
QUENYA: But for who is the greatest among you it is necessary to be your servant.

ENGLISH: who exalts himself will be humbled, and that humbles himself will be exalted.
QUENYA: who exalts himself will be humbled, and that humbles himself will be exalted.

ENGLISH: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you close God's kingdom before Men, for you do not go inside, and that go inside you stop!
QUENYA: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you close God's kingdom before Men, for you do not go inside, and that go inside you stop!

ENGLISH: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you travel across sea and land to turn a single person to your faith, and when he has received it, you make him worthy of Gehenna two times more than you.
QUENYA: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you travel across sea and land to turn a single person to your faith, and when he has received it, you make him worthy of Gehenna two times more than you.

ENGLISH: Woe to you, blind leaders, that say: 'If anyone gives his oath by the temple, that is nothing, but if anyone gives his oath by the gold of the temple, he is obliged.'
QUENYA: Woe to you, blind leaders, that say: 'If anyone gives his oath by the temple, that is nothing, but if anyone gives his oath by the gold of the temple, he is obliged.'

ENGLISH: Fools and blind ones! For what is the greater, the gold or the temple that hallows the gold?
QUENYA: Fools and blind ones! For what is the greater, the gold or the temple that hallows the gold?

ENGLISH: Also you say: 'If anyone gives his oath by the altar, that is nothing, but if anyone gives his oath by the gift on it, he is obliged.'
QUENYA: Also you say: 'If anyone gives his oath by the altar, that is nothing, but if anyone gives his oath by the gift on it, he is obliged.'

ENGLISH: Blind ones! For what is the greater, the gift or the altar that hallows the gift?
QUENYA: Blind ones! For what is the greater, the gift or the altar that hallows the gift?

ENGLISH: Therefore who gives his oath by the altar does so by it and by all the things on it,
QUENYA: Therefore who gives his oath by the altar does so by it and by all the things on it,

ENGLISH: and who gives his oath by the temple does so by it and by he that dwells in it,
QUENYA: and who gives his oath by the temple does so by it and by he that dwells in it,

ENGLISH: and who gives his oath by heaven does so by God's throne and by who is sitting on it!
QUENYA: and who gives his oath by heaven does so by God's throne and by who is sitting on it!

ENGLISH: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you give the tenth of i mint and the dill and the cumin, but you have abandoned the more important things in the Law: justice and mercy and faithfulness. It was necessary to do these things, and yet not abandon the others.
QUENYA: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you give the tenth of i mint and the dill and the cumin, but you have abandoned the more important things in the Law: justice and mercy and faithfulness. It was necessary to do these things, and yet not abandon the others.

ENGLISH: Blind ones, that strain out the gnat , but devour the camel!
QUENYA: Blind ones, that strain out the gnat , but devour the camel!

ENGLISH: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites, for you cleans outside of the cup and the dish, but on the inside they are full of plunder and lack of self-control.
QUENYA: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites, for you cleans outside of the cup and the dish, but on the inside they are full of plunder and lack of self-control.

ENGLISH: Blind Pharisee, cleanse first the inside of the cup and the dish, for its outside to be clean as well!
QUENYA: Blind Pharisee, cleanse first the inside of the cup and the dish, for its outside to be clean as well!

ENGLISH: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites, for you are like whitened graves, which indeed seem beautiful on the outside, but on the inside they are full of bones of dead ones and every kind of uncleanness.
QUENYA: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites, for you are like whitened graves, which indeed seem beautiful on the outside, but on the inside they are full of bones of dead ones and every kind of uncleanness.

ENGLISH: In that manner you as well on the outside seem just to men, but on the inside you are full of hypocricy and lawlessness.
QUENYA: In that manner you as well on the outside seem just to men, but on the inside you are full of hypocricy and lawlessness.

ENGLISH: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites, for you build the graves of the Prophets and adorn the tombs of the just,
QUENYA: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites, for you build the graves of the Prophets and adorn the tombs of the just,

ENGLISH: and you say: “If we existed in our father's days, we did not have part with them in the blood of the Prophets!”
QUENYA: and you say: “If we existed in our father's days, we did not have part with them in the blood of the Prophets!”

ENGLISH: Thus you witness against yourselves that you are sons of that killed the Prophets!
QUENYA: Thus you witness against yourselves that you are sons of that killed the Prophets!

ENGLISH: You too, then, fill your fathers' measure!
QUENYA: You too, then, fill your fathers' measure!

ENGLISH: Serpents, brood of worms, how will you escape from the judgment of Gehenna?
QUENYA: Serpents, brood of worms, how will you escape from the judgment of Gehenna?

ENGLISH: Therefore, behold! I am sending to you prophets and wise ones and scribes. Some among them you will kill and you will crucify, and some among them you will flay in your synagogues and you will pursue them from city to city,
QUENYA: Therefore, behold! I am sending to you prophets and wise ones and scribes. Some among them you will kill and you will crucify, and some among them you will flay in your synagogues and you will pursue them from city to city,

ENGLISH: and so there will come upon you all righteous blood poured forth on earth, from the blood of righteous Abel to the blood of Zechariah son of Barakiah, whom you slew between the sanctuary and the altar.
QUENYA: and so there will come upon you all righteous blood poured forth on earth, from the blood of righteous Abel to the blood of Zechariah son of Barakiah, whom you slew between the sanctuary and the altar.

ENGLISH: Truly I say to you: All these things will come upon this generation!
QUENYA: Truly I say to you: All these things will come upon this generation!

ENGLISH: Jerusalem, Jerusalem, that slays the prophets and stones those that are sent to her – how frequently I wished to gather your children, as a hen gathers her young under her wings ! But you did not want to.
QUENYA: Jerusalem, Jerusalem, that slays the prophets and stones those that are sent to her – how frequently I wished to gather your children, as a hen gathers her young under her wings ! But you did not want to.

ENGLISH: Behold! Your house is left to you!
QUENYA: Behold! Your house is left to you!

ENGLISH: And I say to you: From now you will not see me until you say: 'Blessed is he that is coming in the name of the Lord.'”
QUENYA: And I say to you: From now you will not see me until you say: 'Blessed is he that is coming in the name of the Lord.'”

ENGLISH: Leaving, Jesus went away, but his disciples came to him to show him the buildings of the temple.
QUENYA: Leaving, Jesus went away, but his disciples came to him to show him the buildings of the temple.

ENGLISH: In answer he said to them: “Do you not see all these things? Truly I say to you: Here a stone will by no means remain on a stone that will not be thrown down!”
QUENYA: In answer he said to them: “Do you not see all these things? Truly I say to you: Here a stone will by no means remain on a stone that will not be thrown down!”

ENGLISH: When he sat on the Mounts of Olives, the disciples came to him when they were alone, saying: “Tell us: What is the time when these things will happen, and what will be the sign of your return and the conclusion of the age?”
QUENYA: When he sat on the Mounts of Olives, the disciples came to him when they were alone, saying: “Tell us: What is the time when these things will happen, and what will be the sign of your return and the conclusion of the age?”

ENGLISH: In answer Jeuss said to them: “See that nobody causes you to err ,
QUENYA: In answer Jeuss said to them: “See that nobody causes you to err ,

ENGLISH: for numerous ones will come in my name, saying: 'I am the Christ!', and they will cause many to err.
QUENYA: for numerous ones will come in my name, saying: 'I am the Christ!', and they will cause many to err.

ENGLISH: You will hear about wars and will receive news of wars; take heed, that you are not terrified. By necessity it will happen, but the end still has not come.
QUENYA: You will hear about wars and will receive news of wars; take heed, that you are not terrified. By necessity it will happen, but the end still has not come.

ENGLISH: For nation will rise against nation and kingdom against kingdom, and will be famines and earthquakes in numerous places.
QUENYA: For nation will rise against nation and kingdom against kingdom, and will be famines and earthquakes in numerous places.

ENGLISH: All these things are a beginning of pains.
QUENYA: All these things are a beginning of pains.

ENGLISH: Then people will give you over into tribulation and will kill you, and you will be hated by all the nations by reason of my name.
QUENYA: Then people will give you over into tribulation and will kill you, and you will be hated by all the nations by reason of my name.

ENGLISH: And then numerous ones will fall away and will betray one another and will hate one another.
QUENYA: And then numerous ones will fall away and will betray one another and will hate one another.

ENGLISH: And many false prophets will arise and will cause many to err,
QUENYA: And many false prophets will arise and will cause many to err,

ENGLISH: and since the lawlessness grows, love will become cold in the greater number of people.
QUENYA: and since the lawlessness grows, love will become cold in the greater number of people.

ENGLISH: But who endures until the end, he will be saved.
QUENYA: But who endures until the end, he will be saved.

ENGLISH: And the gospel of the kingdom will be made known in the entire world as a witness for all the nations, and then the end will come.
QUENYA: And the gospel of the kingdom will be made known in the entire world as a witness for all the nations, and then the end will come.

ENGLISH: Therefore, when you see the Disgusting Thing of Destruction, of which Daniel the Prophet spoke, standing in a holy place” – let who is reading understand –
QUENYA: Therefore, when you see the Disgusting Thing of Destruction, of which Daniel the Prophet spoke, standing in a holy place” – let who is reading understand –

ENGLISH: “then it is necessary for who are in Judea escape to the mountains.
QUENYA: “then it is necessary for who are in Judea escape to the mountains.

ENGLISH: A man on the roof is not to go down to bring his goods out of his house,
QUENYA: A man on the roof is not to go down to bring his goods out of his house,

ENGLISH: and a man in the field is not to return to his house to pick up his cloak.
QUENYA: and a man in the field is not to return to his house to pick up his cloak.

ENGLISH: Woe to the pregnant women and that suckle a baby in those days!
QUENYA: Woe to the pregnant women and that suckle a baby in those days!

ENGLISH: Pray that your flight will not happen in winter or on the sabbath,
QUENYA: Pray that your flight will not happen in winter or on the sabbath,

ENGLISH: for then there will be a great tribulation, as has not happened from the beginning of the earth until now, and will not happen again.
QUENYA: for then there will be a great tribulation, as has not happened from the beginning of the earth until now, and will not happen again.

ENGLISH: If those days were not shortened, there was not flesh being saved, but for the good for the chosen ones, those days will be shortened.
QUENYA: If those days were not shortened, there was not flesh being saved, but for the good for the chosen ones, those days will be shortened.

ENGLISH: Then, if anyone says to you: 'Look! Here is the Christ!', or 'There!', do not believe it .
QUENYA: Then, if anyone says to you: 'Look! Here is the Christ!', or 'There!', do not believe it .

ENGLISH: For false Christs and false prophets will rise up and will give great signs and wonders, to cause also the chosen ones to stray, if that was possible.
QUENYA: For false Christs and false prophets will rise up and will give great signs and wonders, to cause also the chosen ones to stray, if that was possible.

ENGLISH: Behold, I have told you beforehand.
QUENYA: Behold, I have told you beforehand.

ENGLISH: Therefore, if people say to you: 'Behold! He is in the wilderness!', do not go thither. If they say: 'Behold, he is in the inner rooms!', do not believe it!
QUENYA: Therefore, if people say to you: 'Behold! He is in the wilderness!', do not go thither. If they say: 'Behold, he is in the inner rooms!', do not believe it!

ENGLISH: For as when the flash of thunder comes out from east and shines to west, so it will be at the coming of the Son of Man!
QUENYA: For as when the flash of thunder comes out from east and shines to west, so it will be at the coming of the Son of Man!

ENGLISH: The place where the corpse is, there the eagles will gather!
QUENYA: The place where the corpse is, there the eagles will gather!

ENGLISH: Soon after the tribulation in those days, the Sun will bcome dark, and the Moon will not give his sheen, and the stars will fall from heaven, and the powers of heaven will be being shaken.
QUENYA: Soon after the tribulation in those days, the Sun will bcome dark, and the Moon will not give his sheen, and the stars will fall from heaven, and the powers of heaven will be being shaken.

ENGLISH: And then the sign of the Son of Man will be seen in heaven, and then all tribes of the earth will beat themselves in lamentation, and they shall see the Son of Man coming on the clouds of heaven having power and much glory;
QUENYA: And then the sign of the Son of Man will be seen in heaven, and then all tribes of the earth will beat themselves in lamentation, and they shall see the Son of Man coming on the clouds of heaven having power and much glory;

ENGLISH: and he will send his angels with a mighty trumpet-blast, and they will gather his chosen ones out of the four winds, from heaven's border to its other border.
QUENYA: and he will send his angels with a mighty trumpet-blast, and they will gather his chosen ones out of the four winds, from heaven's border to its other border.

ENGLISH: Now learn this comparison from the fig tree: When its branch becomes soft and it sprouts its leaves, you know that summer is near.
QUENYA: Now learn this comparison from the fig tree: When its branch becomes soft and it sprouts its leaves, you know that summer is near.

ENGLISH: Thus you as well, when you see all these things, know that he is near, before the doors.
QUENYA: Thus you as well, when you see all these things, know that he is near, before the doors.

ENGLISH: Truly I say to you that this generation shall by no means pass away before all these things happen.
QUENYA: Truly I say to you that this generation shall by no means pass away before all these things happen.

ENGLISH: Heaven and earth shall pass away, but my words will not pass away.
QUENYA: Heaven and earth shall pass away, but my words will not pass away.

ENGLISH: Of that day and hour nobody knows, not the angels in heaven and not the Son, but the Father alone.
QUENYA: Of that day and hour nobody knows, not the angels in heaven and not the Son, but the Father alone.

ENGLISH: For as the days of Noah were, so will be the coming of the Son of Man.
QUENYA: For as the days of Noah were, so will be the coming of the Son of Man.

ENGLISH: For as they were in those days before the Flood, eating and drinking, marrying and being married off, until the day that Noah went into the ark;
QUENYA: For as they were in those days before the Flood, eating and drinking, marrying and being married off, until the day that Noah went into the ark;

ENGLISH: and they understood nothing until the Flood came and carried them off, so the coming of the Son of Man will be.
QUENYA: and they understood nothing until the Flood came and carried them off, so the coming of the Son of Man will be.

ENGLISH: Then two men shall be in one field: One will be brought and the other will be abandoned.
QUENYA: Then two men shall be in one field: One will be brought and the other will be abandoned.

ENGLISH: Two women will grind with the same mill; one will be brought and the other will be abandoned.
QUENYA: Two women will grind with the same mill; one will be brought and the other will be abandoned.

ENGLISH: Therefore be awake, for you do not know what day your Lord will come.
QUENYA: Therefore be awake, for you do not know what day your Lord will come.

ENGLISH: But know this: If the master of the house knew in what watch the thief will come, he was awake and did not allow anyone to break into his house.
QUENYA: But know this: If the master of the house knew in what watch the thief will come, he was awake and did not allow anyone to break into his house.

ENGLISH: Therefore you as well be ready, for the Son of Man will come in an hour when you do not think so.
QUENYA: Therefore you as well be ready, for the Son of Man will come in an hour when you do not think so.

ENGLISH: Who is the faithful and wise thrall whom his lord put over the people of his house, to give them food in the proper hour?
QUENYA: Who is the faithful and wise thrall whom his lord put over the people of his house, to give them food in the proper hour?

ENGLISH: Happy is that thrall if his lord, when he comes, finds him doing so.
QUENYA: Happy is that thrall if his lord, when he comes, finds him doing so.

ENGLISH: Truly I say to you: He will put him over everything that he has.
QUENYA: Truly I say to you: He will put him over everything that he has.

ENGLISH: But if that evil slave will say in his heart: 'My lord is late',
QUENYA: But if that evil slave will say in his heart: 'My lord is late',

ENGLISH: and he will begin to beat the other slaves and drink with that fill themselves with wine,
QUENYA: and he will begin to beat the other slaves and drink with that fill themselves with wine,

ENGLISH: then the lord of that slave will come on a day that he does not foresee and in an hour that he does not know,
QUENYA: then the lord of that slave will come on a day that he does not foresee and in an hour that he does not know,

ENGLISH: and he will punish him in a harsh manner and will give him the same end that the hypocrites receive. There will be his tears and his grinding of teeth.
QUENYA: and he will punish him in a harsh manner and will give him the same end that the hypocrites receive. There will be his tears and his grinding of teeth.

ENGLISH: Then the kingdom of heaven will be like ten maidens that brought their lamps and went outside to meet the bridegroom.
QUENYA: Then the kingdom of heaven will be like ten maidens that brought their lamps and went outside to meet the bridegroom.

ENGLISH: Five among them were unwise, and five were wise.
QUENYA: Five among them were unwise, and five were wise.

ENGLISH: For the foolish ones took their lamps but did not bring oil with them,
QUENYA: For the foolish ones took their lamps but did not bring oil with them,

ENGLISH: while the wise ones brought oil in their bottles with their lamps.
QUENYA: while the wise ones brought oil in their bottles with their lamps.

ENGLISH: When the bridegroom was late, all among them were slumberous and slept.
QUENYA: When the bridegroom was late, all among them were slumberous and slept.

ENGLISH: In the middle of the night was a cry: “Behold the bridegroom! Go to meet him!”
QUENYA: In the middle of the night was a cry: “Behold the bridegroom! Go to meet him!”

ENGLISH: Then all those maidens arose and prepared their lamps.
QUENYA: Then all those maidens arose and prepared their lamps.

ENGLISH: The unwise ones said to the wise ones: 'Give us of out of your oil, for our lambs will soon be extinguished!”
QUENYA: The unwise ones said to the wise ones: 'Give us of out of your oil, for our lambs will soon be extinguished!”

ENGLISH: The wise ones answered: 'Maybe the oil will not suffice for us and for you. Instead go and buy for yourselves!'
QUENYA: The wise ones answered: 'Maybe the oil will not suffice for us and for you. Instead go and buy for yourselves!'

ENGLISH: After they went away to buy, the bridegroom came, and the maidens that were ready went with him to the feast of marriage, and the door was closed.
QUENYA: After they went away to buy, the bridegroom came, and the maidens that were ready went with him to the feast of marriage, and the door was closed.

ENGLISH: Afterwards the other maidens also came, saying: 'Lord, lord, open for us!'
QUENYA: Afterwards the other maidens also came, saying: 'Lord, lord, open for us!'

ENGLISH: In answer he said: 'Truly I say to you, I do not know you!'
QUENYA: In answer he said: 'Truly I say to you, I do not know you!'

ENGLISH: Therefore take heed, for you do not know the day or the hour.
QUENYA: Therefore take heed, for you do not know the day or the hour.

ENGLISH: For the matter is like when a man who was going to travel to another country summoned his thralls and gave his goods into their keeping.
QUENYA: For the matter is like when a man who was going to travel to another country summoned his thralls and gave his goods into their keeping.

ENGLISH: And to one among them he gave five talents, to another two, to another one – according to their skill. Then he went away.
QUENYA: And to one among them he gave five talents, to another two, to another one – according to their skill. Then he went away.

ENGLISH: Quickly that received the five talents went away and traded with them, and he gained another five.
QUENYA: Quickly that received the five talents went away and traded with them, and he gained another five.

ENGLISH: In the same manner who received the two gained another two.
QUENYA: In the same manner who received the two gained another two.

ENGLISH: But that received the one, went off and dug in the ground and hid the money of his lord.
QUENYA: But that received the one, went off and dug in the ground and hid the money of his lord.

ENGLISH: After a long time the lord of those thralls came and had a reckoning with them.
QUENYA: After a long time the lord of those thralls came and had a reckoning with them.

ENGLISH: And coming forward, that received thmattme five talents brought another five talents, saying: “Lord, you gave five talents into my keeping. Behold, I have gained another five talents!”
QUENYA: And coming forward, that received thmattme five talents brought another five talents, saying: “Lord, you gave five talents into my keeping. Behold, I have gained another five talents!”

ENGLISH: His lord said to him: “Well done, good and faithful thrall! You were faithful over a few things. I will put you over many things. Come into the joy of your lord!”
QUENYA: His lord said to him: “Well done, good and faithful thrall! You were faithful over a few things. I will put you over many things. Come into the joy of your lord!”

ENGLISH: Also who received the two talents came forward and said: “Lord, two talents you gave into my keeping. Behold, I have gained another two talents!”
QUENYA: Also who received the two talents came forward and said: “Lord, two talents you gave into my keeping. Behold, I have gained another two talents!”

ENGLISH: His lord said to him: “Well, done, good and faithful thrall! You were faithful over a few things. I will put you over many things. Come into your the joy of your lord!”
QUENYA: His lord said to him: “Well, done, good and faithful thrall! You were faithful over a few things. I will put you over many things. Come into your the joy of your lord!”

ENGLISH: In the end that received the one talent came forward and said: “Lord, I know that you are a harsh man, reaping where you did not sow and gathering where you did not scatter.
QUENYA: In the end that received the one talent came forward and said: “Lord, I know that you are a harsh man, reaping where you did not sow and gathering where you did not scatter.

ENGLISH: Therefore I was terrified and went off and hid your talent in the ground. Here you have what is yours!”
QUENYA: Therefore I was terrified and went off and hid your talent in the ground. Here you have what is yours!”

ENGLISH: In answer he said: “Wicked and dull thrall, then you knew that I reap where I did not sow and gather where I did not scatter?
QUENYA: In answer he said: “Wicked and dull thrall, then you knew that I reap where I did not sow and gather where I did not scatter?

ENGLISH: Therefore it was necessary for you to put my money with the bankers, and when I came I could receive what was mine with added money .
QUENYA: Therefore it was necessary for you to put my money with the bankers, and when I came I could receive what was mine with added money .

ENGLISH: Therefore you are to take the talent from him and give it to the one that has the ten talents!
QUENYA: Therefore you are to take the talent from him and give it to the one that has the ten talents!

ENGLISH: For to everyone that has, more will be given and he will have abundance, but that does not have – also what he has will be taken from him!
QUENYA: For to everyone that has, more will be given and he will have abundance, but that does not have – also what he has will be taken from him!

ENGLISH: And you are to throw the no-good thrall into the darkness on the outside! There will be his tears and his grinding of teeth.
QUENYA: And you are to throw the no-good thrall into the darkness on the outside! There will be his tears and his grinding of teeth.

ENGLISH: But when the Son of Man shall come in his glory, and all the angels with him, then he will sit down on his glorious throne.
QUENYA: But when the Son of Man shall come in his glory, and all the angels with him, then he will sit down on his glorious throne.

ENGLISH: And all the nations will be gathered before him, and he will separate them one from the other, as when a shepherd separates the sheep from the goats.
QUENYA: And all the nations will be gathered before him, and he will separate them one from the other, as when a shepherd separates the sheep from the goats.

ENGLISH: And he will put his sheep at his right hand, but the goats at his left hand.
QUENYA: And he will put his sheep at his right hand, but the goats at his left hand.

ENGLISH: Then the king will say to that are standing to his right: 'Come, you who are blessed by my Father, possess the kingdom prepared for you from the founding of the world!
QUENYA: Then the king will say to that are standing to his right: 'Come, you who are blessed by my Father, possess the kingdom prepared for you from the founding of the world!

ENGLISH: For I was hungry and you gave he food; I was thirsty, and you gave me something to drink; I was a stranger, and you received me,
QUENYA: For I was hungry and you gave he food; I was thirsty, and you gave me something to drink; I was a stranger, and you received me,

ENGLISH: naked, and you covered me. I was sick and you cared for me, I was in prison and you came to me.'
QUENYA: naked, and you covered me. I was sick and you cared for me, I was in prison and you came to me.'

ENGLISH: Then the just ones will answer him so: 'Lord, what the time that we saw you hungry and gave you food, or thisty, and gave you something to drink?
QUENYA: Then the just ones will answer him so: 'Lord, what the time that we saw you hungry and gave you food, or thisty, and gave you something to drink?

ENGLISH: What the time that we saw you as a foreign person and received you, or naked, and covered you?
QUENYA: What the time that we saw you as a foreign person and received you, or naked, and covered you?

ENGLISH: What the time that we saw you sick or in prison and came to you?'
QUENYA: What the time that we saw you sick or in prison and came to you?'

ENGLISH: And in answer the king will say to them: 'Truly I say to you: In the measure that you did that to one among these smallest brothers of mine, in the same measure to me you did it.'
QUENYA: And in answer the king will say to them: 'Truly I say to you: In the measure that you did that to one among these smallest brothers of mine, in the same measure to me you did it.'

ENGLISH: Then he will say also to that are standing at his right: 'Pass from me, you that are accursed by my Father, into the eternal fire that has been prepared for the Devil and his angels!
QUENYA: Then he will say also to that are standing at his right: 'Pass from me, you that are accursed by my Father, into the eternal fire that has been prepared for the Devil and his angels!

ENGLISH: I was hungry, and you gave me nothing to eat, I was thirsty and you gave me nothing to drink,
QUENYA: I was hungry, and you gave me nothing to eat, I was thirsty and you gave me nothing to drink,

ENGLISH: I was a stranger and you did not receive me, naked and you did not cover me, sick and in prison, but you did not care for me.'
QUENYA: I was a stranger and you did not receive me, naked and you did not cover me, sick and in prison, but you did not care for me.'

ENGLISH: Then they as well will answer, saying: 'Lord, what was the time that we saw you hungry or thirsty or a stranger or naked or sick or in prison, and we did not serve you?'
QUENYA: Then they as well will answer, saying: 'Lord, what was the time that we saw you hungry or thirsty or a stranger or naked or sick or in prison, and we did not serve you?'

ENGLISH: Then he will answer them so: 'Truly I say to you: In the measure that you failed to do so to one among these smallest ones, in the same measure you failed to do it for me.'
QUENYA: Then he will answer them so: 'Truly I say to you: In the measure that you failed to do so to one among these smallest ones, in the same measure you failed to do it for me.'

ENGLISH: And they will go off into eternal punishment, but the just ones, into eternal life.
QUENYA: And they will go off into eternal punishment, but the just ones, into eternal life.

ENGLISH: And after Jesus completed all these sayings, he said to his disciples:
QUENYA: And after Jesus completed all these sayings, he said to his disciples:

ENGLISH: “You know that two days from now the Passover will come, and the Son of Man will be given over to be crucified!”
QUENYA: “You know that two days from now the Passover will come, and the Son of Man will be given over to be crucified!”

ENGLISH: Then the chief priests and the elders among the people gathered in the courtyard of the chref priest, whose name was Caiaphas,
QUENYA: Then the chief priests and the elders among the people gathered in the courtyard of the chref priest, whose name was Caiaphas,

ENGLISH: and made plans together to seize Jesus by cunning and to kill him.
QUENYA: and made plans together to seize Jesus by cunning and to kill him.

ENGLISH: But they said: “Not at the festival, or will be an uprising among the people!”
QUENYA: But they said: “Not at the festival, or will be an uprising among the people!”

ENGLISH: When Jesus was in Bethany, in the house of Simon the Leper,
QUENYA: When Jesus was in Bethany, in the house of Simon the Leper,

ENGLISH: a woman having a stone-box full of fragrant oil came to him, and she poured it on his head when he lay at the table.
QUENYA: a woman having a stone-box full of fragrant oil came to him, and she poured it on his head when he lay at the table.

ENGLISH: Seeing that, the disciples were wroth and said: “What is the reason for throwing away the oil? For one could sell it for a great sum, to give it to poor!”
QUENYA: Seeing that, the disciples were wroth and said: “What is the reason for throwing away the oil? For one could sell it for a great sum, to give it to poor!”

ENGLISH: Knowing this, Jesus said to them: “How is that you are making trouble for the woman, when she has done a good deed to me?
QUENYA: Knowing this, Jesus said to them: “How is that you are making trouble for the woman, when she has done a good deed to me?

ENGLISH: For the poor you have always among you, but you will not always have me.
QUENYA: For the poor you have always among you, but you will not always have me.

ENGLISH: For when this woman put this fragrant oil on my body, she did it to prepare me for the tomb.
QUENYA: For when this woman put this fragrant oil on my body, she did it to prepare me for the tomb.

ENGLISH: Truly I say to you: Wherever this gospel will be made known in the entire world, what this woman did will also be told in memory of her!”
QUENYA: Truly I say to you: Wherever this gospel will be made known in the entire world, what this woman did will also be told in memory of her!”

ENGLISH: Then one among the twelve, he whose name was Judas, went to the chief priests
QUENYA: Then one among the twelve, he whose name was Judas, went to the chief priests

ENGLISH: and said: “What will you give me if I give him over to you?” And they put thirty silver pieces before him.
QUENYA: and said: “What will you give me if I give him over to you?” And they put thirty silver pieces before him.

ENGLISH: And he sought how he was going to give him over when it was possible for him.
QUENYA: And he sought how he was going to give him over when it was possible for him.

ENGLISH: On the first day of Unleavened Breads the disciples came to Jesus, saying: “Where do you wish that we prepare for you, for you to eat the Passover?”
QUENYA: On the first day of Unleavened Breads the disciples came to Jesus, saying: “Where do you wish that we prepare for you, for you to eat the Passover?”

ENGLISH: He said to them: “Go into the city to so-and-so and say to him: The teacher says: 'My time is near; in your house I will make the Passover with my disciples!”
QUENYA: He said to them: “Go into the city to so-and-so and say to him: The teacher says: 'My time is near; in your house I will make the Passover with my disciples!”

ENGLISH: And the disciples did as Jesus commanded them, and they prepared the Passover.
QUENYA: And the disciples did as Jesus commanded them, and they prepared the Passover.

ENGLISH: When evening came, he lay at the table with the twelve disciples. While they were eating, he said: “Truly I say to you: One among you will give me over!”
QUENYA: When evening came, he lay at the table with the twelve disciples. While they were eating, he said: “Truly I say to you: One among you will give me over!”

ENGLISH: In deep grief every one among them began to say to him: 'Surely I am not he, Lord?'”
QUENYA: In deep grief every one among them began to say to him: 'Surely I am not he, Lord?'”

ENGLISH: In answer he said: “ who dips his hand with me in the bowl is who will give me over.
QUENYA: In answer he said: “ who dips his hand with me in the bowl is who will give me over.

ENGLISH: The Son of Man will indeed pass away, as is written about him, but woe to the man by whom the Son of Man is given over! was better for that man if he was not born!”
QUENYA: The Son of Man will indeed pass away, as is written about him, but woe to the man by whom the Son of Man is given over! was better for that man if he was not born!”

ENGLISH: In answer Judas, who was going to betray him, said: “Surely I am not he, Rabbi?” He said to him: “You have said it!”
QUENYA: In answer Judas, who was going to betray him, said: “Surely I am not he, Rabbi?” He said to him: “You have said it!”

ENGLISH: While they were eating, Jesus took a bread, and after speaking a blessing he broke it, and giving it to his disciples he said: “Take it, eat! This is my body!”
QUENYA: While they were eating, Jesus took a bread, and after speaking a blessing he broke it, and giving it to his disciples he said: “Take it, eat! This is my body!”

ENGLISH: And he took a cup, and after giving thanks he gave it to them, saying: “Drink of it, all among you!
QUENYA: And he took a cup, and after giving thanks he gave it to them, saying: “Drink of it, all among you!

ENGLISH: For this is my blood of the covenant, which will be poured forth on behalf of numerous ones for forgiveness of sins.
QUENYA: For this is my blood of the covenant, which will be poured forth on behalf of numerous ones for forgiveness of sins.

ENGLISH: But I say to you: I will by no means drink of this fruit of the vine until that day when I shall drink it new with you in my Father's kingdom!”
QUENYA: But I say to you: I will by no means drink of this fruit of the vine until that day when I shall drink it new with you in my Father's kingdom!”

ENGLISH: And after singing the hymns they went out to the Mount of Olives.
QUENYA: And after singing the hymns they went out to the Mount of Olives.

ENGLISH: Then Jesus said to them: “All among you will fall away from me in this night, for it is written: 'I will strike the shepherd, and the sheep of the flock will be scattered.'
QUENYA: Then Jesus said to them: “All among you will fall away from me in this night, for it is written: 'I will strike the shepherd, and the sheep of the flock will be scattered.'

ENGLISH: But after my being raised, I will go before you into Galilee!”
QUENYA: But after my being raised, I will go before you into Galilee!”

ENGLISH: But in answer Peter said to him: “ if all will fall away from you, I will not fall away!”
QUENYA: But in answer Peter said to him: “ if all will fall away from you, I will not fall away!”

ENGLISH: Jesus said to him: “Truly I say to you: In this night, before a cock shall sound, you will deny me thrice!”
QUENYA: Jesus said to him: “Truly I say to you: In this night, before a cock shall sound, you will deny me thrice!”

ENGLISH: Peter said to him: “If it is necessary for me to die with you, I shall not ever deny you!” All the other disciples said the same thing.
QUENYA: Peter said to him: “If it is necessary for me to die with you, I shall not ever deny you!” All the other disciples said the same thing.

ENGLISH: Then Jesus came with them to the place called Gethsemane, and he said to his disciples: “Sit here while I go thither to pray!”
QUENYA: Then Jesus came with them to the place called Gethsemane, and he said to his disciples: “Sit here while I go thither to pray!”

ENGLISH: And bringing Peter and the two sons of Zebedee with himself, he began to have grief and to be troubled.
QUENYA: And bringing Peter and the two sons of Zebedee with himself, he began to have grief and to be troubled.

ENGLISH: Then he said to them: “My soul is heavy until death with grief. Remain here and keep yourselves awake with me!”
QUENYA: Then he said to them: “My soul is heavy until death with grief. Remain here and keep yourselves awake with me!”

ENGLISH: After going a short walk forward, he fell upon his face, praying and saying: “My Father, if that is possible, may this cup pass away from me! And yet, not as I wish, but as you wish!”
QUENYA: After going a short walk forward, he fell upon his face, praying and saying: “My Father, if that is possible, may this cup pass away from me! And yet, not as I wish, but as you wish!”

ENGLISH: And he came to the disciples and found them asleep, and he said to Peter: “Could you not keep yourselves awake for a single hour with me?
QUENYA: And he came to the disciples and found them asleep, and he said to Peter: “Could you not keep yourselves awake for a single hour with me?

ENGLISH: Be awake and pray, or you will fall into temptation! For the spirit is eager, but the flesh is weak!”
QUENYA: Be awake and pray, or you will fall into temptation! For the spirit is eager, but the flesh is weak!”

ENGLISH: Again, for a second time, he went away and prayed, saying: “My Father, if it is not possible that this will pass without my drinking it, let your will happen!”
QUENYA: Again, for a second time, he went away and prayed, saying: “My Father, if it is not possible that this will pass without my drinking it, let your will happen!”

ENGLISH: And he came again, and found them asleep, for their eyes were heavy.
QUENYA: And he came again, and found them asleep, for their eyes were heavy.

ENGLISH: And he went away from them and prayed for a third time, saying the same word again.
QUENYA: And he went away from them and prayed for a third time, saying the same word again.

ENGLISH: Then he came to the disciples and said to them: “Surely you are not still sleeping and resting? Behold, the time is near when the Son of Man will be given over into the hands of sinners!
QUENYA: Then he came to the disciples and said to them: “Surely you are not still sleeping and resting? Behold, the time is near when the Son of Man will be given over into the hands of sinners!

ENGLISH: Rise, let us go! Look! who betrays me has come near!”
QUENYA: Rise, let us go! Look! who betrays me has come near!”

ENGLISH: And while the words were still in his mouth, behold, there came Judas, one of the twelve, and with him a great crowd having swords and clubs came from the chief priests and the elders among the people.
QUENYA: And while the words were still in his mouth, behold, there came Judas, one of the twelve, and with him a great crowd having swords and clubs came from the chief priests and the elders among the people.

ENGLISH: who gave him over had given them a sign, saying: “Anyone that I kiss, take him into custody!”
QUENYA: who gave him over had given them a sign, saying: “Anyone that I kiss, take him into custody!”

ENGLISH: And straightway he went to Jesus and said: “Greetings, Rabbi!”, and he kissed him.
QUENYA: And straightway he went to Jesus and said: “Greetings, Rabbi!”, and he kissed him.

ENGLISH: But Jesus said to him: “Fellow, what is your reason for coming?” Then they came forward and laid hand on Jesus and took him into custody.
QUENYA: But Jesus said to him: “Fellow, what is your reason for coming?” Then they came forward and laid hand on Jesus and took him into custody.

ENGLISH: But behold, one among that were with Jesus reached out with his hand and drew his sword and struck the chief priest's thrall and cut off his ear.
QUENYA: But behold, one among that were with Jesus reached out with his hand and drew his sword and struck the chief priest's thrall and cut off his ear.

ENGLISH: Then Jesus said to him: “Put your sword in its place again, for all that take the sword will be undone by the sword .
QUENYA: Then Jesus said to him: “Put your sword in its place again, for all that take the sword will be undone by the sword .

ENGLISH: Or do you not suppose that I can make petition to my Father, for him to send me in this moment over twelve legions of angels?
QUENYA: Or do you not suppose that I can make petition to my Father, for him to send me in this moment over twelve legions of angels?

ENGLISH: But then how will it be made true, the Scripture that says that so it must happen?”
QUENYA: But then how will it be made true, the Scripture that says that so it must happen?”

ENGLISH: In that time Jesus said to the crowds: “Have you come with swords and clubs, as upon a robber, to seize me? Day after day I sat in the temple teaching, and yet you did not seize me.
QUENYA: In that time Jesus said to the crowds: “Have you come with swords and clubs, as upon a robber, to seize me? Day after day I sat in the temple teaching, and yet you did not seize me.

ENGLISH: But all this has happened to make the Scripture true!” Then all the disciples abandoned him and fled.
QUENYA: But all this has happened to make the Scripture true!” Then all the disciples abandoned him and fled.

ENGLISH: Then who seized Jesus led him away to Caiaphas the chief priest, while the scribes and the elders assembled.
QUENYA: Then who seized Jesus led him away to Caiaphas the chief priest, while the scribes and the elders assembled.

ENGLISH: But Peter followed them from afar, as far as the courtyard of the chief priest, and he went inside and sat down with the servants, to see the end.
QUENYA: But Peter followed them from afar, as far as the courtyard of the chief priest, and he went inside and sat down with the servants, to see the end.

ENGLISH: The chief priests and the High Counsil sought lying testimony against Jesus, for them to kill him,
QUENYA: The chief priests and the High Counsil sought lying testimony against Jesus, for them to kill him,

ENGLISH: but they found nothing, though numerous lying witnesses came forward. In the end, two came forward
QUENYA: but they found nothing, though numerous lying witnesses came forward. In the end, two came forward

ENGLISH: and said: “This man has said: 'I can throw down the temple of God and build it up in three days.'”
QUENYA: and said: “This man has said: 'I can throw down the temple of God and build it up in three days.'”

ENGLISH: Then the chief priest arose and said to him: “Are you answering nothing? What is that these people witness against you?”
QUENYA: Then the chief priest arose and said to him: “Are you answering nothing? What is that these people witness against you?”

ENGLISH: But Jesus was silent. And the chief priest said to him: “By the living God I put you under oath that you will tell us if you are the Christ, the Son of God!”
QUENYA: But Jesus was silent. And the chief priest said to him: “By the living God I put you under oath that you will tell us if you are the Christ, the Son of God!”

ENGLISH: Jesus said to him: “You have said it. But I say to you: From now you will see the Son of God sitting by the right hand of the Power and coming on the clouds of heaven!”
QUENYA: Jesus said to him: “You have said it. But I say to you: From now you will see the Son of God sitting by the right hand of the Power and coming on the clouds of heaven!”

ENGLISH: Then the chief priest tore his garments, saying: “He has blasphemed! What further need for witnesses do we have? Behold! You have heart the blasphemy.
QUENYA: Then the chief priest tore his garments, saying: “He has blasphemed! What further need for witnesses do we have? Behold! You have heart the blasphemy.

ENGLISH: What do you think?” They answered: “He is worthy of death!”
QUENYA: What do you think?” They answered: “He is worthy of death!”

ENGLISH: Then they spat in his face and struck him with fists,
QUENYA: Then they spat in his face and struck him with fists,

ENGLISH: saying: “Speak to us as a prophet, o Christ! Who is that struck you?”
QUENYA: saying: “Speak to us as a prophet, o Christ! Who is that struck you?”

ENGLISH: Now Peter sat down on the outside in the court, and a maidservant came to him, saying: “You too were with Jesus from Galilee!”
QUENYA: Now Peter sat down on the outside in the court, and a maidservant came to him, saying: “You too were with Jesus from Galilee!”

ENGLISH: But he denied that before all, saying: “I do not know of what you are speaking!”
QUENYA: But he denied that before all, saying: “I do not know of what you are speaking!”

ENGLISH: After he went out to the gate, another maiden noticed him and said that were there: “This man was with Jesus from Nazareth!”
QUENYA: After he went out to the gate, another maiden noticed him and said that were there: “This man was with Jesus from Nazareth!”

ENGLISH: And again he denied it, with an oath: “I do not know the man!”
QUENYA: And again he denied it, with an oath: “I do not know the man!”

ENGLISH: After a short time those that stood around him came and said to Peter: “Indeed you are among them, for your speech reveals you!”
QUENYA: After a short time those that stood around him came and said to Peter: “Indeed you are among them, for your speech reveals you!”

ENGLISH: Then he started to curse and say with oaths: “I do not know the man!” And in the same moment a cock sounded.
QUENYA: Then he started to curse and say with oaths: “I do not know the man!” And in the same moment a cock sounded.

ENGLISH: And Peter recalled which Jesus said: “Before a cock shall sound, you will deny me thrice!”
QUENYA: And Peter recalled which Jesus said: “Before a cock shall sound, you will deny me thrice!”

ENGLISH: And he went outside and let bitter tears flow.
QUENYA: And he went outside and let bitter tears flow.

ENGLISH: When morning came, all the chief priests and the elders among the people made a consideration against Jesus in order to kill him.
QUENYA: When morning came, all the chief priests and the elders among the people made a consideration against Jesus in order to kill him.

ENGLISH: They bound him and led him away and gave him over to Pilate the governor.
QUENYA: They bound him and led him away and gave him over to Pilate the governor.

ENGLISH: Then, when Judas saw that he was being judged, he had a change of mind and brought back the thirty silver pieces to the chief priests and the elders.
QUENYA: Then, when Judas saw that he was being judged, he had a change of mind and brought back the thirty silver pieces to the chief priests and the elders.

ENGLISH: He said: “I sinned when I gave over righteous blood!” They said: “What is that to us? You see to it!”
QUENYA: He said: “I sinned when I gave over righteous blood!” They said: “What is that to us? You see to it!”

ENGLISH: Then he threw the silver pieces into the temple and went off, and he went away and hanged himself.
QUENYA: Then he threw the silver pieces into the temple and went off, and he went away and hanged himself.

ENGLISH: But the chief priests took the silver-pieces and said: “It is not allowed to throw them into the holy treasury, for they are a payment for blood!” After making a consideration they bought with them the potter's field, as a grave-place for strangers.
QUENYA: But the chief priests took the silver-pieces and said: “It is not allowed to throw them into the holy treasury, for they are a payment for blood!” After making a consideration they bought with them the potter's field, as a grave-place for strangers.

ENGLISH: Therefore that place has been named “Bloodfield” until this day.
QUENYA: Therefore that place has been named “Bloodfield” until this day.

ENGLISH: Then which was said through Jeremiah the Prophet was made true: “And they took the thirty silver pieces, the payment for the man that had his worth fixed, for whom the Children of Israel fixed a payment, and they gave them for the potter's field, as the Lord commanded me!”
QUENYA: Then which was said through Jeremiah the Prophet was made true: “And they took the thirty silver pieces, the payment for the man that had his worth fixed, for whom the Children of Israel fixed a payment, and they gave them for the potter's field, as the Lord commanded me!”

ENGLISH: But Jesus stood before the governor, and the governor asked him: “Are you king of the Jews?” Jesus answered: “You yourself say it!”
QUENYA: But Jesus stood before the governor, and the governor asked him: “Are you king of the Jews?” Jesus answered: “You yourself say it!”

ENGLISH: But when the chief priests and the elders said that he had done crimes, he did not answer.
QUENYA: But when the chief priests and the elders said that he had done crimes, he did not answer.

ENGLISH: Then Pilate said to him: “Do you not hear all the things that they witness against you?”
QUENYA: Then Pilate said to him: “Do you not hear all the things that they witness against you?”

ENGLISH: And yet he did not answer him, not with a single word. Therefore the governor had great wonder.
QUENYA: And yet he did not answer him, not with a single word. Therefore the governor had great wonder.

ENGLISH: From festival to festival a habit of the governor was to release to the crowd a person from the prison, the man that they wanted.
QUENYA: From festival to festival a habit of the governor was to release to the crowd a person from the prison, the man that they wanted.

ENGLISH: At that time was in prison a man called Barabbas, having an evil name .
QUENYA: At that time was in prison a man called Barabbas, having an evil name .

ENGLISH: Therefore, after they gathered, Pilate said to them: “Who is the person that you wish I am to release to you, Barabbas or Jesus called Christ?”
QUENYA: Therefore, after they gathered, Pilate said to them: “Who is the person that you wish I am to release to you, Barabbas or Jesus called Christ?”

ENGLISH: For he knew that they gave him over because of envy.
QUENYA: For he knew that they gave him over because of envy.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, when he sat on the seat of judgement, his wife sent to him, saying: “May there be nothing between you and that righteous man, for I had great pain today in a dream concerning him!”
QUENYA: Furthermore, when he sat on the seat of judgement, his wife sent to him, saying: “May there be nothing between you and that righteous man, for I had great pain today in a dream concerning him!”

ENGLISH: But the chief priests and the elders talked the crowds into requesting Barabbas, but that they were to destroy Jesus.
QUENYA: But the chief priests and the elders talked the crowds into requesting Barabbas, but that they were to destroy Jesus.

ENGLISH: In answer the governor said to them: “Who among the two do you wish that I am to release to you?” They said: “Barabbas!”
QUENYA: In answer the governor said to them: “Who among the two do you wish that I am to release to you?” They said: “Barabbas!”

ENGLISH: Pilate said to them: “Then what am I to do to Jesus who is called Christ?” All among them said: “Let him be crucified!”
QUENYA: Pilate said to them: “Then what am I to do to Jesus who is called Christ?” All among them said: “Let him be crucified!”

ENGLISH: He said: “Then what evil has he done?” But they cried still more: “Let him be crucified!”
QUENYA: He said: “Then what evil has he done?” But they cried still more: “Let him be crucified!”

ENGLISH: When he saw that he could do nothing beneficial, but that sooner an uprising was going to arise, Pilate took water and washed his hands before the crowd, saying: “I do not have guilt of the blood of this man! You see to it!”
QUENYA: When he saw that he could do nothing beneficial, but that sooner an uprising was going to arise, Pilate took water and washed his hands before the crowd, saying: “I do not have guilt of the blood of this man! You see to it!”

ENGLISH: And in answer the people said: “Let his blood come upon us and upon our children!”
QUENYA: And in answer the people said: “Let his blood come upon us and upon our children!”

ENGLISH: Then he freed to them Barabbas, but Jesus he flayed and gave him over to being crucified.
QUENYA: Then he freed to them Barabbas, but Jesus he flayed and gave him over to being crucified.

ENGLISH: Then the governor's soldiers brought Jesus into the palace, and gathered the entire soldier-host to him.
QUENYA: Then the governor's soldiers brought Jesus into the palace, and gathered the entire soldier-host to him.

ENGLISH: And they took from him his clothes and put on him a scarlet cloak,
QUENYA: And they took from him his clothes and put on him a scarlet cloak,

ENGLISH: and they made a crown of thorns and put it on his head, and a reed in his right hand.
QUENYA: and they made a crown of thorns and put it on his head, and a reed in his right hand.

ENGLISH: And falling on their knees before him they spoke to him with scorn, saying: “Hail, king of the Jews!”
QUENYA: And falling on their knees before him they spoke to him with scorn, saying: “Hail, king of the Jews!”

ENGLISH: And they spat on him and took the reed and struck him on his head.
QUENYA: And they spat on him and took the reed and struck him on his head.

ENGLISH: And after their scorn against him, they took away from him the cloak and put on him his own clothes, and they led him away to be crucified.
QUENYA: And after their scorn against him, they took away from him the cloak and put on him his own clothes, and they led him away to be crucified.

ENGLISH: On the road they found a man for Cyrene called Simon. This man they compelled to carry his cross.
QUENYA: On the road they found a man for Cyrene called Simon. This man they compelled to carry his cross.

ENGLISH: And when they came to a place called Golgotha, that is, Skull,
QUENYA: And when they came to a place called Golgotha, that is, Skull,

ENGLISH: they gave him wine in a mix with gall, but after tasting it he did not want to drink.
QUENYA: they gave him wine in a mix with gall, but after tasting it he did not want to drink.

ENGLISH: After crucifying him they distributed his garments by throwing lots,
QUENYA: After crucifying him they distributed his garments by throwing lots,

ENGLISH: and sitting there they were watching him.
QUENYA: and sitting there they were watching him.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, over his head they put the accusation against him, written: “This is Jesus, king of the Jews!”
QUENYA: Furthermore, over his head they put the accusation against him, written: “This is Jesus, king of the Jews!”

ENGLISH: Then two robbers were crucified with him, one at his rigth and one at his left.
QUENYA: Then two robbers were crucified with him, one at his rigth and one at his left.

ENGLISH: that passed by blasphemed against him, shaking their heads
QUENYA: that passed by blasphemed against him, shaking their heads

ENGLISH: and saying: “You who were going to throw the temple down and re-build it in three days, save yourself! If you are God's Son, come down from the cross!”
QUENYA: and saying: “You who were going to throw the temple down and re-build it in three days, save yourself! If you are God's Son, come down from the cross!”

ENGLISH: In the same manner also the chief priests and the scribes spoke to him with scorn and said:
QUENYA: In the same manner also the chief priests and the scribes spoke to him with scorn and said:

ENGLISH: “Others he has saves; himself he cannot save! He is king of Israel; let him now come down from the cross and we will believe in him!
QUENYA: “Others he has saves; himself he cannot save! He is king of Israel; let him now come down from the cross and we will believe in him!

ENGLISH: He has put his hope in God; now let him rescue him if he wants him, for he said: I am God's Son!”
QUENYA: He has put his hope in God; now let him rescue him if he wants him, for he said: I am God's Son!”

ENGLISH: In the same manner also the robbers crucified with him abused him.
QUENYA: In the same manner also the robbers crucified with him abused him.

ENGLISH: From the sixth hour darkness fell over the entire land, until the ninth hour.
QUENYA: From the sixth hour darkness fell over the entire land, until the ninth hour.

ENGLISH: Aroud the ninth hour Jesus cried out with a mighty voice, saying: “Eli, eli, lema sabachtani?”, that is: “My God, my God, what is your reason for forsaking me?”
QUENYA: Aroud the ninth hour Jesus cried out with a mighty voice, saying: “Eli, eli, lema sabachtani?”, that is: “My God, my God, what is your reason for forsaking me?”

ENGLISH: When they heard this, some among who stood there said: “This man is calling Elijah!”
QUENYA: When they heard this, some among who stood there said: “This man is calling Elijah!”

ENGLISH: And in the same moment one among them took a sponge and filled it with sour wine and put it on a reed and let him drink.
QUENYA: And in the same moment one among them took a sponge and filled it with sour wine and put it on a reed and let him drink.

ENGLISH: But the others said: “Let him be! Let us see if Elijah comes to save him!”
QUENYA: But the others said: “Let him be! Let us see if Elijah comes to save him!”

ENGLISH: But Jesus again cried with a mighty voice and expired.
QUENYA: But Jesus again cried with a mighty voice and expired.

ENGLISH: And behold! the curtain in the temple was torn into two, from top to bottom, and the earth shook, and the rocks were split.
QUENYA: And behold! the curtain in the temple was torn into two, from top to bottom, and the earth shook, and the rocks were split.

ENGLISH: And the tombs were opened, and many bodies of the sleeping holy ones were raised,
QUENYA: And the tombs were opened, and many bodies of the sleeping holy ones were raised,

ENGLISH: and coming out of the tombs after he was raised they came into the holy city and showed themselves to many.
QUENYA: and coming out of the tombs after he was raised they came into the holy city and showed themselves to many.

ENGLISH: But the centurion and with him that were watching Jesus, when they saw the earthquake and the things happening, were extremely terrified, saying: “This man was indeed God's Son!”
QUENYA: But the centurion and with him that were watching Jesus, when they saw the earthquake and the things happening, were extremely terrified, saying: “This man was indeed God's Son!”

ENGLISH: There were there many women watching from afar, who followed Jesus from Galilee to serve him.
QUENYA: There were there many women watching from afar, who followed Jesus from Galilee to serve him.

ENGLISH: Among them were Mary Magdalene, also Mary mother of Jacob and Joseph, and the mother of the sons of Zebedee.
QUENYA: Among them were Mary Magdalene, also Mary mother of Jacob and Joseph, and the mother of the sons of Zebedee.

ENGLISH: When evening fell, came thither a rich man from Arimathea called Josef, who also was a disciple of Jesus.
QUENYA: When evening fell, came thither a rich man from Arimathea called Josef, who also was a disciple of Jesus.

ENGLISH: This man went to Pilate and asked for Jesus' body. Then Pilate gave the order, and it was given to him.
QUENYA: This man went to Pilate and asked for Jesus' body. Then Pilate gave the order, and it was given to him.

ENGLISH: And Joseph took the body and wrapped it in pure linen,
